title: Increases gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 for taxable year 2010.

Supplements the State annual appropriations act for the State fiscal year 2010-2011, makes appropriations for Pharmaceutical Assistance to the Aged and Disabled Programs and the Homestead Rebate/Credit Program.
Provides for philosophical exemption to mandatory immunizations.
Authorizes DCA to establish bidding and conflict of interest guidelines for homeowners' associations.
Requires that notice of hearing on certain zoning changes be by certified mail only.
Creates defibrillator grant program in DHSS for municipalities; appropriates $1.7 million.
Creates video camera grant program in DLPS for municipalities; makes an appropriation.
Prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from possessing body vest.
Eliminates requirement that school bus drivers be fingerprinted for license renewal.
Prohibits awarding of municipal professional services contracts to certain elected officials.
Increases period of license suspension for certain drunk driving offenses.
Establishes the offense of incest.
Requires Medicaid program to increase reimbursement for ambulance services provided to Medicaid recipients who are also Medicare eligible to Medicare rate.
Extends veteran's tax deduction to certain persons undergoing training for deployment in Operation "Iraqi Freedom."

Revises public school district budget cap adjustment for special education and establishes adjustments for utility costs, health benefits costs, legal fees, and membership dues for New Jersey School Boards Association.
Raises penalties for operating snowmobiles or all-terrain vehicles while under the influence.
Eliminates use of vaccines containing mercury over three years.
Provides for motor fuels tax exemption to school bus contractors.
Exempts certain State authorities and local government contracting units from bidding requirements when goods and services are procured below prices available under State contract.
Increases income limits for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Maintains affordability controls on low and moderate income housing in perpetuity.
Clarifies procedure for determination of discount for prepayment and interest for delinquency on property taxes and municipal charges.
Establishes building permit center in Division of Codes and Standards in DCA.
Prohibits double-trailer truck combinations on certain portions of U.S. Route 206 in Mercer and Somerset counties.
Creates offenses pertaining to unauthorized use of confidential information.
Requires fingerprinting for certain disorderly persons offenses.
Provides for priority consideration, by State, of permit applications by counties and municipalities with 10 or more shared services.
Permits board of chosen freeholders to establish "Sharing Resources" grant and loan program to encourage shared services and municipal consolidation.
Grants county planning board power to review site plans for land development affecting county roads.
Regulates the sale and possession of body armor.
Prohibits electric public utilities from cutting or removing agricultural items located on certain right-of-way easements on private property.
Establishes certain ethics protocols for procurement of fire engines.
Abolishes Council on Affordable Housing for failure to comply with legislative directives.
Requires recipients of certain unusually hazardous substances to notify local fire officials of anticipated storage time of such substances in their communities.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses providing employment to certain National Guard or reservists.

Exempts construction, expansion or renovation of buildings or other structures for police departments, fire departments, and volunteer first aid, emergency, ambulance or rescue squads from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Requires insurers and SHBP to provide coverage for expenses incurred in screening for ovarian cancer.
Requires MVC to immediately suspend driver's license of alleged drunk drivers who cause a death.
Adds "significant bodily injury" to assault by auto or vessel statute; upgrades penalties for inflicting serious bodily injury.
Prohibits unauthorized use of name, image or likeness of members of Armed Forces of United States.*
Establishes Lane Splitting Task Force.
Requires voter registration forms be made available when applying for hunting, fishing, or trapping license.
Provides that public official may refuse to solemnize civil unions if solemnization conflicts with public official's conscience or sincerely held moral or religious beliefs.
Clarifies certain standards for regulation of recreational vehicles as housing.
Prohibits State departments and agencies from considering or requiring compliance by Highlands planning area municipalities with Highlands regional master plan in certain circumstances.
Establishes reporting requirements and permissive inference for violations by motor vehicle operators approaching or passing certain horses, ponies and mules.
"Transparency in Government Act;" provides for establishment of State public finance website.
Revises definition of religious employer in statute concerning insurance coverage of prescription female contraceptives.
Requires minimum geographic cost adjustment for school districts in certain counties.
Clarifies that licensed dealers may provide firearms for display at fund raising events sponsored by certain tax exempt organizations.
Sunsets "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act" five years after date of enactment unless certain conditions are met.
"Ovarian Health Protection Act"; prohibits procurement or use of human eggs for research or experimentation.
Limits the salaries of school business administrators, superintendents of schools, and assistant superintendents of schools to the salary of the Commissioner of Education.

Establishes Department of Economic Development and Regulatory Affairs; transfers certain functions, powers, duties, agencies, divisions, and other entities from other principal departments to Department of Economic Development and Regulatory Affairs.
Prohibits placing primary election candidates into political party lines on primary ballot.
Prohibits MVC from charging certain fees for renewal of boat or motor vehicle registrations.
Revises "Administrative Procedure Act" concerning socio-economic impact statements for proposed rule-making.

Renames Dept. of Agriculture as Dept. of Agriculture and Conservation; transfers certain agencies from other depts. to Dept. of Agriculture and Conservation; clarifies authority of Fish and Game Council.
"Transparency in Government Act;" provides for establishment of State public finance website.
Excludes certain stable stall rentals from sales and use tax imposition and provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of equine-related services.
Expands range of local units eligible to join an insurance fund established by a municipality or county under certain circumstances.
Establishes task force to study treatment of veterans diagnosed with post traumatic stress disorder in judicial proceedings.
Establishes sex-selection and race-selection abortions as third degree crimes and permits civil actions.
Requires physicians to provide patients opportunity to undergo obstetrical ultrasound or sonogram within 48 hours of performing abortion.
Eliminates $500 minimum tax on New Jersey S corporations with New Jersey gross receipts less than $100,000 under Corporation Business Tax.
Provides certain retirees from public police departments the right to hawk, peddle and vend.
Permits use of deadly force against black bears in certain cases.
Abolishes Department of the Public Advocate.
Provides that farm, farmstand, or other agricultural operation selling firewood obtained from property other than seller's shall not be considered a lumber yard.

Authorizes municipalities that petition for or receive substantive certification pursuant to the "Fair Housing Act" to make certain affordable housing units available on a preferential basis to certain eligible persons.
Prohibits use of public funds for embryonic stem cell research.
Provides that no more than four of the seven public members appointed to the Highlands Water Protection and Planning Council may be of the same political party.
Allows certain self-employed business owners to deduct their own pension plan contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Allows for exclusion of certain properties from Highlands preservation area.
Provides for no net loss of DEP lands for fishing, hunting, and trapping purposes.
Enhances duty and broadens liability concerning security of personal information, and response to breach of security, under "Identity Theft Prevention Act."
Requires "permanent injury" under limitation on lawsuit threshold to seriously impact life of injured person to pierce threshold.
Repeals sections of law pertaining to transfer of civil service and non-civil service employees of terminated local health agency to superseding agency.
Establishes "New Jersey Commission on Government Efficiency and Cost Control" to recommend measures for efficiency and cost reduction in State government.
Requires State provide description of services to be provided if local unit must pay for services.
Requires voter referendum and vote by affected governing bodies for approval of proposed consolidation plan.
Authorizes black bear hunting permits and permit fees, and clarifies Fish and Game council authority over bear hunting.
Requires high-mounted rear stoplights on certain passenger vehicles.
Prohibits employment of unauthorized aliens.
Requires principals and teachers of public schools to conduct an oral recitation from the Declaration of Independence before the opening of school each day in grades 3-12; appropriates $10,000.
Provides authorized emergency vehicles protection under lemon law.
Concerns hazardous waste transporter fee.
Eliminates expansion of preschool education program in "School Funding Reform Act of 2008."
Establishes in DEP the Environmental Science Review Board and Environmental Policy Review Board to review proposed environmental regulations for consistency with planning policies and science.
"New Jersey Jobs Protection Act;" requires verification of employment.
Exempts contaminated and industrially-zoned sites from affordable housing rules.
Prohibits the imposition of affordable housing need and related fees upon the local transfer or move of a business.
Decreases sales and use tax rate from 7% to 6%.
Expands scope of review of Pension and Health Benefits Review Commission.
Provides that certain absentee ballots will be counted if received within ten days of election.
Provides that sales by UEZ retailers of items delivered to location outside of the UEZ shall not qualify for partial exemption from the sales tax.
Grants municipal courts discretion to assess court costs for certain dismissals and changes court costs for certain violations.

Prohibits elected officials and public employees from enrolling for health benefits with more than one public entity; provides civil action for treble expenses by public entity providing additional coverage.
The "New Jersey Self-Defense Law."
Prohibits sale of certain products using advertisements alluding to controlled dangerous substances or analogs.
Requires schools to provide eligible high school students with voter registration material.
Directs Division of Consumer Affairs to develop informational brochure regarding dental amalgam, and requires dentists to distribute brochure to patients and offer composite alternatives.
Requires public schools to include instruction on caffeine-related health issues as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Allows municipalities to require mortgage lenders to maintain vacant residential properties during foreclosure.
Authorizes creation of 33rd urban enterprise zone in Belleville Township.
Broadens criteria for certain municipalities to qualify as having UEZ-impacted business districts.
Directs DOT, in consultation with other State entities, to study and report on certain solar and wind energy installations.
Permits hiring of certain laid off law enforcement officers without utilizing Civil Service lists. *
Permits exemption from mandatory immunization for students in writing for any reason.
Provides gross income tax deduction for health care plan costs.
Provides that DNA test results may be used in establishing parentage.
Requires insurers to inform insureds whether certain coverages extend to rental automobiles.
Gives judge discretion to close court proceedings to the public in cases involving national or State security.
Provides that civil service make-up examinations not include the same questions as the original examination.
Expands number of disorders included in newborn screening program.
Requires the licensing of certain security officers and the registration of their employers.
Establishes guidelines for dissemination of vital records.
Requires the State to provide State aid for public school adult high school programs.
Permits members of State Police to receive travel and subsistence reimbursement exceeding $500 limit from certain sources other than State for out of State travel for educational purposes.
Provides in-network benefits to patient with disability for services provided by out-of-network provider under certain circumstances.
Requires 45 days' notice to affected municipalities of discontinuance of certain bus and train service.
Requires informational posters about safe placement alternatives for newborn infants be posted in public restrooms used by females.
Establishes NJ FamilyCare coverage buy-in program for certain small employers.
Provides tuition-free enrollment at New Jersey public colleges to certain members of the State Police.
Prohibits disqualification and replacement of cast absentee ballots because of withdrawal of candidate prior to election day.
Requires that automated external defibrillators be located on every floor of State House and State House Annex; requires training for State Police.
Directs Medicaid to establish medical home demonstration project.
Provides for reciprocity of certain out-of-State EMT certification.
Requires health insurers, SHBP, and SEHBP to provide coverage for interpreter services for persons who have limited English proficiency or deafness.

Permits submission of online voter registration form through secure Department of State Internet site; authorizes use of digitized signature from New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission database for online voter registration form approval.
Expedites payment of PFRS accidental death benefit.
Creates a civil "rape shield" law.
Permits a tax deduction under the New Jersey gross income tax for taxpayers who operate or maintain for their employees a licensed child care center or who have paid the cost of outside child care.
Provides a corporation business tax credit for day care center support benefiting children of employees.
Limits operation of personal watercraft in coastal wetlands.
Revises State funding formula for public education.
Requires pharmacists to report prescription drug-related deaths and substantial bodily injuries to Board of Pharmacy.
Raises monetary threshold for at-fault automobile accidents to $1,000.
Revises New Jersey Safe Haven Infant Protection Act and other laws relating thereto.
Changes compensation trigger for reenrollment of PERS retiree from $15,000 in aggregate to $15,000 per public employer.
Establishes tuition aid grant pilot program for part-time county college students.
Requires all direct patient care staff in general hospitals to wear identification badges.
Requires police departments and parole board to adopt maternity policies.
Provides for conscientious exemption to mandatory immunizations.
Makes it a crime of the third degree to practice psychology, marriage and family therapy, chiropractic or State-certified psychoanalysis without the appropriate license or certification.
Requires DOE to establish working group to develop a plan for the regional provision of special education services.
Exempts municipal clerk from penalties for Open Public Records Act violations under certain circumstances.
Changes maximum stream length and width restrictions on certain county or municipal stream cleaning activities.
Prohibits use of certain underwriting guidelines by insurers pertaining to guide dogs, service dogs, or hearing assistance dogs harbored on the insured property.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for certain purchases made by certain flood victims.
Authorizes special license plates for county and municipal emergency management volunteers.
Provides for forwarding of criminal history record background check information among State agencies under certain circumstances.
Excludes individual building single family home as his primary residence from provisions of "Fair Housing Act."
Prohibits health care institutions from discharging medications into sewer or septic systems.
Allows for certain capital asset loss and capital asset loss carryforward deductions under the New Jersey gross income tax.
Prohibits public financing of privately-owned, for-profit projects within the meadowlands complex.
Requires three specific categories of public members on Board of Medical Examiners.
Requires notification and authorization of DHSS prior to transfer of hospital license to another entity.
Prohibits use of smokeless tobacco in public schools.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from permitting direct solicitation of students for credit card accounts.
Establishes a Special Medical Malpractice Part in the Superior Court.
Creates 12 additional Superior Court judgeships; establishes a Special Business Part in the Superior Court; provides for appropriations.
Establishes a Business Part in the Superior Court.
Extends certain federal income tax advantages of individual health savings accounts to individual taxpayers under the New Jersey gross income tax.

Conforms voter identification procedures to requirements of Statewide voter registration system; permits use of provisional ballots for voters who move to different counties; revises certain penalty provisions.
Creates a Business Court.
Establishes grant program for school districts to develop in-district and collaborative special education programs and services to reduce need to place classified students out-of-district.
Provides Student Population Density Aid to certain public school districts.
Clarifies applicability to primary elections of campaign contribution and expenditures reporting act.

Applies certain conflicts of interest restrictions on legislators to county, municipal and local authority condemnation proceedings and project contracts funded directly or indirectly by State monies.
Requires Joint Legislative Committee on Ethical Standards to maintain information on Internet; requires certain assistance to be provided to individuals filing complaints with the committee.
Exempts local governmental units from supplemental titling fees on passenger automobiles they purchase or lease.
Imposes mandatory terms of imprisonment for contempt for violation of domestic violence orders.
Clarifies authority of municipalities to utilize zoning authority to regulate billboards or outdoor advertising bearing commercial advertisements.
Concerns additional unemployment benefits during training in cases of disability.
Prohibits campaign contributions between county party committees; makes such contributions a third degree crime; increases to third degree crimes certain other campaign finance offenses.
Prohibits contributions by certain entities doing business with State; limits amount of contributions by principals and officers of such entities.
Limits contributions by certain public contractors; limits contributions by county and municipal political party committees.

Limits political contributions by certain government contractors; revises disclosure standards applicable to State officials; expands disclosure for lobbyists; prohibits certain types of dual office holding.
Authorizes counties and municipalities to adopt regulations limiting political contributions by contractors.

Limits contributions to certain candidates and elected officials by certain public contractors; limits contributions by certain political party committees; repeals certain campaign contribution prohibitions.

Provides local governments may limit political contributions by business entities performing or seeking to perform public contracts; limits contributions by county and municipal political party committees.
Prohibits public entities from engaging certain governmental affairs agents.
Establishes certain ethical standards and financial control requirements for State authorities.
Imposes penalties on certain State officers and employees for failure to file financial disclosure statements required by executive order or by code of ethics.
Designates highway ramp off of State Highway Route No. 23 at Alps Road in Wayne Township as "Gregory F. Velardi, Sr., Ramp."
Provides that MIA-OON flag be displayed at certain public buildings annually for 30 days beginning September 11.
Eliminates statute of limitations in cases brought under the "Survivor's Act" where the death resulted from murder or manslaughter under certain circumstances.
Establishes Hooked on Fishing-Not on Drugs Program in DEP and appropriates $200,000 therefor from Drug Enforcement and Demand Reduction Fund.
Allows municipalities to provide free or reduced fee beach badges to active military and NJ National Guard personnel.
Requires local government notification of sex offender registration and prohibits sex offenders from living near schools, child care centers or playgrounds.
Requires prosecutor to determine risk of re-offense under Megan's Law prior to offender's release from incarceration.
Excludes certain illegal aliens from workers' compensation and temporary disability benefits.
Requires DEP to assume responsibility for dredging of waterways providing boat access to lagoon communities; appropriates $6,000,000.
Establishes special dredging account; directs $5,000,000 of sales tax collected annually be deposited therein; directs DEP to administer account and dredging program with certain requirements.
Appropriates $26,140,000 for dredging projects and dredged material disposal projects related to navigational waterways.
Establishes a New Jersey Coordinating Council on the Decommissioning of Nuclear Power Generating Facilities.
Repeals State and local hotel and motel occupancy taxes and voids existing municipal implementing ordinances.
Revises law concerning sexually oriented businesses.
Requires court to consider results of domestic violence assessment before dissolving certain domestic violence restraining orders.
Prevents use of condemnation to acquire residential and other private property under redevelopment laws.
Requires reduction in number of State employees to FY2000 level; establishes procedure to control creation of new State positions and filling of vacancies.
Increases personal needs allowance to $55 for low income persons residing in certain facilities.
Bars companies which hire illegal aliens from public contracts, grants, loans, or tax incentives for seven years.
Increases prison time for certain persons convicted of a motor vehicle offense when license suspended for DUI.
Extends penalties for driving under the influence to include any substance that impairs driving ability; deems driver's consent to non-invasive drug tests.
Criminalizes fifth or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Ends the transitional energy facilities assessment, caps the State use portion of State energy tax revenues and ensures the balance of such State revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service.
Reestablishes senior citizen supplemental stabilization aid.
Requires account numbers to be truncated on certain sales receipts.
Clarifies that harassment made anonymously or otherwise through electronic communication devices constitutes a petty disorderly offense.
Requires Department of the Treasury to calculate State motor vehicle fleet miles per gallon average and to increase it over four years.
Directs DOT to study and report on implementation of truck stop electrification systems to reduce truck idling and fuel usage.
Requires State and county offices of emergency management to designate critical infrastructure in need of emergency power generators.
Establishes coastal operations team to review county evacuation plans.
Provides for Statewide evacuation strategy for hospitals and other health care facilities.
Allows counties to establish emergency management registry for individuals with special needs.
Establishes commission authorized to identify and locate emergency shelters.
Directs DOT and NJT to study and report on transportation infrastructure needs in coastal counties.
Establishes, in the Division of Fish and Wildlife in DEP, a program to encourage school children to avoid drug use and appropriates $200,000 therefor from Drug Enforcement and Demand Reduction Fund.
"Invest in New Jersey First' Act;" requires preference in awarding certain contracts for critical infrastructure projects.
Establishes NJ Alzheimer's Disease Study Commission.
Requires DEP rejection of new solid waste facility registration if affected municipality disapproves proposed facility location.
Requires BPU to provide funding for purchase and installation of photovoltaic technologies for age-restricted community clubhouse facilities from societal benefits charge.
Requires use of electronic mail for community notification under Megan's law.
Requires health insurers to cover Lyme disease.
Establishes municipal authority to supervise, discipline and terminate employment of construction code officials.
Supplemental appropriation of $150 million to DOT for repair or construction of bridges on Route 72 connecting Long Beach Island to the mainland.
Requires notaries public to be U.S. citizens.
Creates offense of financial exploitation of the elderly.
Requires assessment of bay scallop resource, and authorizes DEP to establish a bay scallop fishery.
Supplemental appropriation of $250,000 to DLPS to assist local police departments in paying for new NICS terminals.
Eliminates the New Jersey inheritance tax and repeals chapters 33 through 37 of Title 54 of the Revised Statutes.
Authorizes municipalities to adopt ordinances requiring maintenance and repair of certain wharves, piers, docks and bulkheads.
Permits conversion of fines for violation of certain municipal ordinances into tax liens.
Revises criteria for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Requires State reimbursement to municipalities of cost of disabled veterans' total property tax exemption.
Provides immunity from civil liability for persons performing animal rescue and authorizes formation of emergency animal rescue response units.
Establishes "Seniors Helping Seniors Who are Blind or Visually Impaired Demonstration Program" in DHS; appropriates $360,000.
Allows gross income tax filers to designate contributions to VetGroup, Inc. for services for veterans.
Authorizes special license plate for distinguished service medal recipients.
Provides certain veteran benefits to veterans of the global war on terror conflicts and those of certain military engagements served during certain periods.
Requires State to reimburse counties and municipalities for salary and fringe benefit costs of employee on official leave of absence for military service in war on terror; makes an appropriation.
Extends veterans' property tax exemption to tenant shareholders in cooperatives and mutual housing corporations.
Allows PERS ordinary disability retiree to earn up to $3,000 in PERS-covered employment annually before cancellation of disability benefit and reenrollment in PERS.
Extends payment of homestead property tax reimbursement to non-eligible surviving spouse for portion of tax year during which deceased spouse lived.
Requires reservation of portion of tenant vouchers under State rental assistance program for veterans.
Requires newly hired State employees be New Jersey residents.
Permits certain portion of municipal development trust funds to be spent on housing affordability assistance to veterans.
Makes annual compensation paid to surviving spouses of certain blind or disabled veterans payable from date of veteran's death.
Establishes task force to study issues facing returning members of the United States Armed Forces and New Jersey National Guard and make recommendations on how State should address issues.
Increases penalties for identity theft when victim is a senior citizen or veteran.
Allows corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credit for certain unreimbursed psychiatric treatment of veterans.
Dedicates up to $400,000 annually of fees collected at Island Beach and Liberty State Parks to special funds to be used to support certain park programs, and makes appropriations from the funds.
Establishes a permanent Interdistrict Public School Choice Program.
Requires DOE to submit evaluation report to Legislature prior to fully implementing secondary education redesign proposal.
Permits the conversion of nonpublic schools into charter schools.
Increases membership of PFRS board of trustees from 11 to 13 members.
The "Foreclosure Rescue Fraud Prevention Act."
Exempts Holocaust reparations payments from legal process, and from estate recovery under Medicaid program.
Requires DHSS to establish "New Jersey Autism Website."

Provides employees and officers working fewer than 1,000 hours annually will be ineligible for TPAF or PERS membership and service credit but will be eligible for Defined Contribution Retirement Program.
Requires certain arbitrators to file financial disclosure statements.
Limits amount of contribution to legal defense fund of holder of elective public office and requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Requires practitioners to disclose business relationship with out-of-State facilities when making patient referrals to those facilities.
Authorizes wiretap orders for investigation of luring or enticing a child, identity theft, stalking and harassment under certain circumstances.
Makes technical correction to definition of "creditable coverage" in individual, small employer and larger group insurance laws.
Provides for appointment to board of directors of New Jersey Automobile Insurance Risk Exchange by Commissioner of Banking and Insurance.
Prohibits misleading use of senior-specific certifications or professional designations in connection with sales of securities.
Increases and clarifies permissible categories of fees chargeable by residential mortgage lenders and brokers.
Prohibits stranger-originated life insurance contracts.
The "Health Care Provider Network Transparency Act"; establishes requirements for granting access to certain health care provider discounts.
Restructures ticket sales law.
Transfers management, administration and duties of "the workers' compensation security fund" to the New Jersey Property-Liability Insurance Guaranty Association.
"Life Settlements Act"; regulates life settlement contracts and prohibits stranger-originated life insurance contracts; repeals "Viatical Settlements Act."
Makes supplemental appropriation of $7,000,000 to DOE to reinstate nonpublic technology initiative aid.
Requires HIV testing for pregnant women and marriage license applicants.
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.
Prohibits public and independent institutions of higher education from admitting any student who is not a United States citizen or who does not hold lawful immigration status.
Requires impact statement for any proposed regulation affecting volunteer ambulance squads and fire companies.
Allows for certain variances, exemptions, and waivers under "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Restores the death penalty for persons who commit certain murders.
Allows credit against certain charges to CATV customers opting out of premium service within 30 days of CATV company notice of network or programming change.
Increases membership of PFRS board of trustees.
Increases specialized care nursing facility beds for persons with Huntington's Disease. *
Requires insurance coverage for magnetic resonance imaging for women at high risk for breast cancer.
Increases from $15,000 to $25,000 annual compensation PERS retiree may earn in PERS-covered employment without reenrollment.
Provides that public schools will not be in session on Veterans' Day of each year.

Requires school board member and local elective office candidates to file financial disclosure statements; requires criminal background disclosure for school officials and school board member candidates.
Adds two employees to the boards of trustees of the State colleges and the county colleges.
Adds two student representatives to board of governors of Rutgers University.
"Group Home Fire Safety Act."
Makes discretionary driver's license suspension for first offense of driving without motor vehicle liability insurance.
"Steven's Law;" prohibits use of non-wood bats in certain organized games.
Permits real estate brokers to provide rebates to purchasers.
Confers civil service status on police officers employed by UMDNJ, Rutgers University, and NJIT.
Requires physicians and other prescribers to obtain informed consent from parents or guardians of minors for certain medications with "black box warning."
Requires health insurers to provide coverage for certain infant formulas.
Imposes limits on fees charged for discovery in municipal court matters.
Provides procedure to cancel mortgage of record by affidavit under certain conditions.
Requires creditor to provide mortgage payoff balance to borrower within five business days after request.
Requires theaters to reserve certain seats for patrons with hearing loss.
Expands the Tuition Aid Grant program to part-time undergraduates.
Requires that school districts use a model contract developed by the Commissioner of Education when employing a superintendent of schools.
Prohibits use of wireless telephones or electronic communication devices by operators of public transit vehicles in certain situations. *
Refines certain review and approval responsibilities under the "Municipal Land Use Law" and the "map filing law."
Requires each county to establish and maintain veterans' service office.
Revises the "Construction Lien Law."
Requires State Treasurer to follow usual procurement process prior to entering into cooperative purchasing agreements.
Limits actions against court-appointed psychologists and psychiatrists in certain Family Court matters.
Prohibits posting of certain personal information on the Internet or misrepresentation of identity on the Internet for the purpose of harassment of a minor child.
Provides that municipalities with minimum amounts of developable land may file certification with the Council on Affordabe Housing, even if no petition for substantive certification is filed.
Provides an additional month for the completion of a school district's annual audit.
"Tabitha's Law"; requires parent or guardian to notify school administrators if pupil will be absent; requires school to notify parent in event of unexcused pupil absence.
Provides sales tax exemption for certain off-road diesel equipment and certain retrofit devices.
Requires motion sensor light switches in State buildings.
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement leak detection programs.
Creates temporary suspension of certain rules of Council on Affordable Housing under certain economic conditions.
The "New Jersey Right to Home Defense Law."
Authorizes the conferral of certain academic degrees by religious corporations.
Requires sex offenders in satellite-based monitoring program to pay for certain equipment and monitoring costs.
Prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from serving on political party committees.
Establishes criminal penalties for operating or participating in pyramid promotional schemes.
Increases penalties for failing to secure a child in a child passenger restraint system or booster seat while operating a motor vehicle.
Permits eviction for good cause of tenants who are creating nuisance; requires court to notify landlord when restraining order has been issued barring tenant from residential rental property.
Restricts bail options for second and subsequent offenses occurring while released.
Permits municipality to enact ordinance to curb gang related loitering and criminal activity.
Permits master deed of condominium to reflect proportional common and limited common elements interests of each owner as fractions.
Establishes professional standards for county sheriffs and their employees.
Establishes the crime of assault by animal.
Authorizes designation of joint urban enterprise zone by Urban Enterprize Zone Authority.
Requires health care facilities to report certain information about their health care staff to their respective professional boards or DHSS.
Permits price adjustments in local public contracts for asphalt cement and fuel.
Modifies intent, purpose and standard of construction of "Municipal Land Use Law."
Modifies rule governing decisions under the "Municipal Land Use Law."
Prohibits BPU from exercising authority over utility service extensions in manner which creates cost differentials that distinguish among persons or localities based on location of such extensions.
Requires appointed board of education members and candidates for an elected board to reveal criminal convictions prior to assuming or running for office.
Decreases membership of county boards of taxation to 2004 level.
Amends the "Fair Housing Act" to change details of regional contribution agreements.
Provides for increase in relocation assistance amounts based on increase of CPI.
Concerns urban enterprise zones.
Disqualifies member of board of education or member of charter school board of trustees for conviction of certain crimes and requires member to undergo criminal history background investigation. *
Requires that all emergency departments have necessary pediatric equipment available.
Permits appointment of municipal emergency management coordinator from contiguous or adjoining municipality.
Exempts sales of services by counties and municipalities from sales and use tax.
Establishes motor vehicle registration for street rods and custom motor vehicles.
Creates offense of impairing communications, which would constitute domestic violence in certain circumstances.
"The Domestic Violence and Workforce Development Initiative Act."
Creates the "New Jersey Security and Financial Empowerment Act" to assist victims of domestic violence and sexual assault.
Provides that schools may be used as polling places only under certain circumstances.
Establishes a loan redemption program for certified vocational-technical education teachers employed in public schools in the State.
Removes monk parakeet from list of potentially dangerous species.
Supplemental appropriation of $750,000 to DHSS for Office on Women's Health.
Increases fees charged for marriage licenses and dedicates monies to Displaced Homemakers Trust Fund.
Requires "just compensation" for condemnation of single-family residence to be based on cost of comparable relocation properties.
Permits a child who moves out of a school district due to a family crisis to remain enrolled in that district until the end of the school year.
Increases funding for compulsive gambling prevention, education, and treatment programs.
Establishes certain specific gambling offenses connected with animal fights under the animal cruelty laws; establishes minimum jail time for first offenders.
Exempts testing of cigarettes in tobacco businesses from "New Jersey Smoke-Free Air Act."
Prohibits convicted former elected or appointed public official from registering as governmental affairs agent.
Revises "Notaries Public Act of 1979."
Increases membership of the New Jersey State Board of Dentistry.
Creates Bergen County Transportation Trust Fund.
Increases amount of divorce filing fees to be allocated to displaced homemaker services.
Establishes the Preschool Through Grade 20 Council; appropriates $500,000.
Establishes a loan redemption program for certified technology education teachers employed in public schools in the State.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $500,000 to The College of New Jersey to expand technology education teacher preparation program.
Requires van accessible handicapped parking spaces be used exclusively by handicapped equipped vans.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses paying a salary differential to National Guard members or reservists on active duty.
Appropriates $200,000 from "Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund" for grant to Save Ellis Island, Inc. to develop lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Creates offense of animal incapacitation and increases and revises certain animal cruelty penalties.
Prohibits certain breeding and sales practices; requires persons selling cats or dogs to provide certain information; and provides penalties.
Provides for Autism Advocate in Division of Advocacy for the Developmentally Disabled.
Requires simple majority for proposal to increase school tax levy above tax levy growth limit.
Provides for special Bronze Star license plates.
Limits motor bus owner responsibility for no-fault medical expense benefits coverage for certain injured passengers.
Increases New Jersey Life and Health Insurance Guaranty Association payment cap to $250,000 for certain annuities.
Requires installation of low-flow toilets and low-flow showerheads in multiple dwellings having 3 or more units.

Clarifies that executive county superintendent's authorities regarding special education services do not allow him to require a child study team to make a specific determination on the special education placement for a student.
Creates new offenses and penalties regarding animal fighting.
Establishes the "Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Compact."
Permits in-person wagering at casinos on results of professional sports events, subject to voter approval and change in federal law.
Increases the types of matters eligible to be voted upon by a sending district representative on a receiving district board of education.
Makes elected officials with compensation less than $50,000 ineligible for health care benefits on the 61st day after enactment.
Makes certain State and local appointed public officials ineligible, retroactive to July 1, 2007, for PERS membership regardless of prior PERS membership.
Limits State appointment or employment of members of Legislature for two years after completion of legislative service.

Eliminates PERS credit and health care benefits for appointees to State or local agency, board, commission, authority or instrumentality with annual compensation less than $20,000 and weekly hours fewer than 35.
Requires appointment of State monitor in certain school districts.
Requires Executive Branch departments or agencies notify Legislature of completion of school district audit report within 30 days of completion.
Prohibits nonrenewal of homeowners insurance policies based on proximity to water or risk of windstorm related claims.

Provides that certain districts are not penalized in the calculation of State debt service aid for school facilities projects in which bonds were authorized but not issued prior to effective date of P.L.2008, c.39.
Increases penalty for certain type of manslaughter.
Allows vendors to retain 1% of sales tax collected as consideration for collecting and promptly remitting the tax.
Provides sales tax exemption for sales of prepared foods.
Prohibits casino licensees from entering into certain agreements.
Extends Neighborhood Revitalization Tax Credit Program eligibility to areas located in municipality in which casino gaming is authorized.
Increases fine for defacement of private property including property used for religious purposes.
Prohibits Pinelands Commission from altering pinelands management area boundaries.
Makes various changes to registration and community notification requirements under Megan's Law.
Removes penalty of suspension or postponement of driving privileges for underage person convicted of unlawfully entering or wagering in casino or simulcasting facility.

Provides investment alternative tax will not apply to new casinos during first five years of operation; changes certain requirements for CRDA projects funding; temporarily changes rates for casino gross revenue tax and investment alternative tax.
Reduces number of members serving on Casino Control Commission from five to three.
Provides for off-site public access and setback waivers for certain coastal developments; establishes standard for determining filled water's edge.

Authorizes county colleges and county vocational school districts to establish aviation related job certification, training, and internship programs and provides a corporation business tax credit for funds donated to support such programs.
Reduces from ten to three number of qualified voters in an election for whom a person can serve as an authorized messenger.
Addresses qualifications and compensation of casino conservators and persons providing services under conservatorship.
Expands area for designation of eligible neighborhoods under "Neighborhood Revitalization State Tax Credit Act."
Authorizes "100 percent Disabled Veteran" license plates for qualified veterans; entitles holders to handicapped parking privileges.
Prohibits smoking in State-owned or operated vehicles.
Creates "New Jersey Senior Labor Task Force."
Prohibits awarding of certain State grant funds to nonprofit organization which includes on its governing board the Governor or legislator.
Expands the provisions of Operation Recognition to veterans of the Korean and Vietnam conflicts.
Reduces compensation afforded members of Legislature by 20%.
Decreases the threshold percentages of student enrollment necessary for a sending school district to obtain representation on a receiving school district board of education.
Provides gross income tax exclusion for income earned in aviation related employment during or after qualified aviation related job training.
Expands "Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit" program to municipalities with casino gaming.
Prohibits loans as political contributions by certain persons; prohibits certain inducements for political contributions; reduces permitted amount of outstanding loans in certain cases.
Prohibits campaign contributions by certain individuals, businesses or other organizations performing public contracts.
Prohibits awarding of municipal professional services contracts to members of Legislature.
Prohibits certain relatives of legislators from being employed or assigned in certain positions.
Requires all elected officials and candidates and certain other public officials to file financial disclosure statement.
Clarifies that certain ethical standards apply to Governor and Governor's staff.
Establishes new standard and procedure for forfeiture of elective public office for accepting illegal contributions; removes illegal contribution threshold for such forfeiture.

Limits contributions to certain candidates and elected officials by certain public contractors; limits contributions by certain political party committees; repeals certain campaign contribution prohibitions.
Prohibits member of Legislature from performing certain no-bid contracts.
Requires issue advocacy organization using certain candidate information in advertisements to register with ELEC as political committee or continuing political committee.
Prohibits simultaneous holding of certain State, county and municipal elective offices; provides for transition period between offices.
Bans campaign contributions and certain political communication by corporations and labor organizations.
Prohibits campaign contributions by certain individuals, businesses or other organizations that purchase or acquire property involved in eminent domain proceedings.
Establishes a "State Authorities Review Commission."
Establishes a "Local Authorities Review Commission."
Clarifies penalties court may impose in sentencing certain adults and juveniles guilty of making false public alarms.

Requires electronic bulletin board on DCA website for local units to advertise shared services opportunities; requires development of computerized survey to match local units together to implement shared services.
Requires suspension of State officer or employee indicted for certain offenses that, upon conviction, require forfeiture of office or position.
Requires suspension of local elected and appointed officers and employees indicted for certain offenses that, upon conviction, require forfeiture of office or position.
Eliminates PERS membership for current and future part-time elected and appointed officials.
Concerns criminal background checks for certain school employees.
Prohibits sex offenders from entering school property.

Establishes measures to provide employment stability for teaching paraprofessionals employed in school districts that receive federal funding under Title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act.
Requires ELEC to provide ethics training for governmental affairs agents.
Requires all elected or appointed local government officers to receive ethics training.
Requires public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes or found at fault in certain civil actions to reimburse public entities for legal expenses.
Establishes certain minimum standards for State contracts paid on hourly basis.

Requires prequalification process for prospective bidders on school district transportation contracts; authorizes debarment of bidders convicted of certain crimes; authorizes disqualification of bidder or termination of transportation contract for certain crimes by an employee.
Increases penalties for underage drinking.
Directs AG to enter into agreement with U.S. Attorney General to empower certain corrections officers to investigate immigration status of inmates.
Prohibits certain political activity by governmental employees and by public employee unions.
Provides that fee increases for holders of certain licenses be authorized by State Comptroller under certain circumstances.
Requires State Treasurer to post information about State contracts for legal services on special website.
Permits Commissioner of Transportation to adopt regulations limiting the operation of certain commercial motor vehicles.
Prohibits member of Legislature from representing any person or party other than the State in connection with any proceeding of municipal, county, or State government entity.
Allows a motor fuel tax refund for fuel used by certain volunteer first responders operating personal vehicles during emergency responses.
Regulates receipt of things of value by members and employees of Legislature and officers and employees of Executive Branch.
Limits payment to certain public employees for accumulated sick leave upon retirement; requires fine and reprimand or termination for violation of sick leave by public employee.

Authorizes municipalities and fire districts to require physician's certificate as condition for service or continuing service by volunteer fire fighters; requires municipalities and fire districts to reimburse them for out-of-pocket costs.
Decreases certain public document copy fees; amount of fee dependent upon whether letter size page or legal size page. *
Allows State agencies, counties and municipalities to comply with certain publication requirements by means of Internet.
Requires reporting of public high school, district and Statewide drop-out and graduation rates.
"Statewide Drought Management Act."
Concerns unwanted delivery of newspapers.
Adds contact via electronic device to prohibited contact enumerated in permanent restraining orders for convicted stalkers.
Requires certain cities of the second class to establish a Second Chance Council to develop a plan to increase jobs for released criminals and high school dropouts.
Outlines procedures for conducting drug tests involving State law enforcement officers.
Establishes timeframes for certain stages in interest arbitration procedures.
Expands definition of "place of business" under Franchise Practices Act.
Requires complaint filed with Joint Legislative Committee on Ethical Standards to be in writing and signed and to contain certificate of acknowledgement; bars faxing of complaint to joint committee.
Requires legal action against certain licensed persons to be brought within two years.
Makes chief of police contractual municipal employee and requires peer review and performance evaluation for contract renewal.

"New Jersey College Student and Parent Consumer Information Act"; requires each four-year public institution of higher education to provide on its website certain information regarding its costs, faculty, and graduation rates.

Includes limitations on amount of retirement compensation which may be provided by a school board in the employment contracts of superintendents of schools, assistant superintendents of schools, and school business administrators.
Revises law concerning tastings and samplings conducted by certain alcoholic beverage licensees.
Prohibits public safety directors from exercising police powers.
Establishes new motorcycle safety provisions.
Creates e-mail registration requirement for convicted stalkers.
Clarifies school district employees subject to statutory provisions concerning supplemental compensation for unused sick leave and vacation carry forward requirements.
Requires DHS to develop procedures to enable hospitals to promptly transfer emergency department patients with mental illness to appropriate treatment setting.
Requires DHS and DCF to establish standardized admission protocols and medical clearance criteria for admission to behavioral health care facilities.
Requires DHS and DCF to identify available mental health services and perform needs assessment.
Extends time period for renewal of lapsed alcoholic beverage retail licenses.
Reduces required local employer contributions to PERS and PFRS for State fiscal years 2009 through 2011.
Concerns newspaper publication of notice of certain real estate sales.
Permits certain persons holding elective public office to remain eligible for enrollment in PERS.
Provides for certain surplus lines producer fees to be determined by regulation.
Concerns certain disciplinary procedures, collective bargaining, and binding arbitration in public employment.
Increases loss ratio reporting and disclosure requirements for carriers offering individual and group health insurance plans; applies loss ratio requirement to large group health insurance plans.
Concerns the delivery and oversight of coverage under certain health benefits plans; establishes Health Care Patient Ombudsperson.
Regulates physician profiling programs used by managed care networks.
Increases reimbursement rate for certain special education costs.
Extends prevailing wage requirements to certain maintenance-related projects.
Establishes in DOE a four-year Community Service Phase Two Pilot Enhancement Program.

Re-establishes State Board of Education as the rule-making authority under several school district accountability statutes and reinstates its role in considering appeals from any Commissioner of Education determination.
Provides that executive reorganization plan cannot take effect unless approved by the Legislature within 60 days of transmittal.
Requires vacancies in US Senate be filled only by special election.
"Fort Monmouth Economic Revitalization Authority Act." *
Requires builders of new homes to provide owners with building plans.
Clarifies DCA's authority to ensure planned real estate development builders comply with disclosure requirements.
Requires developer under "The Planned Real Estate Full Disclosure Act" to post bond with DCA and provides for more accountability to owners in common interest community.
Exempts volunteer fire companies from charitable registration fees.
Authorizes any municipality outside Highlands Region to establish receiving zones for Highlands transfer of development rights program.
Clarifies current law regarding noisy motor vehicle muffler; establishes penalty for commercial motor vehicle operators.

Clarifies and strengthens disclosure requirements for certain complimentary tickets received by candidates, officeholders, political party officials, political committees and continuing political committees.

Authorizes the Legislative Counsel in the Office of Legislative Services to accept proper and sufficient service of process on behalf of the State Legislature when either or both Houses are named defendants in any legal proceeding.
Eliminates awards of punitive damages against public entities, and against public officers, employees and servants acting within the scope or under color of their office, employment or agency.
Changes date for election of fire district commissioners from third Saturday in February to day of general election.
Phases out the transfer inheritance tax over two years.
Provides for the election of school board members at November general election.
Moves school, fire district and certain municipal elections to date of nonpartisan municipal elections.
Increases statutory mandatory retirement age for justices, judges, administrative law judges, county prosecutors, and workers' compensation judges from 70 to 75.
Directs State public issuer of obligations to use competitive bidding process when investing proceeds from such obligations.

Prohibits contributions by administrator of Type II school district to candidates for member of district's school board; restricts employment by Type II school district of contributors to election campaign of member of district's school board.
Permits tax credit against gross income tax for certain adoption expenses.
Concerns debarment of contractors for conviction of certain computer-related crimes.
Requires foreign corporations providing electronic communication services or remote computing services to comply with New Jersey subpoenas, court orders and search warrants.
Revises child pornography law.
Excuses students with conflicts of conscience from certain class requirements of public institutions of higher education.
Requires school districts to provide transportation to public and nonpublic school pupils living along hazardous routes.
Requires certain conditions affecting application for development or zoning variance to be recorded with municipality and county.
Requires savings from recent changes in PERS and TPAF to ease unfunded liability of those systems.
Makes it a fourth degree crime to exhibit fraudulent motor vehicle insurance identification card to municipal prosecutor.
Imposes $50 surcharge on intoxicated drivers; establishes county sheriffs or prosecutors educational program in secondary schools concerning dangers of impaired driving.
Provides for State income tax deduction to private well owners for water testing costs.
Authorizes special license emblems for Fraternal Order of Police members.
Prohibits sex offenders from using or possessing erectile dysfunction drugs; prohibits provision or sale of erectile dysfunction drugs to sex offenders.
Empowers federal air marshals to make arrests for certain violations of New Jersey law.
Establishes confidential data base to assist State Police in issuance of firearms purchaser identification cards and handgun purchase permits.
The "Consumer Telephone Records Protection Act of 2008."
Regulates sale of certain bicycles with quick release wheels.
"Truth in Beef Packaging Act of 2008."
Requires certain CATV companies to offer a family-oriented and moderately-priced cable programming package to subscribers.
Prohibits sending unsolicited advertising by text messaging, and requires companies offering text messaging services to allow customers to block all incoming and outgoing text messages. *
Reduces compensation of members of Legislature by 15%.
Permits elected officials and legislators with simultaneous PERS-covered elected office or employment to choose only one position for receipt of PERS credit.
Establishes annual sales tax holiday for certain sales of personal computers and certain sales of school supplies and equipment during first full weekend of August.
Requires telephone number to report suspicious activities or behavior related to terrorism be printed on certificates of approval.
Prohibits display of gift card account numbers.

Requires DOE to post information on website concerning incidents in which a pupil is left on a school bus at the end of a driver's route; permits commissioner to fine busing providers for such incidents.
Affords employment protection to certain volunteer emergency responders.
Establishes Office of Airline Consumer Advocate and consumer bill of rights for airline passengers; requires provision of certain services to passengers on flights delayed more than two hours.
Directs Attorney General to develop guidelines for positive identification of suspects before release.
Wireless Telephone Consumer Protection Act; establishes certain consumer protections for wireless telephone subscribers.
The "Truth in Mortgaging Act"; creates crime of residential mortgage fraud.
Creates crime of exposure to toxic pollutants.
Requires the adoption of nepotism policies by school districts and charter schools.
Prohibits sale of lottery tickets or shares after claim of top prizes.

Requires site remediation procedures for structures to be used for residential purposes; modifies procedures for structures to be used for child care and educational purposes, and sites previously used for agricultural purposes.
Prohibits credit card foreign transaction fees.
Prohibits sale of products containing dextromethorphan to minors under 18 years of age.*
Requires breath or blood sample to be obtained from certain drivers involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death or serious bodily injury.*
Requires debt collector to provide debtor certain information.
Requires State Treasurer to organize and publish certain contract and grant data and information on State expenditure Internet website.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in hedge funds and derivative contracts.
Requires school districts to provide for the safe operation of electrically operated partitions in classrooms or other school facilities.
Requires each hospital board of trustees to adopt a written policy governing conflicts of interest.

Provides for county welfare agency monitoring of welfare emergency assistance motel placements, annual inspection of hotels used for emergency assistance recipients and notice of mobile health van services.
Prohibits certain unsolicited checks.
Establishes the authority of the court to order electronic monitoring of certain convicted domestic violence offenders.
Establishes minimum registered professional nurse staffing standards for hospitals and ambulatory surgery facilities and certain DHS facilities.
Expands offense of computer criminal activity to include accessing computer data for an unlawful purpose by means of a knowing misrepresentation as to identity of person requesting information.
Prohibits unilateral changing of terms and conditions of employment by public employers.
Establishes criminal penalties for failure to pay the minimum wage.
Provides non-forfeitable right to post-retirement medical benefits provided by law to certain public employees with 25 years of service.
Requires the establishment of a prequalification process for prospective bidders on public school district transportation contracts.
Authorizes a board of education to reject the lowest bid for a school transportation contract based on the school bus safety inspection record of the bidder.
Permits a board of education to adopt a salary policy in excess of three years and requires the payment of increments pursuant to an expired policy in certain circumstances.
Prohibits political contributions by county and municipal political party committees to other committees; increases certain penalties.
Prohibits delegation of investment discretion of Director of Division of Investment to outside managers.
Establishes circumstances under which municipalities may base development approval, the timing thereof, or denial, on sufficiency of local transportation infrastructure.
Clarifies power of municipalities to zone for separation of incompatible land uses through specification of reasonable separation limitations.
Makes employment matters not exempted by statute mandatory subjects of public employment collective bargaining.
Establishes the "Healthy Workplace Act."
Amends "State Transfer of Development Rights Act," and provides for impact fees and other incentives for establishment of transfer of development rights programs.
Provides DEP authority over remedy selection for cleanup of contaminated property to be used for residential purposes or as a school.
Jessica Rogers' Law: upgrades assault by auto or vessel in situations of road rage.

Establishes presumption of grandfathering of certain governing documents of homeowners' associations upon conflict with new statutory or regulatory provisions unless majority of members vote to amend.

Requires all cats and dogs released from shelters and pounds be sterilized with certain exceptions; increases certain dog-related fees; dedicates increases to Animal Population Control Fund; establishes new eligibility criteria for State spaying and neutering program.
Regulates pharmacy benefits management companies; makes an appropriation.
Provides for mandatory life imprisonment for sexual assault upon a minor.
Requires a State tax expenditure report be included in the Governor's annual budget message.
Extends eligibility for total property tax exemption to 100% disabled Cold War veterans; requires State to reimburse municipality for local tax revenue loss.
Requires movie theaters to install captioning technology for use by hearing impaired patrons.
Makes various changes to the "Law Against Discrimination"; repeals section 4 of P.L.1985, c.73.
The "Toxic-free Children's Products Act."
Requires Governor's annual budget message to include certain contract information.
Requires contractors to provide Department of the Treasury with employment information about contracts with public bodies.
Revises scope of public employee collective negotiations.
Provides additional penalties for violations of "Uniform Securities Law (1997)" involving certain persons.
Establishes permissive inferences related to conduct that serves as predicate to sex offenses against minors.
Upgrades certain sex crimes against minors.
Requires persons subject to Megan's Law registration to provide law enforcement with any Internet identifiers.
Limits job creation estimation under COAH regulations for warehousing activities.
Requires interpretive statements of State general obligation bond act public questions to include certain fiscal information.
Immunizes employers from civil liability for certain disclosures regarding employees and former employees.
Provides immunity from liability for certain recreational activities and from injuries caused by acts of God.
Requires the Director of the Division of Taxation to establish a gross income tax payment system by credit card or debit card.
Authorizes DMV to offer a red heart-shaped identifying symbol on personalized license plates.
Allows property taxpayers an additional year to file tax appeal after revaluation.
Includes auxiliary police officers in Emergency Services Length of Service Award Program.
Establishes that passenger vehicles other than police vehicles have a useful life of five years and allows local units to bond for such vehicles.
Establishes "Grandparenting Resource Center Pilot Program" and appropriates $3,000,000.
Mandates training for judges and judicial personnel regarding problems and issues faced by grandparents who are raising their grandchildren.
Creates the "Grandparents' Court Liaison Program."
Directs the Commission on Higher Education and the Department of Human Services to work with institutions of higher education in the development of certain family programs.
Requires HMFA to prioritize projects affordable to extended family care givers; amends Fair Housing Act to allow funding to programs supporting extended family care.
Requires DHS and DHSS to provide information about federal and State benefits to persons providing kinship care.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $4.4 million to DLPS for purchase and distribution of thermal imaging cameras for local police services.
Exempts sales of returnable plastic containers and pallets from sales and use tax.
Reduces statute of limitations for medical malpractice liability actions to four years.

Requires health insurers to cover treatment ordered by health care provider for covered person based on generally accepted standards of health care practice, subject to appeal; creates Carrier Appeals Program.
Permits law enforcement personnel to examine account records of E-ZPass customers when the theft of a transponder has been reported.

Dedicates $20 million annually in realty transfer fee revenues to pay for development, improvement, and repair of State parks, forests, recreation areas, historic sites, natural areas and fish and wildlife areas.
Requires interactive computer services to disable access to images, information, or data which depicts child engaged in prohibited sexual act.
Concerns medical malpractice procedures and liability.
Requires penalties to be levied against renters and homeowners who violate affordability controls on affordable housing units.
Limits to $5,000 per election amount contributed to and by county committee of a political party.
Upgrades crime of kidnapping minor less than 16 years of age and increases applicable term of imprisonment.
Revises the calculation of courtesy busing school budget cap adjustment for courtesy busing performed along a hazardous route.
Requires DMVA to send Servicemembers' Advisory Notice to members of National Guard called to active duty.

Prohibits former elected official from receiving for five years compensation from charitable or non-profit organization when official's candidate committee donated campaign contributions to organization.
Directs State owned or operated marinas to provide a 50% discount on boat launching fees for senior citizens on weekdays.
Revises maximum price at which ticket brokers or season ticket holders may resell tickets.
Requires insurers and State health care coverage programs to cover cost of HIV vaccine.
Eliminates requirement that candidate campaign treasurer reports be filed with county clerk for legislative, local and school board candidates.
Prohibits candidates and elected public officials charged with crimes from using campaign contributions for their legal defense.
Implements measures to strengthen oversight of hospital charity care subsidies.
Establishes Office of Airline Consumer Advocate and consumer bill of rights for airline passengers.
Provides that new ratables will be phased into the calculation of equalized valuation over a ten-year period in determining eligibility for State school aid.
Prohibits solid waste collectors from billing for residential collection services more than 30 days in advance of the service.
Clarifies that certain former New Jersey National Guard members may be eligible for higher education tuition assistance.
Clarifies calculation of at-risk weight in school funding formula.
Requires use of highest appraisal value as offer price for Green Acres and farmland preservation programs.
Prohibits DEP from imposing conditions on projects exempt from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Authorizes local law enforcement officers to inspect trucks.
Provides for awarding of certain costs to defendants who prevail in DEP enforcement actions.

Requires State compensation of property owners for certain property devalued due to certain environmental laws; and requires State agencies to evaluate proposed administrative rules for potential to constitute taking of real property.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for New Jersey - Local Open Space and Farmland Acquisition.
Repeals gross receipts and use taxes on retail sales of fur clothing.
Requires boards of education to provide more detailed information on compensation of school district employees not covered by collective bargaining agreements.
Authorizes certain non-emergency mutual agreements between municipalities for law enforcement purposes.
Limits hospital charges for care provided to county inmates at county correctional facilities to Medicaid rate.
Permits sale of raw milk under certain conditions and establishes raw milk permit program.
Exempts certain municipalities from payment for certain State Police services.
Prohibits county agency from arranging for emergency shelter services to be provided in different county, unless counties agree.
Authorizes business entities to designate representatives in court proceedings without the necessity for representation by an attorney.
Grants county governing body final authority to determine expenditures for courtroom facilities.
Establishes a limited education grant program for certain school districts sending pupils to a district that is experiencing overcrowding in its school facilities.
Allows students eligible for kindergarten enrollment in the subsequent school year to enroll in a choice district without prior enrollment in the sending district.
Requires family of juvenile in county detention center to reimburse county.
Provides that budget cap adjustment for the opening of a new school facility may be taken over several budget years in certain circumstances.
Designates "I'm From New Jersey" as the State song.
Requires DOT to provide for removal of deer carcasses from county and municipal roads; appropriates $730,000.
Clarifies that BB guns are not firearms under New Jersey law.
Limits the transportation costs of school districts sending students to county vocational school districts located outside the county of residence.
Requires notification of certain domestic violence victims through the Victim Information and Notification Everyday System (VINE).
Eliminates separate presidential primary election; provides delegates and alternates to national conventions of political parties will be elected at regular June primary election.
Requires executive county superintendent of schools to review all proposed contracts for goods or services of school districts with State support ratio of 70% or greater.

Adjusts thresholds under the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJQSAC) that trigger State intervention in school districts and requires appointment of State fiscal monitor in districts with a certain State aid support ratio.
Designates bison as agricultural livestock.
Establishes a formula for the distribution of State aid to school districts.
Authorizes reimbursement for EMT training from EMT Training Fund for certain volunteer firefighters.
Establishes program authorizing lease of historic buildings and structures in State parks, forests, and wildlife management areas.
Repeals law permitting project labor agreements.
Grants certain leaves of absence for Vietnam Veterans of America conventions.
Allows commercial farmer to recover reasonable costs and attorney fees of defending against unreasonable complaints under "Right to Farm Act."
Prohibits public utilities from recovering certain charges from customers.
Requires accountability of NJSPCA and county societies for prevention of cruelty to animals to Attorney General and county prosecutors, respectively.
Changes membership of, and election process for, NJSPCA board of trustees.
Provides tort claims immunity to certain State volunteer workers.
Permits board of education to accept donations for purpose of providing property tax relief.
Requires motorists to stop for pedestrians in or waiting to enter crosswalks.
Requires public schools to weight courses in visual and performing arts equally with other courses worth same number of credits in calculating grade point average.
Provides that limitation on lawsuit option does not apply in accident caused by drunk driver.
Permits municipal police officers to make arrests for any disorderly persons or petty disorderly persons offense outside the territorial limits of their municipality.
Establishes crime of participation in criminal street gang initiation ritual.

Expands duties of State Auditor to include performance audits at request of legislator; establishes Performance Audit Committee, consisting of eight public members, to help conduct performance audits.
Allows person calling certain State or local government entities to have option of speaking or leaving a recorded message with a human telephone operator during normal business hours.
Requires employers to provide time off from work for members of certain volunteer organizations to respond to fires under certain conditions.
Creates new motor vehicle offense of engaging in a pattern of aggressive driving.

"Janet's Law"; requires public schools, recreational fields and youth camps to have automated external defibrillators for youth athletic events, and public schools to include pupil training in use thereof and in cardio-pulmonary resuscitation.
Grants immunity from civil liability to persons reporting information concerning crimes related to terrorism.
Requires ballot question on approval of State bond issue to disclose total amount of debt of State or other entity, debt service on which is funded through annual State appropriation.
Allows charitable contribution tax deductions under New Jersey gross income tax.
Makes desecration of a military monument a crime of the third degree.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for new motor vehicles with certain fuel efficiency.
"New Jersey Senior Citizen Taxpayer Reverse Mortgage Program."
Creates the "Local Unit Audit Teams" program in the Department of the Treasury.
Eliminates provision that permits current members of Legislature who hold more than one elective public office on February 1, 2008 to continue to do so if service is continuous.
Requires health insurance coverage for anesthesiology services in connection with outpatient diagnostic screenings, including colonoscopies.
Exempts from realty transfer fees, sales of homes of certain New Jersey members of the military.
Requires impact statement for any proposed regulation affecting volunteer ambulance squad and fire company.
Concerns priority of claims against certain insured tortfeasors as between insurer paying PIP benefits and injured party.
Establishes Educational Security Task Force.
Authorizes members of the New Jersey State Legislature to solemnize marriages and civil unions.
Requires graduated driver licensees who plead guilty to non-point violations to complete driver safety course.
Provides for public comment period at certain sessions of each house of the Legislature.
Establishes conditional intervention program in municipal court for certain first-time offenders.
Requires certain persons to report suspected abuse, neglect or exploitation against vulnerable adults.
