Criminalizes driving under the influence with person 17 years of age or younger in vehicle.
Makes No Early Release Act applicable to persons convicted of child pornography crimes.
Imposes surcharge on drunk drivers to establish Drunk Driving Prevention and Education Grant Fund.
Increases drunk driving enforcement surcharge.
Enhances penalties for driving when license revoked.
Increases mandatory minimum term of imprisonment for certain repeat sex offenders.
Clarifies definition of "primary care" in Primary Care Physician and Dentist Loan Redemption Program to include practice of geriatrics.
Includes death by auto or vessel and certain assaults to crimes with bail restrictions; adds non-United States citizenship status to conditions warranting presumption favoring posting full cash bail.
Requires all automobile passengers to wear seat belts.
Requires annual review of all released sex offenders to determine if they were registered and tiered.
Provides for mandatory terms of imprisonment for assault upon senior citizens.
Provides for instruction in dyslexia awareness and methods of teaching students with dyslexia for candidates for teaching certificates and current teachers and paraprofessionals.
Establishes program for directing motorists to agricultural tourism establishments.*
Excludes charges for certain membership and initiation fees and dues from sales and use tax.
Includes death by auto or vessel and certain assaults as crimes with bail restrictions.
"Pharmacy Quality Improvement and Error Prevention Act."
Requires notice to primary and secondary borrower before repossession of motor vehicle under certain circumstances.
Permits in-person wagering at casinos on results of professional sports events, subject to voter approval.
Concerns arbitration for certain non-teaching school staff.
Chloe and Samantha's Law; requires notice to consumers of availability of products to prevent tip-over accidents involving certain furniture or televisions.
Directs State Comptroller to identify and recommend certain programmatic budget reductions for certain State agencies, authorities, and instrumentalities.
Increases the application fee and provides for an admission fee to pre-trial intervention; dedicates fee increase for victim services.
Revises animal fighting laws; increases existing, and establishes new, penalties.
Requires DEP to establish free recreational saltwater fishing registry.
Requires persons who serve alcoholic beverages in bars and restaurants to complete educational program.
Eliminates downgrading of DWI offenses that occur more than 10 years after previous conviction.
Provides that any public or nonpublic building used as a polling place and involved in providing care to children must be closed on general election day.

Establishes sales and use tax rate reduction period from October 1, 2009 through December 31, 2009 for sales of certain goods and services greater than or equal to $10,000; sets reduction period tax rate at 3.5%.
Establishes conflict resolution procedures through Department of Agriculture for complaints against existing commercial fishing docks and fish processing facilities at established locations. *
Designates July 30th of each year as "Corrections Officers Day."
Increases certain penalties for vehicular homicides involving intoxicated drivers; designated "Josh's and Craig's Law."
Provides automatic farmland assessment for owners of permanently preserved farmland.
Establishes new crimes concerning service dogs and upgrades crimes against certain other animals.
Increases PFRS benefits for active members when PFRS funded at 101%, for retirees over three fiscal years thereafter.
Provides paid post-retirement medical benefits to certain retired veteran State employees.
Requires civilian employees of DOC to be trained in gang awareness.
Requires 40 hours annual in-service training for State corrections officers.
Requires internal affairs investigations to be conducted by unit separate from unit responsible for collecting gang intelligence information.
Requires State Auditor review of certain Department of Corrections privatization contracts.
Requires State to offer surplus State police vehicles to certain volunteer fire and emergency service organizations.
Establishes the Travel and Tourism Supplemental Revenue Fund.
Authorizes DEP and NJ Marine Fisheries Council to regulate taking and management of striped bass.
Creates a directory of registered telemarketers.
Supplemental appropriation of $2 million to NJ Commerce and Economic Growth Commission for tourism promotion and grants to regional tourism councils.
Suspends certain tolls during evacuation of coastal areas.
Establishes "New Jersey Veterans' Hospital Task Force."
Requires notice of cancellation or nonrenewal of automobile and homeowners insurance policies to be sent by certified mail, return receipt requested.
Prohibits adoption of certain rules and regulations by State agencies prior to July 1, 2009.
Provides for deprivatization of motor vehicle inspection program when vendor contract concludes.
Exempts assets redeemed for long-term health care from property tax reimbursement income standards; requires notice of property tax reimbursement program on tax bills.
Extends useful life of certain school buses from 12 to 16 years.
Prohibits DEP from mandating public access to tidal waterfront areas adjacent to critical infrastructure or requiring the purchase or improvement of off-site locations for this purpose.
Permits public employees to waive enrollment in State-administered pension systems and elect enrollment in Defined Contribution Retirement Program.
Directs Office of Emergency Management to develop and undertake annual public awareness campaign concerning State's emergency coastal evacuation plan.
Prohibits towing and transportation of boats during emergency evacuations.
Requires the State Police to implement reverse lane strategy on certain roads.
Creates "Real Property Revaluation Review Commission."
Creates State contract set-aside program for businesses owned and operated by disabled veterans.
Creates "Task Force on the Extension of Route 55."
Directs DOT Commissioner to allocate Transportation Trust Fund monies for concept development and design of Route 55 extension.
Prohibits imposition of corporation business tax on certain foreign corporations carrying passengers into and out of State in motor vehicle or motorbus.
Requires license suspension of certain health care professionals and medical waste facilities, generators, and transporters for willful illegal or improper medical waste disposal.
Increases civil penalties for medical waste violations and intentional ocean pollution.
Requires that newly built schools be constructed to serve as emergency shelters.
Authorizes veterans property tax exemption for totally disabled veterans who did not serve in theater of war.
Lowers age of eligibility for surviving spouse under homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Requires issuance of construction permits for installation of wheelchair ramps on residential real property within 3 business days of application.
Allows public employers to offer retirees with other health care coverage incentive to waive SHBP coverage.
Allows construction of wind dependent energy facilities within 500 feet of mean high water line of tidal waters under certain circumstances.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
Creates crime of victimization of persons with disabilities and senior citizens.
Requires employers and birthing facilities to notify insured pregnant women if their health insurance coverage is not subject to 48-hour maternity law.
Authorizes the court to credit an indigent person under certain circumstances.
Allows person on police officer or firefighter eligible list who is unable to complete requirements for employment due to certain military service to have name placed on subsequent eligible list.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
Authorizes the issuance of restraining orders in situtations where the domestic violence statutes do not apply; repeals section 2 of P.L.1999, c.47.
Requires criminal history record background checks for public employees handling vital records.
Provides voter registration assistance to persons completing parole, probation, and criminal sentences.
Establishes "William's Law," pertaining to pool safety.
Permits surcharge of up to 22% to offset private collection fees for certain delinquent debts owed to courts, counties, and municipalities.
Amends Health Enterprise Zone law to allow municipalities more discretion in granting property tax exemptions to medical offices.
Establishes "Court Security Enhancement Fund" and increases court fees.
Provides prescriber or health care facility with discretion to number prescription blank forms consecutively.
Requires public bodies to allow public comment at every meeting.
Outlines criteria municipalities are to consider when establishing speed limits for local streets.
Eliminates dual governmental pay to members of Legislature for legislative duties.
Allows former mayors to perform marriages.
Authorizes special plate for holders of "Combat Action Ribbon."
Requires financial disclosure by candidates for public office in county or municipality.
Permits certain oaths, affirmations, and affidavits to be taken before township and village mayors.
Requires additional notices to governmental agencies upon termination of utility services to residential customers.
Exempts handicapped spots from meters or fees.
Increases penalties for underage drivers who have consumed alcohol.
Excludes veterans' benefits from calculation of financial obligation for care at psychiatric facility.

Requires elected public officials and candidates for elective public office to disclose if they ever filed for bankruptcy; requires financial disclosure by candidates for public office in county or municipality.
Excludes military compensation of military personnel serving outside of this State from gross income tax.
Requires BPU to consider certain revenue-raising limitations when determining whether to approve increases in public utility rates, fares or charges that may be assessed to municipalities.
Permits contiguous municipalities in different vicinages to share court facilities.
Permits board of fire commissioners to amend fire district budget after adoption to insert special items of revenue.
Establishes security standards for judicial hearings at mental health facilities.
Requires municipal court judge to disclose to governing body of municipality information concerning certain decisions by the Advisory Committee on Judicial Conduct.
Provides that certain nonprofit organizations would not be assessed a civil administrative penalty under the "Water Supply Management Act" for exceeding permitted water allocations.
Alexandra's Law; prohibits operation of motor vehicle with detectable amount of CDS in blood.
Provides for electronic monitoring of domestic violence offenders and notification to the victim; designated as "Lisa's Law."
Establishes innovation zone program to stimulate technology industry clusters around New Jersey's research universities, colleges or research hospitals.
Provides bill of rights for persons receiving services under Congregate Housing Services Program.
Provides for equal opportunity for businesses that pay societal benefits charges to apply for certain energy-related incentives and funding. *
Directs the BPU to establish certain energy-conservation programs.

Requires development and implementation of mitigation plans for radon contamination in certain child care centers; requires DOE to develop such plans for child care centers operating in public schools, request funding, and implement plans when funded.
Authorizes companies under BPU jurisdiction to bill customers electronically upon customers' request.
Directs Chief Technology Officer to conduct study of costs and benefits of replacing the State's high-volume, basic computing systems with more cost-effective alternatives.
Authorizes public providers of utility services to bill customers electronically upon customers' request.
Limits electric public utility cost recovery to equipment or software that is compatible with, and capable of interoperating with, a smart grid system.
Establishes a Smart Grid Pilot Program and Smart Grid Technology Research Center at Rutgers The State University; appropriates funding for grants.

Directs Chief Technology Officer in the Office of Information Technology to study and report potential benefits of expanding the use of electronic transactions, including the use of electronic signature and electronic record by the State.
Authorizes creation of local renewable energy collaboratives and central renewable energy generation systems, and provides for sale of renewable power generation. **
Expands State programs to encourage investments in small technology companies.
Requires State to use energy-efficient outdoor lighting fixtures.
Requires EDA to establish a "High Performance Green Building Demonstration Project."
Requires BPU to offer similar incentives to residents purchasing certain oil heating equipment as are offered to residents purchasing certain natural gas heating equipment.

Requires development of uniform fee schedule by Department of Treasury for registration and certification of small and women- and minority-owned businesses; requires collaboration to streamline procurement application process.
"New Jersey Trade Secrets Act."
Establishes Become A Nurse license plates and dedicates fees for nursing scholarships.
Requires notification of rape care advocate under certain circumstances by law enforcement, prosecutors and medical providers.
Revises certain procedures for municipal redevelopment programs; prohibits certain campaign contributions by redevelopers.
Provides that payment of alimony shall become judgement by operation of law when due, and shall be enforceable as a civil judgement.
Requires notice of development applications be given to residential tenants on that property.
Imposes mandatory interest payment on delinquent child support judgments.
Permits physicians and veterinarians to earn continuing education credits by providing certain free medical or veterinary services.
Curbs contributions by certain public contractors and certain developers; curbs contributions by county and municipal political party committees.
The "Smart Container Act."
Requires Medicaid, NJ FamilyCare and SHBP to cover cost of HPV vaccine.
Prohibits certain terminal leave compensation for local elected officials.
Establishes the "Firearm Automated Licensing System"; provides for an additional assessment fee for retail dealer licenses, handgun purchaser permits and firearm purchaser identification cards.
Requires health insurers and SHBP to provide coverage for screening for cervical cancer, including testing for HPV.
Prohibits person from serving as officer of more than two political campaign committees.
Requires managed care plans to pay health care claims based on assignment of benefits.

Requires governmental affairs agents to disclose on notice of representation form compensation amount received from State or local government entities; requires notice to be posted on Internet site of Election Law Enforcement Commission.
Requires retailers to post warnings of lead poisoning from improper paint removal.
Revises criminal history record check process undergone by public and nonpublic school employees and school bus drivers.
Prohibits application of certain temporary tattoos. *
Requires prices to be quoted over telephone.
Requires staff of shelters for victims of domestic violence and emergency shelters for homeless to undergo criminal history record background checks.
Provides that public schools will not be in session on general election days when Office of President of the United States is on ballot.
Provides that property owner who negligently contaminates or neglects property shall be assessed property taxes at value of property without consideration of effects of contamination or neglect.
Concerns eligibility for Catastrophic Illness in Children Relief fund assistance when more than one child in family has catastrophic illness.
Requires State to contract with pharmaceutical companies to purchase influenza vaccine for high-risk persons and their care providers.
Requires DEP to establish and maintain a list of persons to be excluded from providing fill material to landfill reclamation project sites.
Presumes motor vehicle registrant wants to register to vote at time of registration, unless person specifically declines.

Requires additional public participation and health impact study as conditions of conversion of health service corporation to domestic stock insurer; dissolves the Heath Service Corporation Conversion Temporary Advisory Commission. *
Establishes New Jersey State Building Green Building Technology Task Force.
Requires board of education to unseal and announce contents of bids for certain subcontracting only at regularly scheduled, public meetings of the board.
Requires the Passaic Valley Sewerage Commissioners maintain minutes of meetings; provides Governor veto over minutes.
Requires development and distribution of curriculum guidelines on Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
Requires Local Finance Board approval for proposed loan agreements between local authorities and for-profit entities.
Requires SHBP to provide coverage for expenses incurred in screening for prostate cancer.
Requires mandatory sexual violence training for law enforcement, judicial and prosecutorial personnel.
Permits county board of taxation to extend municipality's filing deadline for assessment appeals for any year in which revaluation is implemented.
Establishes presumption of eligibility for accidental disability allowance for certain public employees who worked in certain locations following September 11, 2001 attack in New York City.

Creates presumption regarding disability pension and workers compensation eligibility for public employees and emergency personnel participating in World Trade Center operations; requires Commissioner of Health and Senior Services to develop health registry and screenings.
Revises scope of P.L.2004, c.89, expediting certain State permits in smart growth areas.
Allows certain undocumented aliens to qualify for in-state tuition rates at public institutions of higher education.
Increases contribution limit by counties and municipalities to volunteer first aid, ambulance, and rescue squads.
Authorizes probation officers to exercise police powers.
Transfers all probation functions and employees to Bureau of Probation in State Parole Board.
Establishes three-year Nurse Educator Pilot Program in Division of Consumer Affairs.
Revises law governing compulsory arbitration for public fire and police departments.
Establishes Task Force on Hospital Technology to recommend incentives to encourage hospitals to integrate technology to improve patient care and safety.

Revises statutory mental health coverage requirements and requires all health insurers and SHBP to cover treatment for alcoholism and other substance-use disorders under same terms and conditions as for other diseases or illnesses.
The "Animal Cruelty Recodification and Modernization Act."
Allows property taxpayers an additional 90 days to file tax appeal after revaluation.
Requires DOC to transfer certain payments of restitution to VCCB.
Exempts from realty transfer fees, sales of homes of certain New Jersey members of the military.
Creates Juvenile Transfer Task Force.
Expands membership of Domestic Security Preparedness Task Force to include DOBI commissioner.
Increases from $15,000 to $30,000 annual compensation in PERS-covered employment retiree may earn without reenrollment.

Requires certain appointed public officials to work 35 hours or more per week to be eligible for PERS and SHBP; requires termination of PERS and SHBP participation of certain appointed officials whose term of appointment expires.
Provides alternative annual reorganization meeting date for county political committees if regular date coincides with period of religious observance.*

Makes total property tax exemption for 100% disabled veterans retroactive to effective date of determination of total disability; requires State to reimburse municipalities for reimbursement of property taxes paid to veteran.

Designated Kevin Apuzzio's Law; allows municipalities to provide increased survivor pensions for certain volunteer emergency workers and requires municipalities to provide health and life insurance coverage to volunteer firefighters.
Prohibits Internet posting of certain information on law enforcement officers.
Changes title of animal cruelty investigator to "municipal humane law enforcement officer" and defines term in statute.
Provides that labor union representatives cannot be compelled to disclose certain information.
Clarifies authority of private investigators to perform executive protection services.
Revises requirements for private investigator identification cards.
Concerns access to government records by licensed private detectives under certain circumstances.
Requires boards of education to provide certain nutritional information for food and beverage items offered for sale in school cafeterias.
Waives certain motor vehicle fees for religious or charitable organizations that offer transportation for after school programs.
Establishes "gun-free" and "weapon free" zones around certain school and public properties.
Adds certain crimes as crimes which have bail restrictions.
Provides for automatic enrollment in PAAD and Senior Gold programs under certain circumstances.
Establishes "Regional Network Health Benefits Plan Pilot Program."
Provides for continuation of health insurance coverage in group and SHBP health plans for unlimited period of time for certain former employees and their dependents.
Requires DEP to hold local public hearing for certain major developments located in a State park or forest.
Requires off-track wagering licensee to pay 4% of its wagering revenues to host municipality.
Limits rent increases in certain low income rental projects financed by the New Jersey Housing and Mortgage Finance Agency.
Permits municipality to determine permissible parking distance from intersection, crosswalk or "stop" sign.
Expands homestead property tax rebate program for certain non-senior and non-disabled tenants based on revised income qualifications.
Prohibits businesses that outsource jobs overseas from receiving State contracts or grants; prohibits investment of State funds in such businesses.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for enrollment at a New Jersey college or university.
Modifies elements of the crime of stalking.
Requires readings at two separate meetings before final passage of a policy by a board of education.
Requires non-custodial parent to purchase health benefits coverage for child.
Requires social studies teachers to complete training in African-American studies.
Establishes "Matthew's Law Limiting the Use of Restraints."
Prohibits possession of ammunition capable of penetrating body armor.
Establishes Distressed Cemetery Maintenance and Preservation Fund.
Increases minimum wage.
Establishes Office of Minority Teacher Recruitment in Department of Education.
Authorizes educational service providers to provide in-district special education instructional programs.
Provides enhanced penalties for drunk drivers with blood alcohol concentration of 0.17% or greater.
Establishes the California fine particle standard as State standard.
Provides enhanced penalties for certain crimes when victim is 65 years of age or older, or disabled.
Requires ATM independent sales organizations to provide certain withdrawal options.
Allows persons on parole and probation to vote; provides registration assistance to persons on probation, parolees, and persons completing sentences.
Clarifies intent of Legislature to protect certain senior tenants; aligns housing age restrictions with federal law.

Expands parity between certain State-chartered financial institutions, and permits interstate banking by such institutions through de novo branching or expanded authority to acquire existing branches or institutions.
Makes certain requirements concerning downhill skiing.
Requires criminal history record check of school district volunteers.
Requires motorists operating vehicles to maintain minimum three foot safety distance when overtaking bicycles.
Revises approval process for rate changes applicable to medical malpractice liability insurance.
Permits evidence of prior convictions or juvenile adjudications in certain criminal cases.
Permits the refurbishment of school buses to extend the life of the bus by eight years.
Designates "John Bull" as NJ State steam locomotive.
Provides incentive grants for school districts to establish educational foundations.
Includes local emergency management volunteers in Emergency Services Volunteer Length of Service Award Program.
Permits the rabies inoculation of dogs at pounds or shelters under the direction of certain veterinarians.
Requires joint municipal planning board review of long-range facilities plans developed by regional school districts.
Provides employment credit for military service for Board of Education employees.
Increases pharmacy dispensing fees under Medicaid and PAAD by $1.00 over three-year period; appropriates $6,481,000 in State funds and $3,325,000 in federal funds.
Increases Medicaid reimbursement to assisted living providers.

Establishes single personal financial disclosure form for local government officers, candidates for Governor and member of Legislature, members of Legislature and school officials; revises criminal law on gifts to public servants.
Requires State responsibility for the educational costs of children in foster homes.
Revises eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Requires breath or blood test of drivers in fatal accidents.
Requires the placement of defibrillators in a public school complex.
Limits the payment of transportation costs for homeless students.
Allows New Jersey S corporations to elect to transfer corporation business tax credits to shareholders to apply against the shareholders' gross income tax liability.
Implements the economic indicator recommendations of the Commissioner of Education on Abbott district designation.
Authorizes the appointment of an independent counsel to investigate allegations concerning the New Jersey Schools Construction Corporation.
Prohibits the construction of school facilities on a contaminated or remediated site.
Establishes Public School Revenue Study Commission.
Abolishes Department of Personnel and New Jersey Commerce, Economic Growth and Tourism Commission and makes certain transfers; abolishes various other statutory entities.
Establishes Task Force on Public School Student Recess to study benefits of student recess and make recommendations on advisability of mandatory recess in school districts.
Permits any full-time employee of school board to attend annual New Jersey Education Association convention without loss of pay.
Appropriates $5 million for Sire Stakes, horse breeding and development.
Appropriates $10 million for Sire Stakes, horse breeding and development.
Exempts employees and school board members of federal impact aid districts from certain out-of-state travel restrictions.

Authorizes Council on Affordable Housing to enter into memoranda of understanding with certain planning entities; establishes presumption of compliance with council's regulations; establishes moratorium on builder's remedy.
Upgrades offenses of engaging in unauthorized practice of law; creates civil action; provides that persons convicted of the offenses are barred from appointment as a notary public. *
Requires the State and local contracting units to purchase biodiesel or biodiesel blended fuel manufactured in NJ.
Requires State entities to purchase biofuels in place of fossil fuels when reasonable, prudent and cost effective. *
Authorizes legal permanent resident aliens to sit for examination for certification as municipal clerk, chief financial officer, tax collector, or public works manager.

Requires specific reduction of sulfur content in heating oil, and scheduled increase of blending biofuels therein after July 1, 2011, unless requirements are waived by Governor pursuant to Executive Order.
Authorizes assessment of development impact fees by municipalities.
Permits certain sheriffs to enforce truck weight limits.
Establishes a computers for schools program in DOC.
Establishes N.J. Historical Commission program for preservation and promotion of graves of significant individuals of the American Revolutionary period; appropriates $200,000.
Raises vehicle registration fees for heavy vehicles and dedicates portion to Transportation Trust Fund Account.
Provides for automatic expungement of criminal records under certain circumstances.
Authorizes use of automated motor vehicle identification systems to enforce motor vehicle laws on certain local streets.
Eliminates smoking ban exemption for casinos and simulcasting facilities.
Enacts the "New Jersey Parentage Act of 2006."
Eliminates award of attorneys' fees, filing fees and costs of suit for technical violation of the consumer fraud act.
Directs AG to develop guidelines for law enforcement cooperation with municipal prosecutors.
Establishes the "Municipal Court Prosecutors' Automated System."
Directs AG to develop mandatory guidelines for municipal prosecutors.
Sets confidentiality standards for public employee assistance program records; prohibits employer actions against program participants.
Provides public servant is guilty of official misconduct if he knowingly obtains, arranges or provides "no-show" job for himself or another.
Requires in-network hospitals to notify patients of out-of-network health care professionals who provide services in hospital.
Establishes procedures for admitting into evidence blood sample certificates and related lab reports in drunk driving cases.
Upgrades assault on victims who are disabled.
Creates nine-member New Jersey Legislative Elections Public Financing Study Commission.
Requires electronic recording of purchases of over-the-counter drugs used to manufacture methamphetamine.
Requires certain tax-exempt institutions to reimburse school districts for the local educational costs of students who reside in tax-exempt institutional facilities and are enrolled in the district.
Requires the design of new public schools to incorporate the "Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design" (LEED) guidelines.
Prohibits use of State funds to lease or purchase certain motor vehicles.
The "Pesticide Use Reduction Recognition Act."
Prohibits cemetery company from charging additional fee for rendering certain services on Sunday.
Establishes that vacant permit parking spaces normally reserved for NJT train passengers are available for general public use during off-peak times. *
Allows lawsuits against home improvement contractors to be brought in county in which residential or non-commercial property is located.
Requires dental benefits coverage for dental composite restorations.
Clarifies failure to provide minimum care to an animal constitutes animal cruelty.
Requires the incorporation of solar panels in design and construction of new public school facilities.
Increases fine for student truancy and requires truant student to attend court-ordered truancy counseling program or other appropriate program.
Requires filing of report comparing investment returns earned by private money managers and by State employees for public employee retirement funds and State of New Jersey Cash Management Fund.
Requires replacement of all electronic voting machines used in State by district-based optical scan voting systems by June 8, 2010; makes appropriation.
Permits limited pharmacy sales of syringes and needles without a prescription.
Grants EDA broader discretion to approve applications for corporation business tax certificate transfer program and business employment incentive program.
Imposes certain conditions on NJPDES permit for energy generation facilities that withdraw water from, or discharge water to, a shallow lagoonal estuary.
Establishes 6-member "Prescription Drug Labeling Task Force."
Permanently disqualifies certain persons convicted of child endangerment from working with children.
Eliminates supplemental realty transfer fee and one percent fee on transfers of certain commercial real estate and tax on sale of controlling interests in certain commercial real property.
Removes authority of MVC to increase certain fees; sets certain fees by statute.

Requires energy monitoring systems to be installed in new commercial buildings; allows credit against corporation business tax and gross income tax for costs of purchasing and installing energy monitoring systems.
Permits developer to qualify for low interest loan from NJEDA when building new green housing.
Requires DOE to provide annual comparison of Statewide assessment scores of students based on enrollment in school buildings that incorporate certain United States Green Building Council guidelines.
Authorizes county colleges and county vocational school districts to establish green job certification programs.
Creates a green building competition.
Provides gross income tax exclusion for income earned by completing qualified energy efficient and renewable energy job training.
Concerns Office of Smart Growth and green building in NJ.
Provides for priority consideration, by DCA, DEP, DOT, and local government units, of permit applications for green building projects.
Expands duties of BPU Business Ombudsman to include permitting assistance to businesses that manufacture, or seek to manufacture, green energy products.
Requires basic generation service providers and electric public utilities to provide electric service at reduced rates to green buildings.
Establishes six-month paid green internship program in Department of Community Affairs.
Requires New Jersey Department of Labor and Workforce Development to provide database of initiatives from other states with respect to green jobs.
Requires Department of Labor and Workforce Development to establish a database of green job vacancies.
Requires Department of Labor and Workforce Development to establish certification program for green jobs and provide for tax credits.
Requires health insurance carriers to use standard explanation of benefits form.
Permits payments in subsidized adoption until child becomes 21 years of age under certain circumstances.
Allows adoptees access to nonidentifying family medical history information.

Requires certain nongovernmental employers to provide health care premium conversion plans for employees; excludes certain employee health care premium conversions from taxation under the gross income tax.
Establishes the crime of negligent homicide.
Provides for civil action and treble damages for a violation of the "New Jersey Trademark Counterfeit Act."
Requires owner to immediately report loss or theft of firearm to police.
Requires DHSS to establish emergency action plan for hospitals.
Requires study of availability of certain health care services by independent entity.
Excludes from income for gross income tax and PAAD eligibility purposes victims' remuneration for involuntary internment received under judgments or settlement agreements.
Prohibits penalizing pharmacy for dispensing forged or fraudulent prescription approved by certain State prescription drug benefit programs.
Requires insurers to cover treatment for sickle cell anemia; requires DHSS to provide information to public about sickle cell anemia.*
Establishes the "Healthy New Jersey Labor-Management" demonstration program.
Allows a gross income tax deduction for certain higher education tuition and fee expenses.
"The Muhammad Ali/Rocky Marciano Boxing Reform Act"; enhances regulation of boxing.
Requires small employer health insurance carriers to offer coverage for treatment of infertility.
Provides for attachment of real property relating to terrorism.
Extends the statute of limitations for certain sexual abuse cases.
Provides certain requirements for donation container solicitations by charities.
Requires insurers to provide coverage for medications and dose-intensive chemotherapy/bone marrow transplants and umbilical cord blood transplants for treatment of sickle cell anemia.
Restricts sale or lease of certain ultrasound equipment.
Adds fraud via telecommunication or electronic means to list of prohibited activities for certain security transactions; increases penalties.
Extends eligibility for certain benefits to veterans who performed active service in U.S. Armed Forces during Cold War.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to Cold War veterans.
Prohibits false or secret compartments in motor vehicles under certain circumstances.
Imposes liability insurance requirement on alcoholic beverage licensees and provides penalties for occupancy and fire code violations.
Provides for increased penalties for a crime committed in a church, synagogue, temple or other place of public worship.
Establishes "Victim-Witness Scholarship Fund;" establishes "Witness Protection Fund;" and concerns State forfeiture funds.
Establishes a pothole repair and research program in the Department of Transportation and provides funding from new motor vehicle tire fee revenue.

Requires managed care companies to pay health care claims based on assignment of benefits and disclosed fee schedules; requires coverage under certain conditions; authorizes civil actions against violators.
Changes composition of board of directors of health service corporations.
Includes security fraud as violation of consumer fraud act.
Permits certain minors to consent to forensic care or treatment.
Upgrades offense of harassment under certain circumstances.
Concerns the issuance and forfeiture of bail bonds.
Increases income eligibility limits for PAAD program and Senior Gold Prescription Discount Program.
Establishes Task Force on Underage Drinking in Higher Education.
Modifies laws concerning inmate income and complaints; creates uniform identification cards for attorneys to enter State correctional facilities.
Exempts military personnel receiving combat zone pay from the gross income tax.
Requires campaign contribution to be accompanied by certification that contributor has not been convicted of crime.
Prohibits use of campaign funds by candidate or legislative leader convicted of crime; requires that such funds be paid to ELEC for enforcement purposes.
Eliminates statute of limitations in civil cases involving certain sexual offenses.
Requires AG to defend challenges to certain municipal ordinances that establish residency requirements for convicted sex offenders.
Prohibits the use of certain fishing gear on artificial reefs.
Designates portion of State Highway Route No. 35 as "Chosin Few Memorial Highway." *
Establishes penalties for manufacture, purchase or possession of certain keys.
Requires Superintendent of State Police to conduct study prior to closing road station.
Restricts conveyance of National Guard Training Center in Borough of Sea Girt, Monmouth County; requires study and public hearings before conveyance.
Upgrades lewdness to fourth degree crime if committed in public rest room.
Designates "Hail to New Jersey" as State song.
Requires Division of Criminal Justice to prepare impact statement before police force merger; requires merger to be approved by referendum.
Eliminates imposition of sales and use tax on charges for initiation fees, membership fees, or dues for access to or use of certain health and fitness clubs and organizations.
Establishes State Energy Council.
Establishes training wage.

Revises laws governing provision of affordable housing; reestablishes regional contribution agreement as method of meeting affordable housing obligation; repeals Statewide non-residential development fee.
Requires local units to provide notification when changing health benefits plan providers.
Provides that only licensed locksmiths may program motor vehicle transponder keys.
Requires Division of Property Management and Construction to conduct analysis of State buildings to determine energy and cost savings through use of renewable energy equipment or technology.
Provides partial tax credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for cost of renewable energy property.
Permits bars and restaurants to serve alcohol at bingo games on premises.
Removes licensing requirement for recreational bingo games.

Permits municipalities to satisfy fair share housing obligation by a 15 percent set aside of new residential development; defines municipal fair share as a portion of prospective regional housing need.
Upgrades penalties for assaults committed against process servers and licensed private investigators and detectives.
Removes proposed exemption from State's public records act for certain domestic nonprofit corporations under certain circumstances.
Requires permanent driver's license suspension for third drunk driving offense.
Requires motor vehicle dealer to pay off loan on trade-in within seven days.
Requires person eligible for health care benefits from more than one public entity to choose coverage from only one.

Prohibits member of Legislature from holding local appointive office or position; removes provision allowing current members holding more than one elective position as of February 1, 2008 to continue to do so if service continuous.
Defines and removes limits on municipal market to affordable programs.
Imposes a two-year moratorium on increases in public utility rates.
Establishes requirements governing the closing of any State prison.
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Authorizes the executive county superintendent of schools to reduce the required local share of a non-operating district.
Penalizes employment of unauthorized aliens; requires verification of citizenship for employment.
Establishes penalties for drivers who have never obtained driver's license.
Restricts occupancy of dwelling unit in age-restricted community to older adults following resale.
Provides enhanced penalties for making a false report to law enforcement authorities in certain circumstances.
Requires Commissioner of Education to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on school districts.
Restricts certain former DEP employees from employment with a permit applicant for one year after termination of DEP employments.
Prohibits implementation of formula-based rates for sewerage authorities and electric, gas and water public utilities.

Extends requirement of wastewater management planning agencies to establish or update wastewater management plans, and extends validity of sewer service areas and wastewater service areas, until April 7, 2011.
Revises procedure for removal of municipal administrator by municipal council; provides for payment of balance of salary to municipal administrator upon removal.
Prohibits release on bail of persons in the country illegally who are charged with crimes of the first or second degree or with two prior criminal convictions.
Permits advertising on exterior of school buses.
Repeals law providing benefits for family temporary disability leave.
Revises requirements for distribution of State aid under "Special Municipal Aid Act."
Prohibits certain expenditures in school districts and establishes State aid penalty for violations.
Requires State agencies to adopt telecommuting programs and reports to be made on implementation of these programs.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain business telecommuting program development and implementation costs.
Invalidates any nominating petition filed after deadline therefor; voids any attempt by candidate to petition court to accept validity of petition filed after deadline.

Prohibits filling of vacancy among candidates if vacancy occurs after 48th and before 14th day before general election, with certain exceptions; prohibits filling subsequent vacancies before general election.
Delays implementation of paid family leave for two years.
"Zero-Based Budget Act;" requires State Treasurer to develop and integrate certain zero-based budgeting practices and procedures in preparation and submission of Governor's annual budget message.
Authorizes free admission to State parks and forests for retired veterans living in NJ and their immediate family members.
Establishes special license plates supporting autism awareness.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses for certain retired military personnel.
Revises and expands duties and responsibilities of State Auditor in performance of certain audits and reviews.
Revises requirements for distribution of State aid under "Special Municipal Aid Act."
Expands the list of crimes that may not be expunged.
Increases penalties for luring a child and kidnapping.
Establishes crime for adult to misrepresent age in order to join youth serving organization.
Provides for use of alternative dispute resolution to settle disagreements between State agencies concerning public works projects.
Expands number of State officials required to reside in State.
Provides 10% reduction in compensation for members of Legislature.
Increases the penalty for certain gang related crimes.
Provides that minimum local tax levy requirement will only be applicable to certain school districts.
Provides for voluntary waiver of compensation by members of Senate and General Assembly.
Establishes crime of initiating a false "Amber Alert."
Establishes penalties for employer who allows unauthorized aliens to operate employer owned motor vehicle.
Requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on municipalities and counties.
Protects municipalities that have complied with affordable housing obligations from being required to provide more than their fair share.
Establishes low interest mortgage program in HMFA for volunteer fire and rescue squad members.
Adds representatives from the Department of Community Affairs to the Domestic Security Preparedness Task Force.
Provides PFRS member in federal or State military service who is injured or killed with disability or death benefits.
Directs the State Lottery Commission to establish video lottery at not more than three horse racetracks; provides for NJ Casino Control Commission and NJ Division of Gaming Enforcement oversight.
Revises statutes regulating bingo, raffles and amusement games.
Revises "Off-Track and Account Wagering Act."
Allows school districts to qualify for assistance under the New Jersey Shade Tree and Community Forestry Assistance Act.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support improvement of State parks and forests.
Concerns contents of zoning ordinances.
Prohibits sale on school property of certain foods during school breakfast and lunch periods.
Requires each municipality to establish a Reverse 9-1-1 system.
Provides immunity from liability for persons who install or inspect child restraint systems.

Requires the "Commission to Review Criminal Sentencing" to examine activities which victimize persons, particularly women and children, and are not codified in the Code of Criminal Justice and recommend appropriate legislation for establishing such crimes.
Concerns magazine subscriptions.
Allows corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credit for employer expenditures to provide certain physical fitness benefits to employees.

Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize 5,000 video lottery terminals at Meadowlands horse racetrack; preserves Casino Revenue Fund at FY2005 level; provides for benefits to horse racing industry.
Authorizes public institutions of higher education to establish textbook rental programs.
Increases penalty amount for violations of certain laws regulating retail sale of motor fuel to not less than $500 nor more than $1,000.
Requires installation of fire suppression systems in school buses and special paratransit vehicles.
Clarifies functioning high-mounted rear stop lamp is required under State law.
Establishes pilot program in DEP for chemical cleanouts in schools.
Clarifies deadline to request absentee ballot application.
Concerns transfer of PANYNJ contracts related to marine terminals.
Criminalizes the manufacture, distribution and possession of Salvia divinorum.
Exempts membership fees, initiation fees, or dues for access to health and fitness, athletic, or sporting clubs of certain charitable organizations from sales and use tax.
Requires labeling of food containing any product from a cloned animal or its progeny.
Requires retail store operators to establish in-store recycling programs that provide opportunities for customers to return clean plastic carryout bags.
Requires retailers to provide consumers with information on origin of raw produce.
Requires NJ Transit to do study of platform safety issues at rail stations.
Revises laws concerning pedestrian safety and traffic control; requires drivers to stop and remain stopped for pedestrians under certain conditions.
"Thomas P. Canzanella Twenty First Century First Responders Protection Act"; concerns workers' compensation for public safety workers.
Requires bittering agent to be added to certain engine coolants and antifreeze to render it unpalatable.
Requires NJ Transit to provide refunds for unused tickets for certain transit services.
Exempts from sales tax all hybrid and certain highly fuel efficient vehicles.
Requires DEP to conduct study concerning single-use paper bags and plastic bags.
Requires SHBP and School Employees' Health Benefits Program audit programs to review employee, retiree and dependent eligibility at least every five years.

Requires biannual assessment of the condition of trees within 25 feet of any public highway maintained by DOT and on the State's three toll roads and repair or removal of trees presenting a traffic hazard.
Permits certain fair share affordable housing obligations to be met with family and veteran's housing.
Requires projects with State or Local financing to be built to high performance green building standards and provides for performance review and annual report.
Designates prison telephone revenues for VCCB claims.
Exempts police from jury duty.
Increases penalties for committing serious offenses while released on bail.
Permits qualified retired law enforcement officers who were employed by law enforcement agencies outside the State to carry firearms.
Requires State park and forest restroom facilities to include an exclusive family restroom.
Requires police notification when driver license is suspended.
Establishes new offenses concerning the unlawful possession and use of credit card scanners.
Provides for reimbursement of training costs of certain law enforcement officers.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under the gross income tax.
Establishes that traffic fine overpayments of $5 or less do not have to be refunded.
Upgrades penalties for certain fireworks violations.
Prohibits additional jughandles on roads or highways in the State.
Increases penalties for certain campaign advertising violations.
Changes earliest date of construction or rehabilitation of housing granted credits without controls.
Includes screening for toxoplasmosis in newborn screening program.
Directs DHSS to adopt regulations concerning the billing practices and fees charged for basic and advanced life support services.
Recodifies offenses against animals under State criminal code; increases degree of crime for certain offenses.
Establishes offense of soliciting image of minor with unlawful purpose.
Establishes animal cruelty offenses pertaining to chaining or other restraint of animals.
Removes requirement of physical interference from crime of obstructing administration of law.
Requires water purveyors and licensed operators to notify municipalities they service regarding water supply and water quality issues.
Ensures operation of certain motor fuel storage, distribution and dispensing facilities during disasters and emergencies.
Provides grants and tax credits for school districts and private contractors for installing cameras on school buses.
Exempts initiation fees, membership fees, and dues of certain golf clubs and organizations from sales and use tax.
Upgrades penalties for drag racing.
Grants right to carry handgun to certain retired campus police officers.
Revises distribution of monies from Alcohol Education, Rehabilitation and Enforcement Fund to municipalities.
Eliminates supplemental realty transfer fee.
Permits use of overseas absentee ballots for all elections.
Requires ten years legal experience to be eligible to be appointed county prosecutor.
Allows TPAF retiree to be employed as certificated superintendent or administrator for limited time frame due to critical need without TPAF reenrollment.
Provides uniform procedure for sheriffs to provide certain surplus notices in mortgage foreclosure actions.
Requires State agencies to review operations and to implement use of Internet to conduct public business when cost savings may be realized, with certain exceptions.
Requires public body to publish notice of public meeting on official Internet website.
Permits county board of chosen freeholders to appoint interim member of county tax board under certain circumstances.
Authorizes creation of 33rd urban enterprise zone in Borough of Seaside Heights.
Requires Family Part under certain circumstances to dispose of charge of contempt of a domestic violence order on an emergency basis, without setting bail.
Creates new $100 assessment for convictions of certain sexual offenses to fund counseling for victims and their families; establishes Sexual Offender Victim Counseling Fund.
Provides New Jersey certification as a school administrator or principal to any applicant with similar certification in another State.
Allocates at least $100 million from Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund for coastal and inland Blue Acres land acquisition projects in flood-prone areas.

Revises certain endorsements to the instructional certificate, requires certified teachers in licensed child care centers located in Early Childhood Program Aid districts, and establishes a loan program to assist in the attainment of certification.
Denies custody and visitation rights to minor child by family members of individuals convicted of certain crimes.
Increases income eligibility limit for homestead property tax reimbursement program beginning in tax year 2002.
"Homestead School Property Tax Reimbursement Act"; provides State reimbursement for 50% of school property taxes paid by seniors, 65 years and older.
Allows gross income tax deduction for charitable contributions made for efforts in relief of the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks.
Allows adopted person access to his original birth certificate and other related information; appropriates $90,000.
Concerns telemarketing political calls.
Provides for the election of school board members at November general election.
Prohibits members of the Legislature from acting on certain bills in which they have personal interest; redefines personal interest.
Eliminates the public vote on a school district budget which is within cap.
Eliminates remarriage prohibition for PFRS death benefits; provides retirement allowance to certain survivors of PFRS members.
Requires private vocational schools to provide adequate written notification when planning to close facilities.
Increases annual income limits for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Authorizes criminal history record background checks of employees and volunteers of nonprofit domestic violence victim serving organizations.
Establishes Autism Education Council.
Provides that PFRS definitions of widow, widower and spouse will include domestic partners of all PFRS members.
Requires members of NJ Legislature to file statement of financial affairs.
Supplemental appropriation of $5 million to DHS to develop community residences for Division of Developmental Disabilities clients on the waiting list.
Provides NJ STARS II Program eligibility to certain students who attained an associate's degree through a joint program offered by a school district and a county college.
Increases penalties for violations committed by provisional driver's license holder.
Permits voter registration up to 29 days before an election; reduces polling place hours by one hour in the morning.
Requires school districts to disseminate information that stresses the importance of rigorous coursework.
Authorizes special license plates with proceeds to the families of NJ troops overseas.
Changes political party affiliation deadline from 50th to 21st day before primary; changes date after which absentee ballots must be available from 40th to 21st day before any election.
Restricts gifts to certified homemaker-home health aides from patients.
Requires home health agencies and health care service firms to place certified homemaker-home health aides to perform certain home-based services.
Requires school districts to identify in the school budget question presented at annual school election the percentage change in school tax levy between the prebudget and budget years.
Enhances penalty for leaving the scene of a boating accident.
Revises voting requirement necessary for the dissolution of a limited purpose regional school district.
Requires certain public restrooms to be equipped with baby-changing stations.
Requires each school district to adopt a dating violence policy to prevent and address incidents involving dating violence.
Requires certain veterinarians to provide written notification to animal owner if boarded animal will not be subject to 24-hour supervision; "Betsy's Law."
Provides for compensation of teachers on appropriate salary guide and schedule after withholding of an increment.
Requires binding arbitration for certain matters relating to dismissals or reductions in salary of tenured persons employed in a teaching capacity at a county college.
Provides that President of Municipal Clerks' Association of New Jersey shall serve as member of Government Records Council.
Permits certain special law enforcement officers to carry firearms at all times when in State.
Requires applicants for liquor licenses and license transfers to notify residents within 200 feet of licensed premises.
Prohibits certain sales of alcoholic beverages within 1,000 feet of schools or religious institutions.
Requires mandatory registration of family day care providers.
Requires public bodies to provide funds for outreach and training programs for minority group members and women in connection with certain construction contracts.
Requires driver's licenses to display licensee's blood type.
Provides that campaign contributions received from certain persons convicted of crimes will be forfeited and paid to ELEC for enforcement purposes.
Permits all municipalities to adopt ordinances requiring bond from seasonal rental landlords in certain circumstances and increases penalties for subsequent offenses.
Prohibits requiring school and county college employees to search for or handle explosive devices.
Prohibits sale of products containing dextromethorphan to minors under 18 years of age.
Revises classification of certain malt beverages for alcoholic beverage tax purposes.
Requires notification of law enforcement for furlough of certain patients from State psychiatric hospitals.
Establishes New Jersey Borough Enterprise Zone Program to encourage business development in small, highly developed municipalities.
Prohibits certain alcoholic beverage advertisements within 300 feet of a school, church, or public park.
Gives judge discretion to revoke boating privileges for third or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Modifies penalty for operating an aircraft while impaired, establishes blood alcohol content offense level and requires report of violation to FAA.

Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits, employer unemployment tax rebates, sales tax exemption, property tax freeze and employee skill training program as incentives for business revitalization in distressed shopping centers.

Provides that tuition assistance or additional compensation for graduate degree provided under employment contracts for certain school district administrators may only be provided if degree is conferred by accredited institution.
Requires DHS to prepare annual reports on State psychiatric hospitals.
Makes various statutory changes to "Child Care Licensing Act."
Requires each hospital board of trustees to adopt a written policy governing conflicts of interest.
Bars sex offenders from jobs which primarily consist of contact with children.
Requires Attorney General to seize campaign funds of convicted candidates; prohibits convicted criminal offenders from making contributions to candidates and committees.
Prohibits sale of candy that resembles a tobacco product.
Regulates assignment and use of State vehicles.
Expands number of safe havens for leaving newborn infants.
Regulates assignment and use of vehicles owned or leased by State authorities.
Requires NJ Commission on Science and Technology to establish a science and technology business assistance service.
Eliminates public school district budget reduction appeals to Commissioner of Education.

Prohibits legislative aide who works, or worked, directly for legislator in district office from making political contribution greater than $30 per election to that legislator; prohibits receipt of such contribution.
"The New Jersey Healthcare Choice Act"; permits health insurers licensed in other states to provide coverage in New Jersey under certain circumstances.
Allows residents of certain Highlands municipalities to designate on gross income tax returns that a portion of gross income tax paid be returned to municipality of residence.
Clarifies right of employers to require employees to speak English while engaged in work.
Caps noneconomic damages in medical malpractice actions at $250,000.
Excludes overtime pay of certain employees from gross income tax.
"Prenatally and Postnatally Diagnosed Conditions Awareness Act in New Jersey."
Prohibits wrongful life/birth suits.

"Family Home Occupation Act;" classifies certain home-occupations as accessory uses needing no use variances in residential zone; authorizes municipalities to limit or exclude certain warehousing, manufacturing or retailing activities.
Repeals law allowing PFRS member to retire with PFRS pension and continue to receive salary for current PFRS-covered elective office.

Allows taxpayers to carryforward and deduct certain losses from net business profits, net gains or income from disposition of property, and distributive share of partnership income under New Jersey gross income tax.
Dedesignates portions of Route 24.
Allows for a gross income tax deduction for any honorably discharged member of the US Armed Forces, reserve unit or national guard.
"Women's Right to Know Act."
Provides for a presumption of joint physical custody in a child custody determination; addresses relocation.
Repeals grandparents visitation statute.
Provides immunity against "wrongful birth" and "wrongful life" suits.
Prohibits Medicaid funding for abortifacients.
Prohibits public and certain private affirmative action programs based upon race, ethnicity, sex, color or national origin.
Prohibits the use of public sector union dues for political activities and requires specific written authorization for such use in the private sector.
Regulates use of human embryos fertilized in vitro.
Revises procedures for securing a permit to carry a handgun.
Concerns municipal rent control ordinances.
Establishes special license plates to fund certain programs for pregnant women.
Prohibits certain political activity by governmental employees and by public employee unions.
Limits compensation and contracts of State and local government officers and employees.
Authorizes certain law enforcement officers and corrections officers to possess and use stun guns while on duty.
Repeals increased penalties for violations in 65 mph zone.
Decreases BPU membership from five to three members.
Includes midwives within definition of "licensed person" for purposes of affidavits of merit in certain actions filed on or after effective date.
Designates New Jersey Route No. 15 as "Ronald Reagan Memorial Highway."
Establishes Lake Hopatcong Fund, dedicates $700,000 annually from pleasure boat registration fees to that fund, and appropriates $700,000 for FY2009.
Bars defamation suits against persons who fairly report the contents of a judicial proceeding or court record.
Limits ability of non-residents to bring tort suits in NJ courts.
Abolishes offices of superintendent of elections and deputy superintendent; transfers powers and duties thereof to county commissioner of registration or county board of elections.
Mandates NICS check be the exclusive method law enforcement uses to determine whether an applicant is qualified to purchase and possess a firearm.
Allows credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for costs of installing certain alternative energy systems.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to the "American Red Cross-NJ Fund".
Requires aggrieved person to request refund prior to commencing suit under consumer fraud law under certain circumstances.
Provides certain limits on benefits coverage by health insurers, SHBP, and SEHBP for certain services related to infertility.
Changes membership of Lake Hopatcong Commission and requires DEP to develop water level management plan for Lake Hopatcong to be approved by commission.
Prohibits motor fuel wholesaler from increasing price more than once in 24-hour period.
Establishes grant program to rehabilitate veterans' organizations posts; appropriates $300,000.
Permits adoptees and certain others access to adoptee's original birth certificate and other related information. *
Establishes Nursing Student Support Program.
Authorizes Casino Control Commission to permit Atlantic City casinos to offer Internet casino gambling.
Establishes limits on resident's hours in hospitals.
Requires certain advertising disclosures by certain funeral establishments.

Requires that chiropractic physicians, podiatric physicians, allopathic physicians, and osteopathic physicians be reimbursed at same rate as other health care providers under various health and accident plans.
Revises "lemon law" refund formula for consumers of certain new motor vehicles.
Prohibits HMOs from denying provider participation to orthotists, prosthetists and pedorthists willing to meet terms of HMO contract.
Revises filing requirements for minor subdivisions.
Requires health benefits coverage for orthotic and prosthetic appliances and provides reimbursement therefor.
Extends responsibilities of tow truck operators responding to calls for assistance from motorists.
Revises various provisions of the "New Jersey Cemetery Act, 2003."
Provides for registration of mold inspectors and remediators.
Requires demonstration of compliance with municipal zoning requirements as a condition for the issuance of certain construction and occupancy permits.
Requires costs of contract for construction be revealed to municipal construction office for construction permit.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for the Meadowlands Conservation Trust.
Requires youth baseball league coaches to comply with pitch count standards to minimize injury to youth baseball pitchers.
Creates Construction Trades Licensing Board for licensing and regulation of several construction professions; creates new division for homeowner protection in Department of Law and Public Safety.
Imposes a four percent gross revenues tax on providers of direct-to-home satellite services.
Revises "Landscape Irrigation Contractor Certification Act of 1991."
Regulates certain service contracts to perform maintenance, repair, replacement, or service of property used for personal, family, or household purposes.
Requires registration of certain additional securities investment advisers.
Provides limits for late charge and returned check fee payments for certain loans.
Prohibits retail sales establishment from storing certain magnetic-stripe data; requires reimbursement for costs incurred by financial institution due to breach of security.
Requires ATM facilities to be equipped with access to emergency telephone service.
Requires ATM operators to disclose balance inquiry fees.
Changes statutory provisions regarding who may interpret and perform evoked potentials or nerve conduction studies.
"Tree Experts and Tree Care Operators Licensing Act."
Concerns continuing education for dentists.
Grants certain veterans preference in affordable housing.
Concerns regulation of court reporting firms.
Permits landscape irrigation contractors to install backflow prevention devices under certain circumstances.
Requires on-site care for children in school bus accidents.
Establishes additional investigative and enforcement powers in Division of Consumer Affairs to deter individuals from engaging in unauthorized practice of professions and occupations.
Mandates education program for "at risk" mortgage borrowers as condition for residential purchase or refinance.
The "Residential Distressed Property Leaseback Act."
The "Residential Property Lease-Purchase Act."
The "Owners' Rights and Obligations in Shared Ownership Communities Act."
Permits transcript or videotape of testimony before local issuing authority to be admissible in ABC appeal.
Requires written security plan when school is polling place and open to students; provides that schools may be used as polling places only under certain circumstances; makes an appropriation.

Requires school districts to take all steps to ensure adequate security for students when school is open as a polling place and provides that school district costs shall be deducted from the itemized list of expenses submitted by the county board of elections.
Exempts senior homeowners from municipal building permit fees.

Prohibits manufacture or sale of reflective glass beads with high arsenic content; prohibits DOT and State's toll road authorities from using paint mixed with reflective glass beads for roadway markings. *
Provides for the expeditious roadway removal of certain disabled vehicles.
Increases funding of Senior Citizen and Disabled Resident Transportation Program.
Shortens time periods for adverse possession, clarifies statutes, and repeals N.J.S.2A:14-30 and N.J.S.2A:14-31.
Requires causes of driver inattention to be noted in traffic accidents.
Exempts experienced firefighters from certification requirement.
Concerns eligible municipalities under the urban transit hub credit.
Requires State firewarden to consult with local fire department commander upon arrival at scene of wildfire.
Amends expiration date of P.L.2005, c.234, which concerns a systematic maintenance check program for intermodal chasis.
Changes definition of "small qualified business" in UEZ statute from having less than $3,000,000 to having less than $5,000,000 in annual gross receipts in that business.
The "Banking Development District Act."
Requires licensure as insurance producer to sell certain funeral insurance policies; prohibits financing of certain preneed funeral arrangements with reverse mortgage.
Makes sundry changes to limousine laws.

Provides for specified alternative proposals and base specifications for certain public contracts; requires contracting unit to specify basis for determining lowest responsible bid and criteria for selection of alternate bids.
Permits municipalities to recover certain costs and fees from alcoholic beverage licensees charged with violations.
Requires designated fire command structure in municipal emergency operations plans involving mutual aid responses to fires.
Increases amount of Transportation Trust Fund monies that may be used for salaries and overhead of DOT and NJT.
Limits liability for insurers conducting boiler insurance inspections.
Allows homestead property tax reimbursement program participants who lose income eligibility due to an IRA withdraw for certain purposes to maintain base year upon requalification.
Clarifies type of liability insurance coverage certain licensed auto body repair facilities must carry.
Provides exemption from motor fuels use tax for certain operations.
Permits municipality, fire district or authority to approve transfer of certain firefighters from PERS to PFRS.
Permits county, county college, or municipality to offer additional retirement benefits to certain employees; permits issuance of refunding bonds to fund benefits.
Makes sundry changes to taxicab laws. *

Prohibits SDA from restricting the ability of certain firms or persons from competing for contracts in more than one Division of Property Management and Construction classification or prequalification category.
Makes various changes to State law concerning commercial driver licenses to comply with Federal Motor Carrier Safety Regulations.
Makes various changes to current system for approval, issuance, administration, and discontinuance of various types of special license plates.
Establishes design-build delivery system for New Jersey Turnpike Authority projects. *
Permits wage withholding for costs associated with certain employee identification.

Limits use of inherently beneficial use doctrine when municipality making variance determination has received substantive certification from the Council on Affordable Housing; provides repose from litigation.
Includes services performed by professional musicians or persons otherwise engaged in performing arts as employment for purposes of unemployment insurance and workers' compensation benefits.
Requires criminal history record background checks on certain volunteer sports personnel.
Clarifies powers of public safety directors.
Exempts certain volunteer emergency service organizations from charitable contribution filing fees.
Provides that person who impersonates law enforcement officer and commits crime is guilty of third degree crime.
Requires all new State buildings to have solar or geothermal energy systems, where feasible.
Establishes 18-month moratorium on promulgation of new administrative rules and issuance of new policy circular letters by State agencies.
Directs prison administrators and halfway house operators to notify local news media of inmate escapes.
Requires corrections officers be notified when inmates test positive for certain communicable diseases.
Prohibits public school fund-raising activities which include unsupervised door-to-door sales by students.
Requires local unit public employers to maintain and preserve retiree health benefits of PFRS retirees at least at the same level as provided at employee retirement.
Requires certain notifications upon sale of property where private well is treated by point of entry systems.
Upgrades possession of child pornography to a crime of the third degree; provides for parole supervision for life for production and transmission of child pornography.
Imposes certain bail restrictions on persons charged with violating domestic violence restraining orders.
Requires certain ambulatory care facilities to provide services to patients without regard to ability to pay or source of payment.
Requires public notice of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey board meetings.
Requires off-track wagering licensee to pay 5% of its wagering revenues to host municipality.
Requires bicycle helmets, reflectors and lights for certain individuals.
Expands civil rights protections to include pregnancy and breast-feeding; requires employers to provide daily break to breast-feeding mothers.
Eliminates maximum age requirement for appointment as police officer or paid firefighter.
Authorizes special "We Support the Arts" license plates with proceeds to the New Jersey State Council on the Arts.
Requires prosecution of domestic violence-related cases in Superior Court; removes jurisdiction from municipal court.
Authorizes "Proud to Be an American" license plate with proceeds to veterans' and emergency management organizations.
Authorizes local contractor preference program.
Permits municipalities to install traffic-lights on self-contained municipal streets without approval of the Commissioner of Transportation.
Creates New Jersey Clinical Trials Registry in DHSS.
Directs NJTA to study and report costs of expanding Vincent R. Casciano Bridge.
Establishes "New Jersey Colorectal Cancer Research Fund"; provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns. *
Permits in-person wagering at casinos and horse racetracks on results of professional sports events, subject to voter approval.
Establishes Senior Citizen Pet Companionship Program in DHSS.
Validates certain local parking, speed limit and traffic direction regulations.
Requires the court, in determining disposition of juvenile offender, to take into account juvenile's status as student receiving special education services.
Authorizes seizure of firearms possessed by persons taken involuntarily into custody by police for mental health screenings and assessments.
Commences payment in lieu of taxes for tax exempt real property owned by Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
Upgrades penalties for assaulting certain health care professionals and workers.
Provides that amendments to municipal budget may be provided in writing at public hearing rather than being read in full.
Exempts veterans from $15 fee for open and competitive civil service examinations and from local residency requirements.
Requires State and local government employers to adopt maternity policy.
Permits police chiefs to issue handgun purchase permits to officers who are regularly employed, full-time members of their departments.
"Personal Seat License Holder's Bill of Rights."
Prohibits cruel restraint and confinement of dogs.
Prohibits job discrimination on basis of credit history or financial status.
Establishes New Jersey Student Athlete Cardiac Screening Task Force.
Allows UEZ municipalities to include grants equal to one month of rent for new qualified businesses as projects eligible for UEZ funding assistance.
Requires breath or blood sample to be obtained from driver involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death or certain bodily injury.
Requires for-profit hospitals to report certain information to DHSS.
"Garden State Film and Digital Media Jobs Act"; supports New Jersey film and digital media industry and strengthens film and digital media production tax credits.
Establishes crime of using a defaced or stolen firearm to cause serious bodily or bodily injury to a law enforcement officer; enhances penalties concerning defaced firearms.
Prohibits supplemental compensation for unused sick leave for public school and municipal employees with annual compensation of $100,000 or more.
Requires Civil Service Commission to generate compensation guidelines to help counties and municipalities determine appropriate pay for various positions.
"Gynecologic Cancer Education and Awareness Act"; appropriates $75,000.
