Prohibits local government agency from employing person on paid leave from local government agency of another county or municipality.
Permits municipality to enact ordinance regulating where sex offenders may reside.
Requires building materials dealer to provide uniquely identified delivery ticket to consumer.
Prohibits sale of food and beverage packaging and containers made with bisphenol A.
The "Country of Origin Signage Act."
Provides gross income tax credit for certain small business employers that provide health care benefits to employees.
Provides a gross income tax credit for textbook purchases made for undergraduate education.
Requires suicide prevention continuing education courses for physicians and podiatrists.
Requires counties, municipalities, fire districts, and boards of education to cooperatively develop and implement five-year financial plans.
Directs certain recoveries of federal funds for services to persons with developmental disabilities be used for grants to support community infrastructure purposes.
Authorizes State and local governments to enter into group purchasing agreement for alternative fueled vehicles.
Provides credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for construction of buildings in accordance with certain energy and environmental performance standards.
Requires electronic submission of certain periodic reports to Governor and Legislature by State agency.
Limits payment upon retirement to $15,000 to local public officers and employees for accumulated sick leave.
Requires Commission on Higher Education to develop accountability and transparency standards for public research institutions and State colleges.
Requires BPU to establish Energy Efficiency Leadership awards program.
Requires DHS to establish training, educational assessment, and remedial instruction programs, and minimum educational standards for staff at State psychiatric hospitals.
Provides a sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain high-efficiency home heating equipment.
Requires State to purchase energy efficient and hybrid vehicles; provides for phase-in of the requirement.
Extends eligibility for N.J. World Trade Center Scholarship Program to dependents and spouses of persons totally and permanently disabled as a result of exposure to the attack sites.
Establishes "green teams" to develop and advance energy conservation and efficiency and environmental sustainability in State governmental offices.
Prohibits State Board of Education from limiting number of certain two-year college credits that may be applied towards meeting teacher certification requirements.
Creates Office of Energy Savings to implement program to improve energy efficiency and conservation for all State agencies.

Requires lighting and security cameras at sexually oriented businesses; imposes civil penalty for permitting access to minors; permits negative secondary effects study; permits tax on sexually oriented business.

Authorizes DOT, NJ Turnpike Authority, and South Jersey Transportation Authority to permit BPU-certified persons to install and maintain solar photovoltaic panels on noise barriers erected on roads and highways.

Establishes loan redemption program for certain teachers under which they are permitted to redeem loan amounts received under New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in public schools.
Encourages purchase of NJ solar panels and wind turbines for State projects and State-funded projects.
Establishes standardized energy audit and training program.
Requires members of governing boards of public institutions of higher education to complete a training program developed by the Commission on Higher Education.
Permits person with developmental disability and legal guardian to audio record sessions of interdisciplinary team in which person or guardian participates.
Eliminates use of rebate procedure for claims of sales and use tax exemption made in connection with certain sales to certain UEZ qualified businesses. *
Requires school districts to annually disseminate information to students and parents or guardians on the dangers of distributing sexually explicit images through electronic means.
Permits diversionary program for juveniles who are criminally charged for "sexting" or posting sexual images.*

Prohibits retail stores from selling cellular telephone equipment or cellular telephone equipment service contracts unless stores provide information brochures about "sexting" to customers who purchase such equipment or contracts.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to address school climate issues related to harassment, intimidation, and bullying in public schools.*
Requires four-year public institutions of higher education to accept for transfer certain academic credits.
Permits undersheriff to perform administrative duties on behalf of county sheriff.
Concerns workers' compensation for firefighters with cancer.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to the "NJBEST college savings program."
Permits rehired public employees to purchase PERS credit for three years of layoff period.

Authorizes creation of urban enterprise zones in Garfield, Harrison, Keansburg, and two joint urban enterprise zones, one in Cliffside Park and Fairview, and one in Buena Vista Township and Buena Borough.
Requires New Jersey institutions of higher education to disseminate fire safety information about their facilities to students, parents or guardians, and employees.
Requires public school district to provide paid time off when certain volunteer emergency aid workers are called to alarm during work hours.
Establishes "New Jersey Fire and EMS Crisis Intervention Services" telephone hotline.
Makes temporary insurance and temporary domestic security local cap exceptions permanent; exempts pre-July 7, 2004 contract obligations from current, lower cap.
Regulates Internet pharmacies and electronic prescriptions.
Changes calculation of average weekly wage for TDI benefits.
Clarifies that certain local administrative agency decisions involving monetary penalties or awards shall be docketed judgments.
Requires certain pools, spas and hot tubs comply with certain barrier requirements.
Clarifies police powers of certain sheriff's officers to enforce motor vehicle and traffic laws.
Provides certified municipal fire inspectors and fire officials having more than four consecutive years service with tenure in office.
Grants tenure or permanent status to certified fire officials and inspectors under certain conditions.
Creates local police officer and paid firefighter emergency registry.
Requires weekly reporting of construction and building permit approvals to municipal tax assessor.
Provides that applicant for business permit as electrical contractor must meet certain requirements.
Criminalizes certain actions in or on railroad property.
Clarifies immunity from civil liability for volunteers affiliated with Citizen Corps under certain circumstances.
Prohibits access to police vehicle global positioning system.
Requires greater accountability of school district contracted service providers.
Establishes "New Jersey Partnership for Secure Schools Pilot Program" in Department of Education; appropriates $3 million.
Requires sports and entertainment facilities to submit emergency operations plan to municipal emergency management coordinator. *
Requires three forms of identification when requesting birth certificate.
Creates motor vehicle offense of smoking in motor vehicle with a child present and dedicates penalties to "Smoking Cessation Fund."
Permits bid for public works contract to be withdrawn due to mistake in certain circumstances. *
Excludes financial benefit received by volunteer emergency responder from gross income.
Enhances PFRS accidental death pension benefit for survivors of member serving in nonsupervisory rank.
Grants workers' compensation coverage to volunteer firefighters going to or returning from their stations when called to a fire.
Criminalizes certain actions in or on utility company's property.
Authorizes credit unions to serve as depositories of public funds; requires credit unions to provide certain funds for financial literacy education.*
Permits municipalities and fire districts to appoint paid fire chiefs for paid and certain part-paid fire departments; clarifies duties and responsibilities.
Requires DHSS to prepare and distribute signs for display at public beaches advising patrons to protect their skin from sun exposure.
Allows certain entities to submit emergency plans electronically.
Allows public contractors paying benefits under collective bargaining agreements to count benefit costs toward compliance with local "living wage" ordinances.
Requires filing of financial and conflict disclosure statements as condition of development approval.
Prohibits enrollment in PERS of public employee who is also public contractor; requires member to designate only one position as basis of enrollment.
Prohibits simultaneous holding of certain State, county and municipal elective and appointive positions.
Provides for mandatory imprisonment and forfeiture of retirement benefits for public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes.
Increases enrollment threshold in PERS and TPAF to $10,000; requires assessment of adding annual minimum hour requirement to qualify for service credit.
Requires Treasurer and Divisions of Pensions and Benefits and Investment Directors to report on status of State-administered pension plans to Legislature by April 15 and December 15 each year.
Requires State Auditor to conduct performance review audit of SHBP at least every three years and to annually conduct limited audit to ensure that only eligible persons are receiving benefits.
Revises membership and duties of Pension and Health Benefits Review Commission.
Requires that ordinary disability retirement in certain State-administered retirement systems be granted only if member has qualified for federal Social Security Disability benefits.
Allows pension calculation to be based on compensation increase in excess of actuarially assumed experience only if employer pays unfunded liability.
Restricts use of accumulated sick leave by public employees in year prior to retirement.
Limits payment upon retirement to $10,000 to State and local public officers and employees for accumulated sick leave.
Prohibits certain public officers and employees from receiving dual health care benefit coverage.
Prohibits member of Legislature from entering into contract with public entity located within member's legislative district.
Clarifies that retention of unearned wages by a public servant is theft under certain circumstances.
Provides increased representation on receiving district boards of education for certain sending districts.
Requires legislators to designate one covered position of elected office or employment for PERS credit.
Prohibits local government officer or employee who recuses himself from matter in which he has interest from engaging in activity that might be construed as lobbying or advocating for interest.
Repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act"; prohibits COAH from basing prospective need portion of fair share obligation on commercial development.
Permits approval of certain regional contribution agreements through December 31, 2009.

Authorizes COAH to credit municipalities with 1.5 units of fair share affordable housing obligation for each housing unit occupied by a veteran; permits municipalities to satisfy fair share affordable housing obligation through 35 percent set aside for veterans.
Authorizes COAH to credit municipalities with 1.5 units of fair share affordable housing obligation for each unit of transitional housing occupied by a veteran.
Provides that deed restrictions on affordable housing units are not extinguished by foreclosure proceedings.
Makes members of county boards of taxation ineligible for membership in State-administered retirement system or for health care benefits coverage under plan for public employees.

Provides a gross income tax credit of up to $7,500 for qualified home purchases made by certain first-time homebuyers in the remaining portion of taxable year 2009, taxable year 2010 and taxable year 2011.
Reduces corporation business tax rate and provides an additional rate reduction for three years for taxpayers that relocate corporate headquarters to New Jersey.
Revises Business Employment Incentive Program to spur economic growth.
Prohibits issuance of DEP permits or approvals for activities associated with offshore drilling for oil or natural gas.
Provides gross income tax deduction for three years of nursing pay for new enrollees in nursing education programs.
Requires boards of education to provide civics instruction in elementary and middle school grades and requires DOE to provide funding to enhance civics instruction.
Requires health insurance coverage for hair headpieces for patients receiving chemotherapy treatment for cancer.
Authorizes the court to include provisions for animals in domestic violence restraining orders.*
Provides that if wireless telephone service subscriber terminates service, any applicable subscriber termination fee is to be prorated.
Regulates expiration dates and dormancy fees for certain prepaid bank cards, such as mall gift cards.
Eliminates 15% fee charged by cemetery company on transfer of graves, crypts and niches.
Permits advertising on exterior of school buses.
Establishes "New Jersey Energy Efficient Weekend" sales tax holiday during third weekend of April.
Requires notification of certain fee increases by assisted living residences within certain time frames.
Requires newly licensed registered professional nurse to attain baccalaureate degree in nursing within 10 years of initial licensure.
Requires premium sharing for health care benefits for elected officials and certain appointed officials.
Provides that 20% of fee charged for initial certified copy of birth certificate shall be used to support certain activities of NJ Cord Blood Bank. *
"Plastic Carryout Bag Reduction Act."
Establishes a gross income tax credit for full time enrollment at four year institutions of higher education, county colleges and accredited post-secondary schools in New Jersey.
Increases annual income limitation to receive senior and disabled citizens' property tax deduction to $15,000.
Directs that one sample ballot shall be delivered to each residence address where at least one resident thereof is registered to vote.
Establishes Statewide allogeneic cord blood bank, requires certain health insurers to provide coverage for cord blood banking and appropriates $5 million to DHSS.
Provides that total annual out-of-state travel expenses of a board of education shall not exceed $3,000.
Authorizes appointment of part-time county tax administrator.
Allows cosmetologist-hairstylists to operate mobile facilities when providing services.
Prohibits toll-free passage for SJTA employees, officers, and members except while commuting or carrying out official duties.

Authorizes county surrogates to establish or expand programs to provide information to law enforcement officers, firefighters and first aid squad members concerning the preparation of wills, living wills and powers of attorney.
Exempts reimbursements from Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare and allows deduction for charity care in calculation of gross receipts for purposes of assessment on ambulatory care facilities.
Requires DCF to provide information on home visitation resources and shaken baby syndrome to parents of newborn infants. *
Authorizes the issuance of $2,705,000,000 in general obligation bonds to finance the construction and renovation of higher education facilities; appropriates $5,000.
Revises the structure, functions and authority of the State Investment Council and the Director of the State Division of Investment.
Prohibits the use or possession of cellular picture phones to invade another person's privacy and prohibits camera or picture cell phones in schools.
Adds budget language specifying Medicaid reimbursement for various ambulance services provided to certain recipients.
Abolishes Landscape Architect Examination and Evaluation Committee; transfers powers to New Jersey State Board of Architects.
Adds two additional public members to NJ Transit board.
Requires the State Police to establish a recently relocated offenders section within the Megan's Law sex offender Internet registry.
Requires report and public hearing prior to DEP recommendation of site for inclusion on Superfund list.
Requires certain service extensions undertaken in municipally-designated areas in need of redevelopment or rehabilitation to receive same benefits as if located in smart growth area.
Requires DEP to submit annual financial report on status of certain fund balances.
Revises civil service status of certain county welfare agency management positions and requires county welfare agencies to adjust office hours.
Exempts comprehensive outpatient rehabilitation facilitites from ambulatory care assessment.
Requires DOE to submit an annual review to the Legislature assessing its performance of district oversight responsibilities.
Requires Mandated Health Benefits Advisory Commission to study financial impact of all enacted mandated health benefits.
The "New Jersey Health Insurance Reform Act."
Authorizes expenditures from open space trust funds to develop or maintain recreation and conservation land although the land was not acquired by the municipality.
Requires Treasurer and Division of Pensions and Benefits and Investment Directors to report on status of State-administered pension plans to Legislature by May 15 and November 15 each year.
Allows health maintenance organizations to include charity care assessments for purposes of meeting certain loss ratio requirements.
Provides a plan to rebalance State resources to provide community services and supports for persons with developmental disabilities.
Concerns calculation of certain HMO loss ratios; makes various changes to individual and small employer health benefits programs, charity care and NJ FamilyCare programs.
Expands permitted expenditures from Airport Safety Fund.
Provides single sales fraction for corporation business tax income allocation formula and establishes airline-specific sales fraction.
Requires public institutions of higher education and Department of Military and Veterans Affairs to include link on their websites for access to educational information. *
Establishes a New Jersey Homebuyer Tax Credit Program under the New Jersey gross income tax for home purchases during a qualified period. *
Requires that DMV suspension and revocation notices be given by certified mail.
Requires notification of municipalities by public utilities under certain circumstances.
Exempts government-owned property from adverse possession and eliminates statute of limitation period for recovery.
Allows publication of legal advertisements in "free" newspapers.
Changes perimeter for bow and arrow hunting around occupied building.
Establishes New Jersey Rx Program to reduce prescription drug prices.
Requires and permits preference in awarding certain contracts.
Requires that public officers or public employees convicted of crimes involving their office or employment be sentenced to mandatory prison terms and forfeit pension benefits.
Clarifies tenure protections for exempt firemen in public employment.
Authorizes municipality to request DEP to require additional remediation of certain landfill sites.
Concerns certain workers' compensation supplemental benefits.
Increases annual income limitation for senior and disabled citizens' eligibility for $250 property tax deduction and bases future annual income limitations on annual CPI changes.
Prohibits boards of education from charging students a fee to participate in extracurricular activities.
Regulates advertising of manufacturers rebates by retail mercantile establishments.
Permits historic motor vehicles to be used for pleasure driving one day per week.
Requires hospitals and physicians to have examination tables accessible to handicapped patients.
The "Real Estate Installment Contract Act."
Adds supplementary budget language authorizing deposit and utilization of monies recovered from MTBE contamination.
Makes various technical and procedural amendments to the "Municipal Land Use Law."

Mandates that certain personnel critical to certain State finance and revenue generating activities are essential employees during a declared State government shutdown due to failure to enact an annual appropriation act.
Expands covered claims under New Jersey Surplus Lines Insurance Guaranty Fund to include liquor law liability insurance claims.
"New Jersey Fair Debt Collection Practices Act."
Permits imposition of municipal host community petroleum bulk processing impact fees under certain circumstances.
Permits direct shipping of wine to New Jersey consumers.
Removes requirement that Casino Control Commission inspectors and agents be present at all times during casino operations and instead permits presence at times deemed appropriate by commission.
Creates eight additional judgeships; increases certain court fees to fund judgeships and to supplement funding for Legal Services of New Jersey.
Revises various off-track wagering provisions of the "Off-Track and Account Wagering Act."
Regulates mailed manufacturer's rebates.
Permits casino employees to serve on Atlantic City governing body in certain circumstances.

Protects property taxpayers by requiring removal of certain property tax deduction and credit information from documents available for public inspection and provides for homestead property tax benefit in form of credit.
Permits county government to limit appropriation for county prosecutors' offices.
Establishes special license to serve alcoholic beverages in qualifying redevelopment areas.
Creates voter-verified paper record pilot program; removes requirement that voting machines produce voter-verified paper record by January 1, 2009.
Eliminates requirement that voting machines produce voter-verified paper record by January 1, 2009.
Removes confidential employee status of certain Casino Control Commission employees.
Provides useful life of three years for certain permitted maintenance projects with Transportation Trust Fund monies.
Concerns suspension and revocation of employer licenses for repeated violations of wage, benefit and tax laws.
Permits tenant to be removed from leased housing due to criminal activity under certain circumstances.
Concerns rights of DRPA employees.
Allows students with disabilities to bring service animal to school.*
Provides for licensure of elevator, escalator, and moving sidewalk contractors by State board.
Establishes procedures and standards regarding public service privatization contracts.
Makes membership in the New Jersey School Boards Association optional.
Requires payment to municipality for use of municipal services by for-profit lessee of property owned by county or county improvement authority.
Reduces sales tax rate on certain sales and admission charges at places of amusement in urban enterprise zone areas and provides that sales tax revenue be for municipal purposes.
Provides financial assistance for higher education expenses of former Work First New Jersey recipients after leaving program.
Provides for receipt for voter at primary or general election; allows receipt to be proof of eligibility to vote in subsequent election; provides State reimbursement.
Provides official State recognition of Powhatan Renape Nation, Nanticoke Lenni-Lenape Indians of New Jersey, Inc., and Ramapough Mountain Indians as American Indian Tribes for certain purposes.
Establishes Prevention Services Programs for Children and Families Network.
Establishes Trenton Capital City Aid program.
Allows identity theft victims to petition for judicial determination of factual innocence.
Restricts large trucks to certain highway networks.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
Requires businesses to notify customers concerning use of radio frequency identification systems that collect information about customers.
Establishes minimum energy efficiency standards for certain products.
Establishes New Jersey Chronic Kidney Disease Task Force.
Establishes school chemical management program; appropriates $90,000.
Permits labor peace agreements in projects in which public entities have proprietary interests.
Decreases the penalty for certain parole violations.
Requires county sheriff to establish procedure to assist pre-release inmates applying for certain assistance.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits to businesses employing qualified ex-offenders.
Concerns access to wage records in connection with projects subject to prevailing wage requirements.
Authorizes eight hours of leave for parents and guardians from work for school-related events of children.
Requires that motor fuel pumps operated by retail dealers be equipped to measure in temperature-adjusted gallons.
Requires newly hired State employees be New Jersey residents.
Revises law concerning meetings of public bodies.
Qua-Daishia's Law: bars disclosure of personal identifying information contained in grand jury materials; creates fourth degree offense for unauthorized disclosure.
Provides for continuing education for real estate brokers, broker-salespersons and salespersons, and creates a new licensing category of referral agents.
Prohibits use of education and occupation as rating factors in automobile insurance underwriting.
Expands membership of Domestic Violence Fatality and Near Fatality Review Board.
Exempts sales to homeowner assistance and recovery programs from realty transfer fees.
Requires notice by insurers when private passenger automobile insurance applicant not placed in most favorable tier based upon certain criteria.
Authorizes special Alpha Kappa Alpha license plate.
Establishes "Smart Housing Incentives Act."
Specifies term for chairmen of county boards of election; authorizes non-consecutive terms.
Mandates professional engineers to complete continuing professional competency requirements during each biennial licensure period.
Extends service prevailing wage requirements to food service contracts and to local units and State authorities.
Concerns dispensation by an optometrist or ophthalmologist to a patient of drugs delivered to the eye through a contact lens.
Addresses various concerns affecting post-release employment.

Requires State entities to examine opportunity of minority and women-owned financial institutions to serve as senior managing underwriters, imposes reporting requirements, and enables establishment of aspirational levels of utilization and relative compensation.
Creates Foreclosure Prevention and Neighborhood Stabilization Revolving Trust Fund; places temporary surcharge on mortgage foreclosure complaints.
Authorizes imposition of additional fines for overcrowding.
Makes changes in Primary Care Physician and Dentist Loan Redemption Program.
Establishes guidelines for operating authorized emergency vehicles in emergency situations.
Establishes September 11th Memorial License Plate; dedicates fees therefrom to support a memorial and victims injured in attack.
Removes license suspension penalty for persons with only one outstanding parking fine; permits Motor Vehicle Commission to refuse registration to persons with outstanding parking fine.
Provides for mandatory forfeiture of retirement benefits of elected official convicted of crime involving office held.

Imposes mandatory minimum terms of imprisonment and forfeiture of pension and retirement benefits for public officers or employees convicted of crimes involving or touching their office or employment.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Act;" increases sentences for sex offenders and persons who harbor them.
Provides free tuition at public institutions of higher education for surviving spouses and dependent children of military personnel killed in performance of duties.
Requires DOT to construct noise barriers on Interstate 78.
Establishes statutory procedure for annexation of municipality by another county.
Clarifies that permitting sexual abusers to reside with a child constitutes endangering welfare of a child.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Child Protection Zone Act."
"Judy and Nikki's Law"; provides for life imprisonment without parole for persons convicted of murder of a child 16 years of age or younger.
Provides immunity from civil liability to anyone who in good faith uses an automated external defibrillator in an emergency.
Establishes 24-hour hotline for information concerning the crime of human trafficking; appropriates $75,000.
"Highway Accident Property Tax Relief Act;" requires State to reimburse municipalities for costs of providing certain emergency services.
Prohibits DOT from entering into certain contracts concerning short-line freight rail services.
Exempts senior citizens, disabled persons and veterans from E-ZPass account monthly service charge.
Exempts from sales tax certain sales by or to any senior citizens club organized for pleasure, recreation, or other nonprofitable purposes.
Allows corporation business tax credit for full cost of purchasing portable defibrillators.
Requires persons under age 17 to wear helmets when operating non-motorized scooters.
Requires Division of Criminal Justice to establish program to train municipal and county law enforcement officers to detect computer crime.
Creates housing purchase matching grant program for members of United States Armed Forces and New Jersey National Guard who have served in certain military operations.
Prohibits certain employment or supervision of relatives of certain members of the Legislature.
Expands eligibility under the Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act by broadening certain municipal qualifier provisions.
Establishes right of way for funeral processions.
Excludes certain federal employee Thrift Savings Fund contributions from gross income under the gross income tax.
Upgrades the disorderly persons offense of desecration of a venerated object to a crime of the third degree if the object desecrated is a military monument.
Provides that public employee pension benefits are calculated on base salary exclusive of various forms of extra compensation.
Allows judgment for restitution of stolen public funds to be levied against convicted employee's retirement allowance or pension contributions.
Imposes mandatory term of life imprisonment without eligibility for parole on persons who commit particularly brutal sexual assaults.
Expands domestic violence protection for adoptive parents.
Establishes "Alan M. Augustine Colorectal Cancer Research Fund"; appropriates $100,000.
Requires sex offender's tier designation to be completed and reviewed by the court prior to release from incarceration.
Directs Attorney General to publicize information about human trafficking hotlines; mandates law enforcement training on responding to the needs of victims of the crime of human trafficking.
Establishes parental orientation program in certain school districts.
Increases penalties for failing to yield to pedestrian when pedestrian is seriously injured.
Establishes the "Corrupt Gains Restitution Act."
Eliminates COAH requirement that municipality obtain initial plan endorsement from the State Planning Commission to retain substantive certification.
Permits regional contribution agreements through COAH bank; permits units transferred to be counted toward recipient municipality's fair share obligation.
Limits fair share affordable housing obligation in planning areas 4 and 5.
Requires State Treasurer to post information about State contracts for $17,500 or more on special website.
Extends textbook sharing program to include all school equipment.
Reduces number of signatures required on petition to recall elected official.
Reduces number of paid holidays from 13 to 10 for all State and local government employees.
Establishes limits for certain damages in medical malpractice actions.
Imposes new criteria of $18,000 compensation and 30 hours weekly for TPAF and PERS membership as well as for TPAF and PERS credit after break in service.
Limits tuition increase in district sending-receiving relationships to change in State aid and tax levy of sending school district.
Makes it a crime to sell or possess products or materials designed to alter firearms to look like toy guns.
Subjects certain shared service agreements to review of Attorney General; requires Division of Local Government Services to provide assistance with shared service agreements.
Requires labeling of foods produced from cloned animals.
Requires investigating law enforcement officer to contact next of kin of unconscious motor vehicle accident victim who has been transported to hospital emergency room.
Prohibits public employers from reimbursing tuition or awarding promotions or compensation based on degrees or certifications obtained from unaccredited institutions.
Revises the law concerning hazing; upgrades criminal penalties, provides certain immunities, creates civil offense and requires written policies.
Provides full forfeiture of pension of elected or appointed official convicted of any crime touching office.
Provides for certain requirements concerning Independent Health Care Appeals Program.
Prohibits persons violating animal cruelty law from owning, keeping, or harboring animals; requires DHSS establish and maintain website list of such persons.
Allows only one PERS-covered position for PERS membership, contributions and service credit; provides for PERS designation of maximum compensation position among multiple positions held.
Modifies tax levy growth limitation for certain school districts in sending-receiving relationships.
Amends the "Public Corruption Profiteering Penalty Act."
Concerns unemployment benefits and work stoppages.
Requires environmental sustainability plan for State House Complex.
Excludes certain contributions to deferred compensation plans and provides deduction for certain individual retirement savings under the gross income tax.
Creates TPAF and PERS new membership eligibility criteria of 20 or more hours weekly.
Allows gross income tax credit for certain contributions to New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program and to certain other federally qualified tuition savings programs.
Exempts from sales tax for two years certain hybrid and highly fuel efficient vehicles and energy efficient appliances.

"Tara's Law"; Establishes registry of offending community care residence providers and requires written monthly case manager reports of individuals with developmental disabilities residing in community care residences.
Provides State Comptroller with express authority to engage certified public accountants as independent contractors on contingency fee basis.
Authorizes creation of memorial license plates for immediate family members of September 11 victims.

Establishes priority for certain municipalities, counties, and non-profit organizations to purchase State surplus real property prior to public auction; requires State to follow Green Acres fair market valuation process.
Requires health care representative to make health care decisions for incapacitated patient in accordance with patient's religious beliefs.
Appropriates $3.6 million from the Clean Waters Fund for sewerage infrastructure improvements at the former Marlboro Psychiatric Hospital.
Prohibits use of "build-out" approach to determine fair share of affordable housing need in given region.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from selling from ice cream trucks.
Authorizes municipal governing body to create and maintain list of municipal residents in need of special assistance in case of emergency for public safety purposes.
Provides that gift certificates and cards shall not expire or contain dormancy fees.

Creates an integrated State medical examiner system by increasing the authority of the State Medical Examiner regarding forensic investigations, establishing regional medical examiner offices, and eliminating the county medical examiner system.
Requires public utilities to set bill due date to no earlier than 20 days past postmarked date if mailed by regular mail, or 20 days past sent date if sent electronically.
Permits candidate in any election to sign own nominating petition and be circulator therof.
Requires all candidate and campaign committee reports be filed electronically beginning January 1, 2012.
Requires that handicapped indentification cards bear photo of card holder.
Establishes innovation zone program and creates innovation zone around Aviation Research and Technology Park in Atlantic County.
Requires contribution for health care benefits provided for certain local elected and appointed officials.
Authorizes Sunday bow hunting on federal military installations.
Reduces age for membership in New Jersey State Firemen's Association.
Revises certain exemptions to "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Appropriates $17.45 million in 1992 and 2003 bond act monies for loans to fund dam restoration projects and $1.371 million in 1992 bond act monies to fund State dam restoration projects. *
Requires DOE to adopt green cleaning policy for schools and child care centers with 50 or more students.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for 50% of purchase cost of diesel engine conversion devices.
Increases penalties for violations of certain pet shop laws and regulations.
"Historic Property Reinvestment Act"; provides credits against certain taxes for certain costs of rehabilitating historic properties.
Provides for sales tax exemption for advanced technology partial zero emission vehicles, imposes surcharge on certain automobiles.
Requires DEP to designate smoke-free sections of State beaches, parks, and forests.
Establishes sales tax holiday for certain energy efficient products during third week of April and October.
Expands jurisdiction of municipal arson investigators.
Changes date by which mail-in ballots are transmitted to mail-in and overseas voters from the 40th to the 45th day before an election.
Requires court to issue animal protective orders against persons found guilty of abusing animals.
Requires greater disclosure for campaign advertisements broadcast within certain time periods prior to an election.
Requires instruction in traumatic situations as part of police training courses and assessment of police training candidates.
Requires criminal history background check for certain persons working at schools.
Permits granting residency credit points to candidates taking certain municipal police and fire promotional examinations.
Permits sentencing as repeat sex offender if adult defendant had been previously adjudicated delinquent as a juvenile for a sex offense.
Empowers special agents and enforcement officers of National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's Fisheries Office of Law Enforcement to make arrests for certain violations of State law.
Establishes a permanent Gang Land Security Task Force.
Establishes the "Office of the Gang Member Relocation Coordinator."
Criminalizes purchase or possession of firearms ammunition by persons convicted of certain crimes.
Allows law enforcement officers in PERS to transfer to and enroll in PFRS; requires all law enforcement officers to be enrolled in PFRS.
Increases juror compensation.
Directs Department of Corrections to provide employment assistance to inmates prior to release.
Adds option of receipt of employee's contributions plus portion of employer contributions when vested PERS member leaves PERS-covered service.
Provides for expungement of certain records of victims of identity theft.
Permits immediate expungement of court records where the person is acquitted or discharged or where the charges have been dismissed.
Establishes civil commitment procedure for violent predators.
Establishes certain educational requirements for State inmates under the age of 21.
Authorizes grants to New Jersey Transit Police Department to purchase body vests.
Requires DOC to institute shift overlap program in State correctional facilities.
Requires members of State Police to undergo annual performance evaluations.
Requires DOC employees who recruit, interview, and hire corrections officers to have gang awareness training.
Requires Police Training Commission to develop accelerated training course for certain corrections officers.
Requires 40 hours annual in-service training for State corrections officers.
Establishes Office of Animal Welfare in DHSS.

Requires animal cruelty training for selected assistant county prosecutors and tracking of animal cruelty cases in State uniform crime reporting system; directs AG to issue prosecutor guidelines for animal cruelty cases.
Establishes 25-cent municipal court surcharge for all violations; creates grant program for animal shelters funded by surcharge.
Requires municipal court to hear certain violations of animal cruelty statutes within 14 days of the summons date.

Authorizes municipalities that receive certification pursuant to the Fair Housing Act to make affordable housing units available on a preferential basis to persons of low and moderate income employed in a municipality's housing region.
Clarifies tax status of certain construction projects undertaken at State and county colleges through public-private partnerships and eliminates the sunset provision for such projects.
Requires the reporting of criminal offenses occurring on school property to law enforcement authorities.
Limits punitive damages in certain cases involving two or more comparatively negligent defendants.
Increases sheriffs' fees for executing arrest warrants in Special Civil Part.
Permits the issuance of restraining orders against persons charged with certain prostitution related offenses.
Authorizes a motion to dismiss in a cause of action (a "SLAPP" suit) arising from a defendant's valid exercise of the constitutional rights of freedom of speech.

Establishes lawn watering restrictions; authorizes DEP to adopt water conservation regulations and to reduce water supply application backlog; and requires installation of automatic rain sensor devices under certain circumstances.
Extends time period for renewal of lapsed alcoholic beverage retail licenses.

Requires certain conditions be met in order for school districts to provide their employees with tuition assistance for coursework or additional compensation upon acquisition of academic credits or completion of a degree program.
Establishes registry of offenders of individuals with developmental disabilities in DHS.
Requires municipality to comply with State audit prior to receiving State aid.
Revises provisions of "New Jersey Economic Stimulus Act of 2009" concerning public-private higher education construction and improvement projects and municipal ordinances to adopt stimulus measures.
Reinstates prohibition against representation of casino licensees and applicants by legal and other professional service entities associated with certain former public officers and employees.

Extends casino employment and post employment restrictions to employees and members of State Police assigned to Division of Gaming Enforcement and Casino Control Commission, and members of immediate family and business associates thereof.
Prohibits Casino Control Commission employees and members from performing casino internal control functions during casino conservatorship period.
Requires vehicle registration to contain issue date.
Consolidates various municipalities into the new municipalities of Seaside Township and Long Beach Island Township, or alternatively requires shared services agreements for all major services.
Consolidates all "doughnut municipalities" and "doughnut-hole municipalities" within 10 years.
Establishes "Police Officer, Firefighter and Public School Teacher Home-buyer Assistance Act."
Requires sharing of revenues derived from major developments situated near municipal borders under certain circumstances.
Establishes a "Home Energy Efficiency Improvement Program" in the EDA.
Authorizes adoption of timed-growth ordinances by municipalities.
Establishes a gross income tax credit for attendance at New Jersey county colleges.
Expands number of literacy advocacy programs eligible to receive voluntary taxpayer contributions through gross income tax returns.
Requires that certain relocation notices be bilingual in municipalities where at least one-third of the population are likely to speak a common non-English native language.
Affords emergency services peer counselors confidentiality privileges.
Prohibits sale of tobacco products in vending machines and establishes requirements for retail sales of tobacco.
Establishes procedure to insure inmates with military service receive all the veteran benefits to which they are entitled upon release.
Requires automobile insurers to maintain sales representation in urban rating territories.
The "Abandoned Cemetery Maintenance and Preservation Act."
Provides procedure for municipality acquiring school property from non-operating school district following merger to extinguish restrictive deed covenant.
Requires lobbyists that are nonprofit organizations to report annually to Election Law Enforcement Commission estimated number of members, contributors, and supporters.
Prohibits telecommunications companies from charging for certain services.
Authorizes civil action for certain economic damages against owner or keeper of pet animal that injures or kills another person's pet animal.
Authorizes release of sex offender registration information to DHS and county welfare agencies.
The "New Jersey Spam Deterrence Act."
Concerns access to certain job training courses for employees affected by plant closings, mass layoffs or transfer of operations.
Concerns use of health information technology products.
Prohibits hospitals from executing certain contracts for electronic health records systems.
Requires health insurers to cover medically necessary expenses for preventing infertility in women undergoing chemotherapy or radiation therapy.
Permits licensed facilities currently providing inpatient psychiatric services to add inpatient psychiatric beds without obtaining certificate of need.
Permits municipalities to defer 100% of payment of property taxes owed by senior citizen homeowners enrolled in PAAD.
Requires applicants for public assistance undergo retinal scan to detect multiple case fraud.
"New Jersey Health Benefit Exchange Act." *
"Prescription Drug Right-to-Know Act"; establishes clinical trials registry in DHSS; requires pharmaceutical companies to publicly disclose clinical trial data.
Exempts drugs for treatment of certain conditions from restrictive mechanisms under Medicaid, NJ FamilyCare, AIDS Drug Distribution Program, and PAAD and Senior Gold programs.
Expands NJ Cancer Education and Early Detection Program in DHSS to include treatment for colorectal and prostate cancers; appropriates $450,000.
Excludes certain Medicare premiums in determining eligibility for PAAD and Senior Gold programs.
Excludes certain premiums in determining PAAD eligibility.
Requires DHSS to make list of drugs with "black box" warnings accessible through its website.
Provides for a gross income tax deduction for COBRA premium expenses.
Requires examinations of joint insurance funds and certain reporting by those funds.
Allows persons affected by certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs to receive temporary suspension of payment of interest on mortgage loan.
Establishes a financial or personal information "do not sell" list for residents of this State.
Provides that employees no longer must pay full cost of purchase of PERS, PFRS or TPAF credit for military service.
Allows DMVA to fundraise for handicap accessible vehicle purchase.
Changes membership requirements of the Veterans' Services Council.
Creates New Jersey Honor Guard Ribbon.
Requires New Jersey DMVA to issue Cold War certificates to Cold War veterans.
Directs New Jersey Turnpike Authority to designate Garden State Parkway as memorial highway to POW-MIA's.
Broadens eligibility for certain veterans' benefits by eliminating requirement of service during specified dates or in specified locations.
The "Debt-Management Services Act of New Jersey."
Allows veteran or personal representative to withdraw honorable discharge papers from county clerk.
Expands eligibility for veterans' civil service preference; creates additional preference benefits.
Requires DMVA, through State veterans service offices, to provide surviving beneficiary of deceased service member with comprehensive benefits packet.
Grants credit against business taxes to developer of rental housing reserved for occupancy by veterans.
Prohibits persons under 19 from smoking in public and purchasing tobacco products.
Establishes the "Veterans Court Pilot Program."

Prohibits permanent change of child custody during period of active military service; provides that absence due to active military duty, by itself, is insufficient justification to modify a child custody or visitation order.
Expands the means to obtain a protective order for a minor.
Authorizes special Gold Star Family motor vehicle license plates for certain family members of military personnel who died while on active duty.*
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for maintenance of certain State memorials honoring war veterans.

Authorizes municipality to require enhanced notice of applications for development under MLUL by posting signs and expanding scope of individual notice to property owners within 400 feet of subject property.
Exempts certain purchases by school food service providers from the sales and use tax.
Requires certain physicians to complete course in recognizing and reporting child abuse and neglect.
Authorizes property tax deferment for deployed military personnel.
Provides post-traumatic stress disorder from military service during combat may be mitigating factor during sentencing.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for the NJ World War II Veterans' Memorial Fund.
Recognizes POW and MIA as valid description of casualty status and category classification for military personnel.
Increases maximum Emergency Services Volunteer Length of Service Award Program contributions and prospectively changes certain vesting requirements.
Increases personal needs allowance to $50 for those persons currently residing in nursing facilities, State hospitals or State developmental centers.
Requires State to reimburse municipalities for lost revenue resulting from veterans' total property tax exemption.
Requires managed care plans to cover treatment of overweight and obesity in adults on fee-for-service basis.
"Tattooing and Body Piercing Practice Act."
Enhances rights and remedies of employees who disclose or refuse to participate in fraudulent employer practices.
Establishes Medication Management, Outreach and Support Program in DHS; appropriates $8 million.
Extends charity care payments to physicians providing hospital-based charity care.
Provides additional enforcement provisions under "Health Care Quality Act"; allows certain private causes of action for violations; expands administrative remedies; establishes enforcement fund.
Revises criteria for determining health claim to be "clean claim" for purposes of promptly remitting payment.
Makes reforms to "Health Care Quality Act;" requires audits of provider networks.
"Nursing Student Incentive Loan and Loan Redemption Program Act"; appropriates $5 million.
Extends prevailing wage requirements to projects of county bridge commissions.
Authorizes leave for parents and guardians of children with special needs.
Revises "Health Care Quality Act;" requires certain provisions in managed care plan contracts; clarifies certain responsibilities for ordering tests and procedures.
Concerns liability, standards of care, and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.
The "New Jersey Consumer Catastrophe Preparedness and Protection Act"; creates "New Jersey Catastrophe Fund"; appropriates $10,000,000.
Immunizes policyholders from liability within policy limits when coverage exceeds New Jersey Property-Liability Insurance Guaranty Association statutory limit of $300,000.
Provides for expedited injunction for violations of law requiring prenotification of certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs.
Establishes Electronic Health Information Technology Fund.
"Dietitian/Nutritionist Licensing Act."
Requires health insurers to cover costs of tobacco use cessation services.
Enters New Jersey in Nurse Multistate Licensure Compact.
Provides civil immunity for certain volunteer physicians, nonprofit clinics and federally qualified health centers.
Requires DHSS to review standard of care at health care facilities in which 40% or more of direct patient care nursing staff are temporary hires.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for active duty members of United States Armed Forces, Reserve components thereof, and National Guard from New Jersey.
Establishes procedures for operation of air ambulance services.
Requires insurers and State health care coverage programs to cover cost of HPV vaccine.
Requires pharmacist to dispense epilepsy drug from same manufacturer as previously dispensed for certain patients. *
Requires Commissioner of Health and Senior Services to adopt uniform informed consent form for clinical demonstration projects approved by DHSS.
Permits person covered by certain managed care plans to receive covered services from network provider without obtaining written referral from primary care provider.
Revises standards for expert witnesses in medical malpractice actions.
"New Jersey Public Water Supply Fluoridation Act."
"New Jersey Broadband and Electronic Health Information Network Authority Act."
Requires insurers, Medicaid, and NJ FamilyCare to reimburse for childhood immunizations at levels specified by regulation.
Establishes "Bleeding Disorders Treatment Fund."
Requires all assisted living facilities set aside at least 10% of beds for Medicaid-eligible persons and accept at least 5% Medicaid direct admission.
Requires adult Work First New Jersey recipients to complete secondary education under certain circumstances and receive life skills training.

Prevents managed care plan from denying coverage for maintenance medications for chronic conditions for covered persons solely because of change in health benefits plan or pharmacy benefits manager initiated by employer or carrier.
Prevents managed care plan from denying coverage for certain health care services provided to covered person solely because covered person did not present referral to provider who performed services.
Requires health insurers that cover speech therapy and SHBP to provide coverage for certain services.
Requires Division of Taxation to provide certain information to applicants deemed ineligible.
Revises health wellness insurance benefits.
Prohibits payment of temporary disability benefits to incarcerated individuals.

Requires State Treasurer to issue cost benefit analysis and security report for conversion of military housing to civilian housing at Earle Naval Weapons Station and places moratorium on issuance of certain State permits and plan approvals.
Requires accident and injury data in NJ Transit annual report.
Expands eligibility for subsidy payments from CATV Universal Access Fund to include certain Medicaid recipients.
Prohibits termination of certain telephone service.
Standardizes redemption of unused sick and vacation leave by active local government employees.

Reduces amount of Special Municipal Aid and extraordinary aid awarded to municipalities that have not set limits on the amount of supplemental compensation paid to employees for unused sick and vacation leave.
Regulates the awarding and use of compensatory time granted to local government employees.

Requires certain political subdivisions to grant employees only those holidays granted to State employees and standardizes amount of paid vacation and sick leave granted to employees of certain political subdivisions.
Limits amount of compensation which may be paid by certain political subdivisions to their employees upon their resignation, retirement, termination, or other separation from employment.
Prohibits certain political subdivisions from awarding longevity-based benefits to their employees.
Prohibits annual bonuses for perfect attendance and the non-use of sick leave.
Prohibits terminal leave compensation for local government employees.
Prohibits additional compensation for on-call time.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies with ties to terrorists.
Exempts child care centers operating in public schools from certain environmental review licensing requirements.
Requires weekly update of known contaminated site database.
Enpowers U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs Office of the Inspector General law enforcement officers to make arrests for certain State law violations.
Extends time period during which municipal fire departments may hire certain laid off firefighters.
Permits certain members of Junior Firemen's Auxiliaries to perform non-hazardous support duties at fire sites.
Decreases rental motor vehicle surcharge from $5 per day to $3 per day.
"New Jersey Uniform Common Interest Ownership Act."
Increases threshold amount at which MLUL escrow deposits must be deposited in interest bearing accounts.
Prohibits payment of public employee bonuses not directly contingent upon achieving certain performance goals.
Permits unused sick leave by public employee to be carried forward for one year only; requires unused administrative leave to be cancelled.
Establishes registry of offenders of individuals with developmental disabilities in DHS.
Amends "Law Against Discrimination" to provide every person engaged in raising a dog for guide or service the right to access public facilities.
Requires certain DOC, county, and municipal prison physicians to acquire certain training.
Requires BPU to increase credit provided when issuing Solar Renewable Energy Certificates for solar energy produced by equipment manufactured in NJ. *
Provides exemption from tax on sales of certain energy saving products and services purchased from businesses located in UEZ.
Provides certain employment protections for sheriff's investigators.
Prohibits the sale of jewelry containing phthalates.
Extends prevailing wage requirements to certain for-sale housing projects.
Establishes bio-recovery specialist license and requires first responders to provide certain support to victims.
Prohibits use of public funds by employers for certain employee influence activities.
Revises the definition of "public works projects" related to project labor agreements to include bridges.
Permits construction workers to file a lien against the owner of real property under "Construction Lien Law."
Invalidates consumer contracts which require a waiver of right to file a consumer complaint.
Includes reverse rate evasion as form of insurance fraud and provides for civil and criminal penalties.
Requires Council on Affordable Housing to adjust municipal fair share to reflect job loss in a municipality.
Broadens scope of information sharing and civil immunity therefor, related to insurance fraud.
Provides consumer protections under certain telecommunications service provider contracts.
Establishes "Solar Equipment Purchase and Installation Assistance Program" in NJ EDA.
Reforms procedures concerning provision of affordable housing; abolishes Council on Affordable Housing.
Establishes penalty for suspension, by bus operator under contract with NJ Transit, of peak hour regular route service.
Revises provisions of "New Jersey Economic Stimulus Act of 2009" concerning public-private higher education construction and improvement projects and municipal ordinances to adopt stimulus measures.

Authorizes court to waive certain fees, offer mediation as sentence; authorizes defendant information in presentence report; reduces certain expungement waiting periods; requires benefits be considered in juvenile plan. *
Establishes aid program for certain municipalities with State correctional facilities.
Prohibits delivery of more than one magazine issue before billing information is obtained. *
Provides for regulation of small wind energy systems by municipalities.
Provides that public employee pension benefits are calculated on base salary exclusive of various forms of extra compensation.
Requires officers and employees of political subdivisions to contribute a portion of their base salary towards the cost of their health care coverage.
Requires all elected or appointed local government officers to receive ethics training.
Concerns patient billing by emergency medical services providers.
Requires hospitals to report to DHSS number of applications completed by parents or caretakers of children presumptively eligible for NJ FamilyCare or Medicaid programs.
Exempts from the gross income tax New Jersey lottery winnings from drawings before July 1, 2009.

Extends requirement of wastewater management planning agencies to establish or update wastewater management plans, and extends validity of sewer service areas and wastewater service areas, until April 7, 2011.
Reforms procedures concerning provision of affordable housing; abolishes Council on Affordable Housing.
Establishes procedures to prevent and eradicate bedbug infestations in certain residential property.
Limits authority of "Blue Ribbon Panel for Review of Long-Term Prisoners' Parole Eligibility." *
Authorizes Parole Board and sheriff's offices to hire alternate route trained police officers; exempts alternate route trainees from certain civil service requirements.
Clarifies provision authorizing certain inmates to be released on parole six months early.
Prohibits the manufacture, distribution, and sale of certain jewelry.
Permits municipalities to use auxiliary police in non-emergency situations.
Authorizes director of board of freeholders to exercise veto power over proposed actions of county authorities.
Requires notice of sheriff's sale of goods to be published in newspapers and on county sheriff websites.
Authorizes paid leaves of absence for certain delegates of employee organizations representing corrections officers attending conventions.
Allows child support payor to petition court for accounting of recipient's disposition of child support funds under certain circumstances.
Permits publication of legal notices by governments and individuals on official government website instead of newspaper.
Repeals cosmetic medical procedure gross receipts tax.
Excludes cosmetic dentistry from cosmetic medical procedures gross receipts tax.
Makes it unlawful practice to sell certain products via Internet auction.
Provides that the salary of an administrator of an approved private school for students with disabilities may not exceed median salary of comparable school district administrators.
Clarifies that motor vehicle rental companies may recover, through a "vehicle registration recovery fee" separately stated in rental agreement, certain costs of doing business.

Establishes uniform lower contribution limits and requires greater disclosure of all campaign contributions received by candidates; repeals laws regulating campaign contributions by entities performing certain public contracts.

Establishes the "Safe Drop Off of Drugs Program" for the collection and disposal of unused prescription drugs and other medicines; authorizes use of recycling tax revenues for program; establishes Corporation Business Tax Credit for companies providing disposal.
Authorizes creation of 33rd urban enterprise zone in Town of Harrison, Hudson County.
Requires disclosure of all campaign contributions received and expenditures made by school board candidates.
Directs DHS to declare surplus certain unused real property and provides for direct sale thereof.
Increases TPAF cost of living adjustment from 60% to 100% of Consumer Price Index.
Prohibits State officer or employee involved in awarding contract from holding employment with party awarded contract for two years after leaving State service.
Revises requirements for emergency medical services delivery.
Establishes Center for the Study of Health Care Billing Data.

Revises requirement for school district participation in Alliance for Competitive Telecommunications program and requires consultation with New Jersey Association of School Business Officials on certain training.
Permits "opt out" of compulsory automobile insurance; reinstates financial responsibility laws; eliminates territorial rate caps.
Expands scope of claims subject to "Health Claims Authorization, Processing and Payment Act"; modifies procedures applicable to health claims reviews.
Requires State Comptroller to establish schedule for each county to undergo performance review by State Comptroller's staff every five years.
Deems utilization management decisions on behalf of certain insurers to be practice of health care profession.
Deletes prior authorization requirements by certain insurers for accessing certain health care services.
Requires carriers offering managed care plans to report certain utilization management decisions to DOBI.
Permits electric public utilities to earn 15% rate of return on investment in, and installation of, certain voltage regulation technologies.
Provides for complaint forms to register perceived violations of local zoning ordinances and "State Uniform Construction Code Act."
Prohibits municipalities from requiring permits for certain voter registration drives.
Requires evidence be retained indefinitely in homicide cases and until defendant's sentence expires in sexual assault cases.
Requires county prosecutors to investigate credible allegations of voter intimidation; requires Attorney General to direct investigation if county prosecutor fails to act.
Establishes notice requirements for utility service shut-off and provides for appointment of receiver in place of tenant organization for utility service payments in senior living facilities.
Relieves municipalities along certain light rail lines of civil liability in Quiet Zones under certain circumstances.
Requires discount for certain E-ZPass frequent users of NJ Turnpike Exit 6.
"Plastic Bag Recycling Act."
Establishes a civil action for the eviction or removal of persons who commit drug-related crimes on leased residential property.
Makes certain changes to public access of government records.

Prohibits employees of certain organizations from enrolling in State-administered retirement system or health care plan of public employer; prohibits certain TPAF and PERS members from receiving service credit while on leave with labor organization.
Changes prospectively definition of compensation used to calculate benefits in PERS and TPAF to average of five highest-paid years and in PFRS, SPRS, and JRS to average of three highest-paid years.

Requires second class counties with superintendent of elections to establish office of deputy superintendent; authorizes chair and vice-chair of county committee and county's two State committee members to select superintendent and deputy nominees; appropriates funds.
Upgrades burglary of a residence as a crime of the second degree; upgrades it to a crime of the first degree if committed while armed. *
Includes e-mail addresses in list of confidential items to be redacted from public records under OPRA
Requires 25 percent of playground equipment to be accessible by disabled persons.
"Reduce Plastic and Paper Bag Usage Act."
Concerns regulation of paratransit vehicles and drivers transporting persons in wheelchairs.
Requires municipal certification of installation of automatic rain sensors on lawn sprinklers as condition of transfer of residential property.
Requires installation of automatic rain sensors on lawn sprinklers on commercial, retail and industrial property.
Places statutory restrictions on the type and amount of compensation provided to local public employees.
Appropriates $17.45 million in 1992 and 2003 bond act monies for loans to fund dam restoration projects and $1.371 million in 1992 bond act monies to fund State dam restoration projects.
Requires licensed home inspector to report an energy rating for each home inspected for buyer in contemplation of purchase.
Increases host community benefit for municipalities wherein solid waste transfer stations are located from fifty cents to one dollar per ton of solid waste processed at such facilities.
Expands scope of New Jersey Regulatory Flexibility Act dealing with economic impact of rules on small businesses.
Appropriates $600,000 to the Lake Hopatcong Commission from constitutionally dedicated Corporation Business Tax revenues.
Requires third-party disbursement service organization that contracts with local government unit or board of education to post bond against failure to meet obligations.
Permits local taxing district to refund overpayments of property tax monies paid more than three years ago in certain circumstances.
Exempts security deposits by residential tenants from provisions of "Uniform Unclaimed Property Act.
Prohibits use of equipment and facilities to produce obscene materials in public school districts and public institutions of higher education.
Excuses students with conflicts of conscience from certain class requirements of public institutions of higher education.
Provides unemployment benefits for certain spouses of National Guard members.
Provides for educational stability of children placed in resource family homes and that school district of residence for the child shall be present district of residence of parent or guardian.
Establishes death benefit for certain first aid volunteers and volunteer firefighters.
Creates New Jersey Servicemembers' Civil Relief Act of 2010.
Makes certain changes concerning the appointment, duties, and tenure of the Director of Division on Civil Rights.
Raises minimum wage to $8.50, then makes annual adjustments based on increases in the Statewide average weekly wage.
Requires Commissioner of Education to accept charter school applications throughout the calendar year and expedites approval of charter school applications.

Provides for the election of school board members at November general election and eliminates vote on school budgets except for separate proposals to spend above cap which will also occur at general election.
Provides for maintenance of State buildings and facilities by direct hire of certain skilled labor. **
Requires gradual replacement of incandescent light bulbs in public school buildings with compact fluorescent light bulbs whenever possible.
Requires all campaign contributions to be reported to ELEC.
Establishes "Solar Roof Installation Warranty Program" in NJ EDA; appropriates $2 million from "Global Warming Solutions Fund."
Prohibits for ten years after compliance with penalty or sentence imposed by court elected or appointed officials convicted of certain crimes from serving as governmental affairs agents.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Records Privacy.

Penalizes permittees who acquire construction permits and certificates of occupancy by illegally influencing the permit procurement process; requires posting of bonds in certain situations; permits civil fines.
Prohibits member of Legislature from seeking certain grants or loans through annual appropriations act or legislatively-controlled program.
Requires Secretary of State to set standards for certification of electronic voting machines; permits voting machine examiners to request certain information and consults with experts as necessary.
Provides for reincorporation of certain local churches under Title 16 of the Revised Statutes.
Designates portion of U.S. Route No. 40 in Buena Borough, Atlantic County as "Peter 'Pete' Dandrea Section of the Harding Highway."
Establishes that police cruisers have a useful life of five years and allows local units to bond for such vehicles.
Provides that receipt of public pension or retirement allowance will be suspended during reemployment with public employer; allows enrollment in DCRP based on such reemployment.
Establishes moratorium on the installation of synthetic turf pending a comprehensive public health study.
Prohibits unmuffled use of compression release engine brakes; creates fine.
Increases and indexes maximum homestead property tax deduction under gross income tax.
Requires amount by which actual State General Fund revenue exceeds anticipated State General Fund revenue for a fiscal year to be appropriated as State school aid.
Allocates nondedicated portion of State realty transfer fee collections to municipal property tax relief.
Establishes "Matthew's Law Limiting the Use of Restraints."
Requires insurers and State health care coverage programs to cover cost of HPV vaccine.
Requires municipalities to include unique identifier on signs at certain handicapped parking spots.
Permits eligible claimant who is proportionate owner paying entire property tax bill to collect entire homestead property tax reimbursement amount.
Permits municipal board of library commissioners to reduce library tax rate when municipality acquires new ratables.
Jaden's Law; requires DHSS to prepare online brochure about the option to donate bone marrow. *
Requires electric public utilities to develop plans to upgrade their distribution equipment in order to accommodate any increased use thereof to charge motor vehicles propelled by electricity.
Makes certain changes to open public records act; formally names open public records act "Martin O'Shea Open Public Records Act."

Directs the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association to waive 365-day period of ineligibility for interscholastic sports upon an affirmative demonstration that the transfer is for non-athletic reasons.
Prohibits smoking at public parks and beaches.
Requires Department of State to establish and maintain a website to provide a clearinghouse of information for nonprofits.
Requires HMOs that contract with DHS to reimburse hospitals for emergency services based on cost of those services.
Establishes "Government Functions and Services Study Commission," appropriates $95,000.

Creates housing purchase matching grant program for reserve component of the U.S. Armed Forces and the New Jersey National Guard who have served in certain military operations; appropriates $2,000,000.
Creates commission to study effectiveness of county government; appropriates $95,000.
Requires use of uniform silver flags to mark certain pesticide applications.
Prohibits display of political party affilliation on mail-in ballot envelopes.
Requires OLS to make audiovisual recordings of legislative sessions available to public in electronic form.
"One Strike, You're Ours;" adds use of Internet as aggravating factor in child sex crimes and requires lifetime electronic monitoring of offender.
Establishes special license plates to fund diabetes research and education.
Upgrades crime of soliciting or recruiting for criminal street gang while on school property.
Requires sellers of used motor vehicles to complete and submit form.
Requires that public employees who are married, partners in civil union couples, or with domestic partners receive health care benefits from only one public employer.
Requires certain school districts to reduce per pupil administrative expenditures by 10% over three-year period and certain reporting by executive county superintendents of schools.
Establishes Bill of Rights license plate to fund historic preservation.
Requires all prison commissary profits be turned over to Victims of Crime Compensation Agency.
Terminates sick leave injury program for State employees injured after July 1, 2011 or upon expiration of current collective negotiation agreement.
Bars direct solicitation letters from attorneys to accident victims and other persons.
Requires health benefits coverage for bone mass measurement.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Child Protection Zone Act."

Requires Office of Homeland Security and Preparedness to train inspectors on indentifying terrorist activity; creates grant program for inspectors to obtain radiation detection devices; appropriates $300,000.
"Property Assessment Appeal Transparency Act"; revises content of required annual notification of real property assessment.
Increases and revises membership of New Jersey Cemetery Board.
Requires signs posted by retail motor fuel dealers to indicate motor fuel prices for cash and credit card customers; establishes new penalties for violations.
Requires individual to be at least 21 years of age to enter into contract for the use of a credit card under certain circumstances.
Requires State-administered retirement systems to make determination on accidental disability retirement applications within three months of receiving applicant's medical determination.
Requires certain cemeteries to accept Work First New Jersey and SSI allowance for burial expenses.

Permits a child whose parent or quardian is ordered into active military service to remain enrolled in the school district where the child's parent or guardian resided prior to active military service.
Requires builders registering under "New Home Warranty and Builders' Registration Act" to provide Social Security and employer identification numbers.
Eliminates compensation for Chairman and appointed and voting public members of Casino Reinvestment Development Authority.
Requires issuance of general permit for beach food and drink concession stands under certain circumstances pursuant to CAFRA.
Provides for the suspension of tolls on the State's toll roads under certain conditions.
Authorizes counties to participate in property tax appeals for real property having a value of $10 million or more.
Provides for licensure of landscape professionals and registration of professional landscape businesses.
Prohibits organized delivery systems from denying participation in network to imaging centers willing to meet terms of contract.
Provides for mandatory life imprisonment for aggravated sexual assault.
Allows for municipal designation of "Petroleum Manufacturing Retention and Expansion Zones"; requires DEP to expedite permitting in these zones.
Revises criteria for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement for claimants affected by eminent domain.
Establishes standards for sale and application of fertilizer intended for use on turfgrass.
Extends expiration date of special appraisal process for Green Acres and farmland preservation programs from 2009 to 2014.
Allows New Jersey gross income taxpayers to elect to deduct certain losses from certain investment arrangements discovered to be criminally fraudulent.
Requires BPU financial incentives for photovoltaic equipment for residences that are Energy Star compliant receive preferred treatment.
Permits developer to qualify for low-interest loan from NJEDA when building a high performance green building.
Permits water supply service and sewerage service sub-metering in multi-family dwellings to promote water conservation.
Extends expiration date of special appraisal process for Green Acres and farmland preservation programs from 2009 to 2014 for lands in Highlands Region.
