Expands programs in BPU to include low-interest loans and grants to municipalities for energy efficient programs and innovative energy technologies.
Permits surety companies to issue blanket bonds for municipal treasurers and tax collectors, and municipal court judges and administrators.
Extends eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction to residents of continuing care retirement communities.
Appropriates $250,000 to Department of Community Affairs for grants to rape care crisis centers.
Provides matching grant program for local governments to facilitate energy efficiency and conservation of resources in public buildings; appropriates $50 million.
Revises Newborn Screening program in DHSS.
Requires health insurers and State Health Benefits Commission to provide coverage for posttraumatic stress disorder under same conditions as other sickness.
"Plastic Container Recycling Enhancement Act."
Requires financial institution to notify account holder when information relative to an electronic fund transfer is shared with third party.
The "New Jersey Homeowners' Equity Protection Act."
Regulates sale of olive oil.
"Water Supply Open Space, Farmland and Historic Preservation Trust Fund Act."
Provides for voluntary contributions to the "Homelessness Prevention Program" through real estate sales.
Requires DCA to adopt energy inspection code, and requires licensed home inspector to report energy analysis for each home inspected for buyer in contemplation of purchase.
Dedicates up to $150,000 annually of fees collected at Island Beach State Park to special fund to be used to support certain park programs, and makes an appropriation from the fund.
"Stormwater Management and Combined Sewer Overflow Abatement Bond Act of 2010," authorizes bonds for $50,000,000, and appropriates $5,000.
"Water Resource Lands Protection Act."
Requires small school districts to share superintendents and school business administrators under certain circumstances.

Requires installation of operational automatic rain sensor on lawn sprinklers as condition of sale and on lawn sprinklers on commercial, retail or industrial property and in common interest communities within specified timeframes.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $30,000,000 to UMDNJ for expansion and renovation of clinical facilities at New Jersey Dental School.
Provides for decrease and eventual ban on use of non-compostable plastic grocery bags.
The "Retrofitted Green Building Tax Credit Act."
The "Green Building Tax Credit Act."
Bars certain officials from elective office and political activity for certain time periods.
Grandfathers municipal ordinances that require merchants of used and secondhand jewelry to maintain possession longer than minimum period required by State law.
Provides that an "attorney-in-fact" is a fiduciary for purposes of theft statutes.
Requires certain public utilities to notify an appropriate law enforcement officer of service shutoffs to residential customers under certain circumstances.
Limits scope of inmates whose cases must be reviewed for parole eligibility every three years.
Permits possession of certain types of ammunition.
"Post-Viability Protection Act."

Authorizes municipality to adopt ordinance permitting tenant to remain in illegal occupancy with no immediate health or safety risk; requires expiration of ordinance upon evidence of economic stabilization.

Increases certain sentences and imposes bail restrictions on persons who violate domestic violence restraining orders under certain circumstances; authorizes the court to order evaluation and treatment.
Provides exclusive jurisdiction to PERC for certain unfair labor practice claims.
Creates Review Commission on Workers' Compensation.
Prohibits certain provisions in employment contracts.
Concerns apprenticeship programs and other standards for public works contractors.

Prohibits towing of motor vehicles displaying wheelchair placards or license plates under certain conditions, requires clear signage for restricted handicapped parking zones, and requires 24-hour access to certain towed motor vehicles.
Allows an institution of higher education to require the mental health records of a student committed to attend the institution.

Requires public institution of higher education to notify the parents of certain dependent students, without prior consent of the student, when student receives mental health treatment at the institution.
Authorizes waiver of license revocation process for certain child support obligors.*
Creates self-defense justification for victims of domestic violence.
Prohibits the sale of certain children's products containing lead, mercury, or cadmium.
Lengthens service life of certain school buses to 15 years.
Authorizes educational services commissions to purchase goods or services through nationally-recognized and accepted cooperative purchasing agreement.
Creates program for installing standby emergency power generators in new senior housing.
Requires municipal governing bodies and boards of education to provide sufficient time for all requested public comment at open public meetings.
Requires local unit to make adopted budget available for inspection by public in office, without written request, and to make copies available at reasonable fee.
Changes home elevation permit height requirement in flood prone areas.
Establishes procedure for notification to, and review by, municipalities of certain grant and loan applications for acquisition or development of lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Establishes up to four-month extension for expiring carrier contracts with acute care hospitals while parties engage in contract renegotiation.
Requires physician supervision of nurse anesthetists.
Provides that English shall be the official language of the State.
Requires correctional facilities to provide inmates with prescription medication that was prescribed for chronic conditions existing prior to incarceration.
Requires preservation of certain biological evidence.
Increases membership of Fish and Game Council and clarifies it has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Designates four State songs.
Prohibits first responders from disseminating photographs of accident victims and patients to public without consent of victim or patient.
Requires DOT to create map showing refueling facilities where alternative fuel is dispensed.
Establishes cross-acceptance of local master plans; intermunicipal review of certain development applications.
Phases in single sales fraction for corporation business tax income allocation formula, over five years, provides airline-specific sales fraction.
Concerns affordable housing in the Highlands Region.
Standardizes maximum fine for violation of municipal and county ordinances and resolutions at $2,000.
Prohibits local governments from acquiring by condemnation any airport that has had its development rights purchased.
Increases income eligibility limit for reduction or abatement of municipal or county utility authority fees.
Creates alternate voting members on county agriculture development boards.
Requires genetic testing to determine paternity in non-dissolution cases.
Concerns dissolution of free public libraries.
Re-establishes 6.37 percent as top marginal gross income tax rate.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for New Jersey National Guard members and their families in need of assistance.
"Helen's Law;" establishes criminal penalty for causing death or serious bodily injury when violating hands-free cell phone law when driving.
Establishes crime of entering into certain restricted airport areas.
Exempts solar panels from impervious surface or impervious cover designation.
Establishes standards for certain fertilizer applications, requires certification of professional fertilizer applicators, and regulates labeling and sale of certain fertilizers. *
Prohibits sale of tobacco products in vending machines with certain exceptions.
Authorizes Office of Public Defender to provide legal representation for child in proceedings after parental rights have been terminated.
Exempts certain databases from public access under Open Public Records Act under certain circumstances.
Provides for the removal of a State Board of Education member for failure to attend three consecutive board meetings without good cause.
Authorizes certified celebrants to solemnize marriages and civil unions.*
Modifies requirement for advice of counsel in certain "palimony" agreements.
Requires consumer complaints to licensing boards of regulated professions to be resolved within 120 days.

Provides for annual appropriation to NJ Sports and Exposition Authority of 50 percent of revenue from sales tax on admissions to and sales at new Meadowlands stadium to fund debt service, maintenance, repair, and replacement.
Allows municipalities to provide free or reduced fee beach badges to active military and NJ National Guard personnel.
Clarifies school district eligibility to receive State funding for special education evaluation services for children enrolled in New Jersey nonpublic school and living out-of-State.
Requires COAH to subtract affordable units from municipality's fair share affordable housing obligation to reflect job loss upon closure of federal military installation.
Requires the Department of Military and Veterans Affairs' website to provide a link to the website of institutions of higher education located in the State.
Clarifies the intent of the Legislature that the attempt or conspiracy to commit certain offenses may constitute acts of domestic violence.
Revises statute concerning licenses to take menhaden.
Expands "Jersey Fresh" program to include "Made With Jersey Fresh" designation of certain baked goods and other food products.
Creates State Beach Task Force.
Prohibits disclosure of certain personal information by computer services providers.
Upgrades penalties for assaulting certain health care professionals and workers at health care facilities and human services and veterans' facilities.
Changes the scope of public notification regarding contaminated site remediation.
Requires in public schools instruction on the contributions of United States veterans and the observance of patriotic exercises on certain holidays.
Requires Attorney General to defend certain local law enforcement officers.
Requires the supervisor of a school bus driver to inspect the school bus for pupils remaining at the end of the transportation route.
Prohibits housing allowance in contract between State Board of Education and State district superintendent.
Exempts certain lake association membership fees and dues from imposition of sales and use tax.
Removes charges in the nature of initiation fees, membership fees or dues from sales and use tax.
Prohibits DOT from putting tolls on I-78 and I-80 and from transferring jurisdiction to independent authority or entity.
Provides procedures for crediting certain dwellings used by agricultural workers in determination of municipality's fair share housing obligation.
Requires public referendum prior to issuance of general obligation bonds by local units.
Requires cemetery companies to file annual financial report.
Makes certain changes to open public records act; formally names open public records act "Martin O'Shea Open Public Records Act."
Revises law concerning meetings of public bodies to provide greater public access to meetings and to information about meetings.
Establishes "Internet Predator Investigation and Prosecution Fund" with $200 assessment on persons convicted of certain offenses.
Provides for discounted resident trapping license fees for senior citizens.
Requires any individual seeking elective public office to disclose when filing petition of nomination whether he or she has been convicted of a criminal offense.
Allows certain volunteer firefighters, rescue and first aid squad members to claim $5,000 income tax deduction.
Requires certain offenders to register under Megan's Law; upgrades the crimes of invasion of privacy and peering into a window of a dwelling for a second or subsequent offense.
Prohibits seller of real estate to transfer realty transfer fee liability to buyer.
Requires certification that persons directly or indirectly receiving State monies or privileges are not unauthorized aliens.
Requires State to purchase certain vehicle tires and motor oils to minimize fuel usage.
Prohibits use of hands-free wireless telephones and electronic communication devices while providing instruction in the operation of a motor vehicle.
Provides for mandatory terms of imprisonment for certain sexual assaults upon a minor; amends murder statute.
Makes escapees responsible for apprehension costs.
Provides for immediate driver's license suspension under certain circumstances.
Provides that trespassing in nuclear power plant is third degree crime.
Protects property owned by military personnel and first responders from condemnation.
Prohibits release of illegal immigrants from correctional facilities.
Provides for direct property tax relief from Highlands Property Tax Stabilization Fund.
Requires appropriations in the nature of grants-in-aid to include certain criteria in the act in which they are enacted.
Requires proof of lawful presence in the United States to obtain certain benefits.
Requires that the members of a housing authority must reside in the municipality in which the housing authority was created.
Encourages purchase of "Jersey Fresh" and other NJ agricultural products by State agencies, departments and facilities.
Precludes most distributions of increased value of pre-marital residence at time of divorce.
Expands calibers of rim-fire rifles permitted on State wildlife management target ranges.
Repeals traffic control signal monitoring system pilot program.
Requires dentist to notify patient before providing dental prosthesis manufactured outside the United States.
Permits municipalities to purchase and issue certain surplus retail alcoholic beverage licenses.
Establishes calls to psychiatric emergency screening centers for purposes other than emergency mental health concerns as petty disorderly persons offense.
"New Jersey Uniform Athlete Agents Act."
Provides for State assumption of the costs of the county prosecutors' offices.
Creates Witnesses of Crime Protection Program Fund and assess $25 penalty on persons convicted of crimes.
Establishes financial incentives for certain energy providers to conduct energy audits.
Allows for 75% of costs of energy audits undertaken for commercial buildings be paid for by societal benefits charge.
Facilitates the cooperation between certain major sports and entertainment venues.

Requires Governor to make temporary appointment when vacancy occurs in U.S. Senate; requires appointee be member of same political party as person vacating office since beginning of that term; eliminates special election option.
Provides supplemental appropriation of $2,700,000 to DCA for Neighborhood Preservation Program.
Establishes "MarcAnthony's Law," criminalizes use of defaced or stolen firearm to injure a police officer; enhances penalties for defacing a firearm.
Establishes that only non-violent offenders should have their cases reviewed by the parole board every three years.
Eliminates contractual tenure for certain superintendents of schools and administrative principals and reinstates career tenure for these positions.
Regulates captive insurers.
"State Authorities Reform Act."
Consumer Relief Act of 2010; establishes temporary sales and use tax rate reduction periods for sales of certain goods and services.
Requires public notification indicating violation of certain motor fuel laws by retail dealer.
Includes adult with onset physical disabilities as eligible criteria for assistance through Special Needs Housing Trust Fund.
Allows gross income tax deduction for 50% of contributions of $100 or more to domestic violence shelters.
Concerns contracting and licensing procedures for certain organizations under contract with DHS and DCF.
Reinstates certificate of need requirement for ambulatory surgical facilities.
Extends eligibility for $250 property tax deduction to veterans of Operation "Praying Mantis."
Requires certain elected officials and appointed officers eligible for dual health benefits coverage to choose coverage by one public entity.
Repeals law requiring prevailing wage be paid to workers employed in construction undertaken with Board of Public Utilities financial assistance.
Establishes penalties for use of bump key to commit certain crimes.
Establishes exception to five-year limit on payment of victim claims.
Allows certain organizations to file complaints with the Council on Local Mandates.
Allows a gross income tax deduction for the purchase price of monthly passes used for commuting to work by train, bus or ferry.
Expands authorization for use of dealer and temporary license plates and establishes fines for their misuse.
Repeals law providing benefits for family temporary disability leave and deposits moneys from the "Family Temporary Disability Leave Account" into the unemployment compensation fund.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service, and their immediate family members.
Establishes fine for committing motor vehicle offense that results in collision with bicyclist.
"Safe Places Safe Kids Act;" makes it a crime to commit certain offenses in school zones and near playgrounds.
Permits preference in awarding certain public contracts.
Requires a private seller of a used motor vehicle to request identification information from purchaser.
Authorizes creation of local gypsy moth control commissions.
Requires notice to consumers of availability of pet health insurance.
Creates permissive county-based housing assistance program.
"State Medicare Part D Assistance and Information Act."
Requires health care facilities to continuously monitor status of health care practitioner credentials.
Establishes the reckless discharge of a firearm as a crime of the fourth degree.
"Neurodevelopmental Disabilities Institute Act"; appropriates $6 million.
Allows exclusion for calculation of adjusted tax levy for expenditures made by municipalities for "Main Street New Jersey" program.
Requires health insurers SHBP, Medicaid, and NJ FamilyCare to provide coverage for ancillary medical services in connection with outpatient diagnostic screening and surgical intervention services.
Require property condition disclosure statements for real estate sales.
Requires SHBP to cover prostate cancer screening.
Provides for tattoo pigment labeling requirements.
Requires alarm business licensee to maintain business office in this State.
"Geologist Licensing Act."
"Tax Preparers Licensing Act."
Requires public bodies under Open Public Meetings Act to display U.S. flag and recite Pledge of Allegiance at beginning of meeting.
Prohibits DEP from requiring recycling coordinators to complete educational course on recycling.
Provides for issuance of New Jersey Homeland Security Medals; appropriates $5,000.

Requires applications for certain professional and occupational licenses and certain registrations for controlled dangerous substance distribution to include information on applicant's membership in Armed Forces.
Provides that certain disabled veterans may purchase special automobile insurance policies.
Regulates operation of sweepstakes in New Jersey.
Requires that certain information on school district expenditures and student achievement be printed on the ballot and sample ballot for the annual school election.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society.
Directs each institution of higher education to develop and coordinate a comprehensive disaster preparedness plan.
Requires textbook publishers to provide public institutions of higher education with information on price and availability of textbooks.
Permits commercial advertising and sponsorship signs on equipment and materials related to the collection of tolls consistent with State law on outdoor advertising. *
Ruduces number of reports and publications printed by State; provides for most to be available primarily on Internet; requires notice of availability of reports and publications.*
Raises allowable speed for low-speed vehicles to 35 miles per hour.
Requires mandatory jail time for certain driving while intoxicated convictions with high blood alcohol concentration.
Requires breath or blood test in motor vehicle accidents involving pedestrians.
Prohibits candidate's relative from serving as candidate's campaign treasurer.
Provides DYFS caseworkers with personnel and law enforcement assistance when conducting DYFS investigations.
Permits veterans' organization to use net proceeds from games of chance for organizations' support.
Requires continuing education for athletic trainers.
Modifies procedures available under the Drug Offender Restraining Order Act.
Requires that SHBP prescription drug plan use bulk purchasing.
Requires training for constables.
Creates the criminal offense of affinity fraud.
Eliminates 10 day advance notification of proposed effective date of certain shareholder action.
Permits municipalities to transfer the responsibility for hiring adult school crossing guards to the local school district and any charter schools located in the municipality.
Permits certain motor vehicle offenders to apply for a restricted use license.
Jay's Law; requires DWI offenders to wear alcohol monitoring device.
Permits members of Pinelands Commission to approve revisions to comprehensive management plan.
Requires employers to use E-Verify program and prohibits employment of unauthorized aliens.
Adds three members to New Jersey Student Athlete Cardiac Screening Task Force.

Limits leave and supplemental compensation benefits for school district superintendents, assistant superintendents, and school business administrators; provides procedures and penalties for enforcement of TPAF provisions.
Requires school buses transporting certain disabled persons to use flashing lights and establishes penalties for drivers who fail to yeild.
Requires law enforcement officers to search domestic violence restraining order registry upon conducting an arrest.
Requires certain notification periods regarding due dates for premium payments for individual health benefits plans.
Authorizes use of retail coupons for purchase of milk by consumers.
Requires lowest possible price for inmate telephone calls.
Requires printers to display average cost per 1,000 printed pages and ink cartridges to display yield. *
Eliminates legislative leadership committees.
Establishes separate license for dealers of non-motorized trailers.

Prohibits filling of vacancy among candidates nominated at primaries after 48th and before 14th day before general election, except due to death; prohibits filling subsequent vacancies before elections.
Increases penalty for commercial drivers who use a hand-held telephone or electronic communication device while driving.

Requires full and complete disclosure to the BPU by foreign corporations that own or control certain public utilities; prohibits majority ownership or control by foreign corporations of certain public utilities.
Sets State's mileage reimbursement rate at IRS rate for business use of automobile.
Creates bistate commission to coordinate management and flood prevention of waterways flowing between Bergen County, NJ and Rockland County, NY.
Requires development of guidelines and educational fact sheet concerning the nature, risk, and treatment of sports-related head injuries to student-athletes.

Makes public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes or found at fault in certain civil actions liable and subject to pension garnishment for public legal expenses and illegally obtained funds.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Heating Oil and Propane Reserves.
Authorizes municipal dredging of lagoon community waterways and levying of special assessment or issuing of bonds to finance such dredging.
Establishes civil action for damages against organizations that support terrorism.
Establishes process by which a fiduciary is discharged.
"Breann's Law" requires health insurers, the State Health Benefits Program and NJ FamilyCare to provide "out of network" coverage for children with catastrophic illnesses.
Prevents intoxicated employees from receiving workers' compensation.
Provides exception to requirement that posted price of motor fuel must remain unchanged for 24-hour period.
Provides for conscientious exemption to mandatory immunizations.
Clarifies that non-credit courses are eligible courses under the volunteer tuition credit program.

Requires State-administered pension systems to train employers on enrollment requirements; requires employers to certify validity of employee enrollment with acknowledgement of penalty for providing false information. *
Strengthens public disclosure and monitoring requirements of "Open Public Meetings Act".
Establishes measures to deter steroid use among students.
Requires the New Jersey Schools Development Authority to biannually compile information on school facilities project contracts awarded to minority and female contractors.
Eliminates salary for part-time members of certain boards, commissions, and independent authorities.
Eliminates imposition of corporation business tax on certain foreign corporations carrying passengers into and out of State in motor vehicle or motorbus.
Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Meadowlands horse racetrack, subject to voter approval.
Makes various changes concerning payments to public employees for unused sick leave, sick leave injury in State service, and PERS and TPAF disability retirement.

Makes various changes to SHBP and SEHBP concerning eligibility, cost sharing, plan choice, benefit change application, coverage waiver, multiple coverage; requires contributions toward health care benefits by public employees and certain retirees.

Makes various pension system changes concerning eligibility, retirement allowance formula, compensation definition, position eligible for service credit, non-forfeitable rights, enrollment waiver, prosecutors part, PFRS special retirement, employer contributions.
Requires health insurers to disclose broker commissions to purchasers.
Adds public colleges and universities and county colleges to definition of a "qualifying economic redevelopment and growth grant incentive area."
Requires all State agency rules be published in NJ Register, and prohibits use of regulatory guidance documents except under certain circumstances.
Regulates pay-off of trade-in vehicles and certain vehicle title releases. *
Establishes "Blue Ribbon Panel to Review New Jersey's Inmate Policy." *
Requires court to consider gang affiliation when making bail determinations.
Requires active public employees in SHBP and SEHBP to contribute minimum of 1.5% of base salary to share cost of their health care coverage.
Eliminates eligibility for membership in pension systems and for health care benefits for part-time public employees, appointees and elected officials.
Limits amount of appeal bond in civil actions to $50 million. *
Provides a corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization and expansion.
Makes it a crime of the third degree to practice psychology without a license and prohibits certain unlicensed employees of nonprofit community agencies from using title of psychologist.

Increases personal needs allowance to $50 for recipients of Medicaid and Supplemental Security Income who are veterans or spouses of veterans and provides for annual cost-of-living increase in allowance.
Authorizes special license plates for members of the United States Coast Guard.
Requires certain public officers and employees to reside in State. *
Provides that regular work week of all newly-hired full-time State or local government employees will be 40 hours.
Freezes expenditures by public entities on salaries and benefits for period of three years and limits such expenditures thereafter.
Imposes temporary rollback and freeze on property tax bills to 2009 amounts, beginning August, 2010, until State unemployment rate falls below seven percent.
Revises law concerning disposition of assets of a county society for the prevention of cruelty to animals that has dissolved or has had its charter revoked, canceled, or suspended.

Changes "board of chosen freeholders" to "board of county commissioners" and "freeholder" and "chosen freeholder" to "county commissioner" in new sections of law and revisions to current law; requires counties to change terms on website.
Expands qualifications of county corrections officers; clarifies certain administrative and managerial policies of county correctional institutions.
Requires police to provide crime victim with free police report.
Prohibits adoption of new rules exceeding federal standards unless specifically authorized by State law or necessary to protect public health, safety, or welfare. *
Delays effective date of provision authorizing certain inmates to be released on parole six months early.
Requires disclosure to certain prison guards of AIDS status of inmates.
Prohibits telecommunications, utility or cable television companies from charging certain customers prior to actual billing due date.
Recognizes American Sign Language as a world language for meeting high school graduation requirements.
Protects employee rights to ownership and usage of employee inventions developed entirely on employee's own time and without using employer's resources.
Authorizes property tax levy cap banking by local units and boards of education.
Directs DOT to allow wineries to erect tourist-oriented directional signs on roads and highways. *
Requires candidates for teacher certification to complete technology training program.
Prohibits certain TPAF and PERS members from receiving service credit while on leave with labor organization.
Prohibits new employees of certain organizations from enrolling in State-administered retirement system or health care plan of public employer.*
The "Renewable Energy District Financing Act."
Requires State Soil Conservation Committee to adopt standards concerning soil restoration measures. *
Establishes "New Jersey Property Assessment Clean Energy (NJ PACE) Municipal Financing Program."
Establishes minimum reimbursement amounts for medical transportation services under Medicaid.
Renames "New Jersey Trauma Center" at University Hospital as "Eric Munoz Trauma Center."
Concerns compensation and benefits of officers, employees, and members of State and local authorities. *
Requires life imprisonment without parole for persons convicted of the murder of a minor under the age of 18 in the course of the commission of a sex crime.
Reduces 2010 minimum racing dates; makes various changes to breeders' awards during 2010; authorizes certain loans. *
Establishes in DEP the Environmental Science Review Board to review proposed environmental regulations for consistency with science.
Authorizes courts to include animals in domestic violence restraining orders.
Requires driver's licenses to indicate blood type.
Establishes waiver, rebate or payment of insured's deductible, copayment, or coinsurance by health care practitioner as a form of insurance fraud subject to criminal and civil penalties.
Prohibits good faith allegations of child abuse from being used against the accuser in a child custody proceeding; makes it a disorderly persons offense to file a false allegation of child abuse.

Permits wager to be placed at racetracks or casino simulcasting facilities in advance for races not simulcast at facility under certain circumstances if race is simulcast at other facilities in the State.
Establishes Governor's authority over approval of minutes of certain regional commissions.
Requires display of State vehicle abuse hotline bumper stickers on all State vehicles.
Designated the "Dogfighting Zero Tolerance Act of 2009."
Authorizes unemployment benefits for shared work programs.
Removes imposition of sales tax on massage, bodywork and somatic services.
Permits DEP air quality regulation of certain outdoor wood burning units only in response to complaint.
Establishes special license plates for veterans.
Establishes special motorcycle license plates for veterans.
Designated "New Jersey Economic Development Promotion Act"; streamlines and reorganizes State economic development statutes in order to promote administrative efficiency.
Directs State acquisition of Troy Meadows Natural Area, Morris County, for recreation and conservation purposes and designates it as natural area and wildlife sanctuary.
Establishes New Jersey Transportation Heritage Center and authorizes establishment of Foundation for the New Jersey Transportation Heritage Center.
Repeals Highlands planning and environmental permitting provisions of "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act," and amends various statutes to reflect repeal thereof.
Requires posting on State and local government websites information concerning assignment and use of vehicles.
Requires electric power suppliers to pay retail power prices for purchase of certain renewable energy production.
Establishes credit for commercial or industrial ratepayers against societal benefits charge for costs of certain products or services.*
Concerns energy efficiency and renewable energy requirements. **
Requires State Office of Emergency Management to study and recommend evacuation routes in Trenton for inclement weather conditions or other emergency situations. *
Requires DEP to notify municipality of environmental violations by a local entity.
Establishes notification system for operation of petting zoos and certain animal or agricultural exhibitions; establishes sanitation requirement for human contact with animals.
Requires permit for operation of petting zoos and certain animal or agricultural exhibitions, shows, and fairs; establishes sanitation requirements.
Prohibits sale of mercury batteries and consumer products that use mercury batteries; prohibits disposal of used mercury batteries as solid waste.
Authorizes set-asides, and fees in-lieu thereof, for open space and recreation purposes as conditions to approvals under the MLUL.
Modifies blood alcohol concentration level for drunk driving conviction for repeat offender.
Creates 14 additional judgeships; raises court fees.
Establishes the "Anti-Phishing Act."
Requires electric utility bills to separately list the amount of State sales tax, societal benefits charge and transitional energy facility unit rate assessment surcharge.
Provides that certain permits and approvals for critical infrastructure projects must be acted upon within 45 days.
Provides that committing a sex act with a minor under certain circumstances constitutes aggravated sexual assault or sexual assault.
Exempts use of citizen's band and two-way radios by operators of commercial motor vehicles from prohibition on use of hand-held wireless telephone or electronic communication devices while driving.
Requires DHSS to authorize Jersey City to issue certified copies of birth certificates by December 31, 2010.
Amends RICO to add certain crimes involving public servants.
Changes date for mail-in ballots transmission from 40th to 45th day before an election, with certain exceptions; permits referendum on school levy cap and municipal levy cap to occur on same day. **
Increases penalties for drunk driving with a minor as a passenger.
Exempts certain qualified applicants for hazardous material endorsement from criminal history background checks.
Requires health insurers, SHBP and SEHBP to provide coverage for vision rehabilitation services to covered person experiencing sudden onset of blindness.
Transfers administration of certain nutrition programs to Department of Agriculture.

Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Meadowlands racetrack, upon voter approval; dedicates 1/3 net proceeds to General Fund, 1/3 to State education aid, and 1/3 to horse racing industry.
Requires incarcerated persons be counted as residents of their previous address, not prison, for redistricting purposes.
Requires physicians to complete survey as condition for biennial registration with Board of Medical Examiners and requires board to maintain and disseminate survey data as appropriate.
Requires audits of managed care plan provider networks.
Requires MVC to notify Medicaid if driver's license of medical transportation services provider is suspended or revoked.
Permits free municipal library funding to be based on actual requirements instead of fixed statutory tax rate.
Prohibits dual elective office holding and holding of elective office and public office or position.
Makes various changes to "Uniform Recall Election Law."
Enhances crime victims' rights under the "Crime Victim's Bill of Rights."
Clarifies that Fish and Game Council has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Consolidates certain business-related categories of gross income and provides 20 year carryforward of certain net losses under gross income tax.
Prohibits practice of requiring a credit check as condition of employment.
Places restrictions on unsolicited school budget communications sent by a board of education to school district residents 90 days prior to annual school election.
Concerns gender equity in the workplace.

Requires executive county superintendent to designate a county special services school district or educational services commission as the county education services agency to assist local school districts in sharing services.
Revises law relating to title recordation.
Requires scooter riders under 17 years old to wear helmets.
Establishes minimum efficiency standards for certain new televisions.
Permits physicians to prescribe, dispense, or administer antibiotics long-term for treatment of Lyme disease under certain circumstances.
Concerns fair business practices at intermodal marine terminals.
Permits Internet wagering at Atlantic City casinos under certain circumstances.

Provides State recognition of certain Indian tribes for certain limited purposes, establishes process for future recognition of tribes and revises membership and duties of New Jersey Commission on American Indian Affairs.
Allows municipalities adjacent to two or more municipalities having urban enterprise zones to qualify for NJ Redevelopment Authority financing assistance. *
Makes position of treasurer of school moneys optional.
Revises the definitions of Class I renewable energy and renewable energy certificate under the Electric Discount and Energy Competition Act.
Directs NJTransit to study use of E-ZPass technology at Transit parking facilities.
Limits the compensation of school district employees, other than teachers, to $5,000 less than the Commissioner of Education's salary.
"Ocean County Stormwater Management System Demonstration Act."

Exempts certain State authorities and local government contracting units from bidding requirements when goods and services are procured below prices available under State contract; modifies process for contracting through certain cooperative purchasing agreements.
Requires Division of Taxation to regularly provide certain information to municipalities concerning hotel occupancy taxes.
Permits counties and municipalities to withdraw from civil service system by ordinance.
Regulates operation of low-speed electric bicycles.
Authorizes hiring preference for veterans in non-civil service jurisdictions.
Prohibits use of certain accidents involving certain insureds during the course of employment with a government entity as rating factor in automobile insurance underwriting.

Decreases sales and use tax rate from seven percent to six percent and reduces sales and use tax base by eliminating tax on digital property and certain services and by restoring certain exclusions and exemptions.
Repeals application of gross income tax to certain New Jersey Lottery prize winnings.
Reduces the alcoholic beverage excise tax rate on liquor, wine, vermouth, sparkling wine, and hard cider and eliminates the dedication of that tax to the Health Care Subsidy Fund.
Terminates transitional energy facility assessment (TEFA) unit rate surcharges effective January 1, 2011.
Decreases rental motor vehicle surcharge from $5 per day to $2 per day.
Decreases the premium receipts tax for surplus lines insurance coverage.
Reduces cigarette tax rate by 30 cents per pack and reduces revenue dedicated to the Health Care Subsidy Fund.
Removes plenary retail distribution license limit for certain stores.
"Sara's Law;" requires Motor Vehicle Commission to establish next-of-kin program.
Expands DNA database to include samples from disorderly persons and certain violent arrestees.
Expands DNA database to include samples from certain violent arrestees.
Requires certain issue advocacy organizations to disclose contributions and expenditure information.
Waives commercial driver's license requirements for certain Office of Emergency Management drivers.
Clarifies that sexual assault victims are not responsible for any costs of forensic sexual assault examinations or related services.
Revises certain provisions of farmland assessment law.
"Parkinson's Disease Public Awareness and Education Act."
Prohibits the employment of unauthorized aliens and requires employers to use E-Verify program.
Concerns DEP government records requests.
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement a drought interconnection system.
"New Jersey Clean Water, Drought Mitigation and Water Resource Trust Fund Act."
Requires assisted living residences to have standby emergency power generators.
Provides $3,000 gross income tax deduction for certain taxpayers providing home care for an elderly relative.
Authorizes Ocean County Planning Board and municipal planning boards in Ocean County to take certain measures to control stormwater runoff and nonpoint source pollution in Barnegat Bay watershed. *
Provides sales and use tax exemption for certain packaging equipment.
Clarifies insurance coverage for certain home and health care agency employees under their own private passenger automobile insurance.
Eliminates the 1% fee, and the 1% tax, on purchasers of Class 4A commercial property transferred for consideration in excess of $1 million.
Directs MVC to implement certain State Auditor recommendations to enhance integrity of driver database.
Prohibits public utilities from charging for service extensions to certain ratepayers in a manner different from ratepayers located within smart growth areas.
Establishes alternative methods of casino licensure.
Eliminates certificated superintendent and administrator exceptions to TPAF retiree reenrollment requirement.
Repeals law allowing PERS member to retire with PERS pension and continue to receive salary for current PERS-covered elective office.
Requires appointments for safety-related recalls on vehicles to be scheduled on a first-come, first-served basis. *
Establishes "Veteran to Veteran Peer Support Program" telephone helpline. *
Prohibits Pinelands Commission from requiring pinelands development credits for the construction of development project that includes affordable housing.
Requires small employer health benefits plan carriers to offer a basic and essential plan.
Revises process for the awarding of certain local public contracts.
Calculates future service of active members at 1/60 of final compensation for TPAF and PERS pensions.
Modifies calculation of adjusted tax levy for municipalities and counties to allow two-year levy cap banking and eliminate levy cap penalty when debt servicing expenditures are reduced.
Provides for submission to voters in each county a binding referendum on the establishment of a county administrative school district to govern and operate all public schools in the county.
Establishes governance structure for county administrative school districts.
Reduces employer unemployment taxes during fiscal year 2011.
Requires recycling of digital audio players and certain printers.
Requires sellers collecting New Jersey sales tax for locations in New Jersey to record and report on their returns the amount of sales tax collected within each municipality in New Jersey.
Reduces unemployment benefits and employer unemployment taxes.
Extends limit for nonpublic school busing to 30 miles in Atlantic, Burlington, Cape May, Cumberland, Gloucester, Hunterdon, Ocean, Salem, Sussex and Warren Counties.
Revises allocation of fees for certain NJPDES permits.
"Sara's Law;" requires Motor Vehicle Commission to establish next-of-kin program.
Prohibits charges for busy or unanswered cellular telephone calls.
Requires Division of Taxation to display Senior Gold prescription program information on tax return instructions.
Changes signature requirement for recall petition and when recall may be initiated.
Provides that information technology professionals who find child pornography on computers must report the finding to law enforcement.
Designates September 11 each year "September 11 Remembrance Day" in New Jersey.
Clarifies that "entering" a public place for a drug deal is conduct included in C.2C:33-2.1.
Designates portion of Route 47 in Glassboro as "South Jersey Vietnam Veterans' Highway".
Requires municipalities to reimburse qualified private communities for street paving costs.
Allows planning and zoning board members to satisfy training requirements on Internet.
Allows municipality to approve transfer from PERS to PFRS by certain firefighters.
Bans offshore drilling in State waters; prohibits issuance of DEP permits or approvals for activities associated with offshore drilling.
Clarifies criteria for issuing Amber Alert when child abducted by family member.

Creates new taxable category of alcoholic beverages called flavored malt beverages, imposes separate rate of taxation on new category pursuant to alcoholic beverages tax and allocates associated revenue.
Adds certain cannabis-like chemical substances to list of controlled dangerous substances.
Increases membership of State Police Retirement System Board of Trustees; requires membership to include two active and two retired members.
Authorizes State Treasurer to sell as surplus certain land and improvements thereon now part of East Jersey Prison to Woodbridge Township in Middlesex County.
Prohibits transfer of certain juveniles to adult correctional facilities.
Requires NJMVC to implement procedures for issuing nondriver identification cards to persons rendered immobile by disabilities.
Establishes 180 day prohibition on purchase of handgun for certain individuals who fail to report loss or theft of firearm.
Amends Kyleigh's Law to remove requirement that holder of a special learner's permit, examination permit, and probationary driver's license display decal.
Establishes the Early Childhood Educator Development Scholarship Program.
Establishes School Success Task Force to study the issues of student truancy, suspensions, expulsions, dropouts, and school violence.
Creates a credit card do-not-solicit list.
Establishes "Early High School Graduation Pilot Program" in the Department of Education.
Designates portion of New Jersey Route 27 in Princeton Township as "Patrolman Billie D. Ellis Memorial Highway."
Clarifies authority of municipal court to suspend driver's licenses.
The "Seaside Lodging and Rental District Act"; imposes tax on certain lodging properties for tourism promotion therein.
Concerns collective bargaining by executive county superintendents.
Restricts campaign contributions by certain individuals, businesses or other organizations that purchase or acquire property involved in eminent domain proceedings.
Provides certain individuals, businesses or other organizations performing public contracts are prohibited from making certain contributions.
Upgrades penalty for unlawfully transferring a firearm to an underage person.
Makes unlawful possession of assault firearm a second degree crime.
Requires correspondence or notice by public entity contain citations of any appropriate statutes, ordinances, or resolutions.
Revises penalty for destruction of, or damage to, trees, saplings, shrubs or other plants; repeals current law thereon.

Clarifies law concerning labeling of farm products; increases penalties for violations and false labeling and identification of "Jersey Fresh" and Department of Agriculture designated brands; repeals R.S.4:10-15.
Requires health insurers to cover oral anticancer medications on no less favorable basis than intravenous anticancer medications.*
Repeals the New Jersey estate tax.
Requires public school districts to provide instruction on "New Jersey Safe Haven Infant Protection Act" as part of core curriculum content standards.
Transfers Bureau of Securities to Department of Banking and Insurance.
The "Reinsurance and Surplus Lines Stimulus and Enhancement Act."

Expands eligibility for veteran's property tax deduction and totally disabled veteran's property tax exemption to certain veterans exposed to radioactivity from atmospheric nuclear bomb testing at the Pacific Proving Grounds.
Requires health care professionals to notify patients of end of health benefits coverage during course of treatment in certain circumstances.
Allows persons with conditional discharge to receive pretrial intervention as long as discharge did not occur in last five years.
Designates walking as New Jersey State Exercise.
Provides general election, primary, and school election sample ballots may be sent to registered voter by electronic mail if so requested.
Directs State Lottery Commission to permit purchase of lottery tickets by electronic means.
Increases fine for talking or texting on hand-held device while driving.
Requires State Treasurer to include designated space for e-mail address on application forms for notaries public.
Provides dedicated line item on property tax bill to fund municipal free public libraries and joint free public libraries. *

Requires municipalities to exempt 100% disabled veterans from construction permit surcharge fees for improvements to promote living unit accessibility; appropriates $20,000 for municipal reimbursements.

Permits corporation business tax and gross income tax deduction for interest income derived from certain residential mortgage loans and requires financial benefits attributed to deduction to reduce principal of residential mortgage loan.
Prohibits an executive county superintendent of schools from eliminating a nonoperating school district if its elimination would result in a property tax increase.
Phases out sales and use tax imposed on charges for certain initiation fees, membership fees and dues.
Permits agreement by taxpayer and municipal tax assessor to modify an assessment to correct errors in certain circumstances.
Requires school districts to provide transportation to and from school to pupils who reside along certain routes.
Assigns financial responsibility of educating homeless student to district of attendance.
Requires cost analysis in certain cases when State department contracts out work.
Establishes sterilization and animal control programs; establishes dog license surcharge.
Provides penalties for sexually offensive or abusive communication through social networking websites.
Deems certified nurse aides and licensed practical nurses to qualify as certified homemaker-home health aides.
Increases penalties for certain motor vehicle right-of-way violations and requires attendance at Driver Improvement Program.
Establishes prescription and over-the-counter drug abuse public awareness campaign; designated Jason's Law.

Establishes Office of Agricultural Water Usage Assistance; requires DEP to consult with that office regarding water usage certification for farmland; prohibits assessment of certain fees for water usage by farmers.
Establishes animal hoarding as a criminal and civil animal cruelty offense.
Authorizes free State park and forest admission and free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses for persons with certain types of military service. *

Requires forfeiture of public office upon conviction of fourth degree crime or higher; disqualifies person from future office upon conviction of fourth degree crime or higher or conviction of crime involving dishonesty.
Provides immunity for police officers who are subjects of certain disciplinary and administrative hearings.
Authorizes paid leaves of absence for certain delegates of employee organizations representing corrections officers when attending conventions.
Permits certain retired law enforcement officers to possess hollow nose ammunition.
Upgrades penalties for assaulting a law enforcement officer.
Mandates health insurance coverage for certain infant formulas for children up to age five.
Requires all able-bodied Work First New Jersey recipients to perform community service.
Amends Kyleigh's Law to remove requirement that certain drivers display decal.
Retitles State correction officer as State correctional police officer; clarifies law enforcement powers.
Requires State and local emergency operations plans include provisions to address needs of families of emergency responders serving during a disaster or emergency.
Requires serological testing for hepatitis of certain defendants.
Requires written prescriptions to be legibly printed or typed.
"Emma's Law"; provides for screening newborn infants for lysosomal storage disorders.
Authorizes special Gold Star Family license plates.
Requires training and registration for in-house security officers.
Allows physicians to jointly negotiate with carriers over contractual terms and conditions.

Allows victims and relatives to witness parole hearings.

Requires hiring preference for veterans in non-civil service jurisdictions.
Makes all members of Legislature ineligible to participate in SHBP.
Increases motor fuels tax eight cents per year for three years with later CPI adjustment and requires all motor fuels taxes to be credited to Transportation Trust Fund.
Clarifies fee schedule for duplication of government records.
Establishes new procedure in "Administrative Procedure Act" to allow substantial changes to agency rule-making upon adoption.
Changes five year chapter expiration date for rules to seven years; changes procedures for readoption of rules. **

Modifies process for contested case hearings by OAL with regard to telephone and video conferences, delegation of final decision authority, oral decisions, checklist decisions, electronic filings, and settlements.
Concerns safety measures at apartment complex swimming pools.
Provides "grace period" for certain cable television company violations.
Requires BPU to issue a decision within 180 days after receipt of petition by public utilities to sell certain real property. *
Requires Casino Control Commission to solicit plans from each casino licensee for establishment of central control computer system.
Establishes online portal for acceptance of donations to certain funds to which contributions may be made on gross income tax returns. *
Modifies powers of Historic New Bridge Landing Park Commission.
Permits municipalities to establish weapons free zones around schools and public facilities.
Codifies AG recommendations for issuing Amber Alert when family member abducts child.
Concerns municipal dog and cat licensing. *
Extends hiring preference for certain civilian federal firefighters.
Rivises geographic restrictions on where United States Park Police are authorized to make arrests for certain crimes and offenses.*

Prohibits person charged with animal cruelty from entering into pretrial intervention.
Requires Board of Medical Examiners to take certain actions to investigate licensees.
Requires four-year institutions of higher education to achieve a minimum 50% five-year graduation rate for full time students within five years.
Requires issuance of general permit for beach food and drink concession stands under certain circumstances pursuant to CAFRA.
Establishes NJ Task Force on Coordination Among Nonprofit Social Service Organizations.
Requires AG to study and report on graduated driver's license program. *
Excludes from PAAD income eligibility withdrawals from an IRA.
Reduces number of printed copies of each State report or publication required to be filed with State Library; provides for State Library liaison at each State office.

Requires development of interscholastic athletic head injury safety training program; requires certain measures to protect student athletes with concussions; and requires continuing education for athletic trainers.*
Requires DOE to develop and distribute information regarding hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and expands role and membership of New Jersey Student Athlete Cardiac Screening Task Force.
Expands wrongful death act to allow recovery for mental anguish, emotional pain and suffering, loss of society and loss of companionship.
Revises the statutes concerning oaths and affidavits.
Requires boil water notices to be provided by certain public water systems via telephone, email or text message. *
Exempts sales of certain homes and seasonal rentals from the bulk sale notification requirements. *
Incorporates federal standards governing sale and transfer of firearms to aliens and non-residents.
Prohibits school districts from accessing a school-issued electronic communication device to monitor student conduct outside of school property.
Allows certain organizations authorized to conduct bingo or raffles to use up to 40 percent of net proceeds for facility maintenance, operating expenses, or capital improvements.
Requires New Jersey Transit to offer discount passes to all New Jersey higher education students.
Revises criteria for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement for claimants affected by eminent domain.
Requires collection of photo ID for sale of alcoholic beverages if purchaser appears under age 35.
Designates Earth Day week each year for special effort to enforce littering laws.
Authorizes Global Warming Solutions Fund monies to be used to support freshwater wetlands stewardship and restoration.
Provides one-third of motor vehicle fine moneys generated through State Police issued tickets go to municipality where violation occurred.
Requires school districts to inform the parent or guardian of a student recommended to use certain medications of the possible side effects and potential negative consequences of those medications.
Authorizes probationary license holders to exceed passenger restrictions under certain circumstances.
Permits levy cap exclusion for certain monies expended by local unit for shared services.
Requires reduction in number of State vehicles over five fiscal years.
Subjects most State property to local property taxation beginning on July 1, 2010.
Requires certain cable television companies to offer free Internet access to public libraries.

Provides for election of fire district commissioners and school board members at general election; eliminates school budget vote except for separate proposals to spend above cap, also to occur at general election.
Provides energy and utility service sales tax relief benefit to certain manufacturers throughout the State.
Establishes deadlines for filing financial disclosure statements with State Ethics Commission.
Provides that subcontractors who furnish non-specialty trade work shall not be named in local public bid documents.
Transfers the Div. of Fish and Wildlife and related entities to the Dept. of Agriculture.
Requires reduction in number of positions in State service; establishes procedure to control creation of new State positions and filling of vacancies.

Requires that the monetary equivalent of any wage or benefit concession agreed to by a collective bargaining unit be used by the school district to offset any reduction in force initiated for economic reasons.
Protects law enforcement officers from liability when checking car seats.
Requires reduction in number of State vehicles over five fiscal years.
Provides that person commissioned as notary public for first time shall subscribe an oath to discharge duties of office.
Increases statute of limitations and provides treble damages for certain violations of "Uniform Securities Law (1997)."
The "South Jersey Regional Veterans' Health Care Facility Grant Fund Act."
Permits public employees to request payroll deductions for payment to multiple credit union accounts.
Imposes two-year moratorium on certain new outpatient radiation oncology services and establishes Outpatient Radiation Oncology Services Task Force in DHSS.
Allows two elected members of pension commission of closed Hudson County Employees' Pension Fund to be active county employee or retired county employee.
Requires all wireless telephones and electronic communication devices issued by public entities to be activated to receive Amber Alerts.
Removes provision requiring application of certain changes State-negotiated to all participating employers and employees in SHBP and SEHBP.
Clarifies certain dormancy fees chargeable against money orders.
Repeals law that prohibits school boards from imposing terms and conditions of employment.
Removes statutory requirements concerning salaries for certain county officers.
Permits local units to participate in cooperative purchasing agreements.
Establishes five-year tax credit program to support expansion of preschool in school districts.
Requires State to pay all costs associated with maintaining and operating the office of the executive county superintendent of schools.
Provides that certain funds in Casino Simulcasting Special Fund will be paid to Atlantic City Racetrack and prescribes use thereof with certain amounts remaining paid to other racetracks.
Establishes "Domestic Violence Health Care Response Act."
The "Public School Employee Collective Bargaining Reform Act."
"County Corrections Officers Act."
Eliminates minimum corporation business tax on New Jersey S corporations.
Permits school boards to charge certain students for remedial or advanced courses provided during summer school.
Concerns wills, trusts and other governing instruments of decedent estates in the interim of federal estate tax repeal and federal generation-skipping transfer tax repeal.
Requires State to use pervious concrete whenever appropriate.
Simplifies the certification process for out-of-State school district administrators.
Simplifies the certification process for out-of-State teachers.
Limits copy fees for OPRA requests.

Makes part-time elected officials and commission and authority appointees ineligible for PERS, DCRP and health benefits; requires pension credit forfeiture if employed former personal services contractor falsely certifies position as full-time.
Requires all State entities to collect information and funds electronically.

Expands type of school bus driver required to undergo DOE criminal record check process and requires matching of data files to ensure school bus drivers remain qualified pursuant to records maintained by DOE and MVC.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment compensation for public adjusters.
Authorizes nurse or physician employed by student health program at institution of higher education to be appointed to local or county board of health and regional health commission.
Requires voter approval at the annual school election or by the board of school estimate prior to the establishment of a charter school.
Permits the conversion of high-performing nonpublic schools located in failing school district into charter schools.*
Extends Medical Malpractice Liability Insurance Premium Assistance Fund and collection of annual surcharges for 5 years.
Requires applicants for school board employment and school bus driver to be notified of criminal history record check results within 60 days.
Allows professional corporation to use or register an alternate name; allows use of certain abbreviations in certain business names; updates references for certain State business filings.
"Opportunity Scholarship Act"; establishes pilot program in Department of Treasury providing tax credits to entities contributing to scholarships for low-income children. *
Establishes New Jersey Aphasia Study Commission.
Changes references of "mental retardation" to "intellectual disability" or "developmental disability" and uses person-first language for persons with disabilities.
Requires training for certain staff working with persons with developmental disabilities.
Prohibits smoking in automobiles when children are present.
Removes decal requirement from graduated driver's license law; establishes new system for law enforcement to identify novice drivers.
"Kulesh and Kubert's Law;" establishes violation of hands-free cell phone law as reckless under vehicular homicide and assault by auto statutes.
Requires certain motor vehicle reinspections be conducted at licensed private inspection facilities.
Requires employers to pay their employees when serving on a jury.
Requires DHSS to coordinate physician workforce data.
Requires New Jersey School Boards Association to use any unreserved surplus that exceeds 2% of its FY 2010 operating budget to reduce member school district dues for the 2010-2011 fiscal year.
Concerns custody and parenting time for military parents.
Requires Site Improvement Advisory Board to offer recommendations to encourage sustainable development.

Authorizes the State, with prior approval by the State House Commission, to use eminent domain power to acquire lands for recreation and conservation purposes provided lands are protective of drinking water sources.
Reestablishes and revises public contract set-aside program.
"New Jersey Transit Villages Act."
Establishes registry of stroke cases in State.
Makes various revisions to operations of local tax collector's and assessor's offices.

Clarifies commencement of taxability of portions of certain tax exempt buildings; continues tax exemption for portions of tax exempt buildings used for State mandated preschool and kindergarten purposes.
Makes certain repeat offenders ineligible for parole.
Allows bureau chief to assess civil penalty for certain violations of "Uniform Securities Law (1997)."
Repeals restriction on weights and measures officers' and employees' duties.
Moves "Main Street New Jersey Program" from Department of Community Affairs to Deparment of State.
Requires insurance producers to make certain disclosures about health insurance coverage offers.
Appropriates $1,279,941 from various historic preservation funds to provide historic site management grants for certain historic preservation projects.

The "Residential Mortgage Satisfaction Act."
Establishes School Breakfast and Lunch Program Task Force.

Phases out cosmetic medical procedure gross receipts tax over three-year period.

Authorizes annual $5 million transfer from "New Jersey Affordable Housing Trust Fund" to "Urban Housing Assistance Fund" for State fiscal years 2010 through 2013.

Requires DCA to post on its website the current adopted budget of any county or municipality that does not maintain its own website; also requires posting of three immediately preceding adopted budgets.

Establishes pilot project to permit overseas and military voters to vote in certain elections using Internet; makes an appropriation.

Eliminates various inactive boards, commissions, committees, councils, and task forces.

Revises certain unemployment benefit claim procedures and requires registration of authorized agents of parties to the procedures.
Provides for appointment of certain municipal court judges at the local or county level.
Establishes State Mental Health Facilities Evaluation Task Force.
Prohibits all persons under 18 from using tanning facilities.

Requires public agencies to set printers and computers to default to most cost effective fonts for printing to conserve ink and paper.
Increases rate of tax imposed on little cigars under tobacco products wholesale sales and use tax to equal tax rate imposed on cigarettes under cigarette tax.

Requires certain health benefits plans to include coverage for treatment at ambulatory surgical centers and surgical practices and prohibits riders to the contrary.

Provides a corporation business tax credit for certain investment in manufacturing equipment and manufacturing facility renovation, modernization and expansion; requires clawback of forfeited credits.

Requires each public school to observe a period of silence on September 11 of each school year.
Authorizes Chief Administrator of New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission to issue permits for certain overweight trucks and charge fee for such permits.

Requires transfer of municipal free library surplus amounts above 20% to municipality for its general purposes, which may include property tax relief.
Makes it a crime to communicate or transmit sexually suggestive communications to a minor under certain circumstances.

Prohibits electric public utilities from installing capacitor banks within 300 feet of a residential area.
Prohibits issuance of DEP permits and approvals for development related to drilling for oil and natural gas off NJ coast.

Concerns certain taxes and assessments dedicated to the administrative costs of the DOBI.
Permits cancellation of municipal charges and fees under $10.
Reduces school district, county, and municipal property tax levy cap from 4 percent to 2.5 percent and permits unused county and municipal increases to be banked for three succeeding years.

Removes requirement that holder of a special learner's permit, examination permit, and probationary driver's license display decal; requires certain novice drivers submit motor vehicle information to chief administrator.

Amends State college law to remove certain employees from civil service system and allow boards of trustees to conduct collective bargaining.
Authorizes the establishment of probationary periods for nontenured faculty members at State colleges.

Exempts storage facility space furnished to active duty military personnel from the sales and use tax.

Increases certain application fees for civil service examinations and requires review of fees every five years; establishes fee for certain appeals.
Reduces benefits under the State earned income credit program and caps benefits and eligibility at federal program amounts in effect for tax year 2010.

Allows certain projects in municipalities adjacent to one or more UEZ municipalities and a county where a reduced sales tax is assessed on retail sales to qualify for NJ Redevelopment Authority financing assistance.

Requires requestor pick up government records within 10 business days of availability.
Requires payment of certain attorney's fees, expenses and costs in identity theft cases; adds debit card numbers to definition of "personal identifying information".
Appropriates $28,364,422,000 in State funds and $13,204,231,842 in federal funds for the State budget for fiscal year 2010-2011.

Makes FY 2010 State and federal supplemental appropriations totaling $454,509,000, reduces FY 2010 appropriations by $727,892,000, and amends and supplements various language provisions affecting appropriations in FY 2010.
Adjust time periods for presumptions of abandonment, limits issuer imposed dormancy fees and provides for related administration for certain unclaimed property.
Removes cap on .53% hospital total operating revenue assessment and raises cap on ambulatory care facility gross receipts assessment to increase charity care subsidy monies.

Concerns certain taxes and assessments dedicated to the administrative costs of the DOBI.
Renames the Division of Insurance Fraud Prevention as the Bureau of Fraud Deterrence in the Department of Banking and Insurance; modifies structure of Office of Insurance Fraud Prosecutor.
Increases and establishes certain business filing fees.
Limits State ABP contributions for higher education faculty whose salary exceeds statutory maximum salary of Executive Branch department heads.
Establishes professional sports team specialty license plates and dedicates net proceeds to General Fund.
Increases certain application fees for civil service examinations and requires review of fees every five years; establishes fee for certain appeals.

Supplemental appropriation of $24.6 million in State funds and $45.7 million in federal funds to the DHS.
"Medical Philanthropy Act"; provides physicians who provide uncompensated care with $250,000 cap on noneconomic damages in actions alleging medical malpractice.

Abigail's Law; requires that newly-manufactured school buses be equipped with sensors.

Reduces school district, county, and municipal property tax levy cap from 4% to 2.9% percent and permits unused school district, county and municipal increases to be banked for three succeeding years.

Adjusts time periods for presumptions of abandonment, limits issuer imposed dormancy fees, and provides for related administration for certain unclaimed property.

Removes cap on .53% hospital total operating revenue assessment and raises cap on ambulatory care facility gross receipts assessment to increase charity care subsidy monies.

Requires State to pay expenses associated with nonpartisan municipal elections.
