Providing for AG representation of county prosecutors' offices and employees in certain civil actions and providing for State indemnification in certain cases.
Permits agricultural tourism events to be conducted on preserved farmland.
Permits retired law enforcement officers to join the New Jersey Detective Association.
Designates March 13 of each year as "K9 Veterans Day."

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to reimburse school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing and adjusts recipient districts' tax levy growth limit.
Eliminates adjustment of tuition rate for special education students enrolled in a private school for students with disabilities.
Provides that school districts may not be required to have an automated work order system for recording maintenance and repair requests for school district facilities.
The "Anti-Bullying Bill of Rights Act."
Requires government records to be made available on the Internet.
Extends protections of the new vehicle "lemon Law" to new motor vehicle farm equipment purchased or leased in New Jersey.
Reestablishes historic driving privileges afforded holders of agricultural driver's licenses in operating farm equipment and vehicles.
Permits appointment of certain nonpermanent firefighters laid off for reasons of economy to vacant paid positions.
Limits tuition rate charged by Atlantic City School district to per pupil amounts used to determine State school aid.
Authorizes use of county tax board fee revenue for county budget purposes under certain circumstances.
Prohibits siting of industrial wind turbines within 2,000 feet of any residence or residentially zoned property.

Requires suspension of payments for unused sick or vacation leave payable to person indicted for criminal offense; requires forfeiture of such payment upon service deemed dishonorable or conviction for crime.

"Physician Orders for Life-Sustaining Treatment Act"; provides for use of Physician Orders for Life-Sustaining Treatment forms and requires physicians and advanced practice nurses to pursue continuing education in end-of-life care.*
Creates "Green E-ZPass" discounts for certain fuel-efficient vehicles.
Authorizes creation of economic recovery districts; authorizes certain economic recovery district management corporations to issue bonds secured by incentive grants.
Concerns lost or stolen E-ZPass transponders.
Requires landlord to permit tenant to remain in foreclosed property in certain circumstances.
"Revised State Medical Examiner Act"; establishes Office of the Chief State Medical Examiner in DHSS.
Eliminates transfer inheritance taxes on brothers and sisters of a decedent.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old; increases fine on parent of truant student; and requires truant student to complete community service requirement.
Provides that modification of collective bargaining agreement concerning State holiday of Lincoln's Birthday in February 2011 and day after Thanksgiving in November 2010 is to be given effect.
Permits appointment of certain EMT's laid off for reasons of economy to vacant paid positions.
Revises newspaper advertising rates.
Allows denial of coverage to an insured who commits fraud but not to innocent spouse.
Establishes death benefit for forest firefighters.
Establishes the number of students to be supported under the veterinary medicine education program and a service requirement for students who participate in the program.
Prohibits imposition of corporation business tax on certain foreign corporations carrying passengers into and out of State in motor vehicle or motorbus. *
Authorizes notaries public to take oath of office before any official generally authorized to take oaths.
Limits settings where certain surgeries may be performed.
Prohibits the restraint of prisoners during and immediately after childbirth.
Concerns bid specifications for local public contracts.
Allows for unemployment insurance beneficiaries to file, reopen, cancel or close claims online.
Expands immunity from civil liability in connection with provisions of 9-1-1 service.
Prohibits application of foreign laws when application violates constitutional rights.
Requires certain issue advocacy organizations to register with ELEC and disclose contribution and independent expenditure information.
Authorizes account wagering licensee to accept wagers from residents of eligible United States jurisdictions through account wagering system via electronic means such as internet.
Expresses legislative intent that "The Planned Real Estate Development Full Disclosure Act" notice provisions apply to housing cooperatives.
Modifies certain procedures for the assignment of franchise interests regarding the retail sale of motor fuel.
Concerns furloughing of direct care nurses employed by certain State institutions.
Requires use of direct deposit and Internet for State, local government, and school district employee compensation and certain retirement payments and information.
Repeals interest arbitration of labor disputes for police and firefighters.
Repeals all prevailing wage laws.
Prohibits payment of public employee bonuses not directly contingent upon achieving certain performance goals.
Requires Governor notify local governments to fly United States and State flags at half-staff upon death of member of Armed Forces of United States or National Guard who was State resident.*
Requires deeds to include description of property based on survey completed within five years when it is presented for recording.
Requires insurers to allow payment of homeowners' insurance premiums in monthly installments.
Provides that child study team members may be employees of the school district or of a DOE approved agency or clinic.

Decreases annual standardbred race dates to 75 minimum upon consent from Standardbred Breeders and Owners Association of New Jersey; increases to 5% maximum amount of certain purse moneys that may be distributed to aid horsemen.*
Requires Division of Gaming Enforcement to use private contractors to test slot machines and for fingerprint and criminal history record information processing; moves division to Atlantic City.
Establishes the Workforce Shortage Loan Redemption Program.
Upgrades crime of invasion of privacy under certain circumstances.
Upgrades the crime of invasion of privacy if it results in death or serious bodily injury to a crime of the second degree.
Requires nursing homes to provide training to staff in behavioral health issues.
Revises various aspects of casino industry regulation.
Permits immediate appeal of determinations as to immunity of public entities for Conscientious Employee Protection Act and Law Against Discrimination claims.
Permits immediate appeal of determinations as to immunity of public entities under Tort Claims Act.
Permits breweries to offer samples and to sell directly to consumers at brewery premises.
Excludes proceeds of sales or exchanges of solar renewable energy certificates from taxation under gross income tax and corporation business tax.
Requires counties to fix curbs and surrounding areas when damaged during county road projects.
Prohibits use of volunteer driving activities in underwriting for private passenger automobile insurance; revises charitable immunity statute as applied to volunteer drivers.
Upgrades simple assault on a public works employee to aggravated assault.
Requires withdrawal from account wagering system account be paid to patron by electronic means when so requested.
Requires insurers writing homeowners insurance policies in the State to disclose premiums for endorsements.
Permits chief financial officer to recommend reduced appropriation for reserve for uncollected taxes in certain circumstances.
Permits licensed dealers to display and auction firearms at fund raising events sponsored by certain tax exempt organizations.
Requires a public body to record public meetings and post proceedings on its Internet website.
Increases income eligibility standard for certain residential electric customers under the "Lifeline Credit Program" and "Universal Service Fund."
Dedicates revenues derived from certain sales and uses subject to sales and use tax to provide enhanced incentives for breeding and development of certain racehorses in this State.
Establishes sexual assault training requirements for law enforcement officers.
Excludes Armed Services combat zone pay from gross income taxation.
Requires retail food establishments to donate surplus unused baked goods to local nonprofits and charities.
Consolidates certain business-related categories of gross income and provides 20 year carryforward of certain net losses under gross income tax.
Clarifies that criminal impersonation committed by any means including electronic communications or Internet website shall be subject to criminal penalties.
Requires certain owners of foreclosed property to file contact information with municipality and common interest community.*

"Save Barnegat Bay Act"; establishes Save Barnegat Bay Fund, dedicates portion of sales tax on lawn fertilizer, authorizes special license plates, dedicates portion of beach tag fees, and provides for donations.
Provides tax relief for certain non-residential property owners and tenants in consolidated municipalities.
Requires that utilities authorities and water supply districts offer a separate rate structure for senior citizens and disabled persons.
Authorizes mayors to veto proposed actions of municipal authorities.
Reduces State hotel and motel occupancy fee from five to two percent starting FY2012; preserves dedication.
Reduces rate of State hotel and motel occupancy fee after State FY2010 from 5% to 1%; revises dedications of fee revenue.
Revises qualifications and requirements for permits to carry handgun; establishes annual fee of $100.
Requires State Treasurer, in consultation with State Comptroller, to promulgate rules and regulations concerning best practices for awarding independent State authority contracts.
Defines homeowners' association membership and fair standards for elections and recall of trustees in homeowners' associations of planned real estate developments.
Allows certain National Guard and United States Reserve members on federal active duty to receive temporary suspension of payment of interest on mortgage loan.
Requires Director of Division of Local Government Services, in consultation with State Comptroller, to promulgate rules and regulations concerning best practices in public contracts.

Excludes from gross income under the gross income tax certain United States military compensation paid to members of units of the NJ National Guard and reserve components of the United States Armed Forces.
Requires DOT and DEP to conduct study on options to alleviate congestion on Route 47.
Excludes veterans' entitlements from income for determination of PAAD eligibility.
Allows judge to admit evidence of prior sexual offenses in current sexual offense actions.
Establishes in DEP the Environmental Policy Review Board to review proposed environmental regulations for consistency with planning policies.
Prohibits cruel restraint of dogs.
Establishes criminal offense of animal cruelty in the presence of a child.
Concerns violations of the moratorium on taking, landing, or possession of horseshoe crabs.
Revises moratorium on taking, landing or possession of horseshoe crabs or the eggs of horseshoe crabs.
Permits exterior-based property reassessments within eight years of last municipal-wide revaluation.
Concerns homeowners insurance coverage with respect to dogs.
Exempts veterans from $25 fee for appointment or renewal as a notary public.
The "New Jersey Health Insurance Exchange Act."
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Prohibits the sale of laser pointers that exceed certain power output.
Increases penalty for transfer of identification to enable purchase of alcohol by underage persons.
Clarifies that animal cruelty investigations may be conducted by county sheriff's office; appropriates $100,000.
"State Law Enforcement Officers' Bill of Rights."
Requires the Attorney General to issue uniform guidelines regarding release of arrest information to media.
Provides additional penalties for certain crimes involving cemeteries and other property.
Provides immunity to law enforcement officers who, in good faith, release driver in violation of provisional driver's license law.
Prohibits individual from holding simultaneously more than one elective public office.
Provides commission may consider as mitigating factor in determining whether to impose penalty on premises owner that same was reasonably unaware of violation occurring. *
Provides for termination of child support obligation upon certain conditions.
Prohibits possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages on private property by persons under 21 years of age.
Requires DOE to develop educational fact sheet for distribution to parents concerning sports-related eye injuries.
Directs school district to adjust date of group health insurance contract renewal to ensure coordination of any increased costs with adoption of school budget.
Permits municipalities to contract with animal and humane societies which engage in animal foster care.
"Anti-Snow Dumping Act"; prohibits commercial snowplow operators on private property from depositing snow in public roads, streets, and highways or on public lands. *

Requires the Higher Education Student Assistance Authority to develop and distribute a document containing student loan repayment information for school districts and nonpublic high schools to disseminate to students.
Establishes and enhances certain insurance fraud prevention measures.
Allows casino to pay up to 6% or 9% of parimutuel pool to out-of-State racetrack for simucast races; provides casino retains 55% of certain remaining takeout rate amounts.**
Directs establishment of Atlantic City Tourism District; broadens powers and duties of CRDA; transfers Atlantic City Convention and Visitors Authority and its functions to CRDA.
Requires assessment of administrative penalty amount by administrative law judge for environmental violations.
Requires prenotification of mass layoffs by holding company or franchisor at multiple franchise locations.
Creates "Back to Work NJ Program"; makes an appropriation.
Excludes veteran disability compensation from income qualification limits under homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Permits combination of voter petitions and application by municipal governing body for approval of Municipal Consolidation Study Commission by Local Finance Board.
Permits small, women or minority owned businesses located in designated regional centers to qualify for loans from EDA as if located in designated urban center.

Permits collective bargaining on matters covered by civil service; requires civil service examinations to be offered on continual basis; creates title reduction task force; requires posting of layoff plans.
Concerns certain limitations on claims for victim compensation.
"New Jersey Angel Investor Tax Credit Act;" provides credits against corporation business and gross income taxes for investing in New Jersey emerging technology businesses.
Establishes the Technology Business Incubator Program Supplemental Assistance Fund.
Directs New Jersey Economic Development Authority and Commission on Higher Education to promote the establishment of higher education and business partnerships.
Concerns creation of benefit corporations.
Authorizes local public contract set-aside program for employers who hire former prisoners.
Returns control of salaries of county constitutional officers to boards of chosen freeholders.
Eliminates use of rebate procedure for claims of sales and use tax exemption made in connection with certain sales to certain UEZ qualified businesses.
Requires plaintiff in a civil action to pay defendant's attorney fees under certain circumstances where the defendant has made an offer of judgment.
Establishes limit on non-economic damages under the "New Jersey Tort Claims Act."
Imposes limitations on attorney fees awards against public entities.
Enhances penalty for killing police dog or dog engaged in search and rescue efforts.
Excludes appropriations to reserve for uncollected taxes in excess of two percent from calculations of municipal adjusted tax levy.
Authorizes transfer of certain assets of State's public broadcasting system to an entity eligible to operate a public broadcasting system. *
Authorizes various public entities to utilize competitive contracting procedures for certain energy savings improvement projects.
Requires DOT to study stormwater basins in Barnegat Bay watershed; requires DOT and NJ Turnpike Authority to include repairs of stormwater basins in capital project plans.

Permits New Jersey Thoroughbred Horsemen's Association and Standardbred Breeders' and Owners' Association of New Jersey to use purse funds from off-track and account wagering for retired race horses and certain stabling costs.
Provides immunity to institutions of higher education for food donations.
Changes certain licensing requirements for out-of-state entities to operate drivers' schools in New Jersey.

Authorizes State contracting agencies, local contracting units, boards of education, public institutions of higher education, and other public entities to enter into guaranteed energy savings contracts.
Allows certain plumbers and Heating, Ventilating, Air Conditioning and Refrigeration contractors to perform propane services.
Authorizes municipality to deliver property tax bills, construction permits, and receipts for payment via e-mail.
Extends alternate route police training certification from three to five years.
Requires legislators to serve full-time; establishes annual compensation.
Establishes "Blue Ribbon Panel to Review New Jersey's Driver License Suspension Laws."
Permits voter registration of certain persons at age 17 for voting at next election occurring on or after 18th Birthday.
Establishes "Small Business Revolving Loan and Credit Enhancement Fund" within EDA to provide loans and credit enhancement assistance to certain small businesses.
Provides refundable gross income tax credit for amount of annual homestead property tax that exceeds 7 percent of homestead owner's New Jersey gross income.
Modifies New Jersey gross income tax rates.
Establishes "New Jersey Gaming Industry Study Commission" to evaluate impact of enacted gaming and technological reforms and explore future prospects for casino gaming and horse racing in this State.
The "Child Safe Playing Fields Act"; restricts use of lawn care pesticides at schools, child care centers and recreational fields.
Removes statute of limitations in civil actions for sexual abuse; expands the categories of persons who are potentially liable in such actions.
Exempts certain files of clinical programs at law schools in State from Open Public Records Act.

Modifies current law regarding regulation and restrictions on business entities who are public contractors and make campaign contributions to certain office holders, candidates and political organizations.
Limits annual fee increases in shared service agreement to 2 percent.
Provides corporation business tax incentives for life sciences research.
Requires certain State public employees and officers and members of Legislature to file financial disclosure statement with State Ethics commission or Joint Legislative Committee on Ethics.
Creates grant program for newly established small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Creates matching grant program for small businesses engaged in life sciences.
Increases penalty for assault that results in brain damage or permanent severe bodily injury.
Reduces waiting period to expunge disorderly and petty disorderly persons offenses from five to two years.
Requires HIV testing for offense of engaging in prostitution.
Requires plans, specifications, and bid proposal documents for certain local public contracts to address soil contamination.
Provides for excused absences for public school students involved in election activities on day of general election under certain circumstances.
Prohibits persons who violated certain laws from registering as governmental affairs agents and from acting as representative before local government units.
Establishes Medicaid Accountable Care Organization Demonstration Project in DHS.

Establishes temporary dedication of funds from the New Jersey Turnpike authority general reserve account to the Property Tax Relief Fund to fund a temporary gross income tax credit for certain tolls paid.
Authorizes certain disbursements from Hazardous Discharge Site Remediation Fund for transportation of low-level radioactive waste to appropriate disposal facilities.

Authorizes an institution of higher education to initiate a new program without the approval of the Commission on Higher Education that might otherwise be required if the program is not supported by State funds.
Prohibits minors under 18 years of age from using indoor tanning beds.
Requires information on pay checks to be provided on the Internet for State employees who elect direct deposit.
Allows credit against corporation business tax equal to 50 percent of fair market value of new computer equipment donated to public or nonpublic school.
Requires Commissioner of Education to annually evaluate the effectiveness of teacher preparation programs at institutions of higher education in the State.
Requires municipality to report all long and short-term financial and tax agreements to DCA; makes reporting a condition for receipt of special Municipal Aid.
Imposes surcharge on motor vehicle offenses to fund upgraded electronic systems for police vehicles.
Phases out cosmetic medical procedure gross receipts tax.*
Requires owners of certain newly developed shopping centers to provide electric vehicle charging stations.
Directs installation of electric vehicle charging stations at service areas on State's toll roads.
Prohibits issuance of DEP permits or approvals for certain shopping centers not having electric vehicle charging stations.
Provides corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credits for purchase and installation of certain electric vehicle charging stations. *
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of certain electric or plug-in hybrid electric vehicles. *
Extends 2 percent arbitration award cap to certain police and fire contracts that expired before January 1, 2011.
Prohibits drilling technique of hydraulic fracturing.*
Changes the scope of public notification regarding contaminated site remediation.
Establishes standards for commercial insurers and Medicaid program implementing electronic prescribing systems.
Requires MVC to collect information pertaining to veteran status.
Requires registration of bicycles.
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax.
Requires DCF to develop and adopt Statewide youth suicide prevention plan.
Prohibits municipality from imposing special assessment for curb repair in certain circumstances.
Reduces compensation afforded members of Legislature and certain Executive Branch officers by 10 percent.
Extends burial of indigent veterans to those who did not serve in time of war; clarifies role of DMVA in identifying deceased veterans; provides additional funding for burial of indigent veterans.
Prohibits members or affiliates of criminal street gangs from being appointed corrections officers.
Requires home interview of corrections officer applicants.
Requires notification to corrections officers when disturbance occurs in correctional facility.
Requires Commissioner of Corrections to institute 15-minute shift overlap in State correctional facilities.
Allows corporation business tax and gross income tax deductions for the amount of net interest received on loans to certain qualified UEZ businesses.
Authorizes certain municipalities and rural electric cooperatives to establish a municipal shared services energy authority.*
Establishes special license plates to bring awareness to breast cancer.
Provides that graduates of regional or consolidated high schools with constituent municipalities located in different counties are eligible for resident tuition rates at certain county colleges.
The "Pesticide Use Reduction Recognition Act."
Provides for access to adoptee's original birth certificate under certain circumstances.
The "Teacher and School Administrator Protection Act."
Requires health insurers, SHBP and SEHBP to provide coverage for vision rehabilitation services to covered person experiencing sudden onset of blindness.
Prohibits plea bargain if sex offender who committed Megan's Law offense would not be required to register.
Requires scooter riders under 17 years old to wear helmets.
Requires removal of equipment and markings on certain used emergency vehicles.
Requires NJ Environmental Infrastructure Financing Program to give additional weight in ranking system to projects including green or blue roofs.
Requires construction of certain new State buildings, facilities, and structures to include green or blue roofs.
Requires DEP to adopt rules concerning blue roofs and green roofs and provides priority consideration for related permits and other authorizations.
Requires construction of new buildings, facilities, and structures using State, EDA, or NJ Schools Development Authority funds to include green or blue roofs.
Establishes program to provide financial assistance towards installation of blue roofs and green roofs, authorizes use of Global Warming Solutions Fund for certain such purposes.
Provides that the State Board of Examiners may not charge a fee for the issuance of credentials required to serve as a substitute school nurse.
Prohibits sale of blunt wraps.
Permits municipalities and fire districts to appoint paid fire chiefs for paid and certain part-paid fire departments; clarifies duties and responsibilities.
Establishes that board of fire commissioners provide emergency medical services to areas encompassing each fire district.
Establishes death benefit for forest firefighters.
Authorizes Department of Agriculture to implement mobile fresh produce markets for residents of urban "food desert" communities. *
Amends law concerning conversion of age-restricted communities to define substantial detriment and makes other clarifications.
Requires SHBP to provide certain information to participating public employers.
Phases out estate tax over five-year period.
Shortens term of municipal court judges from three years to one year.
Designates portion of New Jersey Route No. 34 in Wall Township as the "Duncan Thecker Memorial Highway."
Permits institutions of higher education to make supplemental contributions to ABP.
The "Wildlife Rehabilitation Act"; establishes Wildlife Rehabilitation Board in, but not of, DEP; and establishes continuing education requirements and permit program for wildlife rehabilitators.

Lowers several corporation business tax rates, increases withholding rate on nonresident noncorporate partners and establishes separate gross income tax rate on gross income in excess of $500,000 but not including foremost categories of business income.
"Parent Empowerment and Choice Act"; enables parents to initiate reform in low performing schools through a petition process.
Requires monitoring of prescriptions for human growth hormones.
Prohibits burial of Petty's Run archaeological excavation site.
Requires services be provided for sexually exploited juveniles charged with certain offenses; creates an affirmative defense regarding prostitution.*
Provides for automatic expungement of records of certain juveniles adjudicated delinquent for engaging in prostitution.
Provides for one-time increase of PFRS retiree annual pensions under $32,000.
Creates "Earn Your Way Out of Prison Into Supervision, Treatment, and Recovery Program."
Designates entire length of New Jersey Route No. 19 in Passaic County as "Congressman William J. Pascrell, Jr. Highway."
Requires persons who transport, store, or sell secondhand mattresses to encase mattresses with protective materials.
Establishes a pilot program in DOE to increase the length of the school day and school year and provides tax credits for corporate contributions to fund the program.
Establishes standards regarding the disqualification of claimants for unemployment compensation for misconduct.

Provides that settlement agents are not responsible for transmitting estimated gross income tax payment and forms for certain nonresident real estate transactions unless so responsible pursuant to contract.
Reduces maximum rate of interest to be charged for delinquent taxes from 18% to 12%.

Allows NJSEA to jointly run racetracks; conforms standardbred racing days to off-track and account wagering law; decreases thoroughbred racing days at Momouth Park and Meadowlands to 71 with horsemen's consent.**
Prohibits certain local public employer continuation of pay programs.
Establishes task force to study various issues related to improving special education programs and services for public school students.
Changes mandatory retirement age for Workers Compensation Judges from age 70 to age 75.
Requires that drivers involved in accident submit to road test in certain instances.
Requires fire districts to establish minimum of three shared service agreements with other fire districts, and to outline agreements in annual budget.
Authorizes exception to the hearsay rule for certain out-of-court statements by witnesses in cases involving a crime.
Concerns NJ Transit's treatment of people with guide or service dogs; establishes Access Link Customer Service Group.
Provides for transfer and sale of inactive liquor licenses for use in qualifying smart growth municipalities.
Authorizes immediate euthanasia of impounded stray animals that are injured or ill beyond hope of recovery.
Allows person with diabetes to voluntarily make notation on drivers license.
Provides for increase in allowance paid to veterans with certain wartime service-connected disabilities.
Revises provisions of "Franchise Practices Act" relating to motor vehicle franchises.
Clarifies trustee's discretionary authority concerning income tax liability.
Prohibits developer from diverting storm water runoff to adjacent or nearby private property.
Provides corporation business tax credit for certain New Jersey news, weather, and sports content production expenses.
Provides workers' compensation coverage for participants of "Back to Work NJ Program."
Establishes mandatory, uniform attorney identification card.
Requires State Comptroller to perform compliance audit to verify municipal implementation of corrective action plan following performance audit.
Restricts campaign contributions by certain individuals, businesses or other organizations that purchase or acquire property involved in eminent domain proceedings.
Temporarily renames NJ Advisory Council on Traumatic Brain Injury as NJ Advisory Council on Traumatic and Acquired Brain Injury; establishes Acquired Brain Injury Fund.
Requires that contracts by non-utility load serving entities to purchase solar renewable energy certificate shall extend for a term of 15 years or longer.
Establishes assisted living facility and comprehensive personal care home resident rights.
"New Jersey Healthcare Exchange Act."
Provides State indemnification for certain local law enforcement officers.
Provides a gross income tax deduction for the payment of credit card interest.
Directs NJTA to reduce tolls no longer required for payment of Access to the Region's Core Tunnel project.
Requires local law enforcement officer or firefighter prescribed anabolic steroids or human growth hormone to report to designated physician for evaluation of fitness for duty.
Allows Governor to remove an executive county superintendent of schools at will.
Provides civil immunity to licensed health care professionals who provide care at health care facilities for no compensation.
Clarifies that any use of another person's personal identifying information is a crime.

Establishes Division of Minority and Women Business Development and State Chief Disparity Officer to monitor efforts to promote participation by minority-owned and women-owned businesses in State contracting.
Establishes the Office of Dropout Prevention and Reengagement of Out-of-School Youth in DOE, and the Student Dropout Prevention Task Force.
Upgrades penalties for certain assaults committed against sports officials.
Requires birthing facilities to screen newborns for congenital heart defects prior to discharge.
Provides for certain psychologists to prescribe medications.
Revises membership of Public Health Council and fully restores functions, powers, and duties of council.
Authorizes public institution of higher education to establish in-municipality tuition rate for students who graduate from public high schools located in the same municipality as the institution.
Provides for a municipal court community service fee.
Prohibits charging vehicle storage fees for days on which storage facility is closed.
Provides State income tax credit for removal of lawns near Barnegat Bay.
Concerns environmental permits in low-income, minority communities.
"Adolescents' Online Privacy Protection Act."
Prohibits sale of merchandise designed to conceal license plates.
Provides credit against ambulatory care facility assessment liability for value of unreimbursed care provided to hospital charity care patients.
Removes limousine services from sales and use tax imposition.
Provides tax credits to certain businesses for certain capital investment in qualified business facilities and qualified residential projects located in vicinity of designated transit villages.

Requires governmental affairs agents retained by government entities to file certain reports with ELEC; requires certain government entities retaining governmental affairs agents to file annual reports with ELEC.
Authorizes donation of forfeited bicycles to charities.
Requires ignition interlock device to be installed on vehicle owned or leased by drunk driver only after period of driver's license suspension.
Guarantees each municipality, at a minimum, Fiscal Year 2010 distribution of energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Aid.
Requires wireless cell phone company to inform subscribers that cell phone GPS capability may be deactivated.
Clarifies that conviction of refusal to submit to breathalyzer constitutes prior conviction for sentencing purposes under drunk driving law.
Expands DNA database to include samples from certain arrestees; designated "Katie's Law."
Allows business tax credit to employers giving paid leave to employees for service with volunteer emergency services organizations under corporation business tax and gross income tax.
Requires forfeiture of public office, position or employment upon conviction of certain offenses.
The "Market Competition and Consumer Choice Act," alters State regulation of competitive services provided by telecommunications and CATV companies.
Provides totally disabled persons with discount on fishing license fees.
Creates New Jersey Business Action Center.
Requires DEP to conduct analysis of "Pollution Prevention Act."
Prohibits automatic renewal of service contracts.
Provides tax credit against gross income tax for costs of certain property that conserves energy or promotes energy efficiency and for other energy efficiency measures.
Creates the "Mold Safe Housing Act."
Requires DCA to establish standards concerning mold hazards in residential building interiors, and certification programs for mold inspectors and mold hazard abatement workers.*
Requires SJTA to provide a cash payment option at every toll plaza.
Establishes that refusal conviction constitutes prior conviction when imposing drunk driving sentence.
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.
Eliminates separate presidential primary election; provides for delegates and alternates to political party national conventions to be elected at regular June primary election.
Permits a farm income averaging credit under the New Jersey gross income tax.
Provides municipalities with discretion to restrict hours for sale of package goods.
Exempts electric vehicle charging systems from real property taxation.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from increasing resident undergraduate tuition by more than 4% over the prior academic year.
The "Safe Playing Fields Act"; restricts use of lawn care pesticides at child care centers, and certain schools, playgrounds, and recreational fields.*
Amends penalty imposed for interfering with apprehension or prosecution of certain criminals.
Prohibits certain local officers from authorizing certain transfers, appointments, changes in compensation, and funding for capital projects in local units.
Prohibits elected public official from approving certain promotions or increases in compensation during period immediately prior to leaving office.
Establishes a municipal court conditional dismissal program for certain first-time offenders.
Makes unauthorized impersonation of another person a crime of the third degree.
Requires requestor to submit request for access to missing government record under certain circumstances.
Concerns calculation of value for conveyance of certain State-owned lands.
Requires Commissioner of DHSS to assess how to increase number of teaching hospitals and medical residency programs throughout State.
Provides for nursing reimbursement adjustment for cost of energy improvements.
Provides for annual adjustments in worker taxes paid into the State disability benefits fund.
Designates portion of U.S. Route 1 in South Brunswick Township as "Pleasant T. Macon Highway."
Requires specific instructions for workers filing unemployment insurance claims.
Changes the trigger for extended unemployment benefits.
Makes changes to retirement benefits for members of the State-administered retirement systems and eliminates future COLAs.
Requires acquisition of defibrillators for use in public and nonpublic high schools and training of certain personnel in usage.
Creates Craft Distillery License to permit the manufacture of smaller amounts of distilled alcoholic beverages.
Establishes State funding for volunteer firefighter training and death benefit.
Reduces amount of fire duty required in order to receive exempt fireman certificate.
Requires Type I or Type II personal flotation devices for each person on board certain vessels.
Provides fair standards for elections and recall of officers for homeowners' associations.
Enhances penalty for tampering with evidence after fleeing the scene of an accident resulting in death.
Directs NJTA to dedicate toll increase revenue no longer required for payment of Access to the Region's Core Tunnel project to Transportation Trust Fund Account.
Limits severance payments made by certain hospitals to $175,000.
Revises definition of class I renewable energy to include energy produced by certain geothermal heat pumps. *
Reduces maximum capacity of ammunition magazines to 10 rounds.
Requires certain health care facilities to adopt certain infection control strategies.
Establishes new standard and procedure for forfeiture of elective public office for accepting illegal contributions; removes illegal contribution threshold for such forfeiture.
"Port Authority of New York and New Jersey Oversight Act."
Provides totally disabled persons with discount on hunting license fees.
Creates the option to make a voluntary contribution for the support of local libraries on gross income tax returns.
Increases the penalty for hindering the apprehension or prosecution of an offender.
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.
Expands the Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit program to include port district municipalities and makes other changes to the program.
Amends provisions NJ Economic Stimulus Act of 2009 concerning Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant program of EDA.
Authorizes municipality to provide for imposition and collection of special assessment to secure developer's recovery of cost of certain improvements in connection with redevelopment project.
Provides unemployment insurance benefits for shared work programs; requires Department of Labor and Workforce Development report.
Modifies employer UI tax rates.

Imposes requirements concerning Passaic Valley Sewerage Commissioners budgets and capital plan; requires commissioners meetings and public hearings be made available to public; requires commissioners make certain information available on website.
Makes humane officers for NJSPCA and county societies eligible for body armor grants.

Requires institutions of higher education to provide students with access to mental health care programs and services and to establish a hotline to provide information concerning the availability of those services.
"Barnegat Bay Protection Act"; establishes Barnegat Bay Protection Fund, dedicates portion of sales tax on lawn fertilizer, authorizes special license plates, and provides for donations.
Mandates notaries public under certain circumstances to advertise information to public regarding limitations on their scope of authority.
Requires completion of no more than 18 credits of continuing education for renewal of burglar alarm licenses.
Requires each nonprofit corporation operating in the State that accepts State funds to hold quarterly board meetings that include time for public participation.
"Appraisal Management Company Registration Act."
Excludes gains on sales of certain real estate purchases from taxation under corporation business tax and gross income tax.
Permits public referendum on certain bond ordinances in municipalities operating under the Walsh Act.
Mandates health insurance coverage for certain amino acid-based elemental formulas.
Replaces plenary winery and farm winery licenses with small winery and wine manufacturing licenses.**
Prohibits attorney serving as elected local government officer in a municipality from representing campaign of candidate for elective office in that municipality to contest election results.
Prohibits imposition of the corporation business tax on certain foreign corporations that only store personal property in this State incident to its importation.
Requires Department of Education to biannually distribute a letter to school districts reminding districts of requirement to enroll resident students regardless of immigration status.
Clarifies enforcement responsibility of State Housing Code concerning multiple dwellings from municipalities to the State under the "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law."

Establishes ovarian cancer public awareness campaign in DHSS.
Requires Board of Medical Examiners to promulgate regulations regarding botulinum toxin injections for minors.
Establishes NJ Advisory Council on End-of-Life Care in DHSS.
Restricts sale and manufacture of flame retardant chemical decabromodiphenyl ether in certain products.
Repeals obsolete statutes concerning the status of women.

Permits certain victims of domestic violence or stalking, and members of immediate family, to register to vote without disclosing street address and cast provisional ballot at any election under certain circumstances.
Requires certain municipal, school and fire district elections occur on date of nonpartisan municipal elections.
Prohibits expenditure of State funds for certain cosmetic services in criminal trials.
Prohibits sale of emergency warning lights to unauthorized motorists.

Prohibits local public employer continuation of pay programs.
Exempts commercial motor vehicle drivers from enforcement of snow and ice removal requirements until appropriate removal equipment is available.
Requires information concerning certain public employees be made public.
Requires voter approval at the annual school election or by the board of school estimate prior to designation as charter school district of residence or expansion of a charter school. *

Requires State Comptroller to review, and make recommendations for improvement of, the procurement process of the State, public institutions of higher education, independent State authorities, units of local government, and boards of education.
Extends period for requested medical exam for disability benefits under PFRS to every two years until 55 years of age.
Establishes air quality standards and certification requirements for indoor skating rinks.
Requires NJ Transit and certain commercial bus operators to disclose information about drivers when requested.
Authorizes certain municipalities to establish safety requirements for certain bars and taverns.
Provides for drug testing of adult recipients of Work First New Jersey program benefits.
Requires approval of extending special improvement districts every 10 years by majority of affected property owners.
Establishes gubernatorial veto power over Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor's meeting minutes; expands gubernatorial oversight powers over commission.
"Consumer Credit Fairness Act."
Requires signs posted by retail motor fuel dealers to indicate motor fuel prices for cash and credit card customers.
Allows person with penicillin allergy to voluntarily make notation on drivers license.
Provides SHBP New Jersey State Employee Wellness Program with financial incentives for participants.
Requires assisted living residences and comprehensive personal care homes to ensure connection of emergency cords in residential units to facility staff.
Requires independent State authority members to disclose employment and contractual relationships between authority and authority member's relatives.
Requires that wheelchairs be secured using four-point securement system in paratransit vehicles.
Requires insurance coverage in the individual and small employer markets and SHBP and SEHBP for "off-label" uses of certain drugs. *
Phases-in single sales fraction for corporation business tax income allocation formula over three years and establishes airline-specific sales fraction.
Establishes alternative business calculation under gross income tax to permit consolidation and carryforward of certain business-related losses.
Increases gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 and dedicates revenue from tax rate increase for direct real property tax relief for taxpayers.
Allows private passenger automobile usage information as rating factor in insurance underwriting.
Requires corporations qualifying for State development subsidy grants to repay entire grant amount if corporation fails to uphold grant terms.
Exempts completed and under-construction buildings used or intended to be used in the work of non-profit hospital associations and corporations from taxation.
Requires municipalities to file copies of tax abatement and exemption agreements with county chief financial officer and county counsel within 30 days of execution.
Establishes that certification for police training course lasts five years.
"Internet Service Provider Customer Bill of Rights."
Provides tax credit against corporation business tax and gross income tax for certain small businesses receiving qualifying loans.
Makes FY 2011 supplemental appropriation of $65,000 to Main Street Counseling Center in West Orange, New Jersey.
Decreases certain motor vehicle fines.
Requires DCA to promulgate certain fire safety regulations concerning upholstered furniture and furnishings purchased for use in residential premises and public buildings.
Exempts charges for residential storage space and dues for residential health and fitness facilities from the sales and use tax.
Establishes temperature control guidelines and standards for school facilities.
Creates Highlands Conservation Trust to preserve land in Highlands Region, and authorizes Highlands conservation license plate to raise revenue therefor.
Requires certain employers to plan and implement traffic reduction programs for employees.
Upgrades penalties for eluding police officer if stolen vehicle involved.
Establishes 14-day grace period for consumer to cancel contract for cellular telephone service.
Requires court appearance for certain motor vehicle offenses that occur in school zone.
Requires criminal history background check for owners and employees of home service enterprises.
Requires mandatory incarceration for motor vehicle theft offenses.
Requires affordable housing be built to green building standards; requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to issue standards.
Establishes $2 surcharge upon building permits for payments to Community Health Law Project.
Establishes uniform real property taxation for commercial renewable energy systems and limits municipal construction permit fees for non-commercial renewable energy systems.*
Extends certain PERS benefits to veterans of "Operation Uphold Democracy".
Requires periodic inspection of exterior walls of certain buildings.
Requires public utilities and cable television companies to accommodate and relocate facilities and pay costs thereof when necessary for infrastructure projects.
Permits direct shipping by wineries and creates Out-of-State Winery license.
Requires local authorities and commissions to establish an Internet website and post information related to each entity's mission, finances, meetings, and employees.
Requires direct deposit for all State employee compensation on and after July 1, 2014.

Prohibits attorney spouse or domestic partner of elected local government officer in a municipality from representing campaign of candidate for elective office in that municipality to contest election results.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program and requires DOT to conduct study.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of fuel cell vehicles.
Establishes public-private pilot program for level 3 electric vehicle charging stations.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of compressed natural gas vehicles.
Expands treatment of mixed use projects under urban transit hub tax credit and requires developers utilizing State funds to reserve affordable units under certain conditions.
Requires at least 50% of highest Casino Simulcasting Special Fund amount awarded to racetrack be paid to Atlantic City Race Course; prescribes uses thereof.
Reduces membership of Casino Control Commission from five to three.
Requires State, regional, and local authorities, boards,and commissions to establish an Internet website and post information related to each entity's mission, finances, meetings, and employees.*
Requires surgical practices to be licensed by DHSS as ambulatory care facilities.
Extends deadline for filing nominating petitions each year new legislative districts are established by Apportionment Commission.
Clarifies responsibility of Unsatisfied Claim and Judgment Fund for pedestrian personal injury protection claims.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for services performed to certain prewritten computer software delivered electronically.
Requires BPU to promulgate regulations requiring electricity providers to provide information so customers can compare prices and services.

Supplemental appropriation to DHSS for $7,453,000 for family planning services, and requires filing of State Plan Amendment to extend Medicaid coverage for family planning services to persons with incomes up to 200% of federal poverty level.
Limits sale and manufacture of flame retardant chemical decabromodiphenyl ether.
Requires municipalities to notify counties of traffic control signal monitoring systems within prescribed period of time.

Forbids members of the State Investment Council from voting on transactions concerning investment with which a member has certain financial or familial conflicts and requires removal for violations thereof.
Encourages local unit sharing of services; makes appropriations.
Establishes pilot program suspending operations of superintendent and deputy superintendent of elections in certain second class counties.
Requires health care facilities to offer influenza vaccination to their health care workers.
Permits registered voters to receive mail-in ballots automatically for all future elections.
Requires incarcerated individual be counted for redistricting purposes at previous address if State resident and not counted if incarcerated and not State resident.
Requires NJ FamilyCare to treat earned and unearned income in same manner when calculating gross family income for parents and caretakers.
Requires DHSS to provide written notice to certain federal, State and local elected officials upon the filing of application for certificate of need to close hospital.
Concerns attorney fees for workers' compensation awards.
"Workforce Investment for New Teachers Act"; provides $5,000 refundable gross income tax credit to new teachers in low-performing school districts.
Establishes a loan redemption program for teachers employed in chronically failing schools.

Requires State to pay full contribution to State-administered pension systems plus $300 million annually until systems are fully funded; provides members of systems with contractual right to financially sound funding of systems.
Requires certain civil actions against certain licensed persons to be brought within two years.
Revises scope of practice of genetic counselors.
Establishes special license plates for honorably discharged veterans.
Imposes post-employment restrictions on certain ABC employees.
Authorizes local public contract set-aside program for business enterprises that are owned by or that employ veterans.
Provides affirmative defense to prostitution charge for persons under 16.
Authorizes prescribed burning in certain circumstances.
Regulates use of pallets in shipment and storage of certain agricultural commodities, foods, drugs, and medicinal products.
Requires children to wear athletic heart protectors while playing organized baseball or softball.
Supplemental appropriation of $6.4 million in State funds and $11.9 million in federal funds to DHS to restore eligibility to parents in NJ FamilyCare.
Establishes real property assessment demonstration program.
Clarifies informed consent provisions of "Access to Medical Research Act" for persons with developmental disabilities.
Permits release of certain student information.
Allows low-speed vehicles to be used for the transportation of passengers for hire.
Creates striped bass license plates.
Authorizes Commissioner of NJDOT to procure revenue-generating sponsors for, and permit sponsorship acknowledgment and advertising on, safety and emergency service patrol vehicles and equipment.
Establishes procedures for awarding of design-build contracts.
Requires certain qualifications for employment as a surgical technologist.
Requires binding arbitration to determine contested cases involving dismissal or reduction in compensation of tenured public school employees.
Concerns wage protection and certain penalties for violating laws regarding wages, compensation or benefits.
Provides certain collocations of wireless equipment, minor site plan status.
Establishes maximum fees for licensing and administration of raffles by Legalized Games of Chance Control Commission and certain municipalities.
Requires DCA to provide information regarding "Lead Hazard Control Assistance Act" to certain dwelling units approved for Weatherization Assistance Program.
Concerns licensure exemptions for boiler operators.
Limits use and supplemental compensation for certain leave; limits employment for certain public employees.
Establishes a 1,000 foot drug free zone around child care centers.
Permits local unit to contract with private entities to lease advertising space on local unit's official Internet website.
Terminates early release program for certain State inmates.
Directs Board of Nursing to encourage nursing schools to give academic credit to students for training received in US military as corpsmen and medics.
Enhances procedures for disposition of State surplus computers, computer equipment and software allocated for redistribution, sale, or disposal.
Provides that any superintendent salary caps adopted by the commissioner will apply to charter school administrators.

Lowers age of eligibility for surviving spouse under homestead property tax reimbursement program; extends payment of homestead property tax reimbursement to non-eligible surviving spouse for portion of tax year during which deceased spouse lived.
Provides supplemental appropriation of $3.8 million from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE for aid to school districts with significant enrollment growth.
Requires certificate of need for hospital-based basic obstetric and pediatric services.
Creates "Comprehensive Anti-Nepotism Act."
Concerns sale of cemetery, grave, and historical markers and plaques.
Caps attorney fee awards in actions against public entities.
Excludes certain services rendered in connection with installation of carpeting and other flooring from sales and use tax.
Concerns liability and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.
Restricts health insurers from limiting access to pain medication.
Increases production limitations and revises privileges of limited and restricted breweries.
Requires health insurers and SHBP to provide certain mental health benefits for eating disorders under same terms and conditions as for other illnesses and diseases.
Prohibits municipal library trustees from transferring donated funds to municipality.
Allows Eatontown, Oceanport, and Tinton Falls mayors to designate council member to represent them as members of Fort Monmouth Economic Revitalization Authority.

Requires schools that participate in Statewide interscholastic sports programs to annually inform student-athletes about National Collegiate Athletic Association eligibility standards for participation in collegiate athletics.
Permits voter registration at polling place on days of municipal, primary, and general elections.
Authorizes immediate euthanasia of impounded stray animals that are injured or ill beyond hope of recovery.
Requires party bidding on, or performing, a State contract to provide employee health care benefits.
Requires "just compensation" for condemnation of single-family residence to be based on cost of comparable relocation properties within 20 mile radius.
Permits water and sewerage service sub-metering in multi-family dwellings.
Establishes pilot program to utilize value-based benefit design in SHBP to increase health benefits coverage for certain employees concerning chronic health conditions.
Provides updated procedures for disposition of State surplus computers and certain other electronic devices designated for redistribution, sale, or disposal.*
Requires annual notice to local employers in PERS and PFRS include contribution rate and calculation for current year, preceding two years, and projection for subsequent two years.
Upgrades penalty for unlawful possession of a firearm on grounds of an educational institution.
Requires legislators and local lawmakers to disclose names of nonconfidential clients from whom more than $10,000 is earned.
"Pamela's law;" criminalizes possession and sale of mephedrone and methylenedioxypyrovalerone, commonly known as "bath salts."*
Increases benefit amounts and income eligibility limits for the Work First New Jersey program.
Increases child support amount that may be received in addition to assistance grant under Work First New Jersey program.
Permits attending advanced practice nurse to determine cause of death and execute death certification when physician is not available.
Establishes mutual aid assistance request protocols for 9-1-1 ambulance dispatchers.
Establishes the crime of negligent vehicular homicide.
Requires contracting units and boards of education to credit contractors with interest earned on certain funds withheld from payment to contractors.
Provides exception from BPU standards for construction and installation of certain solar and photovoltaic electric generation equipment on utility poles by electric public utilities.
Provides for streamlined review of certain wind energy generation facility installments on farmland. **
Establishes the "Private Investment in Public Education Fund."
Establishes preservation requirements for certain biological evidence.

Provides that when Lieutenant Governor also serves as Secretary of State election-related cases will be decided by administrative law judge whose decision will not be reviewable by Secretary of State.
Raises maximum eligibility age for exempt fireman certificates and membership in New Jersey State Firemen's Association.
Entitles member of Legislature, who also serves in another public or tax-supported position, unpaid time off from position to attend to legislative duties.
Requires appointed or elected official receive annual salary of $50,000 or more for position to participate in PERS or DCRP.
Repeals early release program for certain inmates established under P.L.2009, c.330.
Allows certain sole proprietors to join a small employer health benefits purchasing alliance.
Establishes per se standard for driving under the influence of drugs.
Requires DOE to include cheerleaders in the student-athlete head injury safety program.
Requires coin redemption machine operators to disclose fees.

Prohibits public colleges from charging tuition to students who are parents, spouses or children of those killed, missing in action or disabled in Operation Noble Eagle, Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.
Directs NJTA to study and report on potential revenue generating services of NJTA rest areas and service plazas.
Eliminates permit requirement for home production of wine and beer for personal use.

Requires DHS to contract with independent firm for analysis of costs and local impact prior to closure or privatization of State developmental centers or psychiatric hospitals.
Extends for two years expiration date of certain permits pursuant to "Permit Extension Act of 2008."
Establishes flat digital striped bass motor vehicle license plates.
Allows independent physical therapists to jointly negotiate with carriers over contractual terms and conditions.
Revises current juror compensation.
Requires each charter school to annually employ teachers who hold special education endorsements.
Concerns sale of cemetery, grave, and historical markers and plaques.
Prohibits service repair contractors from charging hourly rates for travel time.
Requires recalls on motor vehicles to be repaired prior to sale.
Revises penalties for animal cruelty, increasing degree of certain offenses; designated as Patrick's Law.
Reduces period of time that member of Legislature may be absent, without excuse, before member's seat is deemed vacant.
Requires use of pervious concrete by State agencies under certain circumstances.
Establishes bill of rights for parents of persons with developmental disabilities.
Requires Commissioner of Education to contract with qualified independent entity to conduct evaluation of State's charter schools.
Provides corporate tax credit to corporations making contribution to Child Development Fund in DOE.
Concerns use of emergency warning lights.
Establishes "School Bus Safety and Child Protection Act," requires periodic criminal background checks for certain school employees; and prohibits interference with school bus monitoring devices.
Creates special license plates supporting Autism Awareness.
Removes appropriations for municipal library purposes from the municipal property tax levy cap.
The "New Jersey Parental Rights Program Act."
Permits freeholders and municipal clerks to solemnize marriage and civil union ceremonies.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment insurance for certain seasonal workers.
Concerns repayment of unemployment insurance benefits obtained fraudulently.
Amends definition of "racketeering activity" in RICO statute to include unemployment insurance fraud offenses.

Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for fish and wildlife management and conservation.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts.
Requires that Board of Pharmacy compile and publish list of certain tamper-resistant opioid drugs and that certain conditions be met for pharmacist to substitute for tamper-resistant opioid drug. *

Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax to $1,000,000.
Establishes a process for renewal of DOE issued authorization of certified educational facilities manager.
Repeals State inheritance taxes.
"Melanie A. Cantwell Law;" requires MVC to issue modified license to person convicted of driving under the influence.
Requires withholding of the State operating aid of any public or independent institution of higher education that enrolls students who are not lawfully present in the U.S.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support NJ SHARES.
Suspends pension of any retired public employee who resumes public employment with compensation more than $15,000.

Appropriates $45 million from "2009 Green Acres Fund" and $12 million from "2009 Blue Acres Fund" for State acquisition of lands for recreation and conservation purposes, including Blue Acres projects.

Appropriates $14,818,787 from "2009 Green Acres Fund" and "Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund" for grants to certain nonprofit entities to acquire or develop lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Appropriates $84,495,199 from "2009 Green Acres Fund" and "Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund" for local government open space acquisition and park development projects.
Modifies State's role in local unit consolidations.
Increases surcharge for drunk driving conviction.
Appropriates funds to DEP for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2012.
Makes certain changes to NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust Financing Program.

Appropriates $10,250,780 from 2009 Historic Preservation Fund and 2007 Historic Preservation Fund to provide grants for certain historic preservation projects, and appropriates $600,000 from "2009 Historic Preservation Fund" for associated administrative expenses.
Appropriates $23,588,760 from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund" and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" to State Agriculture Development Committee for farmland preservation purposes.

Appropriates $39 million from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund," "2007 Farmland Preservation Fund," and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" to State Agriculture Development Committee for county planning incentive grants.
Appropriates $23 million from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund" and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Fund" for planning incentive grants to municipalities for farmland preservation purposes.

Appropriates $8.831 million from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund," "2007 Farmland Preservation Fund," and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" for grants to certain nonprofit organizations for farmland preservation purposes.
Provides penalty for registration violations occurring under State's saltwater fishing registry program.
Exempts from real property taxation during construction any building, or portion thereof, to be used for a property tax-exempt purpose.
Establishes Sex Offender Management Commission; amends Megan's Law in response to federal Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006.
Upgrades penalties for certain criminal offenses committed against elderly and disabled persons.
Deletes prior authorization requirements by certain insurers for accessing certain health care services.
Deems employee completion of required training in Public Employees Occupational Safety and Health program standard valid for other employers with same requirement.
Requires administrative law judge to make final decision in certain contested cases.
Requires certain non-profit organizations be subject to open public records act.
Authorizes deer hunting with firearm on Sundays on private property.
Prohibits sale of baked products containing supplemental melatonin.
Prohibits a public institution of higher education from using State funds to pay a commencement speaker.
Limits compensation provided to presidents of public institutions of higher education.
Creates "Inmate Community Service Program" in DOC.
Authorizes issuance of special emergency notes to finance special emergency appropriations for payment of current year property assessment appeal refunds over three years.
Extends "whistleblower" protections to employee disclosure of governmental mismanagement, waste and abuse.
Permits licensed veterinarians to employ foreign veterinary school graduates under certain circumstances.
Requires Chief Administrator of Motor Vehicle Commission to establish standards for average customer wait times at facilities.
Concerns membership and management of homeowners associations.

Establishes certain requirements for trapping of snapping turtles.
Permits municipality to pay commercial and industrial property tax refunds for tax years 2010 through 2011 over subsequent three local budget years.
Concerns exclusion of individuals with certain employment history in advertisements for job vacancies.

Allows elected official who is enrolled in PERS by virtue of another public position to waive coverage in retirement system based on that other public position.
Establishes measures to improve transparency and accountability of regional authorities of this State; enhances oversight of those authorities by Governor and State Comptroller.
Provides that charter schools will be subject to monitoring under the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum.

Requires inmates serving "No Early Release Act" sentences be placed in State correctional institutions and prohibits their participation in Residential Community Release programs until they are eligible for parole.
Establishes licensing program in Department of Agriculture for farmed deer and other cervids.

Supplemental appropriation to DHSS for $7,453,000 for family planning services, and requires filing of State Plan Amendment to extend Medicaid coverage for family planning services to persons with incomes up to 200% of federal poverty level.
Designates portion of State Highway Route No. 35 as "Chosin Few Memorial Highway."
Creates "New Jersey Life Science Internship Challenge" program.
Establishes Retaining Our Best and Brightest Loan Redemption Program.
Establishes pilot program concerning sterilization of cats and dogs released for adoption from various facilities and updates law concerning impoundment.
Establishes health insurance claims database in DOBI.

Provides for designation of surrogates to make health care decisions for certain patients and decision making process for patients without surrogates; establishes demonstration program for transition of isolated patients from inpatient care to post-acute care.
Requires surgical practices to be licensed by DHSS as ambulatory care facilities.
Concerning the "Contractors' Registration Act."
Eliminates licensure of rehabilitation counselors.
Establishes "Study Commission on E-Licensing."
Extends for three years application submission deadline to EDA for review and approval of certain construction projects involving public institutions of higher education.
