Clarifies intent of P.L.2007, c.340 regarding NJ's required participation in Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative.
Establishes three categories for investigative findings of allegations of child abuse or neglect, substantiated, not substantiated, and unfounded.
Revises method of regulation and collection of surplus lines insurance premium taxes.
Creates Veterans Haven Council.
Designates "Red Bank Train Station" as "Daniel J. O'Hern Station - Red Bank, New Jersey." *
Allows all municipalities to sell and lease unneeded public property for "urban" farming and gardening purposes.
Revises responsibility for meadowlands adjustment payments.
Revises statutes concerning dental hygienists and dentists.
Clarifies manner of delivery of certain notices pursuant to "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law."
Requires reporting of suspected abuse of institutionalized elderly to police and that facility employees receive notice of reporting requirement annually; designated as "Peggy's Law."
Prohibits use of jobs relocated within State in calculation of net positive benefit under "Urban Transit Hub Tax Credit Act."
Permits retired law enforcement officers to join the New Jersey Detective Association.
Concerns repayment of unemployment compensation overpayments.

Authorizes local governments to license the use of, or sell in fee simple or as an easement interest, public roads within a municipality to connect a non-contiguous solar, wind, combined heat and power, or biomass generation facility with an end-use customer; requires public utility to provide for the connection.
Establishes a formula for the distribution of State aid to school districts.
Prohibits distribution of campaign materials at any facility owned, maintained, operated or leased by unit of local government.
Provides that children under care, custody or supervision of DYFS may not be home-schooled.
Requires Commissioner of Education to change deadline for municipal review of defeated school budgets whenever he changes the annual school election date.
Requires public parking facilities at NJ Transit stations to be open to public on weekends and other occasions; permits reasonable fee for use of parking facility.
Allows for modifications to land use approvals because of changed economics.
Provides for collection on child support arrearages and certain public assistance overpayments through withholding of casino and racetrack winnings.
Enacts the "Freedom of Religion and Equality in Civil Marriage Act."
Establishes loan redemption program and bonus program for teachers employed in schools in need of improvement.
"Teacher Effectiveness and Accountability for the Children of New Jersey (TEACHNJ) Act."
Makes various changes to pension and health care benefits for public employees.
Expands DNA database to include samples from persons arrested for any crime.
Establishes right to immediate interlocutory appeal from determinations as to class certification in class action lawsuits.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in companies doing business in North Korea.
Requires preservation of employee benefits and contractual rights as condition of sale of Atlantic City International Airport.
Provides for SHBP New Jersey State Employee Wellness Program with financial incentives for participation in program.
Modifies certain State and county-funded rental assistance programs.
Provides certain reemployment rights to teachers dismissed due to a reduction in force.
Consumer Electronics Warranty Lemon Law.
The "Digital Impersonation Prevention Act."

Authorizes Commission on Higher Education to impose a fine against an institution of higher education that fails to appropriately respond to a student's allegation of sexual assault by another student.
Revises confiscation, impoundment, and forfeiture procedures for an animal abandoned by owner or seized from abusing owner.
Establishes "Truck Operator Independent Contractor Act."
Regulates massage therapy advertising.
Updates provisions governing Board of Education Employees' Pension Fund of Essex County to comply with Internal Revenue Code.
Makes changes to manner in which State-administered retirement systems operate and to public employee pension benefits.
Limits applicability of vacancy decontrol under local rent control ordinances under certain circumstances.
Permits local government units to increase service charge imposed for check payments returned for insufficient funds.
Allows municipalities to provide free or reduced fee beach badges to fully disabled veterans.
Authorizes county vocational school district to reduce required local share if the reduction is agreed to by board of education and county governing body.
Clarifies the definition of citizenship in the State of New Jersey.
Renders federal "Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act" null and void in NJ.
Repeals law requiring chain restaurants to post calorie information for menu items.
Authorizes Governor to enter into interstate compact to clarify fourteenth Amendment.
Requires use of uniform silver flags to mark certain pesticide applications.

Establishes as third degree crime new offense of serious bodily injury to an animal; revises other offenses and penalties for animal cruelty, increasing the degree of certain offenses; designated as Patrick's Law.
Prohibits new employees of certain organizations from enrolling in State-administered retirement system or health care plan of public employer.

Makes varius changes to urban transit hub tax credit program concerning mixed use projects, in-State job relocation, tax credit and investment criteria, and affordable housing; makes certain NJ Meadowlands area properties eligible for incentive grants.*
Revises requirement that public employers provide certain health benefit plans to public employees.
Concerns workers' compensation insurance requirements for certain corporations.

Increases PFRS employee contribution rate; requires new members to be age 50 for special retirement; creates cap on PFRS retiree COLA; restructures PFRS board of trustees and gives it control over fund investments.
Requires certain public entities to issue requests for proposals for purchase of certain insurance products and services; requires disclosure of commissions paid.
Permits primary elections to be conducted by mail.
Provides for the designation of new charter school authorizers and additional modifications of the charter school program.

"School Children First Act"; modifies evaluation of teachers and principals; revises tenure acquisition process and certain tenure charge procedures; establishes factors for determining compensation; requires mutual consent for teacher placement; and eliminates certain seniority rights.
Appropriates $3.6 million from the Clean Waters Fund for sewerage infrastructure improvements at the former Marlboro Psychiatric Hospital.
Authorizes marriage and entry into a civil union by proxy for certain persons serving overseas in the Armed Forces or National Guard.
Concerns rights of financial counterparties to terminate and settle certain agreements with certain insurers in the event of insolvency or liquidation.

Provides credits against corporation business and gross income taxes to small and medium-sized businesses for certain export and export promotion activity; designated as the Export Promotion Tax Credit Act.
Requires period of mandatory incarceration for second or subsequent conviction for prostitution.
Upgrades offense and increases penalty for certain acts of defiant trespass.
Requires DEP to develop and implement artificial reef management plan.
Upgrades penalties for illegal use of a hand-held cell phone while driving.
Allows MVC to process title transfers of abandoned vessels without court order; lengthens time period required for desertion of vessel to ripen into abandonment.
Prohibits requiring domed roofs on storage tanks if alternative emissions reduction method for volatile organic compound emissions can be established.
Criminalizes participation in criminal street gang.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
Establishes public bidding and contracting procedures for Rutgers, the State University that mirror those in place for the State colleges.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support the Girl Scouts councils in New Jersey.
Clarifies functions of Law Enforcement Officer Crisis Intervention Services telephone hotline.
Prohibits Governor from using State helicopter for personal and political events; requires quarterly reports to the Legislature.
Requires certain disclosures by health care professionals.
Concerns freshwater wetlands and agricultural irrigation.
Establishes exemption for solar panel installation in certain wetland areas on farmland.

Repeals law allowing PERS member to retire with PERS pension and continue to receive salary for current PERS-covered elective office; permits certain PERS and TPAF members to file for retirement without designating retirement date.
Specifies additional offenses and penalties for torturing or tormenting an animal; designated as Patrick's Law.
Permits school districts to withdraw from civil service system by referendum or adoption of board of education resolution.
Establishes safety zone speed control device pilot program.

Makes various changes to civil service; permits institution of temporary layoffs; permits government entities to opt-out of civil service; requires civil service examinations be offered on continual basis.
Limits use and supplemental compensation for certain leave.
Limits insurance producer commissions to 1.5% of premium in any case in which insured is a board of education.
Converts loan awarded to Barnegat Bay Decoy and Baymen's Museum from loan to grant.
Guarantees each municipality, at a minimum, Fiscal Year 2010 distribution of Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Aid in State Fiscal Year 2012.
Provides for new and increased court and application fees to fund Legal Services of New Jersey and to fund the Judiciary's computerized court information systems.
Requires public schools which have automated external defibrillators to adopt policies concerning usage.

Makes changes to urban hub tax credit program concerning mixed use projects, in-State job relocation in determining net positive benefits, tax credit and capital investment criteria, and affordable housing.

Reduces school district, county, and municipal property tax levy cap from 4% to 2.0% and permits unused school district, county, and municipal increases to be banked for three succeeding years.*
Requires principals and teachers of public schools to conduct an oral recitation from the Declaration of Independence before the opening of school each day in grades 3-12; appropriates $10,000.
Modifies the tort liability of product sellers.
Permits physicians to refer patients to certain physician-owned hospitals.
Changes restrictions on certain county or municipal stream cleaning activities.
Makes permanent the previously temporary authority of the Administrative Director of the Courts to set certain fees for the service of process by mail.
Freezes expenditures by public entities on salaries and benefits for period of three years and limits such expenditures thereafter.
Requires psychologists to video record sessions conducted with children alleged to be abused or neglected.
Eliminates urban enterprise zone programs.
Creates bistate commission to coordinate management and flood prevention of waterways flowing between Bergen County, NJ and Rockland County, NY.
Exempts certain municipalities from payment for certain State Police services.
Authorizes business entities to designate representatives in court proceedings without the necessity for representation by an attorney.
Allows certain volunteer firefighters, rescue and first aid squad members to claim $500 income tax deduction.
Grants county governing body final authority to determine expenditures for courtroom facilities.
Requires proof of lawful presence in the United States to obtain certain benefits.
Exempts volunteer fire companies from charitable registration fees.
Requires school districts to inform the parent or guardian of a student recommended to use certain medications of the possible side effects and potential negative consequences of those medications.
Limits the transportation costs of school districts sending students to county vocational school districts located outside the county of residence.
Revises procedures for securing a permit to carry a handgun.
Requires public referendum prior to issuance of general obligation bonds by local units.
Eliminates separate presidential primary election; provides delegates and alternates to national conventions of political parties will be elected at regular June primary election.
Establishes NJ Water Supply and Pharmaceutical Product Study Commission.
Clarifies current law regarding noisy motor vehicle muffler; establishes penalty for commercial motor vehicle operators.
Authorizes reimbursement for EMT training from EMT Training Fund for certain volunteer firefighters.
Phases out the transfer inheritance tax over two years.
Removes imposition of sales tax on massage, bodywork and somatic services.
Restricts use of accumulated sick leave by public employees in year prior to retirement.
Provides for awarding of certain costs to defendants who prevail in DEP enforcement actions.
Eliminates the alternative minimum assessment under the corporation business tax.
Authorizes any municipality outside Highlands Region to establish receiving zones for Highlands transfer of development rights program.
Permits DEP air quality regulation of certain outdoor wood burning units only in response to complaint.
Modifies development application process under the "Municipal Land Use Law."
Revises certain procedures for real property tax appeals.

"Employment and Training Opportunity Act"; requires housing projects receiving public funds to give hiring, training and purchasing preferences benefitting low-income and severely handicapped residents.
Requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to establish the "Senior Citizen Home Repair and Modification Program;" appropriates $10 million.
Provides that taxes assessed on new property during period pending municipal-wide property revaluation shall not exceed 105 percent of taxes assessed on replaced property.
Establishes division in Department of Treasury to oversee and enforce equal employment opportunity requirements with regard to public works contracts.
Revises law relating to title recordation.
Requires licensed health care professionals and facilities to bill Medicare beneficiaries within 90 days of date insurance payment is finalized.

Provides for county welfare agency monitoring of welfare emergency assistance motel placements, annual inspection of hotels used for emergency assistance recipients and notice of mobile health van services.
Prohibits DHS from closing or changing purpose of State developmental center without passage of approving resolution by Legislature.

Provides certain State department heads cannot holdover in office for more than 120 days; requires Governor, upon expiration of term of county prosecutor and certain other county officials, to nominate successor within 120 days.
Regulates certain servicing activities provided by mortgage servicing organizations for residential mortgage loans and obligations related to such loans.
Provides for the transfer of tenure for a charter school teacher who is subsequently employed in a non-charter public school located in the charter school district of residence.
Requires the New Jersey Schools Development Authority to biannually compile information on school facilities project contracts awarded to minority and female contractors.
Requires DCA to provide Internet resources for homeowner assistance programs and makes an appropriation.
Establishes program in Department of Law and Public Safety for Attorney General to audit, investigate and review superintendents of elections and county boards of elections.
Permits the sealing of certain criminal records; revises eligibility for expungement of criminal and juvenile delinquency records.
Authorizes certain municipalities to impose a tax on the storage of empty shipping containers to fund redevelopment plan activities.
Exempts sales to homeowner assistance and recovery programs from realty transfer fees.
Provides for information that may be requested for issuance of certain driver's licenses.
Establishes identification cards for persons without permanent residence.

Requires Commissioner of Transportation to publish notice of certain transportation-related infrastructure projects and activities on single, searchable Internet website, and directs State Comptroller to monitor publication of those notifications.

Requires State entities to examine opportunity of minority and women-owned financial institutions to serve as senior managing underwriters, imposes reporting requirements, and enables establishment of aspirational levels of utilization and relative compensation.

Revises and expands duties and responsiblities of Inspector General and establishes position of Deputy Inspector General for certain State departments to oversee and monitor allocation and spending of State funds at local level.
Establishes Hooked on Fishing-Not on Drugs Program in DEP and appropriates $200,000 therefor from Drug Enforcement and Demand Reduction Fund. *
Prevents use of condemnation to acquire residential and other private property under redevelopment laws.
Requires prosecutors to determine risk of re-offense under Megan's Law prior to offender's release from incarceration.
Excludes certain illegal aliens from workers' compensation and temporary disability benefits.
Requires reduction in number of State employees to FY2000 level; establishes procedure to control creation of new State positions and filling of vacancies.
Bars companies which hire illegal aliens from public contracts, grants, loans, or tax incentives for seven years.
Ends the transitional energy facilities assessment, caps the State use portion of State energy tax revenues and ensures the balance of such State revenues are paid annually as municipal aid.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service.
Allows municipalities to provide free or reduced fee beach badges to active military and NJ National Guard personnel.
Requires court to consider results of domestic violence assessment before dissolving certain domestic violence restraining orders.
Broadens eligibility for certain veterans' benefits by eliminating requirement of service during specified dates or in specified locations.
Supplemental appropriation of $150 million to DOT for repair or construction of bridges on Route 72 connecting Long Beach Island to the mainland.
Requires additional fines for certain crimes against minors to fund Amber Alert system.
Clarifies that harassment made anonymously or otherwise through electronic communication devices constitutes a petty disorderly offense.
Reestablishes senior citizen supplemental stabilization aid.
Requires Department of the Treasury to calculate State motor vehicle fleet miles per gallon average and to increase it over four years.
Requires reservation of portion of tenant vouchers under State rental assistance program for veterans.
Directs DOT and NJT to study and report on transportation infrastructure needs in coastal counties.
Establishes, in the Division of Fish and Wildlife in DEP, a program to encourage school children to avoid drug use and appropriates $200,000 therefor from Drug Enforcement and Demand Reduction Fund.
Establishes NJ Alzheimer's Disease Study Commission.
Requires BPU to provide funding for purchase and installation of photovoltaic technologies for age-restricted community clubhouse facilities from societal benefits charge.
Requires DEP rejection of new solid waste facility registration if affected municipality disapproves proposed facility location.
Permits certain portion of municipal development trust funds to be spent on housing affordability assistance to veterans.
Authorizes imposition of additional fines for overcrowding.
Makes certain requirements concerning downhill skiing.
Requires public school districts to provide instruction on "New Jersey Safe Haven Infant Protection Act" as part of core curriculum content standards.
Decreases membership of county boards of taxation to 2004 level.
Authorizes certain law enforcement officers and corrections officers to possess and use stun guns while on duty.
Allows for certain variances, exemptions, and waivers under "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Individual's status as minor may not disqualify him from bone marrow donation if medical criteria and informed consent requirements are met. *
Permits Legislature to void closing of State psychiatric hospital or developmental center.
Provides for attachment of real property relating to terrorism.
Provides for the inclusion of home-schooled students in the NJ STARS Program.
Exempts sale of recreational safety helmets from sales and use tax.
Provides corporations business tax and gross income tax credits for employers who support community rehabilitation programs.
Clarifies that automatic sprinkler system is exempt from taxation under certain circumstances.
Creates procedure for destruction of all records pertaining to juveniles who are arrested but subsequently not charged with delinquency.
Requires State to purchase energy efficient and hybrid vehicles; provides for phase-in of the requirement.
Establishes Lake Hopatcong Fund, dedicates $700,000 annually from pleasure boat registration fees to that fund, and appropriates $700,000 for FY2009.
Prohibits State agencies from posting emergency medical technicians' personal information on web sites.
Abolishes offices of superintendent of elections and deputy superintendent; transfers powers and duties thereof to county commissioner of registration or county board of elections.
Establishes a State aid program for charter school facilities.
Makes residential fire extinguisher requirement optional at municipal level.
Changes membership of Lake Hopatcong Commission and requires DEP to develop water level management plan for Lake Hopatcong to be approved by commission.
Provides for State assumption of the costs of the county prosecutors' offices.
Establishes pilot program in the Department of Law and Public Safety requiring the electronic recording of certain police interrogations.
Applies building code of New York City to World Trade Center, requires fire safety inspections.
Creates the Office on Women's Research and Policy and appropriates $150,000.
The "New Jersey Homeowners' Equity Protection Act."
The "Health Insurance Affordability and Accessibility Reform Act."
Establishes the Equity in Education program in DOE to finance school district initiatives that target segregation.
Requires certain financial institutions to disclose overdraft fees.
Authorizes proportional property tax exemption for honorably discharged veterans having a service-connected permanent disability.
Permits certain persons 70 and older to prove identity by affidavit for purpose of renewing driver's license.
Regulates pharmacy benefits management companies.
Revises provisions of the "Open Public Meetings Act" to ensure greater compliance.
Strengthens public disclosure and monitoring requirements of "Open Public Meetings Act".
Limits finance charge for personal lines insurance premium finance agreements to 14%.
Prohibits department heads in Executive Branch from taking unpaid leave to assist any candidates for election to public office.
Provides for residency requirement for administrative law and workers' compensation judges.
Regulates captive insurers.
Increases New Jersey Property-Liability Insurance Guaranty Association payment cap to $500,000; immunizes policyholders protected by association from certain liability.
Prohibits use of education and occupation as rating factors in automobile insurance underwriting.
Establishes the "Anti-Phishing Act."
Revises and expands New Jersey Trademark Anti-Counterfeiting Act.
Clarifies blight criteria under "Local Redevelopment and Housing Law," and prevents use of condemnation to acquire code compliant residential property under that law.
Appropriates $200,000 from "Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund" for grant to Save Ellis Island, Inc. to develop lands for recreation and conservation purposes.
Establishes the "Interstate Insurance Product Regulation Compact."
Prohibits use of insurance scoring by property-casualty insurers in rate-making for personal lines insurance coverage.
Provides that limitation on lawsuit option does not apply in accident caused by drunk driver.
Prohibits operating vehicle in unsafe manner likely to impede traffic or endanger person or property.
Establishes advocacy pilot program for mentally ill offenders.
Requires applicants for notary public commission to take course and pass written examination; requires applicants to submit to criminal history record background check.
Prohibits members of the Legislature from holding other elective public offices.
Doubles fines for certain motor vehicle offenses committed by operators of vehicles transporting hazardous materials.
Requires State to prepare gross income tax return forms for certain taxpayers.
Upgrades offenses of engaging in unauthorized practice of law; creates civil action; provides that persons convicted of the offenses are barred from appointment as a notary public. *
Requires inspection for carbon monoxide detectors whenever oil-fired or natural gas furnaces or water heaters are installed in homes.
Revises qualifications for licensure for land surveyors and for certificates of registration for surveyors-in-training.
Includes administrative law judges and workers compensation judges among persons permitted to solemnize marriages.
Expands wrongful death act to allow recovery for mental anguish, emotional pain and suffering, loss of society and loss of companionship.
Establishes penalties for use of bump key to commit certain crimes.
Terminates sick leave injury program for certain State employees injured after January 1, 2007 or expiration of current collective negotiation agreement.
Concerns priority of claims against certain insured tortfeasors as between insurer paying PIP benefits and injured party.
Provides for licensure of landscape professionals and registration of professional landscape businesses.
Requires licensure as insurance producer to sell certain funeral insurance policies; prohibits financing of certain preneed funeral arrangements with reverse mortgage.
"Steven's Law;" prohibits use of non-wood bats in certain organized games.
Creates local police officer and paid firefighter emergency registry.
Revises filing requirements for minor subdivisions.
Repeals traffic control signal monitoring system pilot program.

Provides a corporation business tax credit for contributions to support facilities construction, expansion, renovation and upgrade at New Jersey public and independent institutions of higher education.
Establishes fixed dates for employment contracts of certain State college professors and other employees.
Prohibits application of certain temporary "black" or "blue" henna tattoos.
Requires government records to be made available on the Internet.
Removes appropriations for gypsy moth suppression from the municipal expenditure cap and county and municipal tax levy cap.
"Ricci's Law;" revises ignition interlock device requirements for certain drunk driving offenses.
Requires MVC to notify Medicaid if driver's license of medical transportation services provider is suspended or revoked.
Requires simple majority for proposal to increase school tax levy above tax levy growth limit.
Expands area for designation of eligible neighborhoods under "Neighborhood Revitalization State Tax Credit Act."
Authorizes counties to participate in property tax appeals for real property having a value of $10 million or more.
Requires issuance of general permit for beach food and drink concession stands under certain circumstances pursuant to CAFRA.
Requires school districts to provide for the safe operation of electrically operated partitions in classrooms or other school facilities.

Requires guidance offered by Local Finance Board to members of local governing body employed by casino, or regarding casino employment of immediate family member thereof, be in form of public advisory opinion.
Allows construction of wind dependent energy facilities on piers within 500 feet of mean high water line of tidal waters.*
Establishes conflict resolution procedures through Department of Agriculture for complaints against commercial fishing docks and fish processing facilities.
Establishes minimum reimbursement amounts for medical transportation services under Medicaid.
Repeals restriction on weights and measures officers' and employees' duties.
Requires certain liability coverage, and offering of coverage, under basic and special private passenger automobile insurance policies.
Provides volunteer EMTs, volunteer firefighters mileage reimbursement; makes appropriations.
Exempts military personnel receiving combat zone pay from the gross income tax.
Requires 12-hour behind-the-wheel course for special learner's permit.
Prohibits the use of certain fishing gear on artificial reefs.
Criminalizes participation in criminal street gang.*
Exempts certain motor vehicle violations from the open public records law.
Provides for modification of child support and certain alimony payments due to changed circumstances.
Designates portion of State Highway Route No. 35 as "Chosin Few Memorial Highway."
Restricts conveyance of National Guard Training Center in Borough of Sea Girt, Monmouth County; requires study and public hearings before conveyance.
Allows planning and zoning board members to satisfy training requirements on Internet.
Authorizes special Gold Star Family license plates.
Concerns repayment of workers' compensation by pension recipients.
Appropriates $470,000 for Deal Lake maintenance projects.
Permits workers' compensation judges to close workers' compensation courts in times of severe weather.
Exempts certain small public utilities from prevailing wage requirements.
Decreases certain motor vehicle fines.
Excludes deferred compensation of certain public school and federal tax-exempt organization employees from current taxation under the gross income tax.
Indexes the maximum gross income tax deduction for homestead property taxes to certain changes in the State average residential property tax.

Requires public school districts to provide an annual, in-school community service opportunity for high school pupils; requires DOE to include community service statistics in annual school report card.
Revises Medicaid reimbursement methodology for certain special hospitals and specifies reimbursement methodology for certain group homes whose residents use the special hospital.
"Plastic Carryout Bag and Film Plastic Recycling Act."
Requires design of new public schools to incorporate green building practices. *
Establishes special license plates for members of the United States Armed Forces.
Creates crime of threatening the life of certain animals.
Defines exclusionary zoning for purposes of New Jersey constitutional obligation.
"Uniform Trust Code."

Revises laws governing provision of affordable housing; reestablishes regional contribution agreement as method of meeting affordable housing obligation; repeals Statewide non-residential development fee.

Exempts certain State authorities and local government contracting units from bidding requirements when goods and services are procured below prices available under State contract; modifies process for contracting through certain cooperative purchasing agreements.
Prohibits health care institutions from discharging medications into sewer or septic systems.
Requires insurance producers to notify Commissioner of Banking and Insurance of any disciplinary action taken by non-governmental regulatory authority.
Clarifies when penalty points are to be assessed for convictions of driving in an unsafe manner.
"Pharmacy Quality Improvement and Error Prevention Act."
"New Jersey Fair Debt Collection Practices Act."
Allows counties to establish emergency management registry for individuals with special needs.
Requires State and county offices of emergency management to designate critical infrastructure in need of emergency power generators.
Expands emergency operations plans to include care for domestic animals.
Establishes commission authorized to identify and locate emergency shelters.
Prohibits towing and transportation of boats during emergency evacuations.
Requires State and local emergency operations plans include provisions to address needs of families of emergency responders serving during a disaster or emergency.
Requires the State Police to implement reverse lane strategy on certain roads.
Provides for Statewide evacuation strategy for hospitals and other health care facilities.
Directs Office of Emergency Management to develop and undertake annual public awareness campaign concerning State's emergency coastal evacuation plan.
Establishes coastal operations team to review county evacuation plans.
Requires that newly built schools be constructed to serve as emergency shelters.
Permanently revokes license of health professional for illegal disposal of medical waste.
Revises laws relative to affordable housing.
Implements recommendations of the Assembly Coastal New Jersey Evacuation Task Force.
Increases certain penalties for vehicular homicides involving intoxicated drivers; designated "Josh's and Craig's Law."
Allows construction of wind dependent energy facilities within 500 feet of mean high water line of tidal waters under certain circumstances.
Provides automatic farmland assessment for owners of permanently preserved farmland.
Requires all automobile passengers to wear seat belts.
Permits transcript or videotape of testimony before local issuing authority to be admissible in ABC appeal.
Establishes a 1,000 foot drug free zone around playgrounds and other public parks, buildings and housing facilities.
Limits rent increases in certain low income rental projects financed by the New Jersey Housing and Mortgage Finance Agency.
Upgrades simple assault committed against domestic violence victims to aggravated assault.
Permits municipalities to transfer the responsibility for hiring adult school crossing guards to the local school district and any charter schools located in the municipality.
Requires written residential leases to be provided in both English and Spanish in certain municipalities.
Requires owner of multiple dwelling to eradicate infestation of bedbugs at own expense.
Allows firms, designated as qualified UEZ businesses, that experience economic hardship to lower employment levels without losing that designation.
Requires certain sanitation procedures for mattresses and product labeling regarding such procedures.
Requires ATM operators to disclose balance inquiry fees.
Requires installation of low-flow toilets and low-flow showerheads in multiple dwellings having 3 or more units.
Creates a credit card do-not-solicit list for certain persons.
Requires proof of firearms safety training as a condition for issuance of firearms purchaser ID cards and permits to purchase handguns.
Allows credit against certain charges to CATV customers opting out of premium service within 30 days of CATV company notice of network or programming change.
Requires licensed exterminators to provide warranty after extermination of bedbugs at residential premises.
Authorizes special license plates for county and municipal emergency management volunteers.
Prohibits imposition of sewerage service connection fee by regional sewerage authorities and public utilities upon certain municipalities and boards of education.*
Permits use of excess municipal construction code fee collections for property tax relief.
Establishes a random selection process for PERC arbitrators.
Requires certain arbitrators to file financial disclosure statements.
Prohibits sale and possession of certain air-powered pellet guns; prohibits fabricating and possession of certain altered firearms and toy guns.
Requires State Treasurer to disseminate information about organ and tissue donation; designates April each year as "Donate Life Month." *
Requires "just compensation" for condemnation of single-family residence to be based on cost of comparable relocation properties.
Prohibits municipal officers and employees serving on redevelopment or housing agencies from voting to condemn property.
Places temporary moratorium on use of eminent domain; creates Eminent Domain Study Commission to examine its use Statewide.
"Jessica Lunsford Act;" concerns sentencing of sex offenders and persons who harbor them; requires electronic monitoring for certain sex offenders and creates child protection zones.
Disqualifies member of board of education for conviction of certain crimes and requires member to undergo criminal history background investigation.
Provides that a homestead owner who is 65 years of age or older or disabled shall not receive a homestead rebate of less than $1,440.
Provides for a mandatory minimum term for assaulting a law enforcement officer.
Creates "Green E-ZPass" discounts for certain fuel-efficient vehicles.
Authorizes marriage and entry into a civil union by proxy for certain persons serving overseas in the Armed Forces or National Guard. *
Immunizes employers from civil liability for certain disclosures regarding employees and former employees.
Requires candidates for teacher certification to complete technology training program.
Eliminates imposition of sales and use tax on charges for initiation fees, membership fees, or dues for access to or use of certain health and fitness clubs and organizations.
Requires municipal court to hear certain violations of animal cruelty statutes within 14 days of the summons date.
Provides that records of convictions for carjacking, promoting prostitution of a child and certain child endangerment crimes shall not be expunged.
Clarifies that responsibility for investment of assets under management of Division of Investment vests in State Investment Council.
Provides for increase in allowance paid to veterans with certain wartime service-connected disabilities.
Requires payment of certain attorney's fees, expenses and costs in identity theft cases; adds debit card numbers to definition of "personal identifying information".
Requires insurers, Medicaid, and NJ FamilyCare to reimburse for childhood immunizations at levels specified by regulation.
Provides unemployment benefits for certain spouses of National Guard members.
Eliminates general purpose, supplemental and mansion realty transfer fees.

"New Jersey College Student and Parent Consumer Information Act"; requires each four-year public institution of higher education to provide on its website certain information regarding its costs, faculty, and graduation rates.
Designates "I'm From New Jersey" as State song.
Authorizes the issuance of restraining orders in situations where the domestic violence statutes do not apply.
Authorizes Commissioner of Education to increase the State share of certain county vocational school district school facilities projects.
Phases in official advertising rate increases; provides for biennial rate adjustments thereafter upon CPI changes.
Clarifies definition of illegal gambling to address Internet gambling; voids credit card debt incurred through illegal gambling; authorizes State to recover illegal gambling losses.
Requires contracting units and boards of education to credit contractors with interest earned on certain funds withheld from payment to contractors. *
Prohibits use of public funds by employers for certain employee influence activities.
Requires State designated children's hospitals to have Pediatric Emergency Physician on duty at all times in emergency department.
Prohibits certain persons convicted of certain crimes from serving as governmental affairs agents.
Permits conduct of lottery games on Internet.

Requires members of Legislature and officers and employees of Legislative Branch to disclose to Joint Legislative Committee on Ethical Standards when charged, indicted, or convicted of crime while in office or employment.
Increases compensation for persons wrongfully imprisoned.
Requires DHS to establish training, educational assessment, and remedial instruction programs, and minimum educational standards for staff at State psychiatric hospitals.
Upgrades certain sex crimes against minors.
Provides penalties for sexually offensive or abusive communication through social networking websites.
Bars certain officials from elective office and political activity for certain time periods.
Allows New Jersey gross income taxpayers to elect to deduct certain losses from certain investment arrangements discovered to be criminally fraudulent.
Limits NJBEST asset-based fees and requires that program offer multiple age-based investment options.
Revises State share calculation for debt service aid for new school facilities projects of county vocational school districts.
Requires disclosure of all fees and charges associated with prepaid debit cards on the package of such cards.
Facilitates the cooperation between certain major sports and entertainment venues.
Provides for no net loss of DEP lands for fishing, hunting, and trapping purposes.
Clarifies that Fish and Game Council has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Prohibits use of public funds for embryonic stem cell research.
Requires minimum geographic cost adjustment for school districts in certain counties.
Concerns affordable housing in the Highlands Region.
Prohibits State departments and agencies from considering or requiring compliance by Highlands planning area municipalities with Highlands regional master plan in certain circumstances.
Establishes "New Jersey Commission on Government Efficiency and Cost Control" to recommend measures for efficiency and cost reduction in State government.
Extends certain federal income tax advantages of individual health savings accounts to individual taxpayers under New Jersey gross income tax.
Expands range of local units eligible to join an insurance fund established by a municipality or county under certain circumstances.

Establishes Department of Economic Development and Regulatory Affairs; transfers certain functions, powers, duties, agencies, divisions, and other entities from other principal departments to Department of Economic Development and Regulatory Affairs.
Revises "Administrative Procedure Act" concerning socio-economic impact statements for proposed rule-making.
"Zero-Based Budget Act;" requires State Treasurer to develop and integrate certain zero-based budgeting practices and procedures in preparation and submission of Governor's annual budget message.
Revises Special Municipal Aid program.
Repeals law allowing PFRS member to retire with PFRS pension and continue to receive salary for current PFRS-covered elective office.

Renames Dept. of Agriculture as Dept. of Agriculture and Conservation; transfers certain agencies from other depts. to Dept. of Agriculture and Conservation; clarifies authority of Fish and Game Council.
Eliminates expansion of preschool education programs in "School Funding Reform Act of 2008."
Establishes in DEP the Environmental Science Review Board to review proposed environmental regulations for consistency with science.
Establishes in DEP the Environmental Policy Review Board to review proposed environmental regulations for consistency with planning policies.
Expands scope of review of Pension and Health Benefits Review Commission.
Requires certain public entities to issue requests for proposals for purchase of certain insurance products and services; requires disclosure of commissions paid.
Requires physicians to provide patients opportunity to undergo obstetrical ultrasound or sonogram within 48 hours of performing abortion.
Provides that sales by UEZ retailers of items delivered to location outside of the UEZ shall not qualify for partial exemption from the sales tax.
Prohibits Council on Affordable Housing from establishing affordable housing need and fees based on commercial and industrial development.
Clarifies the responsible planning entity for provision of fair share housing.
Removes authority of MVC to increase certain fees; sets certain fees by statute.
Requires managed care plans, SHBP, and SEHBP to provide for reasonable accommodation in accessing providers for persons with physical disabilities. **
Establishes Governor's authority over approval of minutes of certain regional commissions.
"State Authorities Reform Act."
Directs the Division on Women to conduct an audit of the coordination of community responses to domestic violence.
Requires managed care plans to pay health care claims based on assignment of benefits.
Establishes Task Force on Hospital Technology to recommend incentives to encourage hospitals to integrate technology to improve patient care and safety.
Requires in-network hospitals to notify patients of out-of-network health care professionals who provide services in hospital.
Revises procedures for municipal redevelopment programs; prohibits certain campaign contributions by redevelopers.
Curbs contributions by certain public contractors and certain developers; curbs contributions by county and municipal political party committees.
Eliminates 15% fee charged by cemetery company on transfer of graves, crypts and niches.
Permits NJ courts to not enforce defamation judgments from foreign countries under certain circumstances.
Requires each hospital board of trustees to adopt a written policy governing conflicts of interest.
Establishes "Bleeding Disorders Treatment Fund."
Enhances crime victims' rights under the "Crime Victim's Bill of Rights."
Increases and revises membership of New Jersey Cemetery Board.

Requires certain appointed public officials to work 35 hours or more per week to be eligible for PERS and SHBP; requires termination of PERS and SHBP participation of certain appointed officials whose term of appointment expires.
Provides alternative annual reorganization meeting date for county political committees if regular date coincides with period of religious observance.*

Requires additional public participation and health impact study as conditions of conversion of health service corporation to domestic stock insurer; dissolves the Health Service Corporation Conversion Temporary Advisory Commission. **
Provides support for obstetric services by certain health care facilities.
Specifies public members on Board of Medical Examiners and requires board to take certain actions to investigate licensees.
Requires each board of education to employ a certain number of substance awareness coordinators.
Extends eligibility for certain veterans' benefits to veterans who served in combat operations.
Permits certain vehicles operated by emergency response workers to use red lights and sirens.
Codifies relevant factors for hearings following custody determinations when one parent wants to move out-of-State with the children.
Makes it a disorderly persons offense to disrupt a funeral by picketing or conducting other protest activities within 300 feet.
Establishes requirements for non face-to-face sales of cigarettes and tobacco products.
Requires licenses to conduct business in tobacco products under the New Jersey Tobacco Products Wholesale Sales and Use Tax Act.
Creates New Jersey Public School Education License Plate.
"Hybrid Swimming Pool Heating Act."
Directs Secretary of Agriculture to determine annually areas for gypsy moth control measures and implement control measures; specifies State pay full implementation cost; appropriates $5,500,000.
Designates Grove of Remembrance at Liberty State Park as official State memorial; appropriates $90,000 for benches and maintenance.
Increases motor vehicle property damage reporting threshold to over $1,000.
Enhances penalties for provisional driver's license holders.
Increases penalties for underage drivers who have consumed alcohol.
Requires licenses for distributors, wholesalers and retailers to conduct business in tobacco products under the New Jersey Tobacco Products Wholesale Sales and Use Tax Act.

"Janet's Law"; requires public and nonpublic schools, recreational fields and youth camps to have defibrillators for youth athletic events, and public schools to train pupils in use thereof and in cardio-pulmonary resuscitation.
Requires that victims of sex offense be informed of offender's risk of re-offense upon release.
Establishes procedures to prevent and eradicate bedbug infestations in certain residential property.
Permits State aid to fund start-up costs for local shared services projects.
Concerns regulation of court reporting firms.
Restricts occupancy of dwelling unit in age-restricted community to older adults following resale.

Authorizes COAH to credit municipalities 1.5 units of fair share affordable housing obligation for each housing unit occupied by member of the armed forces or veteran; permits satisfaction of fair-share obligation through 20 percent set aside.
Concerns penalties for illegally passing school bus.
Prohibits release on bail of persons in the country illegally who are charged with crimes of the first or second degree or with two prior criminal convictions.
Requires person eligible for health care benefits from more than one public entity to choose coverage from only one.
Provides corporation business tax and gross income tax credits for certain businesses telecommuting program development and implementation costs.
Requires State agencies to adopt telecommuting programs and reports to be made on implementation of these programs.
Requires permanent driver's license suspension for third drunk driving offense.
Permits municipalities to enact ordinances regulating where sex offenders may reside.

Prohibits member of Legislature from holding local appointive office or position; removes provision allowing current members holding more than one elective position as of February 1, 2008 to continue to do so if service continuous.

Requires sewerage companies to provide metered service to certain single family, age-restricted community housing customers upon request; prohibits those companies from assessing charges for sewer service prior to providing such service.
"Safe Places Safe Kids Act;" makes it a crime to commit certain offenses in school zones and near playgrounds.
Establishes penalties for manufacture, purchase or possession of certain keys.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping for certain retired military personnel.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service, and their immediate family members.
Authorizes free admission to State parks and forests for retired veterans living in NJ and their immediate family members.
Imposes a two-year moratorium on increases in public utility rates.
Expands the list of crimes that may not be expunged.
Creates permissive county-based housing assistance program.
Protects property owned by military personnel and first responders from condemnation.
Provides that minimum local tax levy requirement will only be applicable to certain school districts.
Authorizes the executive county superintendent of schools to reduce the required local share of a non-operating district.
Increases the penalty for certain gang related crimes.
Requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on municipalities and counties.
Requires Commissioner of Education to compile and annually update list of all unfunded State and federal mandates on school districts.
Eliminates smoking ban exemption for casinos and simulcasting facilities.
Increases income threshold for qualifying for farmland assessment.
Requires presumption that any bail paid by defendant charged with certain weapons offenses will be in the form of full cash.

Requires nonpublic secondary schools and independent institutions of higher education to reimburse school districts for educational costs of students residing in tax-exempt housing and adjusts recipient districts' tax levy growth limit.
Concerning development subsidies and certain employment practices.
Clarifies factors used to determine when child support orders can be terminated.
Establishes employment goals and requirements for development subsidies.
Requires repayment of development subsidies in certain cases of failure to meet job creation or retention requirements.
Permits certain persons convicted of welfare fraud to be employed by a school district or a DOE supervised entity after proving rehabilitation.
Allows a candidate for a teacher certificate an exemption to the grade point average requirement under certain circumstances.
Reduces vesting requirement under State-administered retirement systems to five years' service.
Requires the Commissioner of Education to conduct site visits at least every other month during a charter school's initial year of operation.
Limits amount of time vacant teaching position can be filled by substitute teacher.
Makes changes to the School Ethics Act.
Prohibits possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages on private property by persons under legal drinking age.
Requires criminal history record check of school district volunteers.
Requires spousal consent to election of certain pension payout options under TPAF, JRS and PERS.
Permits counties to establish a central municipal drug court.
Limits annual fee increases in shared service agreement to 2 percent. *
Requires a public school district to provide a daily recess period for students in grades kindergarten through 5.
Prohibits smoking in certain outdoor public places.
Prohibits the use of simulated government documents in advertising.
Requires vehicle registration to contain issue date.
Regulates smoking in multiple dwellings; requires Commissioner of Community Affairs to promulgate construction standards for new multiple dwellings permitting smoking.
Requires installation of automatic rain sensors on lawn sprinklers on commercial, retail and industrial property.
Requires municipal certification of installation of automatic rain sensors on lawn sprinklers as condition of transfer of residential property.
Requires licensed home inspector to report an energy rating for each home inspected for buyer in contemplation of purchase.
Provides for submission to voters in each county a binding referendum on the establishment of a county administrative school district to govern and operate all public schools in the county.
Provides matching grant program for local governments to facilitate energy efficiency and conservation of resources in public buildings; appropriates $50 million.
Increases host community benefit for municipalities wherein solid waste transfer stations are located from fifty cents to one dollar per ton of solid waste processed at such facilities.
Clarifies that "airsoft" guns are firearms.
Establishes crime of removing federally required orange tip from toy gun; establishes crime of disguising a firearm by adding an orange muzzle tip.
"Reduce Plastic and Paper Bag Usage Act."
Imposes water consumption and diversion user fees to fund open space and farmland preservation projects.

Requires holding of binding Statewide referendum by county on whether responsibility for certain municipal functions should be assumed by county government; repeals various sections of law concerning transfer or termination of employees of terminated local health agency.
Requires electric power suppliers to pay retail power prices for purchase of certain renewable energy production.

Authorizes DOT, NJ Turnpike Authority, and South Jersey Transportation Authority to permit BPU-certified persons to install and maintain solar photovoltaic panels on noise barriers erected on roads and highways.
Establishes "Solar Roof Installation Warranty Program" in NJ EDA; appropriates $2 million from "Global Warming Solutions Fund."
Provides exemption from tax on sales of certain energy saving products and services purchased from businesses located in UEZ.
Authorizes creation of local renewable energy collaboratives and central renewable energy generation systems, and provides for sale of renewable power generation. *
Authorizes county regulation of fertilizer application.
Requires BPU to increase credit provided when issuing Solar Renewable Energy Certificates to owners using solar equipment manufactured in NJ.
Requires BPU to offer similar incentives to residents purchasing certain oil heating equipment as are offered to residents purchasing certain natural gas heating equipment.
Authorizes educational services commissions to purchase goods or services through nationally-recognized and accepted cooperative purchasing agreement.
Concerns regulation of paratransit vehicles and drivers transporting persons in wheelchairs.
Imposes certain conditions on NJPDES permit for energy generation facilities that withdraw water from, or discharge water to, a shallow lagoonal estuary.
Increases motor fuels tax and amount annually required to be credited to Transportation Trust Fund.
Permits voter registration at polling place on days of municipal, primary, and general elections.
Prohibits organized delivery systems from denying participation in network to imaging centers willing to meet terms of contract.
Establishes "Victim-Witness Scholarship Fund;" establishes "Witness Protection Fund;" and concerns State forfeiture funds.
Consumer Electronics Warranty Lemon Law.
Creates motor vehicle offense of smoking in motor vehicle with a child present and dedicates penalties to "Smoking Cessation Fund."
Removes two plenary retail distribution license limit for certain food stores and liquor stores.
Requires legal action against certain licensed persons to be brought within two years.
Requires landscape irrigation contractors to install backflow prevention devices under certain circumstances. *
Amends and supplements the "New Jersey Parentage Act;" requires blood and genetic testing under certain circumstances.
Limits amount of appeal bond in civil actions to the total value of the monetary judgment or $50 million, whichever is less.
Authorizes minor to consent to forensic sexual assault examination in the absence of parental consent if, in the judgment of health care professional, minor appears to have been sexually assaulted.
Directs executive county superintendent of schools to void as contrary to public policy any provision of school administrator contract that provides payment in event of district consolidation.
Expands availability of general development plan approvals and long-term vesting of preliminary and final site plan approvals in Smart Growth areas.
Permits retail dealer of motor fuel to sell motor fuel at price below retail dealer's net cost to meet competition.
Establishes early voting procedure for certain elections; makes appropriation.
Outlines procedures for conducting drug tests involving State law enforcement officers.
Prohibits stranger-originated life insurance contracts.
Provides for appointment to board of directors of New Jersey Automobile Insurance Risk Exchange by Commissioner of Banking and Insurance.
Permits the conversion of nonpublic schools into charter schools.
Permits Internet wagering at Atlantic City casinos under certain circumstances.
Permits wagering at casinos in person and through an account wagering system on certain professional and collegiate sport or athletic events.
Classifies burglary of a residence as a crime of the second degree.
Requires inclusion of certain types of drugs in public school instructional programs on nature of drugs and repeals inoperative statutes.
Requires health insurers, Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare to provide coverage for comprehensive program of pediatric feeding and swallowing services.

Establishes a program to provide college scholarships to the spouses and children of those killed, missing in action or disabled in Operation Noble Eagle, Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.
Requires DCA to promulgate certain fire safety regulations concerning furniture and furnishings purchased for use in residential premises and public buildings.
Requires adult corrections officers in-State facilities to complete in-service training program.
Provides for DCA to set maximum loan amounts to volunteer emergency service organizations to purchase vehicles and equipment.
Expands authority of emergency management departments in requesting assistance outside normal territorial jurisdictions.
Requires training for constables.
Establishes a Gun Court Pilot Program in Passaic County.
Extends eligibility for total property tax exemption to 100% disabled Cold War veterans; requires State to reimburse municipality for local tax revenue loss.
Establishes pilot program in Department of Education to provide instruction in personal finance to elementary school students.
Provides for forfeiture of vehicle where weapon was unlawfully possessed.
Expands eligibility for veterans' civil service preference; creates additional preference benefits.
Establishes grant program in DCA to provide funding to youth mentoring programs.
Requires MVC to provide information concerning Selective Service registration requirements.

Authorizes municipalities and fire districts to require physician's certificate as condition for service or continuing service by volunteer fire fighters; requires municipalities and fire districts to reimburse them for out-of-pocket costs.
Permits certain urban police training schools that train at least one class of recruits annually to continue operating.
Establishes scholarship program for law students to reward public service in the area of criminal reentry.
Eliminates certain prohibitions to expungements of criminal records.
Permits bid for public works contract to be withdrawn due to mistake in certain circumstances. *
Permits physicians and veterinarians to earn continuing education credits by providing certain free medical or veterinary services.
Authorizes central municipal court to hear cases brought by county office of consumer affairs.
Permits payments in subsidized adoption until child becomes 21 years of age under certain circumstances.
Concerns on-site generation facilities.
Revises the representation of proprietary schools on New Jersey Presidents' Council and on its executive board.
Creates program for installing standby emergency power generators in new senior housing.
Authorizes bars and restaurants to offer special discounts to certain persons under certain circumstances.
Establishes New Jersey General Accounting Office.
Increases penalties for harboring or concealing a sex offender.
Establishes a Medical Malpractice Court.
Limits contributions by certain public contractors; limits contributions by county and municipal political party committees.
Allows charitable contribution tax deductions under New Jersey gross income tax.
"The 10-20-Life Law."
"Judy and Nikki's Law"; provides for life imprisonment without parole for persons convicted of murder of a child 16 years of age or younger.
Requires notification of certain domestic violence victims through the Victim Information and Notification Everyday System (VINE).
Establishes new limits for campaign contributions by individuals, certain groups and campaign committees.
Requires sex offender's tier designation to be completed and reviewed by the court prior to release from incarceration.
Grants discretion to Parole Board in determining whether inmate should be released on parole.
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Act"; increases sentences for sex offenders and persons who harbor them.
Modifies calculation of adjusted tax levy for municipalities and counties to allow two-year levy cap banking and eliminate levy cap penalty when debt servicing expenditures are reduced.
Directs Attorney General to publicize information about human trafficking hotlines; mandates law enforcement training on responding to the needs of victims of the crime of human trafficking.

Authorizes county colleges and county vocational school districts to establish aviation related job certification, training, and internship programs and provides a corporation business tax credit for funds donated to support such programs.
Provides gross income tax exclusion for income earned in aviation related employment during or after qualified aviation related job training.
Amends "Law Against Discrimination" to provide every person engaged in raising a dog for guide or service the right to access public facilities.
Establishes crimes of dog fighting and leader of a dog fighting network; amends RICO to add leader of a dog fighting network.
Authorizes the court to include provisions for animals in domestic violence restraining orders.*

Establishes the "Safe Drop Off of Drugs Program" for the collection and disposal of unused prescription drugs and other medicines; authorizes use of recycling tax revenues for program; establishes Corporation Business Tax Credit for companies providing disposal.
Establishes Innovation zone program and creates innovation zone around Aviation Research and Technology Park in Atlantic County.
Designated "New Jersey Economic Development Promotion Act"; streamlines and reorganizes State economic development statutes in order to promote administrative efficiency.
Establishes the Garden State New Millennium Loan and Loan Redemption Program; appropriates $5,000,000.
Exempts veterans from $15 fee for open and competitive civil service examinations.*
Imposes realty transfer fee on certain transfers of apartments as well as commercial and industrial properties to finance municipal affordable housing projects.
Reduces drug free school and public property zones to 200 feet.
Revises law concerning disposition of assets of a county society for the prevention of cruelty to animals that has dissolved or has had its charter revoked, canceled, or suspended.
Changes membership of, and election process for, NJSPCA board of trustees.
Requires public notice of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey board meetings.
Requires certain ambulatory care facilities to provide services to patients without regard to ability to pay or source of payment.
Requires bicycle helmets for certain individuals.
Permits certain sheriffs to enforce truck weight limits.
Provides for increase in relocation assistance amounts based on increase of CPI.
The "New Jersey Self-Defense Law."
Prohibits employment and licensing background checks to go back further than seven years under certain circumstances.
Allows persons on parole and probation to vote; provides registration assistance to persons on probation, parolees, and persons completing sentences.
Requires prosecution of domestic violence-related cases in Superior Court; removes jurisdiction from municipal court.
Prohibits Medicaid from implementing broker system for medical transportation prior to receiving community input on proposed system.
Exempts persons engaged in braiding hair from cosmetology-hairstyling licensing requirements.
Establishes Task Force on the Production and Use of Cellulosic Biofuels.

Directs Chief Technology Officer in the Office of Information Technology to study and report potential benefits of expanding the use of electronic transactions, including the use of electronic signature and electronic record by the State.
Grants paid leave for certain firefighters who are affiliates of certain Black or Hispanic firefighters' associations to attend State or national conventions.
Expands membership of Police Training Commission to include representative from Northern New Jersey and South Jersey chapters of National Organization of Black Law Enforcement Executives.
Allocates Amistad Commission in the DOE, designates Commissioner of Education as chair and Secretary of State as vice-chair, and requires DOE to serve as staff.
Allows public contractors paying benefits to count benefit costs toward compliance with local "living wage" ordinances. *
Redirects appropriations in "Mortgage Stabilization and Relief Act" (2009) to provide more effective foreclosure relief to homeowners.
Requires fingerprinting for certain disorderly persons offenses.
Establishes pilot program in DEP for chemical cleanouts in schools.
Requires Executive Branch departments or agencies to notify Legislature of completion of certain draft school district audit reports and submit copy of final report to Legislature.
Authorizes special license plate for distinguished service medal recipients.
Permits undersheriff to perform administrative duties on behalf of county sheriff.
Requires DCF to provide information on home visitation resources and shaken baby syndrome to parents of newborn infants. **
Provides that information technology professionals who find child pornography on computers must report the finding to law enforcement.
Authorizes wiretap orders for investigation of luring or enticing a child, identity theft, stalking and harassment under certain circumstances.
Requires persons subject to Megan's Law registration to provide law enforcement with any Internet identifiers.
Establishes permissive inferences related to conduct that serves as predicate to sex offenses against minors.

Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Requires breath or blood sample to be obtained from driver involved in motor vehicle accident resulting in death or serious bodily injury.
Permits installation of GPS navigation devices which do not obstruct a motor vehicle operator's vision.
Requires Division of Taxation to display Senior Gold prescription program information on tax return instructions.
Authorizes companies under BPU jurisdiction to bill customers electronically upon customers' request.
Authorizes public providers of utility services to bill customers electronically upon customers' request.
Requires solar technology on certain State buildings where feasible.
Provides "Patriots Corner" tribute in State House to New Jersey residents serving in US Armed Forces, reserve components and New Jersey National Guard.
Establishes Apparel Procurement Board; sets standards for procurement of apparel by the State.
Requires State and county employees be New Jersey residents.
Requires DMVA, through State veterans service offices, to provide surviving beneficiary of deceased service member with comprehensive benefits packet.
Requires public institutions of higher education and Department of Military and Veterans Affairs' to include link on their websites for access to educational information. *

Requires member of New Jersey National Guard to apply for all tuition benefits available through U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs in order to qualify for tuition-free enrollment at a public institution of higher education.
Permits municipal or county Hispanic advisory commission to have more than five members.
Allows surviving spouses between 55 and 64 years of age to carry forward homestead property tax reimbursement of qualified deceased program participant.
Repeals New Jersey Turnpike Authority's authorization to build the Route 92 Freeway extension through Middlesex County.
Expands definition of "safe corridor."
Requires Turnpike Authority to prohibit cars on portion of NJ Turnpike dedicated to trucks and buses during certain times and under certain circumstances.
Requires the New Jersey Turnpike Authority to reduce toll rates for commercial trucks.
Requires federal transition funds received by State under Medicare prescription drug program to be used for purposes specified in federal law.
Prohibits campaign contributions by certain individuals, businesses or other organizations performing public contracts.

Directs ELEC to collect fees from certain firms that employ legislative agents; increases certain penalties imposed by ELEC and Executive Commission on Ethical Standards; dedicates funds to those commissions.

Appropriates $50,000 for feasibility study on construction of American Revolution Museum.

Requires greater disclosure for campaign advertisements broadcast within certain time periods prior to an election.

Creates Meadowlands Economic Development Trust; provides for sharing of tax revenues generated by developments of regional economic significance to improve local quality of life.

Exempts reconstruction, improvement or enlargement of hospitals and nursing homes from imposition of affordable housing fees; prohibits calculation of fair share obligation on same.
Provides bill of rights for persons receiving services under Congregate Housing Services Program.

Regulates operation of snowmobiles, all-terrain vehicles, and dirt bikes, and certain other vehicles and off-road vehicles; requires DEP to designate three sites on State-owned land where snowmobiles, all-terrain vehicles, and dirt bikes may be used.
Provides additional enforcement provisions under "Health Care Quality Act"; allows certain private causes of action for violations; expands administrative remedies; establishes enforcement fund.

Requires certain NJ Transit Corporation employees to undergo criminal history background checks and wear photo identification.

Requires chimney sweeps to be registered.
Exempts senior citizens and blind or disabled persons from certain realty transfer fees.

Restores fiscal integrity and enhances funding to Transportation Trust Fund.
Prohibits certain sex offenders from working in ice cream trucks and amusement parks.
Concerns telemarketing political calls.

Eliminates use of vaccines containing mercury over three years.
Establishes Autism Education Council.
Doubles amount of certain retirement income that may be excluded from gross income under the gross income tax.

Allows business tax credit to employers giving paid leave to employees for service with volunteer emergency services organizations.
Permits deferred payment for six months of financial obligation incurred by member of National Guard killed on active duty.
"Historic Property Reinvestment Act"; provides credits against certain taxes for certain costs of rehabilitating historic properties.
Requires certain health care facilities to adopt certain infection control strategies.
Requires Treasurer and Division of Pensions and Benefits and Investment Directors to report on status of State-administered pension plans to Legislature by May 15 and November 15 each year.
Directs MVC to implement certain State Auditor recommendations to enhance integrity of driver database.

Permits New Jersey Historic Trust to charge fees for publications and access to seminars; permits Trust to become tax-exempt charitable organization under section 501 (c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code.
Prohibits sale of products containing dextromethorphan to minors under 18 years of age.
Directs Medicaid to establish medical home demonstration project.
Requires State Treasurer to organize and publish certain contract and grant data and information on State expenditure Internet website.
Directs DHS to prepare plan to establish primary care case management pilot program.
Allows gross income tax deductions for contributions to the New Jersey Better Educational Savings Trust (NJBEST) Program.
Prohibits smoking at public parks and beaches.
Requires Commissioner of Education to determine if the estimated total costs of certain school facilities projects are reasonable.
Increases reimbursement rate for certain special education costs.
"Tax Preparers Licensing Act."
Eliminates downgrading of DWI offenses that occur more than 10 years after previous conviction.
Regulates Internet pharmacies and electronic prescriptions.
Authorizes creation of urban enterprise zones in Garfield, Harrison and Keansburg as well as a joint urban enterprise zone in Cliffside Park and Fairview.
Increases workers' compensation for loss of hand or foot.
Creates a Business Court.
Appropriates $6.2 million to DCA for payment to NJHMDC intermunicipal account.
Repeals cosmetic medical procedure gross receipts tax.
Removes limousine services from sales and use tax imposition.
Requires Police Training Commission to develop accelerated training course for certain corrections officers.

Increases penalties for counterfeiting if the offense creates risk of bodily injury, serious bodily injury or death; creates new offense within Criminal Code of counterfeiting products related to health.
Reduces municipal library tax levy cap from 15% to 4%.
Prohibits persons under age 19 from smoking or carrying a lighted tobacco product in an outdoor public place.
Permits State Lottery Commission to authorize video lottery terminals at Meadowlands horse racetrack, subject to voter approval.
Upgrades possession of child pornography to a crime of the third degree; provides for parole supervision for life for production and transmission of child pornography.
Revises law authorizing issuance of special license plates for street rods; extends authorization to replica custom vehicles.
Concerns school bus safety inspections.
Amends State fiscal year 2009 appropriations provision to remove prohibition on payment of scheduled salary increase for judges of the Division of Workers' Compensation.
"Garden State Film and Digital Media Jobs Act"; expands existing film and digital media production tax credit programs.
Changes the scope of public notification regarding contaminated site remediation.
Establishes a New Jersey Homebuyer Tax Credit Program under the New Jersey gross income tax for home purchases during a qualified period. *
Requires that each school district conducting an interscholastic athletic program must employ one or more school athletic trainers.

Provides for annual appropriation to NJ Sports and Exposition Authority of 50 percent of revenue from sales tax on admissions to and sales at new Meadowlands stadium to fund debt service, maintenance, repair, and replacement.
The "Fitness Professionals Certification Act."
Authorizes Chief Administrator of New Jersey Motor Vehicle Commission to issue permits for certain overweight trucks and charge fee for such permits.
Creates matching grant program in DCA to assist counties in retrofitting county parks to enhance usage by handicapped children; appropriates $525,000.
Waives fee for volunteers and affiliates of Big Brothers and Big Sisters of America to obtain State and national criminal history record background checks.
Requires managed care plans to allow any clinical laboratory to participate in provider network.
