Directs State acquisition of Troy Meadows Natural Area, Morris County, for recreation and conservation purposes and designates it as natural area and wildlife sanctuary.
Revises method of determining reimbursement costs when a law enforcement entity hires a recently trained officer from another law enforcement entity.
Decreases sales and use tax rate from 7% to 6%.
Provides for reduced sales tax imposition on certain sales in certain Highlands Region Preservation Area municipalities.
Directs NJ Sports and Exposition Authority to conduct feasibility study of Meadowlands convention center project.
Provides that committing a sex act with a minor constitutes sexual assault against the minor under certain circumstances.
"Transparency in Government Act;" provides for establishment of State public finance website; requires certain public entities receiving State funds to establish similar website. *
Directs AG to enter into memorandum of understanding with U.S. Attorney General empowering certain corrections officers to investigate immigration status of inmates.
Supplemental appropriation of $2.5 million to dredge Greenwood Lake in Passaic county.
Exempts construction, expansion or renovation of public institutions of higher education, public schools, and police and fire academies from "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Requires DHSS to study relationship between autism and ultrasounds and issue protocol for the use of ultrasounds.

Requires DOE to make certain determinations concerning the provision of educational services to a child residing in a domestic violence shelter and modifies calculation of tuition under certain circumstances.
Bars State from speculative investment of pension and annuity funds in oil futures.
"The New Jersey Healthcare Choice Act"; permits health insurers licensed in other states to provide coverage in New Jersey under certain circumstances.
Concerns dissolution of free public libraries.
Increases income eligibility limit for reduction or abatement of municipal or county utility authority fees.
Requires sex offenders in satellite-based monitoring program to pay for certain equipment and monitoring costs.
Authorizes use of retail coupons for purchase of milk by consumers.
Requires NJT to purchase alternative fuel vehicles.
Requires two-way communications equipment on school buses.
Authorizes certain municipalities to establish safety requirements for certain bars and taverns.
Requires health insurance coverage for hair headpieces for patients receiving chemotherapy treatment for cancer.
Expands DNA database to include samples from disorderly persons and certain violent arrestees.
Concerns lost or stolen E-ZPass transponders.
Prohibits purchaser of used motor vehicle from waiving dealer's obligation regarding emissions control equipment.
Prohibits motor fuel wholesaler from increasing price more than once in 24-hour period.
Changes from two to four number of consecutive general elections where more than 750 votes or less than 250 votes may be cast before election district is redrawn.
Waives commercial driver's license requirements for certain Office of Emergency Management drivers.
Requires 45 days' notice to affected municipalities of discontinuance of certain bus and train service.
Increases funding of Senior Citizen and Disabled Resident Transportation Program.
Prohibits use of wireless telephones or electronic communication devices by operators of public transit vehicles in certain situations. *
Expands permitted expenditures from Airport Safety Fund.
Requires notice of development applications be given to residential tenants on that property.
Removes geographic restrictions on where United States Park Police are authorized to make arrests for certain crimes and offenses.
Establishes new motorcycle safety provisions.
Expands DNA database to include samples from certain violent arrestees.
Prohibits certain elected officials and appointed officers from receiving dual health benefit coverage.
Limits payment to certain public employees for accumulated sick leave upon retirement; requires fine and reprimand or termination for violation of sick leave by public employee.
Prohibits simultaneous holding of certain State, county and municipal elective and appointive positions.
Provides for mandatory imprisonment and forfeiture of retirement benefits for public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes.
Clarifies that retention of unearned wages by a public servant is theft under certain circumstances.
Extends eligibility for veterans' property tax deduction to residents of continuing care retirement communities.
Revises certain provisions of farmland assessment law.
Provides full forfeiture of pension of elected or appointed official convicted of any crime touching office.
Establishes the "Corrupt Gains Restitution Act."
Enacts the "Jessica Lunsford Child Protection Zone Act."
Appropriates $3.567 million from Clean Waters bond fund for sewerage infrastructure improvements at former Marlboro Psychiatric Hospital. *
Prohibits use of "build-out" approach to determine fair share of affordable housing need in given region.
Amends the "Public Corruption Profiteering Penalty Act."
Offers surviving spouse of TPAF or PERS member with 25 or more years of service choice of deferred pension instead of current return of contributions and non-contributory life insurance.
Allows only one PERS-covered position for PERS membership, contributions and service credit; provides for PERS designation of maximum compensation position among multiple positions held.
Repeals "Statewide Non-Residential Development Fee Act"; prohibits COAH from basing prospective need portion of fair share obligation on commercial development.

Provides a gross income tax credit of up to $7,500 for qualified home purchases made by certain first-time homebuyers in the remaining portion of taxable year 2009, taxable year 2010 and taxable year 2011.
Provides gross income tax deduction for certain savings deposits and interest accrued thereon in the remaining portion of taxable year 2009, taxable year 2010 and taxable year 2011.
Exempts from sales tax for two years certain highly fuel efficient vehicles and energy efficient appliances. *
Reduces number of members serving on Casino Control Commission from five to three.
Reduces corporation business tax rate and provides an additional rate reduction for three years for taxpayers that relocate corporate headquarters to New Jersey.

"Tara's Law"; Establishes registry of offending community care residence providers and requires written monthly case manager reports of individuals with developmental disabilities residing in community care residences.
Concerns liability, standards of care, and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.
Revises Business Employment Incentive Program to spur economic growth.

Requires State Treasurer to issue cost benefit analysis and security report for conversion of military housing to civilian housing at Earle Naval Weapons Station and places moratorium on issuance of certain State permits and plan approvals.
Authorizes director of board of freeholders to exercise veto power over proposed actions of county authorities.
Raises minimum wage to $8.50, then makes annual adjustments based on increases in the Statewide average weekly wage.
Permits licensed dealers to display and auction firearms at fund raising events sponsored by certain tax exempt organizations.
Permits direct shipping of wine to New Jersey consumers; permits in-State wineries to ship to other states. *

Expands parity between certain State-chartered financial institutions, and permits interstate banking by such institutions through de novo branching or expanded authority to acquire existing branches or institutions.

Protects property taxpayers by requiring removal of certain property tax deduction and credit information from documents available for public inspection and provides for homestead property tax benefit in form of credit.

Requires executive county superintendent to designate a county special services school district, jointure commission, or educational services commission as the county education services agency to assist local school districts in sharing services. *
Requires local unit public employers to maintain and preserve retiree health benefits of PFRS retirees at least at the same level as provided at employee retirement.
Establishes county-based centers for transition for young adults with developmental disabilities.

The "Residential Property Lease-Purchase Act."
Mandates education program for "at risk" mortgage borrowers as condition for residential purchase or refinance.
Provides for licensure of elevator, escalator, and moving sidewalk contractors by State board.

Requires New Jersey DMVA to issue Cold War certificates to Cold War veterans.

Requires that extended terms be imposed on defendants serving sentences of parole supervision for life who subsequently commit any crime of the first or second degree.
Establishes new crimes concerning service dogs and upgrades crimes against certain other animals.
Increases the application fee and provides for an admission fee to pre-trial intervention; dedicates fee increase for victim services.
Chloe and Samantha's Law; requires notice to consumers of availability of products to prevent tip-over accidents involving certain furniture or televisions.
Permits agreement by taxpayer and municipal tax assessor to modify an assessment to correct errors in certain circumstances.
Clarifies definition of "primary care" in Primary Care Physician and Dentist Loan Redemption Program to include practice of geriatrics.
Excludes veteran disability compensation from income qualification limits under homestead property tax reimbursement program.
Provides certain veteran benefits to veterans of the global war on terror conflicts and those of certain military engagements served during certain periods.
Establishes criminal offense of animal cruelty in the presence of a child.
Establishes Office of Agricultural Water Usage Assistance and requires DEP to consult with that office regarding water usage certification for farmland.
Exempts veterans from $25 fee for appointment or renewal as a notary public.
Authorizes free hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses and free admission to State parks and forests for individuals with certain types of military service.
Directs New Jersey Turnpike Authority to designate Garden State Parkway as memorial highway to POW-MIA's.
Increases membership of Fish and Game Council and clarifies it has sole authority to regulate freshwater fishing, hunting, and trapping.
Prohibits use of certain underwriting guidelines by insurers pertaining to guide dogs, service dogs, or hearing assistance dogs harbored on the insured property.
Permits in-person wagering at casinos and horse racetracks on results of professional sports events, subject to voter approval.
Establishes animal hoarding as a criminal and civil animal cruelty offense.
Permits public employees to waive enrollment in State-administered pension systems and elect enrollment in Defined Contribution Retirement Program.
Removes licensing requirement for recreational bingo games.
Expresses additional rationale for existing statutory prohibition of self-service dispensing of motor fuel at service stations.
Allows representation on receiving district boards of education for certain sending school districts.
Prohibits certain unsolicited political calls by political organizations or candidates to persons in this State.
Concerns recorded telephone messages.
Prohibits BPU from exercising authority over utility service extensions in manner which creates cost differentials that distinguish among persons or localities based on location of such extensions.

Allows certification of a qualified UEZ retailer as a business, notwithstanding that it sells items out of stock at time of purchase at a UEZ location and later mails them to purchaser from another location.
Expands "Jersey Fresh" program to include "Made With Jersey Fresh" designation of certain baked goods and other food products.*
Requires DEP to submit annual financial report on status of certain fund balances.
Changes perimeter for bow and arrow hunting around occupied building.
Clarifies failure to provide minimum care to an animal constitutes animal cruelty.
Establishes criminal and civil penalties for transmission of certain commercial electronic mail messages.
Concerns violations of the moratorium on taking, landing, or possession of horseshoe crabs.
Prohibits telecommunications, utility or cable television companies from charging certain customers prior to actual billing due date.
Revises moratorium on taking, landing or possession of horseshoe crabs or the eggs of horseshoe crabs.
Provides annual salary supplement for teachers earning National Board certification; appropriates $500,000.
Establishes that board of fire commissioners provide emergency medical services to areas encompassing each fire district.
Establishes "New Jersey Veterans' Hospital Task Force."
Clarifies that animal cruelty investigations may be conducted by county sheriff's office; appropriates $100,000.
Retitles State correction officer as State correctional police officer; clarifies law enforcement powers.
Excludes veterans' entitlements from income for determination of PAAD eligibility.

Revises animal cruelty offenses concerning abuse, abandonment, neglect, and improper euthanizing of animals, increases criminal and civil penalties therefor; establishes such penalties for new offenses; repeals conflicting sections of law.
Revises animal fighting laws; increases existing, and establishes new, penalties.
Requires issuance of construction permits for installation of wheelchair ramps on residential real property within 3 business days of application.
Places 2-1/2 percent limit on annual increases on municipal service fees imposed on manufactured homes in mobile home parks.
Permits municipalities to contract with animal and humane societies which engage in animal foster care.
Creates "Real Property Revaluation Review Commission."
Requires all able-bodied Work First New Jersey recipients to perform community service.
Prohibits certain unsolicited checks.
Requires health insurers to cover Lyme disease.
Requires newly hired State employees be New Jersey residents.
Prevents intoxicated employees from receiving workers' compensation.
Prohibits nonrenewal of homeowners insurance policies based on proximity to water or risk of windstorm related claims.
"Breann's Law" requires health insurers, the State Health Benefits Program and NJ FamilyCare to provide "out of network" coverage for children with catastrophic illnesses.
Requires State to reimburse counties and municipalities for salary and fringe benefit costs of employee on official leave of absence for military service in war on terror; makes an appropriation.
Requires public and nonpublic high schools to have person trained in cardio-pulmonary resuscitation on site at all school athletic events and practices.
Establishes criteria for State recognition of Native American tribe.
Concerns environmental permits in low-income, minority communities.
Requires DOC to transfer certain payments of restitution to VCCA.
Provides enhanced penalties for drunk drivers with blood alcohol concentration of 0.17% or greater.
Decreases certain public document copy fees; amount of fee dependent upon whether letter size page or legal size page. *
Limits amount of contribution to legal defense fund of holder of elective public office and requires reporting thereof to ELEC.
Requires disclosure of campaign contributions received or expenditures made by individual seeking election as political party committee officer.

Requires governmental affairs agents retained by government entities to file certain reports with ELEC; requires certain government entities retaining governmental affairs agents to file annual reports with ELEC.
Permits small, women or minority owned businesses located in designated regional centers to qualify for loans from EDA as if located in designated urban center.
Reduces number of reports and publications printed by State; provides for most to be available primarily on Internet; requires notice of availability of reports and publications. *
Adds two members to NJ Commission on American Indian Affairs.
Requires security guards at institutions of higher education which do not employ police officers to immediately report crimes committed on campus to the local police department.
Designates highway ramp off of State Highway Route No. 23 at Alps Road in Wayne Township as "Gregory F. Velardi, Sr., Ramp."
Extends eligibility for N.J. World Trade Center Scholarship Program to dependents and spouses of persons totally and permanently disabled as a result of exposure to the attack sites.
Authorizes institutions of higher education to grant college credit to high school students who complete the Jersey Boys State or Jersey Girls State program.
"New Jersey G.I. Bill"; provides higher education benefits to New Jersey veterans.
Requires replacement of door and ignition locks on county and municipal vehicles prior to sale.
The "New Jersey Bleacher Safety Act."
Exempts municipal clerk from penalties for Open Public Records Act violations under certain circumstances.
Permits municipalities to offer prescription drug benefit to certain retired volunteer firefighters and other emergency aid volunteers.
Imposes fine on owner of dog which attacks or otherwise interferes with guide or service dog.
Requires municipalities that receive State aid to certify that all municipal buildings adhere to fire codes.
Provides certified municipal fire inspectors and fire officials having more than four consecutive years service with tenure in office.
Waives fee to obtain State and national criminal history record background checks for volunteers and affiliates of certain organizations.
Removes income limit for eligibility to receive homestead property tax reimbursement.
Establishes free smoke detector program in DCA.
Provides credit under corporation business tax and gross income tax for marinas and boatyards that follow certain environmentally sound management practices.
Prohibits Pinelands Commission from requiring pinelands development credits for the construction of development project that includes affordable housing.
Prohibits DEP from mandating public access to tidal waterfront areas adjacent to critical infrastructure or requiring the purchase or improvement of off-site locations for this purpose.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts.
Removes certain employed family members from unemployment insurance exemption.
Requires certain veterinarians to provide written notification to animal owner if boarded animal will not be subject to 24-hour supervision; "Betsy"s Law."
Eliminates supplemental realty transfer fee.
Exempts senior citizens and blind or disabled persons from certain realty transfer fees.
Extends the estate tax to the real and tangible property of nonresident decedent estates located in New Jersey.
Extends certain benefits to members of U.S. Reserves and State organized militia who serve at least 180 continuous days.
Concerns unemployment benefits for corporate owners and officers.

Permits municipalities to impose additional requirements on landlords of rental property that is the subject of complaints concerning certain conduct in 12-month period; assesses penalties under certain circumstances.
Creates exception to age requirement for power boat operation conducted during authorized race.
Expands authorization for use of dealer and temporary license plates and establishes fines for their misuse.
Requires local unit or authority to provide director of the Division of Local Government Services with report concerning law suits to which it is a party before budget is approved.

Requires municipalities eligible for Special Municipal Aid to submit budgets for special improvement districts and municipal public benefit corporation for DCA review, requires State Comptroller conduct audits of municipalities receiving aid.
Creates cause of action for failure to maintain certain vacant properties; requires out-of-state creditors to designate in-State representative.
Establishes Disparity in Treatment of Persons with Disabilities in Underrepresented Communities Commission in DCA.
Provides surviving spouses of certain fire and police personnel who die in line of duty with workers' compensation for entire period of survivorship.
Removes confidential employee status of certain Casino Control Commission employees.
Concerns access to wage records in connection with projects subject to prevailing wage requirements.
Prohibits unilateral changing of terms and conditions of employment by public employers.
Empowers federal air marshals to make arrests for certain violations of New Jersey law.
Prohibits possession of ammunition capable of penetrating body armor.
Appropriate $75,000 to DMVA for recreational purposes at NJ veterans' memorial homes.
Revises Newborn Screening program in DHSS.
Allows corporation business tax credit for full cost of purchasing portable defibrillators.
Restricts sale or lease of certain ultrasound equipment.
Directs the BPU to establish certain energy-conservation programs.
Decreases certain motor vehicle fines and lengthens time to provide proof of insurance.
Provides for State income tax deduction to private well owners for water testing costs.
Exempts from commercial and industrial property taxation the value of new capital improvements for security enhancement purposes.
Requires DEP to establish certification program for septic system inspectors.
Creates New Jersey World War II medal; appropriates $5,000.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for the NJ World War II Veterans' Memorial Fund.

Establishes annual sales tax holiday during first weekend of August for certain retail sales of computers, school computer supplies, school supplies, school art supplies, and school instructional materials.
Requires mandatory sexual violence training for law enforcement, judicial and prosecutorial personnel.
Allows certain members of PFRS to serve until age 70 upon approval by municipal governing body.
Prohibits investment of certain public funds in companies doing business in countries that sponsor terrorism.
Grants certain leaves of absence for Vietnam Veterans of America conventions.
Requires HIV testing for pregnant women and marriage license applicants.
Grants roadside diesel bus and truck emissions inspection authority to municipal police; grants authority to police for random inspections for size and weight.
Exempts certain motor vehicle repair dealers from consumer fraud law and regulation under certain circumstances.
Requires ATM facilities to be equipped with access to emergency telephone service.
Establishes "William's Law," pertaining to pool safety.
Repeals the New Jersey estate tax.
Authorizes Boy Scouts license plate.
Enhances penalties for driving when license revoked.
Provides immunity for police officers who are subjects of certain disciplinary and administrative hearings.
Permits certain retired law enforcement officers to possess hollow nose ammunition.
Authorizes paid leaves of absence for certain delegates of employee organizations representing corrections officers when attending conventions.
Eliminates certain components of realty transfer fee.
Requires newly hired State employees be New Jersey residents.
Makes position of treasurer of school moneys optional.
The "New Jersey Health Insurance Exchange Act."
Requires special automobile insurance policies to provide liability coverage for property damage in certain circumstances.

Prohibits public colleges from charging tuition to students who are parents, spouses or children of those killed, missing in action or disabled in Operation Noble Eagle, Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.
The "South Jersey Regional Veterans' Health Care Facility Grant Fund Act."
Provides that gift certificates, prepaid bank cards and gift cards shall not expire or contain dormancy fees.
Provides fair standards for elections and recall of officers for homeowners' associations.
Assures workers' compensation benefits to police, fire and emergency personnel rendering aid under certain emergency circumstances.

Extends limit for nonpublic school busing to 30 miles in Atlantic, Burlington, Cape May, Cumberland, Gloucester, Hunterdon, Ocean, Salem, Sussex, and Warren Counties, and requires existing bus stops to be used.
Prohibits an executive county superintendent of schools from eliminating a nonoperating school district if its elimination would result in a property tax increase.
Provides procedure for municipality acquiring school property from non-operating school district following merger to extinguish restrictive deed covenant.
Phases out sales and use tax imposed on charges for certain initiation fees, membership fees and dues.
Requires corrections officers be notified when inmates test positive for certain communicable diseases.
Requires State Auditor review of certain Department of Corrections privatization contracts.
Provides unemployment insurance benefits for shared work programs; requires Department of Labor and Workforce Development report.*
Requires insurers which provide prescription drug benefits to cover costs of medications for treating sickle cell anemia.
Requires health care providers to obtain informed consent from patients for use of certain reprocessed medical devices.
Requires certain persons seeking license to operate facility to provide magnetic resonance imaging services to undergo criminal history record background checks.
Requires health insurers to offer benefits for dose-intensive chemotherapy/bone marrow transplants and umbilical cord blood transplants for treatment of sickle cell anemia.
Requires that one member of the State Board of Medical Examiners be a practicing podiatric physician.
Allows certain National Guard and United States Reserve members on federal active duty to receive temporary suspension of payment of interest on mortgage loan.
Requires cost analysis in certain cases when State department contracts out work.
Requires public institutions of higher education to advertise for bids prior to awarding contracts for professional services.
Provides State, county, municipal, and school district contracts for professional services will be publicly bid.

Provides for the election of school board members at November general election and eliminates vote on school budgets except for separate proposals to spend above cap which will also occur at general election.
Increases mandatory minimum prison term for certain crimes involving firearms and designated as Tamrah's Law.
Directs the BPU to determine whether the electric generation service market in this State is competitive and to submit a report to the Governor and the Legislature.
Prohibits investment by State of pension and annuity funds in hedge funds and derivative contracts.
Authorizes the court to issue restraining orders to defendants charged with a crime as a condition of release on bail.
Criminalizes driving under the influence with person 17 years of age or younger in vehicle.
Requires the placement of defibrillators on certain trains.
Requires NJ Commission on Science and Technology to establish a science and technology business assistance service.
Provides that receipt of public pension or retirement allowance will be suspended during reemployment with public employer; allows enrollment in DCRP based on such reemployment.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of certain Energy Star labeled residential lighting and appliances.
Exempts from sales and use tax all hybrid and certain highly fuel efficient motor vehicles.
Clarifies penalties for trespassers who damage farmland and crops with all-terrain vehicles and snowmobiles.
Prohibits contracts of executive directors of housing authorities from including incentive bonuses for certain achievements.
Requires certain public restrooms to be equipped with baby-changing stations.
Supplemental appropriation of $5 million to DHS to develop community residences for Division of Developmental Disabilities clients on the waiting list.
Restricts gifts to certified homemaker-home health aides from patients.
Requires home health agencies and health care service firms to place certified homemaker-home health aides to perform certain home-based services.
Requires retail establishments to allow individuals with certain medical conditions access to employee restrooms.
Requires municipalities to reimburse qualified private communities for street paving costs.
Requires Family Part under certain circumstances to dispose of charge of contempt of a domestic violence order on an emergency basis, without setting bail.
Requires each school district to adopt a dating violence policy to prevent and address incidents involving dating violence.
Provides for educational stability of children placed in resource family homes and that school district of residence for the child shall be present district of residence of parent or guardian.
Regulates physician profiling programs used by managed care networks.
Enacts "Truth in Caller Identification Act"; prohibits manipulation of certain telephone caller identification information.
Expands scope of New Jersey Regulatory Flexibility Act dealing with economic impact of rules on small businesses.

Extends requirement of wastewater management planning agencies to establish or update wastewater management plans, and extends validity of sewer service areas and wastewater service areas, until April 7, 2011.
Extends expiration date of special appraisal process for Green Acres and farmland preservation programs from 2009 to 2014.
Prohibits individual from holding simultaneously more than one elective public office.
Requires all campaign contributions to be reported to ELEC.
Prohibits good faith allegations of child abuse from being used against the accuser in a child custody proceeding; makes it a disorderly persons offense to file a false allegation of child abuse.
Renames "New Jersey Trauma Center" at University Hospital as "Eric Munoz Trauma Center."
Establishes "Government Functions and Services Study Commission."
Increases amount of Transportation Trust Fund monies that may be used for salaries and overhead of DOT and NJT.
Requires municipality to comply with State audit prior to receiving State aid.
Requires policy on use of alternative dispute resolution for State agencies; expands duties of Dispute Settlement Office of Department of Public Advocate.
Increases loss ratio reporting and disclosure requirements for carriers offering individual and group health insurance plans; applies loss ratio requirement to large group health insurance plans.
Provides premium assistance to certain small employers who purchase health benefits plans; appropriates $10 million.
Allows health maintenance organizations to include charity care assessments for purposes of meeting certain loss ratio requirements.
Concerns the delivery and oversight of coverage under certain health benefits plans; establishes Health Care Patient Ombudsperson.
Revises law concerning meetings of public bodies to provide greater public access to meetings and to information about meetings.
Makes certain changes to open public records act; formally names open public records act "Martin O'Shea Open Public Records Act."
Revises statutes concerning permissible length of time between certain public questions in certain municipalities.
Excludes certain stable stall rentals from sales and use tax imposition and provides sales and use tax exemption for sales of equine-related services.

Re-establishes State Board of Education as the rule-making authority under several school district accountability statutes and reinstates its role in considering appeals from any Commissioner of Education determination.
Encourages purchase of "Jersey Fresh" and other NJ agricultural products by State agencies, departments and facilities.
Exempts contaminated and industrially-zoned sites from affordable housing rules.
Establishes task force to study treatment of veterans diagnosed with post traumatic stress disorder in judicial proceedings.
Requires MVC to license certain mobile auto body shops.
Requires voter registration forms be made available when applying for hunting, fishing, or trapping license.
Requires Department of State to establish and maintain a website to provide a clearinghouse of information for nonprofits.
Provides for minor and her child to remain together as family unit in DYFS placement.
Prohibits State agencies from including advertisements in mailings to public.
Etablishes a direct taxpayer property tax relief subaccount to ensure that revenue from the "millionaire's" tax increase is dedicated for real property tax relief directly for taxpayers.
Requires textbook publishers to provide public institutions of higher education with information on price and availability of textbooks.
Bars the disclosure of personal identifying information of grand jury witnesses except for name; creates a fourth degree offense for attorney disclosure.
Authorizes public institutions of higher education to establish textbook rental programs.
Revises eligibility for expungement of criminal records.
Requires superintendent to assume responsibilities of principal in certain school districts.
Expands gun court pilot program to include counties with municipalities participating in Operation CeaseFire.
The "Owners' Rights and Obligations in Shared Ownership Communities Act."
Requires staff of shelters for victims of domestic violence and emergency shelters for homeless to undergo criminal history record background checks.
Requires boards of education to provide certain nutritional information for food and beverage items offered for sale in school cafeterias.
Eliminates DCF from licensure as approved adoption agency.
Allows tax credit to health care professionals for expenses to achieve accessibility for persons with mobility impairments.
Prohibits cemetery company from charging additional fee for rendering certain services on Sunday.

Directs the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association to waive 365-day period of ineligibility for interscholastic sports upon an affirmative demonstration that the transfer is for non-athletic reasons.
Requires insurers and State health care coverage programs to cover cost of HPV vaccine.
Requires health insurers and SHBP and SEHBP to provide coverage for screening for cervical cancer, including testing for HPV.
Requires retail pharmacies to stock and dispense emergency contraception.
Provides for establishment of county offices for disability services; appropriates $90,000.
Establishes "Domestic Violence Health Care Response Act."
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society.
Requires retailers to post warnings of lead poisoning from improper paint removal.
Allows application for PERS accidental disability benefit for injury sustained while employed at State psychiatric institution or correctional facility immediately prior to PERS membership.
Requires Medicaid, NJ FamilyCare and SHBP and SEHBP to cover cost of HPV vaccine.
Increases health benefits continuation coverage from 18 months to 36 months for certain persons covered under certain small employer health benefits plans.
Clarifies goal of domestic violence public awareness campaign pertaining to risk factors; requires public awareness notices include language used by substantial segments of local populations.
Makes various revisions to laws regulating certain health benefits plans.
Requires certain cemeteries to accept Work First New Jersey and SSI allowance for burial expenses.
Requires officers and employees of political subdivisions to contribute a portion of their base salary towards the cost of their health care coverage.

Requires State-administered pension systems to train employers on enrollment requirements; requires employers to certify validity of employee enrollment with acknowledgement of penalty for providing false information. *
Requires causes of driver inattention to be noted in traffic accidents.
Establishes Electronic Health Information Technology Fund.
Concerns gender equity in the workplace. *
Requires Attorney General to provide certain information regarding certain charitable organizations to public on Internet.
Requires health insurers to cover medically necessary expenses for preventing infertility in women undergoing chemotherapy or radiation therapy.
Revises criminal history record check process undergone by public and nonpublic school employees and school bus drivers.
Allows adoptees access to nonidentifying family medical history information.
Provides DYFS caseworkers with personnel and law enforcement assistance when conducting DYFS investigations.
Authorizes Parole Board and sheriff's offices to hire alternate route trained police officers; exempts alternate route trainees from certain civil service requirements.
Permits removal of State board, commission or independent authority member for failure to attend three consecutive meetings thereof without good cause.
Requires health insurers SHBP, Medicaid, and NJ FamilyCare to provide coverage for ancillary medical services in connection with outpatient diagnostic screening and surgical intervention services.
Requires the State and local contracting units to purchase biodiesel or biodiesel blended fuel manufactured in NJ.
Requires water purveyors to develop and implement a drought interconnection system.
Establishes "New Jersey Property Assessment Clean Energy (NJ PACE) Municipal Financing Program."
Provides civil service preference to veterans of Operation "Noble Eagle."
Concerns contributions to special funds made through the gross income tax return.
Clarifies deadline to request mail-in ballot application.
Requires State Soil Conservation Committee to adopt standards concerning soil restoration measures. *
Establishes standards for certain fertilizer applications, provides for certification of professional fertilizer applicators, and regulates sale and labeling of certain fertilizers.
Requires certain employers to plan and implement traffic reduction programs for employees.
Requires State entities to purchase biofuels in place of fossil fuels when reasonable, prudent and cost effective. *

Requires specific reduction of sulfur content in heating oil, and scheduled increase of blending biofuels therein after July 1, 2011, unless requirements are waived by Governor pursuant to Executive Order.
Clarifies that motor vehicle rental companies may recover, through a "vehicle registration recovery fee" separately stated in rental agreement, certain costs of doing business.
Prohibits display of signs on any public property or highway.*
Transfers Juvenile Justice Commission to in, but not of, Department of Children and Families.
Makes supplemental appropriation of $100,000 for FY2010 to Kean University to fund the Wynona M. Lipman Ethnic Studies Center.

Establishes a loan redemption program for teachers under which they are permitted to redeem loan amounts received under the New Jersey College Loans to Assist State Students Loan Program through employment in public schools in New Jersey.
Prohibits posting of certain personal information on the Internet or misrepresentation of identity on the Internet for the purpose of harassment of a minor child.
Creates State contract set-aside program for businesses owned and operated by disabled veterans.
"One Strike, You're Ours;" adds use of Internet as aggravating factor in child sex crimes and requires lifetime electronic monitoring of offender.
Extends burial of indigent veterans to those who did not serve in time of war; clarifies role of DMVA in identifying deceased veterans; provides additional funding for burial of indigent veterans.
Provides additional penalties for certain crimes involving cemeteries and other property.
Requires the Attorney General to issue uniform guidelines regarding release of arrest information to media.
Excludes financial benefit received by volunteer emergency responder from gross income.
Makes certain repeat offenders ineligible for parole.
Permits surety companies to issue blanket bonds for municipal treasurers and tax collectors, and municipal court judges and administrators.
Exempts use of citizen's band and two-way radios by operators of commercial motor vehicles from prohibition on use of hand-held wireless telephone or electronic communication devices while driving.
Establishes Rutgers Scarlet "R" license plate.
Requires all wireless telephones and electronic communication devices issued by public entities to be activated to receive Amber Alerts.
Prohibits certain television set sales without offering for sale, in television set sales area, related safety devices; prohibits certain televisions set sales without securing sets on display.
Regulates the sale and possession of body armor.
Establishes innovation zone program and creates innovation zone around Aviation Research and Technology Park in Atlantic County.

Makes public officers or employees convicted of certain crimes or found at fault in certain civil actions liable and subject to pension garnishment for public legal expenses and illegally obtained funds.
Allows judgment for restitution of stolen public funds to be levied against convicted employee's retirement allowance or pension contributions.
Allows members of PERS Prosecutors Part to purchase credit in Prosecutors Part for previous prosecutor service credited as regular PERS service.
Increases health benefits continuation coverage to 36 months for certain persons covered under certain employer health benefits plans.
Allows gross income tax credit for twenty-five percent of adoption expenses incurred by taxpayers filing individually earning less than $75,000 and those filing jointly earning less than $150,000.
Provides for interest and enforcement mechanism for qualified private community to collect annual reimbursement payments from municipality.
Limits job creation estimation under COAH regulations for warehousing activities.
Establishes innovation zone program to stimulate technology industry clusters around New Jersey's research universities, colleges or research hospitals.
Prohibits insurers offering managed care plans from denying participation in network to health care providers willing to meet terms of contract.
Excludes from State gross income tax certain payments made to the families of victims of school violence.
Provides for collection of DNA samples to assist in the prosecution of sexual assault.
Authorizes display of flashing amber warning lights on sanitation vehicles.
Provides two-year window for persons to transfer, render inoperable or surrender assault firearm.
Requires three-day attorney review period for residential leases.
Requires employers to verify employment eligibility of new employees and prohibits employment of unauthorized aliens.
Permits municipalities hosting UEZs to establish set-aside programs favoring local businesses for construction projects using State funds.
Revises laws concerning local redevelopment, relocation assistance and eminent domain.
Allows security officer applicant to demonstrate rehabilitation if previously convicted of crime.
Requires State agencies to submit notice of request for proposals or other documents pertinent to privatization contracts to certain State employees.
Establishes guidelines for creditworthiness determinations concerning affordable housing programs.
Appropriates $7.5 million of Powerball lottery game proceeds to extend Part-Time Tuition Aid Grant Program from county colleges to all colleges.
Expands the Tuition Aid Grant program to part-time undergraduates.

Mandates that certain personnel critical to certain State finance and revenue generating activities are essential employees during a declared State government shutdown due to failure to enact an annual appropriation act.
Allows municipalities to provide free or reduced fee beach badges to active military and NJ National Guard personnel.

Includes limitations on amount of retirement compensation which may be provided by a school board in the employment contracts of superintendents of schools, assistant superintendents of schools, and school business administrators.
Prohibits housing allowance in contract between State Board of Education and State district superintendent.
Requires motorists operating vehicles to maintain minimum three foot safety distance when overtaking bicycles.
Allows two elected members of pension commission of closed Hudson County Employees' Pension Fund to be active county employee or retired county employee.
Limits hospital charges for care provided to county inmates at county correctional facilities to Medicaid rate.
Authorizes creation of local gypsy moth control commissions.
Establishes fine for committing motor vehicle offense that results in collision with bicyclist.
Provides one-third of motor vehicle fine moneys generated through State Police issued tickets go to municipality where violation occurred.
The "Smart Container Act."
Requires for-profit hospitals to report certain information to DHSS.
The "Real Estate Installment Contract Act."
Establishes crime of entering into certain restricted airport areas.
Directs Motor Vehicle Commission to establish a regional service center in a city of the first class.
Requires county prosecutor to determine and report to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement whether persons held for certain violent crimes are lawful residents of the United States.
Establishes pilot program in DOE to ameliorate disparities among school districts with respect to educational technology.
Establishes a three-year moratorium on the establishment of new charter schools.
Requires charter schools to appoint a certified school business administrator.
Prohibits State Board of Education from limiting number of certain two-year college credits that may be applied towards meeting teacher certification requirements.
Requires State institutions of higher education and associated hospitals or medical facilities to obtain legislative approval of any name change.
Strengthens State construction code.

Requires State, school, local government officials to report certain criminal offenses committed by other public officials to Attorney General; imposes penalties for reporting false allegations; requires creation of reportable offenses list.
Establishes the New Jersey-Africa Commission.
Enhances protections for new homebuyers.
Enhances protections afforded purchasers in planned real estate developments.
The "New Homebuyers' Bill of Rights Act."
Prohibits certain advertising on real property and related structures without prior permission of owner.
Requires affirmative vote of majority of full membership of municipal council in mayor-council form of government to approve contracts.
Concerns certificates of occupancy for public housing projects.
Authorizes party to a final divorce judgment or judgment for the dissolution of a civil union to request name change without notifying opposing party.
Prohibits municipalities from setting minimum fees for employment of its off-duty police officers.
Modifies basis for calculating charity care reimbursements, and increases certain insurance premium assessments and taxes to fund reimbursements.
Requires school districts to notify DOE of sicknesses resulting from confirmed or suspected air pollution or other contamination.
"New Jersey Foreclosure Fairness Act"; imposes additional foreclosure notice requirements; amends "Mortgage Stabilization and Relief Act."
Provides that deed restrictions on affordable housing units are not extinguished by foreclosure proceedings.
Changes membership requirements of the Veterans' Services Council.
Grandfathers municipal ordinances that require merchants of used and secondhand jewelry to maintain possession longer than minimum period required by State law.
Requires display of State vehicle abuse hotline bumper stickers on all State vehicles.
Exempts certain lake association membership fees and dues from imposition of sales and use tax.
Prohibits candidates and elected public officials charged with crimes from using campaign contributions for their legal defense.
Requires completion of no more than 18 credits of continuing education for renewal of burglar alarm licenses.

Increases fine for failure to obtain highway occupancy permit issued by DOT Commissioner and provides new requirements and exceptions to obtaining permit prior to constructing work affecting highways under DOT jurisdiction.
Modifies requirement for advice of counsel in certain "palimony" agreements.

Requires Justices of the Supreme Court, Judges of the Superior Court, Tax Court Judges, Workers' Compensation Judges and Administrative Law Judges to be admitted to the practice of law for at least 15 years prior to appointment to the bench.
Establishes up to four-month extension for expiring carrier contracts with acute care hospitals while parties engage in contract renegotiation.
Requires use of uniform silver flags to mark certain pesticide applications.
Provides immunity to law enforcement officers who, in good faith, release driver in violation of provisional driver's license law.
Prohibits members or affiliates of criminal street gangs from being appointed corrections officers.
Concerns homeowners insurance coverage with respect to dogs.
Prohibits insurers and affiliated entities offering managed care plans from denying participation in network to health care providers willing to meet terms of contract.
Requires inmates with sufficient means to pay their incarceration costs.
Authorizes waiver of certain juvenile firearm-related cases.
Provides that only certain DOC employees may recruit, interview, and hire corrections officers.
Requires internal affairs investigations to be conducted by unit separate from unit responsible for collecting gang intelligence information.
Requires notification to corrections officers when disturbance occurs in correctional facility.
Requires home interview of corrections officer applicants.
Requires civilian employees of DOC to be trained in gang awareness.
Requires serological testing for hepatitis of certain defendants.
Requires Commissioner of Corrections to institute 15-minute shift overlap in State correctional facilities.
Requires 40 hours annual in-service training for State corrections officers.
Provides that graduates of regional or consolidated high schools with constituent municipalities located in different counties are eligible for resident tuition rates at certain county colleges.
Requires the placement of defibrillators in public school buildings.

Requires reduction in number of positions in State service; establishes procedure to control creation of new State positions and filling of vacancies.

Authorizes payment of funeral expenses for certain public safety employees killed in line of duty.

Imposes two-year moratorium on certain new outpatient radiation oncology services and establishes Outpatient Radiation Oncology Services Task Force in DHSS.

Subjects most State property to local property taxation beginning on July 1, 2010.

Requires physician practices that provide intravenous therapies in medical office to register with DHSS.

"Opportunity Scholarship Act"; establishes pilot program in Department of Treasury providing tax credits to entities contributing to scholarships for low-income children. **

Permits corporation business tax and gross income tax deduction for interest income derived from certain residential mortgage loans and requires financial benefits attributed to deduction to reduce principal of residential mortgage loan.
