Clarifies that certain ethical standards apply to Governor and Governor's staff.
Prohibits awarding of municipal professional services contracts to members of Legislature.
Establishes new standard and procedure for forfeiture of elective public office for accepting illegal contributions; removes illegal contribution threshold for such forfeiture.
Establishes "Garden State Growth Zone" program within NJEDA.
Streamlines process for State and local agency business permits related to economic development projects.
Appropriates $1,279,941 from various historic preservation funds to provide historic site management grants for certain historic preservation projects.
Requires mail-in ballot postmarked before election day but received within seven days after closing of polls to be considered valid and counted.
Permits certain members of Junior Firemen's Auxiliaries to perform non-hazardous support duties at fire sites.
Directs Chief Technology Officer to conduct study of costs and benefits of replacing the State's high-volume, basic computing systems with more cost-effective alternatives.
Eliminates awards of punitive damages against public entities, and against public officers, employees and servants acting within the scope or under color of their office, employment or agency.
Requires administrative law judges to hear disputes over the recovery of certain medical expense or other personal injury protection benefits.
Restricts sale or lease of certain ultrasound equipment; establishes registration requirements for certain organizations using such equipment.
Prohibits practice of requiring credit check as condition of employment.
Permits sale of motorcycles on Sunday.
"Anti-Snow Dumping Act"; prohibits commercial snowplow operators on private property from depositing snow in public roads, streets, and highways or on public lands. *
Requires the adoption of nepotism policies by school districts and charter schools.
Provides for expedited injunction for violations of law requiring prenotification of certain plant closings, transfers and mass layoffs.
Concerns collective bargaining by executive county superintendents.
Establishes New Jersey Epilepsy Task Force.
Authorizes State Treasurer to sell as surplus certain land and improvements thereon now part of East Jersey Prison to Woodbridge Township in Middlesex County.
Revises the statutes concerning oaths and affidavits.
Establishes New Jersey Aphasia Study Commission.
Provides rental and lease protections for domestic violence victims.
Provides civil immunity for certain volunteer physicians, nonprofit clinics and federally qualified health centers.
Codifies federal law notice, consent, and other requirements concerning certain employer-owned group life insurance contracts.
Prohibits certain elected public office holders from simultaneously holding more than one elective office.
Permits licensed facilities currently providing inpatient psychiatric services to add inpatient psychiatric beds without obtaining certificate of need.
Exempts certain qualified applicants for hazardous material endorsement from criminal history background checks.
Prohibits elected officials from holding more than one elective office.
Requires all elected officials and candidates and certain other public officials to file financial disclosure statement.

Requires that the monetary equivalent of any wage or benefit concession agreed to by a collective bargaining unit be used by the school district to offset any reduction in force initiated for economic reasons.
Exempts sales of certain seasonal rentals and other dwelling units from the bulk sale notification requirements.
Permits public employees to request payroll deductions for payment to multiple credit union accounts.
Enhances competitiveness of film production expenses tax credits.
Requires health insurers to disclose broker commissions to purchasers.
Permits Commissioner of Banking and Insurance to waive statutory liability-to-policyholders' surplus ratio on application by mortgage guaranty insurance company.
Increases rate of tax imposed on little cigars under tobacco products wholesale sales and use tax to equal tax rate imposed on cigarettes under cigarette tax.

"Tara's Law"; provides protections for individuals with developmental disabilities residing in community care residences and for investigations of abuse of individuals with developmental disabilities.
Provides for drug testing of licensees of community care residences and adult household members.
Provides partial sales tax exemption for energy and utility service to certain manufacturers. *
"Kulesh and Kubert's Law;" establishes violation of hands-free cell phone law as reckless under vehicular homicide statute and assault by auto statutes.
Provides gross income tax exemption for the income of certain qualified new resident business owners.
Clarifies interpretation of certain wills and trusts in accordance with changes to Federal law governing estate taxes.
Revises eligibility for expungement of criminal records for certain youthful offenders.
Establishes forest harvest program on State-owned land. *
Eliminates dock fees and establishes penalty for boat permit violations on Greenwood Lake.
Permits certain county boards of chosen freeholders to publish notices of proposed or amended ordinances by title and summary.
Concerns use of artificial reefs for commercial and recreational fishing.
Authorizes hunting of game animals every day of the week during hunting season.
"Toxic Mold Protection Act of 2010."
Clarifies language concerning criminal causation in accordance with recommendation by New Jersey Law Revision Commission.
Requires notary public applicants to disclose certain identifying information.
Requires sellers collecting New Jersey sales tax for locations in New Jersey to record and report on their returns the amount of sales tax collected within each municipality in New Jersey.
Concerns custody and parenting time issues for military parents.
Authorizes sale and lease of unneeded public property to certain nonprofits for gardening and urban farming and exempts such urban farms and gardens from property taxation.
Concerns custody and parenting time for military parents.
Provides for two-year post-employment restriction on certain employees of the Department of Banking and Insurance.
Revises certain unemployment benefit claim procedures and requires registration of authorized agents of parties to the procedures.
Clarifies procedures for admission to intoxication treatment program in lieu of prosecution for certain disorderly persons offenses; establishes fee for application to program.
Designated as the "Dogfighting Zero Tolerance Act of 2010."
Provides for notification to law enforcement authorities of discharge of certain persons brought to screening services for evaluation and assessment for mental health services.
Moves "Main Street New Jersey Program" from Department of Community Affairs to Deparment of State.
Prohibits sale of lottery tickets or shares after claim of top prizes.
Permits school boards to charge certain students for remedial or advanced courses provided during summer school.
Regulates advertising of manufacturers rebates by retail mercantile establishments.
Establishes DCA oversight of Passaic Valley Sewerage Comissioners.
Revises "Electronic Waste Management Act."
Establishes online portal for acceptance of donations to certain funds to which contributions may be made on gross income tax returns.*
Concerns certain limitations on claims for victim compensation.
Revises various off-track wagering provisions of the "Off-Track and Account Wagering Act."
Expands calibers of rim-fire rifles permitted on State wildlife management target ranges.
Changes references of "mental retardation" to "intellectual disability" or "developmental disability" and uses person-first language for persons with disabilities.
Requires certain persons to refund monies to school district if the DOE determines that the monies were non-allowable costs for the district. *
Calculates future service of active members at 1/60 of final compensation for TPAF and PERS pensions.

Penalizes permittees who acquire construction permits and certificates of occupancy by illegally influencing the permit procurement process; requires posting of bonds in certain situations; permits civil fines.
Prohibits adoption of new rules exceeding federal standards unless specifically authorized by State law or necessary to protect public health, safety, or welfare.
Requires executive county superintendent of schools to determine routes and bid and award contracts for all nonpublic school busing in the county.
Phases out cosmetic medical procedure gross receipts tax.*

Establishes priority for certain municipalities, counties, and non-profit organizations to purchase State surplus real property prior to public auction; requires State to follow Green Acres fair market valuation process.
Allows bureau chief to assess civil penalty for certain violations of "Uniform Securities Law (1997)."
Amends Kyleigh's Law to remove requirement that certain drivers display decal.
Exempts from realty transfer fees, sales of homes of certain New Jersey members of the military.
Designates "Red Bank Train Station" as "Daniel J. O"Hern Station - Red Bank, New Jersey."
Establishes "Choose Life" license plate.
Prohibits electric public utilities from installing capacitor banks within 300 feet of a residential area. *
Provides that certain funds in Casino Simulcasting Special Fund will be paid to Atlantic City Racetrack and prescribes use thereof with certain amounts remaining paid to other racetracks.
Eliminates various inactive boards, commissions, committees, councils, and task forces.
Authorizes formation of State college risk management groups and joint liability funds. *
"Emma's Law"; provides for screening newborn infants for lysosomal storage disorders.
Establishes three regional superintendents of schools and eliminates the position of executive county superintendent of schools.
Creates cigar night smoking ban exemption at racetracks and off-track wagering facilities.
Authorizes New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust to expend certain sums to make loans for environmental infrastructure projects.
Appropriates funds to DEP for environmental infrastructure projects.
Makes certain changes to the New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust Financing Program.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for wind energy equipment.
Prohibits municipal zoning ordinances from regulating solar panels under certain circumstances; limits fees for certain renewable energy installations. *
Provides corporation business tax credit and gross income tax credit for qualified wages of certain veterans.
Revises "Notaries Public Act of 1979."
Requires DHSS to post on website information concerning hospital emergency department staffing and services for pediatric patients. *
The "Reinsurance and Surplus Lines Stimulus and Enhancement Act."
Eliminates seniority in Civil Service and other jurisdictions for reductions in force in certain circumstances.

Allows gross income tax refunds to be credited against a taxpayer's delinquent local property taxes and adjusts administration of setoffs against gross income tax refunds and homestead rebates or credits. *
Changes five year chapter expiration date for rules to seven years; changes procedures for readoption of rules.
Establishes new procedure in "Administrative Procedure Act" to allow substantial changes to agency rule-making upon adoption.
Requires school districts to employ a certain number of student assistance coordinators based on district enrollment.

Permits a child whose parent or quardian is ordered into active military service to remain enrolled in the school district where the child's parent or guardian resided prior to active military service.
Requires AG to study and report on graduated driver's license program.
Establishes NJ Animal Abuser Registry.
Requires holder of rental security deposit account to provide second notice before account is deemed abandoned under the "Uniform Unclaimed Property Act."
Requires each general hospital that accepts public funds to hold quarterly board meetings that include time for public participation. *
Permits a waiver for high-performing school districts from the State system for monitoring school districts.

Requires DCA to post on its website the current adopted budget of any county or municipality that does not maintain its own website; also requires posting of three immediately preceding adopted budgets.
Requires notaries public to be U.S. citizens and mandates notaries public under certain circumstances to advertise information to public regarding limitations on their scope of authority.
Permits layoff plans as substitute for employment reconciliation plans for joint meetings or shared service agreements under certain circumstances.

Authorizes executive county superintendent of schools to require implementation of shared services arrangements and to approve school district collective negotiations agreements prior to execution of agreement.
Amends State college law to remove certain employees from civil service system and allow boards of trustees to conduct collective bargaining.
Concerns collective negotiations for public institutions of higher education.
Requires DHS to collect and disseminate data about persons with developmental disabilities.
Clarifies definition of "managerial executives" and "confidential employees" in the "New Jersey Employer-Employee Relations Act."
Jessica Rogers' Law: upgrades assault by auto or vessel in situations of road rage.
Requires Secretary of State to set standards for certification of electronic voting machines; permits voting machine examiners to request certain information and consults with experts as necessary.
Prohibits implementation of formula-based rates for sewerage authorities and electric, gas and water public utilities.
Clarifies ability of certain contracting units to specify use of inherently safer technologies for contracts involving extraordinarily hazardous substances.
Removes decal requirement from graduated driver's license law; establishes new system for law enforcement to identify novice drivers.
Allows gross income tax deduction for first $200,000 earned by certain new physicians and dentists in first seven taxable years of practice in NJ. *

The "Offshore Wind Economic Development Act"; establishes offshore wind renewable energy certificate program, and authorizes EDA to provide tax credits for qualified wind energy facilities in wind energy zones.
Permits eligible claimant who is proportionate owner paying entire property tax bill to collect entire homestead property tax reimbursement amount.
Jaden's Law; requires DHSS to prepare online brochure about the option to donate bone marrow.
Makes various changes to civil service law concerning seasonal appointments, temporary layoffs, and rescinding adoption of civil service.
Establishes farm brewery and winery-brewery beverage license and permits farm wineries to produce hard cider.
Modifies powers of Historic New Bridge Landing Park Commission.
Concerns collective negotiations for school employees; repeals law prohibiting school boards from imposing terms and conditions of employment.
Concerns compensation and benefits of officers, employees, and members of State and local authorities.
Allows Council on Local Mandates to authorize certain organizations to file complaints.
Establishes eligibility and staffing requirements for pediatric medical day care facilities.
Prohibits certain private transfer fees and imposes disclosure requirements.
Permits levy cap exclusion for certain monies expended by local unit for shared services.
Establishes an animal abuser registration system.
Requires investigating law enforcement officer to contact next of kin of unconscious motor vehicle accident victim who has been transported to hospital emergency room.
The "Jobs, Trade and Democracy Act."
Clarifies that school bus for purpose of upgraded penalties in "school zone" criminal drug laws includes any bus owned and operated by board of education or by private contractor.
Exempts contracting units who use cooperative purchasing agreements or cooperative pricing systems from price adjustments in local public contracts for asphalt cement and fuel.
Establishes residency requirement for police officers and firefighters in certain municipalities.
Authorizes counties to license and regulate operation of taxicabs within county.
Provides for transfer of certain funds from Main Street Business Assistance program to "Main Street New Jersey Program Fund."
Prohibits sending unsolicited advertising by text messaging, and requires companies offering text messaging services to allow their customers to block all incoming and outgoing text messages.
Transfers the Div. of Fish and Wildlife and related entities to the Dept. of Agriculture.
Extends increased fee for burial or removal, and transit permits.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to the "American Red Cross-NJ Fund".
Directs Attorney General to develop guidelines for positive identification of suspects before release.
Establishes alcoholic beverage license for certain restaurants in redevelopment areas.
Creates a civil "rape shield" law.
Allows certain plumbers and Heating, Ventilating, Air Conditioning and Refrigeration contractors to perform propane services. *
Provides for development of searchable "Bulletin NJ" local public bidding and employment database.
Requires school districts to report to DOE certain information on students removed from school pursuant to "Zero Tolerance for Guns Act."
Authorizes formation of State college risk management groups and joint liability funds.
Provides dedicated line item on property tax bill to fund municipal free public libraries and joint free public libraries.
Establishes State Mental Health Facilities Evaluation Task Force.
Requires transfer of municipal free library surplus amounts above 20% to municipality for its general purposes, which may include property tax relief.
Limits amount of time a vacant teaching position can be filled by certain teachers employed in a temporary capacity.
Permits publication of legal notices by governments and individuals on official government website instead of newspaper.
Designates bridge on Route 36 over Shrewsbury River as "Captain Joseph Azzolina Memorial Bridge."
Establishes deadlines for filing financial disclosure statements with State Ethics Commission.
Requires a minimum assessed value of $1,000,000 to have appeal of property assessment heard directly by Tax Court in certain circumstances.
Requires certain issue advocacy organizations to disclose contributions and expenditure information.
Eliminates minimum threshold for municipal calculation of reserve for uncollected taxes by alternate method when tax appeal judgments reduce the tax levy.
"Meadowlands Regionalization, Efficiency and Property Tax Relief Act of 2010."
Includes transportation costs in the calculation of extraordinary special education costs incurred by public school districts.
Provides for full State funding of the special education costs of students who reside in resource family homes.
Reorganizes the provisions in Title 18A regarding public and nonpublic school pupil transportation.
Establishes a regional transportation coordinator unit in each office of the executive county superintendent to improve the coordination of pupil transportation services within the county.
Concerns subcontracting agreements entered into by public school districts and higher education institutions.

"Family Home Occupation Act;" classifies certain home-occupations as accessory uses needing no use variances in residential zone; authorizes municipalities to limit or exclude certain warehousing, manufacturing or retailing activities.
Requires State toll road authorities to give preference in awarding service station contracts to bidders offering to dispense certain alternative fuels on State's toll roads.
Requires adult Work First New Jersey recipients to complete secondary education under certain circumstances and receive life skills training.

Requires municipalities accepting long-term tax exemption Payment In Lieu Of Taxes to distribute portion of payments to county and other taxing districts; limits Payment In Lieu Of Tax agreements to 15-20 years.
Increases and establishes certain business filing fees.
Abolishes the Department of the Public Advocate and transfers certain functions, powers and duties.
Extends waiver for new car inspections to five years and eliminates safety inspections for certain motor vehicles.

Provides temporary reduction of annual cap on corporation business tax benefit certificate transfer program for certain technology and biotechnology companies and temporarily suspends certain tax credits for certain film and digital media content production expenses.
Directs each institution of higher education to develop and coordinate a comprehensive disaster preparedness plan.
Adjusts fee schedule for county and municipal golf courses for certain veterans and service members.
Limits State ABP contributions for higher education faculty whose salary exceeds statutory maximum salary of Executive Branch department heads.
Establishes professional sports team specialty license plates and dedicates net proceeds to General Fund.
Concerns certain taxes and assessments dedicated to the administrative costs of the DOBI.
Directs transfer of up to $22 million to support Main Street Business Assistance Program and provides for program's continuation; confers general power on EDA to collect certain fees.
Renames the Division of Insurance Fraud Prevention as the Bureau of Fraud Deterrence in the Department of Banking and Insurance; modifies structure of Office of Insurance Fraud Prosecutor.
Consolidates functions of Office of the Inspector General and Office of the Medicaid Inspector General under Office of the State Comptroller.
Prohibits new employees of certain organizations from enrolling in State-administered retirement system or health care plan of public employer. *
Reduces benefit under State earned income credit program from 25 percent of federal credit amount to 20 percent beginning in Tax Year 2010.
Creates striped bass license plates.

Requires development of interscholastic athletic head injury safety training program; requires certain measures to protect student athletes with concussions; and limits liability of districts and nonpublic schools for certain actions by youth sports team organizations.
Concerns processing and payment of insurance claims for physical therapy services.
Amends effective date of New Jersey Compassionate Use Medical Marijuana Act.

Requires development of interscholastic athletic head injury safety training program; requires certain measures to protect student athletes with concussions; and requires continuing education for athletic trainers.*

Authorizes the State, with prior approval by the State House Commission, to use eminent domain power to acquire lands for recreation and conservation purposes provided lands are protective of drinking water sources.
Clarifies liability for discharges of hazardous substances from drilling platforms that enter NJ waters. **

Requires development and implementation of mitigation plans for radon contamination in certain child care centers; requires DOE to develop such plans for child care centers operating in public schools, request funding, and implement plans when funded.
The "Green Building Tax Credit Act."
Requires Domestic Security Preparedness Planning Group to conduct mock exercise pertaining to agricultural bioterrorism; and appropriates $150,000 therefor from New Jersey Domestic Security Account.
Adjust time periods for presumptions of abandonment, limits issuer imposed dormancy fees and provides for related administration for certain unclaimed property.
Requires notification of law enforcement for furlough or discharge of certain patients from State psychiatric hospitals.
Directs the Department of Education to develop a school district dating violence policy and requires school districts to provide dating violence education in the health curriculum.
Expands number of safe havens for leaving newborn infants.
Expands qualifications of county corrections officers; clarifies certain administrative and managerial policies of county correctional institutions.
Creates "New Jersey Senior Labor Task Force."
Requires Division of Developmental Disabilities to study need for placement trusts for persons with developmental disabilities.
Prohibits minors under 18 years of age from using indoor tanning facilities.*
Requires DHS to conduct follow-up study of former residents of North Princeton Developmental Center.
Designates State Highway Route 31 as the "Tri-County Purple Heart Memorial Highway."
Allows cultivation of commercial shellfish species in certain coastal and inner harbor waters for research and educational purposes.
Requires physicians to complete survey as condition for biennial registration with Board of Medical Examiners and requires board to maintain and disseminate survey data as appropriate.

Prohibits manufacture or sale of reflective glass beads with high arsenic content; prohibits DOT and State's toll road authorities from using paint mixed with reflective glass beads for roadway markings.
Establishes "Jersey Fresh Farm to School Week."
Permits development of solar and wind facilities and structures on landfills and resource extraction operations under certain circumstances. **
Revises statutes regulating bingo, raffles and amusement games.
Requires DOE to develop and distribute information regarding hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and expands role and membership of New Jersey Student Athlete Cardiac Screening Task Force.
Decreases rental motor vehicle surcharge from $5 per day to $2 per day.
Revises sales and use tax to maintain compliance with certain terms and conditions of Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement.
Decreases rental motor vehicle surcharge from $5 per day to $3 per day.
Eliminates use of rebate procedure for claims of sales and use tax exemption made in connection with certain sales to certain UEZ qualified businesses. *
Prohibits possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages on private property by persons under 21 years of age.
Supplemental appropriation of $24.6 million in State funds and $45.7 million in federal funds to the DHS.
Limits right of appeal of disciplinary action taken by employer against certain public employees.
Concerns method of collection of tax on motor fuel, repeals former motor fuels tax.
Concerns outreach and training for minorities and women in the construction industry.

Makes FY 2011 supplemental appropriation of $7,453,000 for Women's Health and Family Planning Services, reduces FY 2011 appropriation for State Employees' Prescription Drug Program by $7,453,000, and requires filing of application for expansion of Medicaid coverage for family planning services.
Increases certain application fees for civil service examinations and requires review of fees every five years; establishes fee for certain appeals.
Increases penalties against Medicaid fraud.

Makes FY 2010 State and federal supplemental appropriations totaling $454,509,000, reduces FY 2010 appropriations by $727,892,000, and amends and supplements various language provisions affecting appropriations in FY 2010.
Removes cap on .53% hospital total operating revenue assessment and raises cap on ambulatory care facility gross receipts assessment to increase charity care subsidy monies.
"The Anti-Big Brother Act."
Provides for certain requirements concerning Independent Health Care Appeals Program.
Provides for establishment and operation of casino at Meadowlands Complex.
Provides for establishment, by NJT and its contract carriers, of customer feedback response programs.
Establishes penalty for suspension, by bus operator under contract with NJ Transit, of peak hour regular route service.
Concerns regular route peak bus services and imposes fee on private carriers that fail to meet certain performance standards.
Establishes Office of the Advocate for Private Commuter Bus Services Consumers and bill of rights for customers of privately operated motorbus regular route services.
Clarifies position of NJT on avoiding destructive competition against private entities providing certain public transportation services.
Makes theft, misappropriation, or wrongful operation of certain motorbuses a second degree crime.
Requires destruction of records stored on digital copy machines under certain circumstances.
Replaces references to Civil Service Commission with chairperson of commission to clarify duties and responsibilities of chairperson.
Requires counseling for certain domestic violence offenders.
Includes reverse rate evasion as form of insurance fraud and provides for civil and criminal penalties.
Limits discretion of municipal court to revoke driver licenses; increases certain penalties.
Recognizes litigation right, and requires arbitration of, uninsured and underinsured motorist coverage causes of action arising from private passenger automobile insurance.
Clarifies right to recover certain uncompensated medical expenses under private passenger automobile insurance.
Provides criminal penalties for unauthorized use of images or likeness of minors and establishes civil action.
Reserves $1.078 million of appropriation for New Jersey City University for A. Harry Moore Laboratory School.

Amends FY2011 annual appropriations act to authorize use of $2,000,000 of federal funds available from Temporary Assistance to Needy Families Emergency Contingency Fund for establishment of Statewide Youth Employment Initiative.
Prohibits delivery of more than one magazine issue before billing information is obtained.
Concerns employee leasing companies.

Allows municipalities adjacent to one or more municipalities having UEZs and a county where a reduced sales tax is assessed on retail sales to qualify for NJ Redevelopment Authority financing assistance.
Creates new offense of theft by financial exploitation of a vulnerable person.
Establishes "Blue Ribbon Panel to Review New Jersey's Driver License Suspension Laws."
Permits dispensing of nutritional and dietary supplements by physicians.
Authorizes prescribed burning in certain circumstances.
Concerns creation of benefit corporations.
Implements Governor's "Tool Kit" proposals for public employer - public employee collective bargaining.
Authorizes the establishment of probationary periods for nontenured faculty members at State colleges.

Limits unused sick leave pay and vacation leave carry-forward for school and local employees; permits local unit to pay certain benefits over 10 years; limits sick leave use by public employee before retirement.
Bars certain employees of certain public agencies from participating in PERS; repeals law permitting PERS and TPAF members on leave who work for labor organization to purchase pension credit.
Establishes procedure for destroying certain contraband tobacco products and cigarettes.
Clarifies local government unit obligations with regard to DEP loan awards for dam repairs.
Extends duration of civil service promotional eligible list to not more than five years or two additional years for good cause.
Authorizes special license plates for members of the United States Coast Guard.
Permits DOT to contract with county or municipality for certain work on highways to prevent public hazards.
Increases fine and imposes license suspension for talking or texting on hand-held device while driving.
Permits commercial advertising and sponsorship signs on equipment and materials related to the collection of tolls consistent with State law on outdoor advertising.
Expands treatment of mixed use projects under urban transit hub tax credit. *
Establishes judicial pre-litigation screening panels for certain actions.
Establishes recreational fishing license plate; dedicates fees to coastal fishing research.
Reinstates State sick leave injury program for State employees who are members of PFRS or SPRS.
Defines homeowners' association membership and fair standards for elections and recall of trustees in homeowners' associations of planned real estate developments.
Increases compensation paid to persons displaced through eminent domain.
Amends FY 2011 appropriations act to provide supplemental appropriation of $5,599,000 to the Department of Human Services for orthodontic care for children and kinship care initiatives.
Authorizes issuance of a handgun purchaser identification card.
Reduces school district, county, and municipal property tax levy cap from 4 percent to 2.5 percent and permits unused county and municipal increases to be banked for three succeeding years.
Authorizes special Gold Star Family motor vehicle license plates for certain family members of military personnel who died while on active duty. *
Permits municipality to pay tax refund in equal installments over period of three years.
The "Child Safe Playing Fields Act"; restricts use of lawn care pesticides at schools, child care centers and recreational fields.
Requires residential leases to specify when rent payments are due and allows residential leases to require weekly, monthly, or annual payments or a single payment for the entire lease term.
Directs BPU to establish standards concerning local government renewable energy generation demonstration projects utilizing renewable energy technologies.*

"Physician Orders for Life-Sustaining Treatment Act"; provides for use of Physician Orders for Life-Sustaining Treatment forms and requires physicians and advanced practice nurses to pursue continuing education in end-of life care. *
Provides for designation of new charter school authorizers. *
Establishes NJ Advisory Council on End-of-Life Care in DHSS.
Establishes "Property Tax Levy Cap Task Force" to monitor impact of changes to levy cap law.
Establishes a 2.0 percent cap on annual appropriations increases for certain State government spending.
Provides useful life of three years for certain permitted maintenance projects with Transportation Trust Fund monies.
Requires workers on a school facilities construction project to undergo a criminal background check and mandates such checks for nonpublic school employees.
Gives judge discretion to revoke boating privileges for third or subsequent drunk driving offenses.
Provides that State or local appointing authority in civil service may institute temporary layoff.
Allows certain organizations to file complaints with Council on Local Mandates in certain circumstances.
Eliminates five percent down payment requirement for bond ordinances approved by counties and municipalities.
Provides that 1.5% contribution required to be made by certain public employees will not take effect until expiration of collective bargaining agreement made applicable to such employees.
Designates State Highway Route 42 as the "Route 42 Purple Heart Memorial Veterans Highway."
Establishes New Jersey Multiple Sclerosis Task Force.
Requires State Board of Education to promulgate policy regarding outside employment of superintendents of schools.
Restores income eligibility level for AIDS Drug Distribution Program to 500% of the federal poverty level.
Requires dentist to notify patient before providing dental prosthesis manufactured outside the United States.
Enters New Jersey in Nurse Multistate Licensure Compact.

Establishes Commission on State-owned Historic Sites in Department of State, transfers administration of State-owned historic sites to commission, and transfers historic preservation programs from DEP to Department of State.
Requires physician supervision of nurse anesthetists.
Establishes priority of preferences for community settings for persons with developmental disabilities transitioning from developmental centers.
Limits certain unused sick leave pay and vacation leave carry-forward for school and local employees; limits sick leave use by new public employees before retirement. *
Establishes sexual assault training requirements for law enforcement officers.
Renames quail management area within Greenwood Forest Wildlife Management Area as "Dr. A. Hunter Wilcox Field Trial Grounds."
Requires minimum water usage charge to be applied per dwelling unit in multi-family dwelling.
Requires 30-day grace period prior to accrual of interest on late water and sewer bill payments.
Requires forfeiture of public office, position or employment upon conviction of certain offenses.
Prohibits boards of education from charging students a fee to participate in extracurricular activities.
Permits racetrack permitholders to provide for single parimutuel pool for each running or harness horse race.
Provides enhanced tax credits to certain businesses under the Business Retention and Relocation Assistance Grant Program.
Allows tax credits for development of qualified wind energy facilities in port district of Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.
Permits chief financial officer to recommend reduced appropriation for reserve for uncollected taxes in certain circumstances.
Provides for early termination of appointed municipal court positions under certain circumstances.
Establishes real property assessment demonstration program in Monmouth County.
Establishes "Monica's Law" concerning domestic violence risk assessment pilot program.
Extends hiring preference for certain civilian federal firefighters.
Prohibits certain terminal leave compensation for local elected officials.
Amends Kyleigh's Law to suspend requirement that graduated driver licensees display decal until certain technology developed.
Establishes NJ Health Care Reform Implementation Council.
Provides veterans preference for employment by county or municipality of certain laid off police officers and firefighters.
Includes adult with onset physical disabilities as eligible criteria for assistance through Special Needs Housing Trust Fund.
Regulates sale of olive oil.
Requires voter approval at the annual school election or by the board of school estimate prior to the establishment of a charter school.
Requires school buses transporting certain disabled persons to use flashing lights and establishes penalties for drivers who fail to yield.
Clarifies power of NJTA to contract for private toll-takers.
Requires conclusion of eviction proceedings for nonpayment of rent not later than 30th day following service of complaint on tenant.
Establishes pilot project to permit overseas and military voters to vote in certain elections using Internet.*
Validates certain fire district obligations.
Prohibits use of volunteer driving activities in underwriting for private passenger automobile insurance; revises charitable immunity statute as applied to volunteer drivers.
Repeals "Global Warming Response Act" and related sections of Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative implementing law.
Exempts agricultural driver's licensees from certain graduate driver law restrictions when operating farm equipment and vehicles.
Repeals the "Agreement Among the States to Elect the President by National Popular Vote."
Prohibits persons violating animal cruelty law from owning, keeping, or harboring animals; requires DHSS establish and maintain website list of such persons.
Requires municipality to report all long and short-term financial and tax agreements to DCA; makes reporting a condition for receipt of special Municipal Aid.
Exempts sheltered workshops from disclosure and fingerprinting requirements for certain solid waste operations.
Authorizes municipal dredging of lagoon community waterways and levying of special assessment or issuing of bonds to finance such dredging.

Changes "board of chosen freeholders" to "board of county commissioners" and "freeholder" and "chosen freeholder" to "county commissioner" in new sections of law and revisions to current law; requires counties to change terms on website.
Requires criminal background check for name change and prohibits persons convicted of certain crimes from changing their name.

Provides that expression of a political view or of a personal opinion on a school district budget by school board member does not constitute action that may form the basis of a school ethics complaint.

Clarifies that breath test warnings given to suspected drunk drivers are to be in English; requires applicants for driver's licenses to be able to read and understand English and directs MVC to offer examinations only in English.
Establishes governance structure for county administrative school districts.

Provides 50% State matching funds to support shared services agreements between municipalities and districts with efficient pupil transportation systems for the provision of public school hazardous busing.
Raises membership of PFRS board of trustees from 11 to 13 members.
Revises qualifications and requirements for permits to carry a handgun.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from increasing resident undergraduate tuition by more than 2% over the prior academic year.
Requires each nonprofit corporation operating in the State that accepts State funds to hold quarterly board meetings that include time for public participation.
Provides for forfeiture of State or local public office, position, or employment upon conviction of any indictable offense.
Limits fee charged by hospital to patient for copy of treatment record.
