Allows NJSEA to jointly run racetracks; conforms standardbred racing days to off-track and account wagering law; decreases thoroughbred racing days at Momouth Park and Meadowlands to 71 with horsemen's consent.*
Requires certain local employees work at least 25 hours a week for health benefit eligibility.
Provides credit against ambulatory care facility assessment liability for value of unreimbursed care provided to hospital charity care patients.
Appropriates $1,000,000 for outreach and enrollment activities in Medicaid and NJ FamilyCare programs.
Provides public employee salaries at all levels of government cannot exceed salary of Governor.
Extends certain PERS benefits to veterans of "Operation Uphold Democracy".
Authorizes incinerator authorities to perform sanitation, public works, and environmental services.
Establishes Extended School Day and School Year Study Commission.
Requires wireless cell phone company to inform subscribers that cell phone GPS capability may be deactivated.
Permits certain deer control activities; prohibits deer feeding; and establishes check-off donation on hunting license applications to support venison donation program.
Concerns removal of certain inmate information from DOC website.
Concerns the registration of persons convicted of arson related crimes.
Directs State Lottery Commission to permit purchase of lottery tickets by electronic means.
Extends deadline for filing nominating petitions each year new legislative districts are established by Apportionment Commission.
Requires certain commissions to maintain meeting minutes; establishes Governor's authority to approve or veto the minutes of those commissions.
Establishes N.J. Historical Commission program for preservation and promotion of graves of significant individuals of the American Revolutionary period; appropriates $200,000.
Authorizes release of sex offender registration information to DHS and county welfare agencies.
Jessica Rogers' Law: upgrades assault by auto or vessel in situations of road rage.
Expands programs in BPU to include low-interest loans and grants to municipalities for energy efficient programs and innovative energy technologies.
Revises membership of Public Health Council and fully restores functions, powers, and duties of council.
Concerns workers' compensation for firefighters with cancer.
Provides for transfer and sale of inactive liquor licenses for use in qualifying smart growth municipalities.
Authorizes immediate euthanasia of impounded stray animals that are injured or ill beyond hope of recovery.
Creates New Jersey Business Action Center.
The "Market Competition and Consumer Choice Act;" alters State regulation of competitive services provided by telecommunications and CATV companies.
Repeals obsolete statutes concerning the status of women.

Modifies process for contested case hearings by OAL with regard to telephone and video conferences, delegation of final decision authority, oral decisions, checklist decisions, electronic filings, and settlements.
Prohibits burial of Petty's Run archaeological excavation site.
"Prescription Drug Right-to-Know Act"; establishes clinical trials registry in DHSS; requires pharmaceutical companies to publicly disclose clinical trial data.
Creates a directory of registered telemarketers.
Makes it unlawful practice to sell certain products via Internet auction.
Clarifies that conviction of refusal to submit to breathalyzer constitutes prior conviction for sentencing purposes under drunk driving law.
Requires monitoring of prescriptions for human growth hormones.
Requires local law enforcement officer or firefighter prescribed anabolic steroids or human growth hormone to report to designated physician for evaluation of fitness for duty.
Restores the death penalty for certain murders.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support the Boys and Girls Clubs in New Jersey.
Establishes the "Veterans Court Pilot Program."
Provides 10% reduction in compensation for members of Legislature.
Revises procedure for removal of municipal administrator by municipal council; provides for payment of balance of salary to municipal administrator upon removal.
Requires prenotification of mass layoffs by holding company or franchisor at multiple franchise locations.
Changes the trigger for extended unemployment benefits.
Reverses certain changes to laws governing State treatment of unclaimed property.
Provides for a municipal court community service fee.
Concerns Watershed Property Review Board in DEP.
Prohibits possession of machetes in certain circumstances.
Increases the penalty for hindering the apprehension or prosecution of an offender.
Amends "State Transfer of Development Rights Act," and provides for impact fees and other incentives for establishment of transfer of development rights programs.
Creates annual inspection cycle for certain hotels and motels under "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law."
Requires DHSS to review standard of care at health care facilities in which 40% or more of direct patient care nursing staff are temporary hires.
Requiring notification of designated rape crisis centers under certain circumstances.
Establishes the "Domestic Violence Victim Protection Pilot Program."
Designates portion of U.S. Route 1 in South Brunswick Township as "Pleasant T. Macon Highway."
Repeals all prevailing wage laws.
Revises provisions of "Franchise Practices Act" relating to motor vehicle franchises.
Amends penalty imposed for interfering with apprehension or prosecution of certain criminals.
Increases penalties for failing to secure a child in a child passenger restraint system or booster seat while operating a motor vehicle.

Makes various changes to PERS, TPAF, PFRS, SPRS, JRS including to board membership, control of investments, adjustments to member contribution, adjustments to benefits, and benefit factor for TPAF and PERS.
Authorizes State and local governments to enter into group purchasing agreement for alternative fueled vehicles.
Requires school districts to annually disseminate information to students and parents or guardians on the dangers of distributing sexually explicit images through electronic means.

Prohibits retail stores from selling cellular telephone equipment or cellular telephone equipment service contracts unless stores provide information brochures about "sexting" to customers who purchase such equipment or contracts.
Permits diversionary program for juveniles who are criminally charged for "sexting" or posting sexual images.*

Authorizes State contracting agencies, local contracting units, boards of education, public institutions of higher education, and other public entities to enter into guaranteed energy savings contracts.
Permits sale of raw milk under certain conditions and establishes raw milk permit program.
Revises provisions of "Franchise Practices Act" relating to motor vehicle franchises. *
Makes changes to retirement benefits for members of the State-administered retirement systems and eliminates future COLAs.
Establishes a civil cause of action for gender-motivated violence.
Permits attending advanced practice nurse to determine cause of death and execute death certification when physician is not available.
Exempts senior citizens, disabled persons and veterans from E-ZPass account monthly service charge.
Prohibits certain local officers from authorizing certain transfers, appointments, changes in compensation, and funding for capital projects in local units.
Deletes requirement for certain cable television companies to fund "CATV Universal Access Fund."

Requires institutions of higher education to provide students with access to mental health care programs and services and to establish a hotline to provide information concerning the availability of those services.
Prohibits sale of mercury batteries and consumer products that use mercury batteries; prohibits disposal of used mercury batteries as solid waste.
Requires scooter riders under 17 years old to wear helmets.
Establishes $100 to $500 fine for owner of animal which attacks, injures, or otherwise interferes with law enforcement animals, search and rescue dogs, or service dogs; designated as "Dusty's Law."
Excludes from PAAD income eligibility withdrawals from an IRA.
Suspends pension of any retired public employee who resumes public employment with compensation more than $15,000.
Requires children to wear athletic heart protectors while playing organized baseball or softball.
Establishes certain criteria for public employee health care benefits plans; requires premium percentage-based employee contribution.
Requires DCF to develop and adopt Statewide youth suicide prevention plan.
Raises age requirement of compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years old.
Permits local units to participate in cooperative purchasing agreements.
Limits sale and manufacture of flame retardant chemical decabromodiphenyl ether.
Makes unauthorized impersonation of another person a crime of the third degree.

Requires prequalification process for prospective bidders on school district transportation contracts; authorizes debarment of bidders convicted of certain crimes; authorizes disqualification of bidder or termination of transportation contract for certain crimes by an employee.
Prohibits sale of emergency warning lights to unauthorized motorists.
Increases penalties for unauthorized display or use of emergency warning lights.
Permits voter registration of certain persons at age 17 for voting at next election occurring on or after 18th Birthday.
Authorizes Department of Agriculture to implement mobile fresh produce markets for residents of urban "food desert" communities.
Authorizes local public contract set-aside program for business enterprises that are owned by or that employ veterans.
Modifies employer UI tax rates.
Establishes that certification for police training course lasts five years.
Upgrades the disorderly persons offense of desecration of a venerated object to a crime of the third degree if the object desecrated is a military monument.
"New Jersey Jobs Protection Act;" requires verification of employment.
Permits sale of home-baked goods under certain circumstances.

Requires State Comptroller to review, and make recommendations for improvement of, the procurement process of the State, public institutions of higher education, independent State authorities, units of local government, and boards of education.
"Barnegat Bay Protection Act"; establishes Barnegat Bay Protection Fund, dedicates portion of sales tax on lawn fertilizer, authorizes special license plates, and provides for donations.
Provides State income tax credit for removal of lawns near Barnegat Bay.
Enhances penalty for tampering with evidence after fleeing the scene of an accident resulting in death.
Reinstates sick leave injury program for State corrections officers and juvenile justice officers under certain circumstances.
The "Wildlife Rehabilitation Act"; establishes Wildlife Rehabilitation Board in, but not of, DEP; and establishes continuing education requirements and permit program for wildlife rehabilitators.
Extends protections of the new vehicle "lemon Law" to new motor vehicle farm equipment purchased or leased in New Jersey.
Increases gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 and dedicates revenue from tax rate increase for direct real property tax relief for taxpayers.
Establishes program to provide financial assistance towards installation of blue roofs and green roofs, authorizes use of Global Warming Solutions Fund for certain such purposes.
Requires construction of new buildings, facilities, and structures using State, EDA, or NJ Schools Development Authority funds to include green or blue roofs.
Requires DEP to adopt rules concerning blue roofs and green roofs and provides priority consideration for related permits and other authorizations.
Requires construction of certain new State buildings, facilities, and structures to include green or blue roofs.
Requires NJ Environmental Infrastructure Financing Program to give additional weight in ranking system to projects including green or blue roofs.
Expands membership of Police Training Commission to include representatives from Italian American Police Society of New Jersey and New Jersey Honor Legion.

Prohibits use of emergency warning lights or other insignia to impersonate law enforcement officer; prohibits sale of these lights to unauthorized persons and increases penalties for unauthorized use.*
Requires NJ FamilyCare to treat earned and unearned income in same manner when calculating gross family income for parents and caretakers.
Supplemental appropriation of $6.4 million in State funds and $11.9 million in federal funds to DHS to restore eligibility to parents in NJ FamilyCare.
Requires birthing facilities to screen newborns for congenital heart defects prior to discharge.
Phases-in single sales fraction for corporation business tax income allocation formula over three years and establishes airline-specific sales fraction.
Establishes alternative business calculation under gross income tax to permit consolidation and carryforward of certain business-related losses.
Authorizes municipal court judge to enroll convicted drivers in aggressive driving programs.
Permits registered voters to receive mail-in ballots automatically for all future elections.

Forbids members of the State Investment Council from voting on transactions concerning investment with which a member has certain financial or familial conflicts and requires removal for violations thereof.
Designates portion of New Jersey Route No. 34 in Wall Township as the "Duncan Thecker Memorial Highway."
Prohibits certain individuals from membership on county boards of elections.
Requires MVC to issue special organization registration plates to qualified organizations; repeals language granting chief administrator discretion in awarding plates.
Creates special license plates supporting Autism Awareness.
Permits municipality to pay commercial and industrial property tax refunds for tax years 2010 through 2011 over subsequent three local budget years. *
Provides affirmative defense to prostitution charge for persons under 16.
Amends eligibility for expungement of criminal records.
Requires State, regional, and local authorities, boards, and commissions to establish an Internet website and post information related to each entity's mission, finances, meetings, and employees. *
Requires at least 50% of highest Casino Simulcasting Special Fund amount awarded to racetrack be paid to Atlantic City Race Course; prescribes uses thereof.
Reduces membership of Casino Control Commission from five to three.
Prohibits expenditure of State funds for certain cosmetic services in criminal trials.
Permits indirect purchasers to seek damages under State antitrust laws.
Removes requirement that executive county superintendents hold certificate issued by the State Board of Examiners.
Requires periodic inspection of exterior walls of certain buildings.
Requires use of pervious concrete by State agencies under certain circumstances.
Authorizes school district to require a certificate of occupancy to demonstrate student eligibility for enrollment in the district.
Requires a board of education to consult with appropriate nonpublic school representatives prior to any change in the provision of nursing services.
Provides sales and use tax exemption for services performed to certain prewritten computer software delivered electronically.
Decreases the minimum corporation business tax on certain New Jersey subchapter S corporations by 25%.
Eliminates limit on application of corporation business tax research credit to 50% of liability otherwise due.
Increases filing threshold for the New Jersey estate tax to $1,000,000.
Extends alternate route police training certification from three to five years.
Requires surgical practices to be licensed by DHSS as ambulatory care facilities.
Establishes standards for commercial insurers and Medicaid program implementing electronic prescribing systems.
Permits direct shipping by wineries and creates Out-of-State Winery license.
Implements recommendations of State Comptroller's report analyzing the on-line transparency of local authorities and commissions.
Requires owners of certain newly developed shopping centers to provide electric vehicle charging stations.
Replaces plenary winery and farm winery licenses with small winery and wine manufacturing licenses.
Provides one-year opportunity to purchase certain military time for service credit in State-administered retirement system by certain veterans.
Authorizes Commissioner of NJDOT to procure revenue-generating sponsors for, and permit sponsorship acknowledgment and advertising on, safety and emergency service patrol vehicles and equipment.
Expands treatment of mixed use projects under urban transit hub tax credit and requires developers utilizing State funds to reserve affordable units under certain conditions.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of compressed natural gas vehicles.
Establishes public-private pilot program for level 3 electric vehicle charging stations.
Establishes public-private alternative fueling station pilot program and requires DOT to conduct study.
Provides corporation business tax credits and gross income tax credits for purchase of fuel cell vehicles.
Concerns eligibility requirements for licensed professional counselors and associate counselors.
Encourages local unit sharing of services; makes appropriations.
Re-aligns enforcement responsibility of State Housing Code concerning multiple dwellings from municipalities to the State under the "Hotel and Multiple Dwelling Law." *
Establishes the "Private Investment in Public Education Fund."
"Melanie A. Cantwell Law;" requires MVC to issue modified license to person convicted of driving under the influence.
Prohibits conflict of interests by governing board members or management employees of homeowners' associations.
Establishes special license plates for honorably discharged veterans.
Concerns liability and insurance coverage for medical malpractice actions.
Establishes the crime of negligent vehicular homicide.
Establishes licensing program in Department of Agriculture for farmed deer and other cervids.
Revises qualifications for handgun permit, establishes crimes for certain handgun use; establishes annual fee of $100.
Concerns permits, letters of exemption, and enforcement with regard to agricultural activities under "Freshwater Wetlands Protection Act".
Permits issuance of home inspectors licenses to certain code enforcement officials.
Provides for appointment of certain municipal court judges at the local or county level.
Allows low-speed vehicles to be used for the transportation of passengers for hire.
Authorizes labeling of foods that are free of genetically modified material.
Directs DOT to establish roadside accident memorial program.
Requires BPU to issue a decision within 180 days after receipt of petition by public utilities to sell certain real property.
Revises definition of class I renewable energy to include energy produced by certain geothermal heat pumps.*
Increases Spill Compensation and Control Act cap on recovery of damages from certain dischargers.
Establishes formula for distribution of State aid to school districts.
Repeals early release program for certain inmates established under P.L.2009, c.330.
Upgrades penalties for certain criminal offenses committed against elderly and disabled persons.
Updates provisions governing Board of Education Employees' Pension Fund of Essex County to comply with Internal Revenue Code.
Requires certain qualifications for employment as a surgical technologist.
"Consumer Credit Fairness Act."
Allows casino to pay up to 6% or 9% of parimutuel pool to out-of-State racetrack for simucast races; provides casino retains 55% of certain remaining takeout rate amounts.*

Permits certain victims of domestic violence or stalking, and members of immediate family, to register to vote without disclosing street address and cast provisional ballot at any election under certain circumstances.
Establishes "School Bus Safety and Child Protection Act," requires periodic criminal background checks for certain school employees; and prohibits interference with school bus monitoring devices.
Imposes post-employment restrictions on certain ABC employees.
Requires all personal audio players distributed in New Jersey to contain warning about volume and hearing loss.
Clarifies the effective date of the "New Jersey False Claims Act."
Allows Eatontown, Oceanport, and Tinton Falls mayors to designate council member to represent them as members of Fort Monmouth Economic Revitalization Authority.
Concerns workers' compensation insurance requirements for certain corporations.
Concerns eligibility for unemployment compensation benefits for certain seasonal employees.
Regulates certain rental-purchase agreements.
"Pamela's Law;" criminalizes possession and sale of mephedrone and methylenedioxpyrovalerone, commonly known as MDPV or "bath salts."
Extends for three years application submission deadline to EDA for review and approval of certain construction projects involving public institutions of higher education.
Requires Department of Education to biannually distribute a letter to school districts reminding districts of requirement to enroll resident students regardless of immigration status.
Exempts certain car-sharing programs from motor vehicle rental fees.
Requires direct deposit for all State employee compensation on and after July 1, 2014.
Restores benefit under State earned income credit program to 25 percent of federal credit beginning in Tax Year 2011.
Repeals Highlands planning and environmental permitting provisions of "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act," and amends various statutes to reflect repeal thereof.
Establishes measures to improve transparency and accountability of regional authorities of this State; enhances oversight of those authorities by Governor and State Comptroller.
Requires certain State oversight of budgets of regional sewerage authorities.
Requires State oversight of budgets of joint meetings.
Extends "whistleblower" protections to employee disclosure of governmental mismanagement, waste and abuse.
Excludes certain services rendered in connection with installation of carpeting and other flooring from sales and use tax.

Provides State recognition of certain Indian tribes for certain limited purposes, establishes process for future recognition of tribes and revises membership and duties of New Jersey Commission on American Indian Affairs.
Regulates pay-off of trade-in vehicles and certain vehicle title releases.

Requires tuition bills of public institutions of higher education to include details on student fees and opt-out provision for student-managed entertainment fees, and requires certain institutions' websites to include student fee information.
The "Family and Private Burial Grounds Preservation Act."
Directs Board of Nursing to encourage nursing schools to give academic credit to students for training received in US military as corpsmen and medics.
Requires DHS to contract with independent firm for analysis of costs and local impact prior to closure or privatization of State developmental centers or psychiatric hospitals.
Extends for two years expiration date of certain permits pursuant to "Permit Extension Act of 2008."
Permits production and sale of certain foods from unlicensed home kitchens.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns for fish and wildlife management and conservation.
Exempts beach bars, amusement parks and carnival amusement rides from noise restrictions of "Noise Control Act of 1971" during certain time periods and subject to certain conditions.*
Provides for drug testing of adult recipients of Work First New Jersey program benefits.
Specifies additional offenses and penalties for torturing or tormenting an animal; designated as Patrick's Law.
Provides that any superintendent salary caps adopted by the commissioner will apply to charter school administrators.
Provides that certain disabled veterans may purchase special automobile insurance policies.
Revises individual cause of action under consumer fraud act and makes certain other revisions regarding applicability of act.
Establishes flat digital striped bass motor vehicle license plates.
Appropriates $84,495,199 from "2009 Green Acres Fund" and "Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund" for local government open space acquisition and park development projects.

Appropriates $14,818,787 from "2009 Green Acres Fund" and "Garden State Green Acres Preservation Trust Fund" for grants to certain nonprofit entities to acquire or develop lands for recreation and conservation purposes.

Appropriates $45 million from "2009 Green Acres Fund" and $12 million from "2009 Blue Acres Fund" for State acquisition of lands for recreation and conservation purposes, including Blue Acres projects.
Provides for certain psychologists to prescribe medications.
Requires binding arbitration to determine contested cases involving dismissal or reduction in compensation of tenured public school employees.
Requires municipal clerk to publish holiday and emergency information on Internet site or in local newspaper.
Reduces number of printed copies of each State report or publication required to be filed with State Library; provides for State Library liaison at each State office.
Establishes 80 as maximum age for issuing special handgun carry permits to retired police officers.
Revises certain exemptions to "Highlands Water Protection and Planning Act."
Provides for collection on child support arrearages and certain public assistance overpayments through withholding of casino and racetrack winnings.
Requires certificate of need for hospital-based basic obstetric and pediatric services.
Provides supplemental appropriation of $4.141 million from Property Tax Relief Fund to DOE for aid to school districts with significant enrollment growth.**
Requires suspension of local elected and appointed officers and employees indicted for certain offenses that, upon conviction, require forfeiture of office or position.
Increases production limitations and revises privileges of limited and restricted breweries.
Clarifies functions of Law Enforcement Officer Crisis Intervention Services telephone hotline.
Establishes New Jersey Hall of Fame License Plate; dedicates fees therefrom to support New Jersey Hall of Fame Charitable Foundation.
Establishes Sex Offender Management Commission; amends Megan's Law in response to federal Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act of 2006.
Allows certain sole proprietors to join a small employer health benefits purchasing alliance.
Permits school districts to withdraw from civil service system by referendum or adoption of board of education resolution.

Requires private entity primarily engaged in business of providing transportation for passengers in wheelchairs to secure passengers in wheelchairs using four-point securement system and to secure unoccupied wheelchairs. *
Establishes public bidding and contracting procedures for Rutgers, the State University that mirror those in place for the State colleges.
Requires nursing homes to permit use of electronic monitoring devices at request of resident.
Permits creation of local hire programs for public work contracts of political subdivisions.
Provides penalty for registration violations occurring under State's saltwater fishing registry program.

"School Children First Act"; modifies evaluation of teachers and principals; revises tenure acquisition process and certain tenure charge procedures; establishes factors for determining compensation; requires mutual consent for teacher placement; and eliminates certain seniority rights.
Expands scope of services provided by alarm business licensees.
Eliminates separate presidential primary election; provides for delegates and alternates to political party national conventions to be elected at regular June primary election.
Directs NJTA to study and report on potential revenue generating services of NJTA rest areas and service plazas.
Clarifies that conversions of housing cooperatives into condominiums are subject to notice provisions of "The Planned Real Estate Development Full Disclosure Act."
Abolishes Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission, transfers bridges to NJ DOT and Penn DOT, removes tolls.
Provides for streamlined review of certain wind energy generation facility installations on farmland.*
Establishes uniform real property taxation for commercial renewable energy systems and limits municipal construction permit fees for non-commercial renewable energy systems.
Provides State indemnification for certain local law enforcement officers.
Exempts from real property taxation during construction any building, or portion thereof, to be used for a property tax-exempt purpose.
Prohibits first responders from disseminating photographs of accident victims and patients to public without consent of victim or patient.
Expands "New Jersey Parentage Act" to include donation of egg or sperm; repeals artificial insemination provision.
Requires hearing and approval of premium changes for individual and small employer health benefits plans; requires certain information be posted on DOBI's website.

Appropriates $8.831 million from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund," "2007 Farmland Preservation Fund," and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" for grants to certain nonprofit organizations for farmland preservation purposes.
Appropriates $23 million from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund" and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Fund" for planning incentive grants to municipalities for farmland preservation purposes.

Appropriates $39 million from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund," "2007 Farmland Preservation Fund," and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" to State Agriculture Development Committee for county planning incentive grants.
Appropriates $23,588,760 from "2009 Farmland Preservation Fund" and "Garden State Farmland Preservation Trust Fund" to State Agriculture Development Committee for farmland preservation purposes.

Appropriates $10,250,780 from 2009 Historic Preservation Fund and 2007 Historic Preservation Fund to provide grants for certain historic preservation projects, and appropriates $600,000 from "2009 Historic Preservation Fund" for associated administrative expenses.

Supplemental appropriation to DHSS for $7,453,000 for family planning services, and requires filing of State Plan Amendment to extend Medicaid coverage for family planning services to persons with incomes up to 200% of federal poverty level.
Enhances procedures for disposition of State surplus computers, computer equipment and software allocated for redistribution, sale, or disposal.
Revises law concerning ticket sales.
Provides for voluntary contributions by taxpayers on gross income tax returns to support NJ SHARES.
Authorizes county vocational school district to reduce required local share if the reduction is agreed to by board of education and county governing body.
Requires fire districts, school districts, and county governments to share in burden of property assessment appeal refunds.
Permits high performing school districts to be monitored by the DOE under the New Jersey Quality Single Accountability Continuum (NJ QSAC) every seven years rather than every three years.
Prohibits public institutions of higher education from increasing resident undergraduate tuition by more than 4% over the prior academic year.

Requires public school districts to include instruction on the dangers of distributing sexually explicit images through electronic means as part of the Core Curriculum Content Standards in Comprehensive Health and Physical Education.
Revises responsibility for meadowlands adjustment payments.
Allows MVC to process title transfers of abandoned vessels without court order; lengthens time period required for desertion of vessel to ripen into abandonment.
Makes certain changes to NJ Environmental Infrastructure Trust Financing Program.
Appropriates funds to DEP for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2012.
Authorizes New Jersey Environmental Infrastructure Trust to expend certain sums to make loans for environmental infrastructure projects for FY2012.
Establishes certain apprentice hunting licenses.*
The "New Jersey Parental Rights Program Act."
Requires every State and local elected official using agent to represent or undertake scheduling of appearances therefore to disclose information about such service.
Requires public schools to include instruction on the events relating to September 11, 2001 and the death of Osama bin Laden, as part of core curriculum content standards.
Permits institutions of higher education to make supplemental contributions to ABP.
Designates portion of State Highway Route No. 35 as "Chosin Few Memorial Highway."
Requires reporting of suspected abuse of institutionalized elderly to police and that facility employees receive notice of reporting requirement annually; designated as "Peggy's Law."

Requires inmates serving "No Early Release Act" sentences be placed in State correctional institutions and prohibits their participation in Residential Community Release programs until they are eligible for parole.
Exempts cosmetic makeup services in conjunction with reconstructive breast surgery from sales tax.
Requires Chief Administrator of Motor Vehicle Commission to establish standards for average customer wait times at facilities.
Establishes pilot program concerning sterilization of cats and dogs released for adoption from various facilities and updates law concerning impoundment.
Establishes a formula for the distribution of State aid to school districts.
"Teacher Effectiveness and Accountability for the Children of New Jersey (TEACHNJ) Act."
Permits local government units to increase service charge imposed for check payments returned for insufficient funds.
Permits use of rebates, allowances, concessions, or benefits for motor fuel purchases on credit, debit or rewards cards.
Establishes "Task Force on the Closure of State Developmental Centers."
Permits veteran's property tax deduction for tax year when veteran was previously qualified to receive deduction and became owner of real property after October 1 of pretax year.
Revises method of regulation and collection of surplus lines insurance premium taxes.
Provides gross income tax credit for certain costs of home bedbug infestation remediation.
Concerns the sale of portable electronics insurance and licensing of limited lines insurance producers for that purpose.
Provides for direct property tax relief from Highlands Property Tax Stabilization Fund.
Excludes military compensation of military personnel serving outside of this State from gross income tax.
Revises statutes concerning dental hygienists and dentists.
Delays implementation of P.L.2009, c.166 concerning role and qualification of local purchasing agents.
Makes various changes to pension and health care benefits for public employees.
Prohibits public and private employers from discriminating against ex-convicts.
Revises penalties for animal cruelty, increasing degree of certain offenses; designated as Patrick's Law.
Reduces period of time that member of Legislature may be absent, without excuse, before member's seat is deemed vacant.
Authorizes certified celebrants to solemnize marriages.
Grants eligibility for solar renewable energy certificates to solar facilities connected to net metering customer's side of the meter, or directly to electric grid at 69 kilovolts or less.*
Allows municipalities to provide free or reduced fee beach badges to fully disabled veterans.
"Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act."
Permits retired law enforcement officers to join the New Jersey Detective Association.
Clarifies intent of P.L.2007, c.340 regarding NJ's required participation in Regional Greenhouse Gas Initiative.
Tightens eligibility criteria and supervision protocols for early release program; directs Attorney General to evaluate program.
Requires school districts and child care centers to distribute information on Megan's Law and instructions on how to access the Megan's Law sex offender registry website.
Requires municipalities to submit economic growth plans to DCA for approval of continued participation in the urban enterprise zone program.
Allows for modifications to land use approvals because of changed economics.
Establishes bill of rights for parents of persons with developmental disabilities.
Establishes per se standard for driving under the influence of drugs.
Exempts certain medically appropriate tattooing services from the sales and use tax.
Increases fine for failure to keep right unless overtaking; establishes fund to pay for certain signage.
Revises the period of time required for a State or county college faculty member to receive tenure.
Allows all municipalities to sell and lease unneeded public property for "urban" farming and gardening purposes.
Makes certain NJ Meadowlands area properties eligible for incentive grants under Economic Redevelopment and Growth Grant program established by "New Jersey Economic Stimulus Act of 2009."
Allows graduates of foreign dental schools to take examination and become licensed as dental hygienists.
Repeals requirement that public employers provide certain health benefit plans to public employees.*
Requires wheelchair-only handicapped parking spaces in certain parking lots.
Makes changes to manner in which State-administered retirement systems operate and to public employee pension benefits.

Permits board of chosen freeholders to change title to "board of county commissioners" and "freeholder" and "chosen freeholder" to "county commissioner"; requires county that changes terms to update website.
Designates shared use walkway on State Highway Route No. 52 Causeway as "John 'Marty' Coggins Memorial Path."
Requires DEP to develop and implement artificial reef management plan.
Concerns UEZ funding to qualifying municipalities.
Establishes campus parking enforcement officers.

Prohibits public colleges from charging tuition to students who are parents, spouses or children of those killed, missing in action or disabled in Operation Noble Eagle, Operation Enduring Freedom or Operation Iraqi Freedom.
Establishes that vacant permit parking spaces normally reserved for NJT train passengers are available for general public use during off-peak times. *

Increase gross income tax rate on income exceeding $1,000,000 for taxable years 2011 and 2012 and expands gross income tax exclusion for pensions, annuities and other retirement income for certain taxpayers beginning in 2011.
Provides State school aid to districts in amount consistent with provisions of "School Funding Reform Act of 2008."
Regulates imposition of standby charges upon distributed generation customers.

Makes various changes to urban transit hub tax credit program concerning mixed use projects, in-State job relocation, tax credit and investment criteria, and affordable housing; makes certain NJ Meadowlands area properties eligible for incentive grants.*
Establishes "Emergency Department Triage Referral Pilot Program" in DHSS.
Extends moratorium on the imposition of Statewide non-residential development fees; requires return of fees paid subsequent to June 30, 2010.
Establishes new standard for court to grant grandparent or sibling visitation rights under certain circumstances.
Authorizes public access to government records through government website.
Guarantees each municipality, at a minimum, Fiscal Year 2010 distribution of Energy Tax Receipts Property Tax Relief Aid in State Fiscal Year 2012.
Provides exception from BPU standards for construction and installation of certain solar and photovoltaic electric generation equipment on utility poles by electric public utilities.
Clarifies trustee's discretionary authority concerning income tax liability.
Eliminates limit on application of corporation business tax research credit to 50% of liability otherwise due.
Decreases the minimum corporation business tax on certain New Jersey subchapter S corporations by 25%.
Permits sale of motor fuels that have not been blended with ethanol for certain purposes.
Regulates certain service contracts to perform maintenance, repair, replacement, or service of property used for personal, family, or household purposes.
